description: WASHINGTON, March 4  Two former Government eco nomic officials, one Republican and one Democratic, recom mended today two tax changes, amounting to tax re duction, to stimulate the econ omy this year.

title: Rise in Money Supply Quickens
description: The pace of moneysupply expansion continued to quicken in the latest couple of weeks, data published yesterday by the Federal Reserve indicated.

title: Senate Extends Authority To Impose Price Controls
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) The Senate adopted today a resolution to extend until June 1 Government authority to regu late the interest rate paid on savings deposits, and standby power for wage and price con trols.

title: Greek Ship Rams Tower
description: NEWPORT, R. I, March 4. (UPI)The Navy and Coast Guard fought high winds and heavy seas today to free a Greek freighter, the George Pan, that had rammed a tower of the Newport Bridge. Gusts of pup 70 miles an hour forced the 200foot long freigh ter into the base of one of two main bridge towers, tearing a hole in the side of the ship.

title: Concern Is Expressed by Substitutes
description: The 48 regular substitute teachers at Junior High School 13 in Harlem worked as usual yesterday alongside the 33 re gularly licensed teachers, but they were worried and con fused.

title: Agent Testifies on Panther's Escape
description: A police undercover agent testified yesterday that a Black Panther who shortly after he had been indicted got taxi fare from him to escape.

title: Danger in the Adirondacks
description: If Governor Rockefeller really favors the recommenda tions of his Temporary Commission on the Future of the Adirondacksand he has so far had nothing but good words to say of its workthe sooner he moves to get them adopted, the better.

title: Tax Aid for Schooling Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Congress was asked today to provide tax credits for higher education expenses. A bill cosponsored by Senators Peter H. Dominick, Republican of Colorado, and Abraham A. Ribi coff, Democrat of Connecticut, would provide a tax credit of $325 on expenses of $1,500 for tuition, fees and books.

title: In Ottawa, Where Snow Is 12 Feet Deep, There's No Place to Shovel It Any More
description: OTTAWA, March 4  One householder shoveled snow from his sidewalk through a window into a bathtub today to let warm water melt it and flush it down the drain.

title: Cahill's Son Fined $200
description: LONG BEACH, N. J., March 4 (UPI)John Cahill, 20yearold son of Gov. William T. Cahill, was fined $200 last night for using loud and abusive lan guage to a policeman and for driving with an expired car registration. Judge John E. Sel ser fined young Cahill, who has been arrested twice in the past on possession of marijuana charges. The Governor's son had pleaded not guilty to the latest charges.

title: Coast Writers Cite Ashford
description: LOS ANGELES, March 4 (UPI)  Emmett Ashford, the first black umpire in the major leagues, today was named win ner of the Civic Award by the Los AngelesAnaheim chapter of the Baseball Writers Associa tion of America.

title: Shoemaker Rides Pinjara To Victory at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 4 (UPI)  Bill Shoemaker rode Pinjara to a 1length victory in the $28,700 Sierra Madre Handicap at Santa Anita today.

title: Bridge:AllStar Team Opens 2 Days Of Competition Here Today
description: The allstar Precision Club touring team, including Ben ito Garozzo and Giorgio Bel ladonna of Rome, and Robert Jordan and Arthur Robinson of Philadelphia, begins two days of serious competition here today. They will face the toughest opposition they have yet met in their Amer ican tour.

title: U.S. Holds 2 as Witnesses in Murder of Convict
description: A tearful 19yearold girl who said she heard the two pistol shots that killed her boyfriend last Saturday night was held in $100,000 bail in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday as a material witness to the murder.

title: Shares on Amex Score Advances In Active Trading
description: The American Stock Ex change scored its biggest ad vance in more than a week yes terday in stepped up trading.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Baseball Signings

title: Ailing Agee of Mets Facing XRays Today
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 4 Tommie Agee, the center fielder for the New York Mets, said today that he had suffered abdominal pains for four days and that Xrays would be taken tomorrow for detection of possible kidney stones.

title: A Chocolate Treat On Weekend Menu
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: 6th Soviet Antarctic Post Is Set Up
description: The Soviet Union has an nounced the establishment of its sixth permanent research station in the Antarctic, ac cording to Moscow newspa pers received here.

title: TWO TEAMS ADDED TO FIELD FOR N.I.T.
description: Providence College and the University of Massachusetts yesterday became the fourth and fifth basketball teams to be entered in the 34th annual National Invitation Tourna ment. The tourney is scheduled for Madison Square Garden on March 20, 21, 22, 24, 25 and 27.

title: Grenade Hurts 3 Israelis
description: TEL AVIV, March 4 (Reuters) Three Israeli soldiers were injured when. Arab guerrillas hurled a hand grenade at them near El Arish, at the southern tip of the Gaza Strip, a military spokesman reported here.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: March 4, 1971

title: Soledad Guard Is Killed
description: SOLEDAD, Calif., March 4 (AP)Robert J. McCarthey, 43 years old, a correctional officer, died today of stabbing wounds inflicted last night by a convict in the maximum security wing of Soledad Prison. He was the third white guard killed at the prison since January, 1970.

title: Nixon Defers Rochester Trip
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Heavy snow and bad weather caused President Nixon today to put off his scheduled visit tomorrow to Rochester, N. Y., to promote his urban develop ment revenuesharing plan.

title: Frazier Puts Hook Into Victory Party
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 4 Despite his quiet confidence, Joe Frazier refused today to guarantee his presence at what has been advertised as a public victory party at the Statler Hilton Hotel in New York following his heavyweight title bout with Muhammad Ali on Monday night.

title: MRS. SAMUEL SMILER; HEADED FOOD CHAIN
description: Mrs. Sarah Weiner Smiler, president of Smiler's Food Stores, Inc., a chain of 14 delicatessen stores in Manhat tan, and an owner of trot ting horses, died yesterday in Misericordia Hospital, the Bronx. She was 72 years old and lived at 300 West 53d Street.

title: TOMBS' DEATH LAID TO ACUTE INFECTION
description: The death of a 45yearold diabetic inmate of the Tombs was attributed yesterday to an acute infection of the epiglot tis and pneumonia, unconnect ed with his diabetic condition but apparently not diagnosed by the Correction Department.

title: Mylai Inquiry Ban Is Laid to General
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 4Maj. Gen. Samuel W. Kos ter, who commanded the Ameri cal Division at the time of the alleged massacre of South Viet namese civilians at Mylai 4, forestalled an onthespot inves tigation of the incident, one of his field officers testified today at the courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: Pentagon Reports Foe May Be Firing New Missile in Laos
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)A Defense Department spokesman said today that the North Vietnamese might be fir ing a new antiaircraft missile in Laos against United States aircraft supporting the South Vietnamese drive against en emy supply trails.

title: D'Amboise and Ballet West Will Tour Europe in Summer
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 4 Jacques d'Amboise will appear as guest artist with Ballet West, the ballet company that serves the Federation of Rocky Moun tain. States, when the troupe makes a sixweek tour of Eu rope this summer.

title: Olivares Stops Korean
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, March 4 (APRuben Olivares of Mexico, a former bantam weight champion, scored a sixthround knockout over Chung Pak of Korea in a 10 round bout at Municipal Audi torium last night.

title: SODA PRICES RISE AT DOW CHEMICAL
description: Price increases for a number of important items were an nounced yesterday.

title: . . . and the Cost of Playing Ball
description: Mayor Lindsay's decision to purchase Yankee Stadium at a cost of $24 million, to renovate it and provide better access roads and additional parking space may, on examination, prove essential to keeping the baseball Yankees and the football Giants in town. On examination by both the City Council and the Board of Estimate, this decision may also demonstrate a justification in economics as well as in the less tangible but equally important areas of civic pride and municipal psychology.

title: Latin Nationalists Annoyed By Yankees on TV Screen
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 4, Television, which now blankets the South American continent from the Caribbean Sea to the Strait of Magellan, is becom ing a majoi target of surging nationalist movements.

title: The Typical Indian Woman Stays Away From the Political Arena. . .
description: JAIPUR, India, March 2  The Rajmata of Jaipur was sitting regally on the edge of the platform, her white chiffon sari flowing around her and an attendant holding the hand microphone so she could ad dress the village crowd.

title: WILLIAM A. BUTLER
description: William Allen Butler, a great grandson of Benjamin Franklin Butler, a former Attorney Gen eral of the United States, died Tuesday in Hartford. He was 85 years old and lived at 116 East 63d Street.

title: Paying the City's Bills . . .
description: The harsh realities of the city and state budget crisis are thundering down on New Yorkers as details emerge of the tax program Mayor Lindsay plans to put alongside the huge one already officially presented by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Yanks: Grapefruit Games Are Acid Tests
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 4  What is sometimes called the Grapefruit League swings into action tomorrow with the New York Yankees playing the Washington Sena tors at Pompano Beach in the first of their 31 exhibition games. Other Florida spring training openers have Boston facing Houston at Cocoa, Pitts burgh playing the Chicago White Sox at Sarasota, and Montreal and Atlanta playing each other at the base they share at West Palm Beach.

title: PAYROLL TAX PLAN FOUGHT IN ALBANY Suburban Legislators Vow to Oppose Proposal
description: ALBANY, March 4  State legislators from the New York City suburbs voiced vigorous opposition today to any city payroll tax that would put a heavier financial burden on their constituents.

title: Laotian Gamble
description: The risk of a further widening of the war in Indochina has been increased by the decision to push deeper Into Laos in the face of strong and increasingly effective enemy resistance.

title: MercedesBenz Taks The Emotional Route
description: Now that the Detroit auto makers are moving slowly to ward more informative adver tising, MercedesBenz, long a believer in the longcopy ap proach to advertising, is tak ing the emotional route.

title: WILLIAM J. HOFFMAN
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., March 4William J. Hoffman, who had been active in real estate for many years in New York before his retirement in 1965, died yesterday at the New Ro chelle Medical Center. He was 87 years old and lived at 10 Walnut Avenue.

title: CITY BOARD DEFIED ON SCHOOL CUTS
description: A revolt was building among community school boards yes terday against the Board of Education's order to lay off teachers and reduce services.

title: A PLAY BY BRECHT STAGED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, March 4Books on Bertolt Brecht usually de scribe Man Is Man as an un canny prophecy of brainwash ing techniques. That is one possible reading. But what William Gaskill's production at the Royal Court Theater makes clear is that others are equally possible, and that the piece itself is morally neu tral. For once, Brecht meant it when he asked audiences to make up their own minds.

title: To Reform Rule 22
description: Letters to the Editor

title: BOYLE QUITS POST WITH U.M.W. BANK
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers of Amer ica, resigned today under Gov ernment pressure as a director of the unionowned National Bank of Washington.

title: Heroic Art Is Shown in Harlem
description: Since its inception in 1968. the Studio Museum in Harlem has directed its attention to survey exhibitions of black artists. Although such exhibi tions made the art world aware that there was a com munity of black artists, the shows have been nonetheless criticized as weak and inef fective.

title: ACCORD IN LIBYA REACHED BY ESSO
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 4 A ninemonth deadlock over the export of liquefied natural gas from Libya was apparently resolved today with an agree ment by the Libyan Govern ment and Esso Libya, a sub sidiary of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: O'Brien Sets Aussie Mark
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, March 4 (AP)Kerry O'Brien captured the 3,000meter steeplechase at an indoor track meet tonight in 8 minutes 24 seconds, an Aus tralian record. Two weeks ago the Aussie ran the fastest two miles ever, indoors or out, with an 8:19.2 time indoors at San Diego.

title: BEANIE CHECKING SCHOOL DEFICIT Wants to See if $40Million Gap in Budget Is Real
description: Controller. Abraham D. Beanie, who is charged with seeing that all city agencies operate within their budgets, said yesterday that he did not yet have enough information to determine  whether the Board of Education's projected $40 million deficit was real or not.

title: Rocky Mount Wins on Turf As Gulf stream Meet Opens
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 4  The Florida racing scene shifted, from Hialeah to Gulf stream today, but nothing changed for two trainers, Eddie Yowell and Eddie Neloy.

title: DENVER TAKES LEAD IN N.C.A.A. SKI MEET
description: LEAD, S. D., March 4 (AP) Denver University won first place in the downhill and the crosscountry races today as the National Collegiate skiing championships began. The Pio neers took a big lead in their bid for a 14th title.

title: WAR FOE GUILTY IN DRAFT CASE
description: A Rockefeller University graduate student was found guilty yesterday at. the end of his. second trial for refusing, to be inducted into the Army be Cause of his Opposition to the war In Vietnam.

title: All Victims of the Game
description: Yambo Ouologuem (pronounced Ooolo gwem) is a 31yearold writer/publisher from Mali, West Africathe descendant of a family who ruled before the French colo nialists came; educated in France; and with the publication of his first novel, Bound to Violence, a winner of French prizes and huge critical acclaim for having produced  yes, one might have guessed it  the first truly African novel. (How very trench, such praise!) But even setting such clamor aside, one does not have to read very far into Bound to Vio lence to realize that one is on to something unusual. Our eyes drink the brightness of the sun and, over come, marvel at their tears, it be gins. Mashallah! Wa bismillah! . . . To recount the bloody adventure of the niggertrashshame to the worthless paupers!there would be no need to go back beyond the present cen tury; but the true history of the Blacks begins much earlier....

title: WhiteonWhite Look Taking New England Skiers by Storm
Army Reinforcements Arrive
description: DACCA, March 4 (Reuters) Army reinforcements arrived here today by plane and ship to help maintain order in East Pakistan.

title: POTATO FUTURES UP 2D DAY IN ROW
description: Potato futures prices, which last Friday hit new lows for the life of the contracts, rose yesterday for the second day in a row. The May contract, the busiest with 1,330 sales, closed up 5 cents at $3.16 a hundred weight. This compared with $2.95 a hundredweight for the May contract jest Friday, or a rise of 21 cents.

title: Transcript of President Nixon's News Conference on Foreign Policy Matters
description: Following is a transcript of Presi dent Nixon's news conference on for eign affairs televised last night from the East Room of the White House, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Ballet: Hodes's Abyss
description: Stuart Hodes's ballet Abyss, which was first given by the Harkness Ballet six years ago, was revived by the City Center Jaffrey Ballet at the New York City Center on Wednesday night. The leading roles, originally given at the work's premiere in Cannes, France, by Lone Isaksen and Erik Bruhn, were here danced by Lili Cockerille and Dennis Wayne.

title: Triple Pays $804 to 116 Bettors at Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 4 It was only the second night of the harness racing meeting at Roosevelt Raceway, and the talk centered more on money than on racing.

title: Where the Laos Trail Leads
description: Both sides know the Nixon plan for Vletnamizing the Indochina war depends on at least partial victory in the continuing Laos battle. Partial victory means destruction of sufficient Communist stockpiles along the south ward channel of the Ho Chi Minh Trail to prevent Hanoi from mounting another serious offensive for another year,

title: INCOME TAX VOTED IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 4 Persons who live or work in Pennsylvania will pay the state a tax of 3.5 per cent on adjusted net income reported on the Federal individual in come tax return.

title: Pregnant and Single, and Glad to Be Both
description: Caterine Milinaire, a freelance writer from Paris, and Lainie,Kazan, a singer actress from Brooklyn, have never met but they have in common the most important thing in their lives. They are pregnant. They are also single.

title: DUMPING IS RULED ON JAPANESE TV'S
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Tariff Commission ruled today that Japanese television sets were being sold in the United States at less than fair value and should be subject to spe cial dumping duties. The com mission said that as a result of the dumping domestic tele vision makers were being in jured.

title: POTTERY RECALLED FOR EXCESSIVE LEAD
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP)  The Food and Drug Adminis tration has ordered the recall of certain pottery manufac tured by Metlox Potteries Inc. of Manhattan Beach, Calif.

title: BIG BOARD CHIDED BY S.E.C. ON RULE
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  The Securities and Exchange Commission has told the New York Stock Exchange that the exchange's proposed new rule for deciding when its members were in danger of insolvency is no, better than the old one.

title: Big 4 Statement Blocked
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. March 4 Representatives of the Big Fourthe United States, the Soviet Union, Brit ain and Francemeeting for two hours and a half today, failed to reach agreement on a joint public statement about the Middle East. They will continue their discussions tomorrow.

title: MAYOR TO PROPOSE NEW TAX PROGRAM OF $876.4MILLION
description: An $876.4million package of new taxesthe core of which is a payroll levy that would supplant the present income tax and affect city residents and commuters equallywas proposed privately yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: THOMAS J. BRADY, FORMER JUSTICE
description: Thomas J. Brady, a former justice of the State Supreme Court, died yesterday in Union Hospital, the Bronx. He was 86 years old on Feb. 25, and lived at 2665 Grand Concourse and in Croton Falls, N. Y.

title: NIXON, IN A SHIFT, ASKS PUBLIC JOBS FOR UNEMPLOYED
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  President Nixon,, proposed to day that states and cities be allowed to use Federal money to create temporary public service jobs for the unem ployed.

title: GREEK EXILES PUT 2,000 ON BLACKLIST
description: ATHENS, March 4  Four underground organizations have compiled what they de scribe as a blacklist of about 2,000 Greeks who are termed collaborators with the ruling military junta.

title: Wood, Field. and Stream
description: MARATHON, takes only about half an hour to spot an accomplished fisher man when you are in the same boat with him, and Cecil Keith established his credentials in less time than that.

title: Volpe Acts to Curb Shady Operators In Airline Charters
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (UPI)  Transportation Secretary John A. Volpe ordered today drive against shady operators in the airline charter business.

title: Freeport H.S. Is Closed After Brawl
description: FREEPORT, L. I., March 4 Freeport High School, frequent ly the scene of racial disturb ances, was closed at the request of the police at noon today after a melee that resulted in injuries to nine students and a teacher.

title: Venezuelan Boy Freed For $900,000 Ransom
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 4 (AP)  Kidnappers have released Leon Taurel, 13yearold son of a Vene zuelan millionaire, the police reported today.

title: Cool but Correct Reception
description: ATHENS, March 4  The twoman Senate factfinding mission was given a cool but correct reception by officials here,

title: HENRY VIII'S MUSIC HEARD AT HUNTER
description: The Early Music Consort of London is made up of four people who look as if they had wandered in from giving an impromptu concert in an Ox ford commons room. David Munrow, who led the group in its program at the Hunter Col lege Playhouse on Wednesday night, provided the usual, or slightly better than usual, arch commentary, rather along the lines of Anna Russell's old heavy satire on the Pro Mu sica Antigua.

title: Bills Seek to End Zoning That Forbids Apartments
description: Three bills designed to pro hibit suburbs from excluding apartment buildings through their zoning laws were intro duced in the Legislature yes terday.

title: Tip for Investors: Look at Research First
Welfare: Myths, Rights and Camps
description: To the Editor: John A. Hamilton's OpEd column of Feb. 22, Welfare's Outrage, serves chiefly to perpetuate myths about wel fare which presumably The Times would prefer to correct. As a member of the editorial board of The Times he surely knows that soft news, no matter how seductive in the telling, doesn't become fact by mere repeti tion. But, it does, unfortunately, be come misinformed public opinion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: William B. Elmer's letter (Feb. 25) suggesting that those receiving public assistance for more than two years be sent to isolated concentration camps (for what else would they be?) is a tidy solution to New York's welfare problem.

title: TWO ARTISTS GRACE WORK BY BEETHOVEN
description: With two such veterans as Isaac Stern and William Stein berg giving a concerto as well known as Beethoven's for vio lin, one would hardly expect major surprises.

title: Top Sociologist Held in Spain For Criticizing Army Chaplain
description: MADRID, March 4  The army has been holding Spain's leading sociologist, Amando de Miguel, under military arrest in a Barcelona hotel for two weeks for having criticized a (sermon delivered by an army chaplain.

title: NASTASE CONQUERS RUSSELL BY 63, 62
description: HAMPTON, Va., March (AP) Topseeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania brushed aside Richard Russell of Kingston, Jamaica, 63, 62, tonight to advance to the quarterfinals of the United States indoor tennis tourna ment.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 0.9 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 109.1 Tuesday from 110.0 last week.

title: BEAME CONDEMNS FISCAL BLUNDER Attacks City's Handling of Police Parity Pay Dispute
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beanie accused the Lindsay ad ministration yesterday of a co lossal fiscal blunder in its han dling of the police parity pay dispute.

title: OIL BLAST IN JERSEY IS LAID TO REACTOR
description: LINDEN, N.J., March 4 (AP) The Humble Oil and Refining Company said today that its investigation had showed that the Dec. 5 explosion and fire at its Bayway plant here stemmed from an overheated reactor, rather than sabotage, as was originally suspected.

title: Seaborg on Soviet Academy
description: MOSCOW, March 4 (Reuters) Glen T. Seaborg, chairman of the United States Atomic En ergy Commission, was elected a member of the Soviet Acad emy of Sciences today at an annual meeting, the press agency Tass reported.

title: Work Here, Live Here
description: To the Editor: As the sponsor of legislation in the City Council to require police recruits to reside in the city after appointment, I am disappointed with The Times's [Feb. 18] editorial position.

title: ISRAEL BOND DRIVE SEEKS $1BILLION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., March 4  American Jewish leaders started a drive today for the sale of $1billion in Israel bonds to provide greatly increased economic aid for Israel.

title: Insurers Stake in Pennsy Estimated at $500Million
description: The extent of the life insurance industry's huge invest ment in the Penn Central Transportation Company, now in bankruptcy proceedings, became clearer yesterday with the disclosure that 13 major life insurers have more than $500 million at stakenow worth roughly 20 cents on the dollar in the financially ailing rail road.

title: SOVIET DISPUTES U.S. ON VIEW OF CONTACTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The Soviet Embassy has taken issue with the American ver sion of their direct contacts on the Middle East.

title: Poetry Winner Ends Up At Heart of the Matter
description: At a morning news confer ence at the Biltmore Hotel, Mona Van Duyn, the poetry winner of this year's National Book Awards, replied to Allen Ginsberg who on Tuesday re ferred to the choice of her To See, To Take, by the other four jurors as ig nominious, insensitive and mediocre.

title: Rail Union Talks Recessed; Usery Cites Some Gains
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The nation's railroads and the United Transportation Union recessed this evening their dead locked contract talks until to morrow morning.

title: Suit Filed to Bar Purchase Of Yankee Stadium by City
description: A suit that noted the nomad ic tendencies of athletic teams was filed yesterday in an attempt to bar the city from buying Yankee Stadium for $24million.

title: Venezuela May Raise Taxes
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 4 (UPI)Venezuela will raise tax prices for her oil exports by an average half a dollar per barrel March 8, reliable indus try sources reported today. In creases are expected to have major impact on the approxi mately one million barrels per day of fuel oil that Venezuela ships to the United States East Coast.

title: T.W.A. PILOTS OPEN DRIVE TO AID LINE
Panther's Accuse Cleaver Of Holding Wife in Algiers
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 4 (UPI)  A report in the Black Panther newspaper has ac cused Eldridge Cleaver, a fugi tive, leader, of holding his wife, Kathleen, a prisoner in Algiers.

title: Bombs and Balance
description: WASHINGTON. March 4Every few days now, somebody introduces a bill in Congress designed to influence the course of the Indochina war or bring America's participation in it to an end, but none of these has any real chance of success.

title: DR. HERTA WESCHER, AUTHORITY ON ART
description: PARIS, March 4Dr. Herta Wescher, an internationally known authority on modern art, died here yesterday of a heart attack. She was 72 years old.

title: $200Million Budget Cuts Asked by G.O.P. in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 4The elimination of several hundred existing state jobs was proposed today by Republican ma jority members of the State Assembly as a means of cutting more than $200million from Governor Rockefeller's pro posed tax increase of $1.1bil lion, the highest in the state's history.

title: U.S. Suspending Nuclear Tests Aimed at Peaceful Atomic Uses
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) The United States is suspend ing underground nuclear tests aimed at finding peaceful uses for atomic energy.

title: 2d Pollution Team Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) Environmental Protection Ad ministrator William D. Ruckel shaus announced today the formation of a second team of water pollution investigators, based in Denver.

title: TOWN IN PHILIPPINES IS REPORTED SEIZED
description: MANILA, March 4 (AP)  Moslems armed with rifles and machine guns attacked Iligan and seized the provincial cap ital on Tuesday, the Philippine News Service reported today.

title: Designed in U.S., Made in Hong Kong
description: Danny Ho Fong, a Chinese born American, came to New York recently to introduce a new collection of tuxedo styled rattan seating at Lord & Taylor. He brought four fifths of his family, leaving behind his daughter, Jana, to run the store. We call it a showroom and she's incharge, said the Los Angelesbased furniture design er and manufac turer, who be lieves in keepinghis entire family occupied in the business that last year registered sales in six fig ures. Mother is the brains of the business, he con tinued, grinning broadly at his wife, Muey. Mrs. Fong is the treasurer of the Fong Brothers Company, which uses the trade name Tropi Cal. It is a concern that hasbecome synonymous in the 20 years of its existence with highstyled, quality rattan furniture designed in Cali fornia and made in the Fongs Hong Kong factory.

title: BUCKS TAKE NO. 18, TIE LEAGUE STRING Triumph, 116113, as Braves Rally Fails Streak on Line at Detroit Tonight
description: MILWAUKEE, March 4 (UPI) The Milwaukee Bucks sur vived a furious fourthquarter charge by Buffalo tonight and beat the Braves, 116113, to tie the National Basketball Asso ciation record for consecutive victories.

title: LAIRD NOW DUBIOUS ON PIPELINE DISPLAY
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird acknowledged today that it probably would have been better if the Defense Depart ment had made clear that a, piece of pipeline shown at a Pentagon news conference had not been obtained during the current South Vietnamese op eration in Laos.

title: 1,000 ARE PRESENT FOR BOOK AWARDS Winners Receive $1,000 at Ceremony in Tully Hall
description: The 22d annual National Book Awards of $1,000 each were presented to recipients in seven literary categories in ceremonies last night in Alice Tully Haltat Lincoln Center. Thel proceedings were attended by about 1,000 cultural and civic leaders.

title: Sounds From an Empty Echo Chamber
description: There ain't but one heavyweight champion of the worldme. The defiant words of Muhammad Ali were still ringing yesterday in Felt Forum, the lesser arena of Madison Square Garden, where the former Cassius Clay and Joe Frazier will become instant millionaires Monday in the richest fight in boxing history.

title: Schools Closed for 2d Day
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 4 The 14 public schools here will remain closed tomorrow for the second day, following a disturbance Wednesday af ternoon at White Plains High School.

title: Retail Sales Last Month Moved Generally Higher
description: The retail sales pace general ly rose in February over the yearearlier level, but results released yesterday reflected sharp variance among the coun try's largest merchandising companies.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London Stock Exchange closed irregular yesterday. Early gains were reduced or completely erased when it ap peared that major unions may support strike action against the Government's proposed in dustrial relations bill.

title: Casey's Nomination Is Supported Again
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 The White House, after looking into various past activities of William J. Casey, President Nixon's nominee to head the Securities and Exchange Com mission, has reaffirmed its sup port of Mr. Casey for the job.

title: MEDIATOR PRESSES CON ED BARGAINING
description: Vincent D. McDonnell, chair man of the State Mediation Board, called yesterday for in tensive and continuing negotia tions between the Consolidated Edison Company and two unions representing 18,900 of the utility's workers.

title: Mercury as Fungicide
description: Letters to the Editor

title: West's Condition Excellent
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., March 4 (UPI)Jerry West, who is lost to the Los Angeles Lakers for the season, was in excellent condition today following sur gery to repair torn ligaments in his right knee. A team spokes man said West was resting comfortably and was eager to try out his crutches.

title: 4 U.S. Airmen Kidnapped By Extremists in Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 4Political extremists kid napped four. American airmen today and threatened their execution by a firing squad unless the United States paid a $400,000 ransom. The police arrested a suspect, prompting an additional demand that he be freed.

title: SCHOOL LAYOFFS BY EXCEED 20%
description: The proportion of the school system's headquarters staff to be laid off in the current budg. et crisis may actually rise above 20 per cent, a key school official said yesterday.

title: Chilean Government Abandons Bill for Neighborhood Courts
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 4 (UPI) Faced with certain de feat In Congress, the Govern ment of Marxist President Sal vador Allende Gossens today withdrew a bill that would have established citizens neighbor hood courts.

title: Why We Fight in Laos
description: AUSTIN, Tex.As the critical battle shapes up for control over the infil tration routes through Laos during the current dry season, it may be useful to recall the history of that critical piece of the world's real estate.

title: Top U.S. Officials Seek Ways To Help in City's School Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  The Government's two top ed ucation officials said today that they were trying to find some additional Federal aid to help ease New York City's school budget crisis, but that the amount probably would be modest.

title: SitIn at Fordham Hospital Shuts Emergency Ward
description: The emergency ward of Ford ham Hospital in the Bronx was closed yesterday because of sitin by more than 60 labora tory and Xray technicians, the Health and Hospital Corpora tion said.

title: Nixon Accuses Symington Of Cheap Shot at Rogers
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  President Nixon accused Sena tor Stuart Symington of Mis souri of taking a cheap shot in suggesting that William P. Rogers had been Secretary of State in title only.

title: FINAL S.O.R.C, SAIL SCHEDULED TODAY
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, March 4 A 31mile race around Booby Rocks tomorrow is all that sep arates Running Tide, a one yearold sloop, from being ac claimed the champion of the Southern Ocean Racing Con ference now.

title: Ali Accepts Underdog Role With Aplomb of Favorite
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 4 No contest, the dire assess ment that he makes of his forthcoming fight for the heavyweight championship of the world, rang out frequently at Muhammad Ali's training session today.

title: East Pakistani Leader Orders Easing of General Strike
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 4 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the East Pakistani nationalist leader, an nounced today that he had au thorized some relaxation of the general strike he had called to protest the postponement of a constitutional assembly.

title: Notre Dame Wins, 11079
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., March 4 (UPI)Austin Carr scored 31 points and received a 15min ute ovation tonight after he led Notre Dame to a 11079 victory over Western Michigan. Carr was playing his last regu lar season college game.

title: JUDITH ALSTADTER IN VARIED PROGRAM
description: Judith Alstadter, a New York pianist who made her debut here last year playing a pro gram of Fault's music, returned to Tully Hall on Wednesday night with a varied program.

title: In Auburn, Snowplows Had Their Own Problems
description: AUBURN, N.Y., March 4 lt would not be completely accurate to describe this town in the Finger Lakes region as paralyzed by the snow that descended on up state New York, but it cer tainly did slow things down.

title: The Food Is Fine but Oh, the Decibels
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Jersey Symphony: A Success Story
description: Three years ago last month, Henry Lewis stepped into the history books when he took charge of the New Jersey Symphony and thus became the first black mu sical director of a United States orchestra. Today the 38yearold conductor can tell a success story about his orchestra that has an as tonishing ring in a time when economic slump threatens the existence of better  estab lished cultural organizations.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: To the Editor: John A. Hamilton, in his Feb. 22 column, overlooked two important welfare outrages.

title: SUSPECT IS SEIZED IN A 1967 MURDER
description: Nearly four years to the day after a prominent theatrical producer and lawyer was found slain in his Murray Hill pent house apartment, the police an nounced yesterday that they had arrested a man who con fessed to the murder.

title: Police in Paris Take Their Protest to the People
description: PARIS, March 4The Paris police took to the streets to day in an effort to con vince the public that they are not fascists or sadists but good citizens loyal to the institutions of the repub lic and of democracy.

title: School Given $4Million
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., March 4 (AP)  Williams Col lege has disclosed one of the largest capital gifts ever made to the college  $4million do nated by Fairleigh Dickinson

title: ARTHUR W. INGALLS
description: BOSTON, March 4Arthur Warren Ingalls, founder and chairman of Ingalls Associates, Inc., an advertising agency, died last Thursday at his home in Newton. He was 82 years old.

title: NETS TOP CONDORS AS BARRY EXCELS
description: MIAMI, March 4Rick Barry, playing with five personal fouls, scored 17 points in the last 9 minutes 24 seconds tonight to preserve the New York Nets 114110 victory over the Pitts burgh Condors.

title: Colombo Wins First Round In Challenge to Government
description: ROME, March 4  Premier Emilio Colombo won a vote of confidence in the Chamber of Deputies today, the first stage of a twin test for the survival of his centerleft Government. The vote was 346 to 235, with 2 abstentions.

title: Monmouth Swimniers Lead Metropolitan Meet Section
description: Monmouth College of New Jersey, with 132 points, took a 3point lead over St. John's yesterday in the Section I com petition of the Metropolitan (swimming and diving cham pionships at New York State Maritime College.

title: N.Y.U Students Put In the Commodore After Heat Is Lost
description: About 600 students at New York University, deprived of heat and hot water in their dormitory yesterday, were of fered the option of moving uptown into the warmth of the Commodore Hotel for the night.

title: MRS. JANET R. OWENS
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, March 4 Mrs. Janet Russell Owens, as sistant professor of piano at Oberlin College Conservatory of Music since 1955, died today after a long illness. She was 60 years old.

title: Mike Nichols to Stage Latest Play by Simon
description: Neil Simon has written a new comedy, The Prisoner of Second Avenue, which will be presented by Saint Subber on Nov. 10 at a the ater to he announced.

title: Mailmen in London Jeer Chief on Plan to End Strike
description: LONDON, March 4 (Reuters) Angry postal workers jeered at their leaders today over a plan to end their 44dayold strike.

title: Miss York Wed to Terence Lynch
description: In the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More here yesterday afternoon Miss Constance York was married to Terence David Lynch by the Rev. John C. Calhoun.

title: PreCanceled Stamps
description: To the Editor: The postal service claims to have saved $750,000 in operating costs in its tremendously successful experi ment with the use of precanceled six cent stamps during the 1970 Christmas season.

title: SETON HALL FIVE, MANHATTAN WIN
description: Bill Raftery's first coaching season at Seton Hall ended on a high note last night. The Pirates finally found a winning combination in three tries against Atlantic Coast Con ference teams, and edged Vir ginia, 7371, at Madison Square Garden. The Pirates in recent weeks had been beaten by Maryland and Duke on the same court.

title: Nixon Aides Defend Postponing Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  The Nixon Administration told Congress today that the main reason it had impounded some $8billion in appropriated funds was to combat inflation.

title: Morris Resigns in Harper's Dispute
description: Willie Morris resigned un expectedly yesterday as ed itor in chief of Harper's Mag azine, a post the 36yearold writer had held for the last four years.

title: After a Quiet Spell for Parties, Suddenly Everybody Picked the Same Day
description: A popular British diplomat was returning to London. A former French journalist was celebrating his 50th birth day. A Moroccan ambassa dor was leaving New York. Not earthshattering events, any of them, but sufficient to spark a spontaneous erup tion of parties, the likes of which had not been seen since the heyday of the char ity ball.

title: Ecuador Fines U.S. Boat $157,340, Highest So Far
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., March 4 (AP)The highest fine ever as sessed against an American tuna boat by a South American country  $157,340 has been levied by Ecuador against own ers of the vessel Apollo, the American Tunaboat Association said.

title: Nandini Satpathy
description: NEW DELHI, March 4 Critics of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi who accuse her of surrounding herself with Communists, point to Nandini Panigrahi Satpathy.

title: 5 Hospital Employes Held On NarcoticsSale Charges
description: Five employes of Mount Si nai Hospital were arrested yes terday on charges of selling narcotics to fellow workers and patients.

title: Dickinson's 68 Leads by Stroke in Doral Open
description: MIAMI, March 4  Jack Nicklaus suffered a scoring let down today as he resumed his tournament campaign after winning the Professional Golf ers Association title last Sun day. In tli,e opening round of the $150,000 DoralEastern open over the lakelined Doral Coun try Club course, Nicklaus scored a twooverpar 74, six higher than pacesetting Gard ner Dickinson.

title: Canadiens Game Postponed
description: MONTREAL, March 4 (UPI) A blizzard forced the postpone ment of tonight's National Hockey League game between the Montreal Canadiens and the Vancouver Canucks. lt was only the third postponement of a game in league history, and the first caused by weather.

title: Delaware Records Released
description: WILMINGTON, Del., March 4 Delaware court records re leased today revealed that in 1961 lawyers for two du Pont brothers raised the question of conflict of interest on the part of William J. Casey, President Nixon's nominee for chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Indian Candidate Hurt As Violence Continues
description: NEW DELHI, March 4 (UPI) A candidate for poli tical office was stabbed and another wounded by a bomb today in continued violence prompted by elections to determine the future of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Gov ernment.

title: Market Place: National Screw In Retrospect
description: It's more than a little ironic. Martin Stone, chair man of Monogram Industries, Inc., was just passing through New York City on his way to Florida where he will pitch two weeks batting practice for Walter Alston's Los Ange les Dodgers.

title: S.E.C. Accuses Occidental Of Issuing False Reports
description: The Securities and exchange Commission yesterday charged the Occidental Petroleum Cor poration and its chairman, Ar mand Hammer, with having is sued false and misleading earnings reports and statements in violation of the antifraud provisions of the. Securities Ex change Act of 1934.

title: Chrysler Recalling 159 Cars
description: DETROIT, March 4 (UPI) Chrysler Corporation notified the National Traffic Highway Safety Administration today that it was recalling 159 Ply mouth Satellite 1971 model cars. The cars will be checked to see if a right front brake line wheelhouse clip was omit ted during assembly.

title: Suspect Was in Jail At Time of Crime, Fingerprints Show
description: A 25yearold unemployed truck driver's helper was cleared of a charge of armed robbery yesterday after his lawyers proved that he was in jail when the crime was committed. If convicted, he could have been imprisoned for 25 years.

title: Corporate Bond Prices Advance;
description: The corporate bond market, which early yesterday continued to adjust to the new higher level of interest rates estab lished this week, suddenly moved upward later in the afternoon.

title: Work on Campus Starts
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., March 4 (AP)The Woods Hole Ocean ographic Institute broke ground today for a $12million Quisset campus. The 184acre campus will include three buildings of, laboratory and office space plus a conference center, library and housing for staff and students.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Interbank Card As sociation has announced the election of John Reynolds, senior vice president of the First Na tibnal City Bank, New York, as chairman of the board of the international association of more than 5,300 banks offering the Master Charge, card serv ice. He succeeds Karl Hinke, executive vice president, Marine Midland Banks, Inc., who has served as board chairman since 1968. Mr. Reynolds is the senior credit officer in the bank's personal banking group as well as supervisor of the domestic branches and residential mortgage program. Mr. Reynolds, who joined First National City in 1946, was made a senior vice presi dent in 1967.

title: W. R. GRACE LISTS LOSS FOR QUARTER
description: W. R. Grace & Co. had a 24.2 per cent increase in 1970 earnings before extraordinary items but a 47.2 per cent de crease in net income after such charges, with an indicated loss for the fourth quarter, accord ing to the annual results issued yesterday.

title: Hanoi, Protesting Air Attacks, Sends Deputy to Talks in Paris
description: PARIS, March 4The Viet cong and North Vietnamese chief delegates stayed away from the Paris negotiations to day to protest American air at tacks on North Vietnam. Their deputies attended the 105th session, a grim and fruitless meeting.

title: 3 Power Failures Upset Lives Of 600 Families in Riverdale
description: Three days of sporadic but repetitive power failures have reduced nearly 600 families in Riverdale to an uncertain state of existence.

title: Youths Bomb Belfast Cars
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Friday March 5 (Reuters)  Youths attacked two police vehicles with a gelignite bomb near the center of Belfast early this morning, damaging the vehicles but missing the drivers.

title: Stage: Tarot Reopens
description: Tarot, not to be con fused with Charles Ludlam's The Grand Tarot, is a rock musical that was first intro duced in New York at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, as presented by the Chelsea Theater Center. It reopened last night at Circleinthe Square.

title: DOW IS UP BY 8.97 AS TRADING RISES
description: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange jumped to new recovery high yesterday on increased, volume.

title: ELIAS GABAY DIES; LED KNISH BAKERY
description: Elias Gabay, who retired in 1966 as president of Gabila & Sons, 120 South Eighth Street, Brooklyn, leading knish bak ers, died Wednesday at Miami Beach, Fla. He was 82 years old and lived at the Eighth Street address.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Installment Debt and New Orders Rise
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) United States consumers in creased their installment debt by $87million in January but credit on automobile loans de clined, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: LOCKHEED'S CHIEF RETURNING TO U.S.
description: LONDON, March 4Daniel J. Haughton, chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, will meet airline customers for his Tristar jet in New York tomorrow in what could be a crucial session for the plane's future.

title: Badillo Urges a $20Billion U.S. Loan to States
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 Representative Herman Badillo injected a new element into the debate on revenue sharing to day by proposing that the Fed eral Government lend $20bil lion to the states and cities over the next two years.

title: New York Magazine Shifts Discussed
description: Leading contributors to New York magazine have met to hear and discuss ideas affecting the weekly publica tion, including changes in the emphasis of its contents.

title: NIXON EXPRESSES HOPE ON MIDEAST
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 President Nixon indicated to night that the United States was willing to see the Middle East ceasefire extended tacitly rather than by agreement, and he declined to put public pres sure on Israel to make negoti ating concessions to the Arabs.

title: WIESNER MAY GET TOP POST AT M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 4A presidential search com mittee at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology is re liably reported to have selected Dr. Jerome B. Wiesner, former science adviser to President Kennedy, as its nominee to be the school's 13th president.

title: Vance in Negro Fund Drive
description: Cyrus R. Vance, former Dep uty Secretary of Defense, has been appointed the 1971 na tional campaign chairman for the United Negro College Fund, Inc., which is seeking to raise $10million this year for 36 pri vate, predominantly black col leges.

title: To Save the Villard House
description: Letters to the Editor

title: A.B.C. ASKS WAIVER FOR TUESDAY TOPS
description: The American Broadcasting Company yesterday filed a petition with the Federal Com munications Commission ask ing a waiver of the F.C.C.'s threehour prime time rule that will go into effect this Fall. A.B.C. wants its wellrated 3hour Tuesday night pro gram schedule kept intact

title: PRESIDENT SAYS LAOS OPERATION AIDS U.S. PULLOUT
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  President Nixon said tonight that the allied operation in Laos had very seriously dam aged Hanoi's military ability and thus assured the continued withdrawal of American troops from South Vietnam this year and next.

title: Worst Toll Since September
description: SAIGON, March 4 (AP)  The heavy fighting in Laos was reflected in the weekly casualty reports issued today by the allied commands here.

title: Two Premiers Proposed
description: DACCA, March 4 (AP)Sheik Mujib proposed today that Pakistan's constitutional crisis be settled by giving each wing of the country its own premier.

title: ExColonel Relates How He Prevented A Brothel on Base
description: WASHINGTON, March 4 (AP) A retired Army colonel told a panel of amused Senators of his running battle to prevent a brothel from being erected in the center of Army headquar ters in Vietnam.

title: STORM BECALMS ADVANCE DISPUTE
description: The Staten Island Advance braced yesterday for a renewal of picketing and harassment by ItalianAmerican groups but, although the pickets command truck drove past the Grasmere plant, no pickets or other dem onstrators braved the snow storm.

title: Trudeau Weds in Canada
description: NORTH VANCOUVER, Brit ish Columbia, March 4Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau was married today to 22year old Margaret Sinclair in Roman Catholic ceremony here.

title: Judge Will Rule Today On Radio Fight Bulletins
description: State Supreme Court Jus tice Edward T. McCaffrey said yesterday he would rule by noon today on a suit to bar the Mutual Broadcasting System from broadcasting radio bulletins on the prog ress of Monday's AliFrazier fight.

title: Greta Keller Sings And Evokes Aura Of the Twenties
description: After an absence of seven years, Greta Keller is making a brief visit to New York to sing in the Rembrandt Room of the Stanhope Hotel, Fifth Avenue at 81st Street. She will be there until March 13, when she returns to Vienna.

title: TAXPAYER KHEEL SUES PORT AGENCY
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator, sued the Port of New York Authority yesterday, charging that the agency was illegally avoiding its mandated authority to improve mass transportation by rail in the metropolitan area.

title: A Kirsten Celebration Soprano, Marking 25 Years at the Met, Repeats Her. Debut Role in 13oheme
description: Dorothy Kirsten made her debut with the Metropolitan Opera on Dec. 1, 1945, as Mimi in La Boheme. On Wednesday night, she sang the same role with the com pany, celebrating 25 consecu tive seasons there. It is a record unequaled by any other leading American so prano. (With the San Fran cisco Opera, a much younger organization than the Met, she is the only artist to es tablish a similar record there.)

title: President Truman, March 5, 1946
description: On March 5, 1946, Winston Chur chill made his Iron Curtain speech at Westminster College in Fulton, Mo. He was introduced by President Tru man, who also spoke following Mr. Churchill's memorable address. These are President Truman's remarks.

title: VILLANOVA CHOICE IN I.C. 4A AGAIN
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 4 I. C. 4A coaches will seek new, solutions to a familiar problem tomorrow, and Satur day: How to unseat Villanova in the 50th annual indoor track and field championships.

title: Dominant Phase By ISADORE BARMASH
description: Investigation of false adver tising represents the most dominant phase of the F.T.C.'s activities in behalf of consumer protection, the commission chairman said here yesterday.

title: Senate Report on Greece Assails State Department
description: WASHINGTON, March 4  A report to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee contended today that the State Department had misled itselfand in the process Congressabout the willingness of the military junta, in Athens to restore constitu tional democracy in Greece.

title: Racing Program Canceled
description: CHESTER, W. Va., March 4 (UPI)Waterford Park officials called off tonight's racing be cause of hazardous driving con ditions. It was the second con secutive day the races were canceled because of the bad weather.

title: Switch by Litton Affects 3 Nations
description: LONDON, March 4 (AP) Litton Industries, Inc., is switch ing some production from Japan to the United States and other production to Britain from the United States, its president, said today.

title: F.T.C. IS CRITICAL OF TWO CONCERNS
description: WASHINGTON, March (AP)The Federal Trade Com mission attacked today what it termed false claims in sweep stakes promotion of the Procter & Gamble Corporation and the LonginesWittnauer Watch Co.

title: Kuwait Is Resuming Subsidy, Heeding Appeal by Hussein
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March  After, a personal appeal from King Hussein, the Ruler of Ku wait, Sheik Sabah alSalem al Sabah, has issued instructions to his Government to resume the annual subsidy to Jordan as of this month.

title: Hanoi Reports U.S. Force Near.
description: TOKYO, Saturday, March 6 (AP)A Hanoi broadcast said today that four United States landing ships with 1,500 American marines aboard had approached close to the North Vietnamese coast in the southern panhandle ready for action.

title: PRICES DECLINE ON. LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange moved fractionally lower yesterday in quiet dealings.

title: 2 NEWSPAPER OWNERS. SENTENCED IN GREECE
description: ATHENS, March 5  Two newspaper owners were sentenced to serve seven months in jail and pay $3,333 fines for having printed a misleading headline involving Vice President Agnew.

title: Two Killed in Panic in Brazil
description: SALVADOR, Brazil, March 5 (AP)Two young spectators were killed last night and 2,000 were injured when panic broke out in the packed grandstands of a soccer stadium in this northeast coastal city.

title: N.F.L. Owners, Players Concur on Written Pact
description: The National Football League Players Association and the N.F.L. owners announced settlement yesterday on a written fouryear contract that had been agreed to verbally last summer.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended March 2.

title: $250,000 Jersey Standard Gift Gives Harlem Prep a Reprieve
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) announced yesterday that it was giving $250,000 to the Harlem Preparatory School, a private, tuitionfree high school serving black and Puerto Rican youths here.

title: N.Y.U. Girls Dorm Reflects Turmoil
description: The Samuel Rubin International Residence Hall is a New York University women's dormitory near Washington Square that looks like the hotel it once was.

title: SABRES, HAWKS PLAY 22 DEADLOCK
description: BUFFALO, March 5 (UPI)Eddie Shack and Steve Atkinson scored goals in the second period 62 seconds apart tonight to earn the Buffalo Sabres a 22 tie with the Chicago Black Hawks in a National Hockey League game.

title: French Riviera Gets Snow
description: NICE, France, March 5 (Reuters)  Startled residents of French Riviera resorts, including Nice, awoke today to find palm trees and mimosa blossoms covered with snow. In part of Nice, the snow was four inches deep.

title: Police Station Bombed
description: BELFAST, March 5A police station was damaged by bomb in 10 hours of rioting here today.

title: Bridge:TopRanked Black Experts Play Touring Stars Today
description: An unusual match will be played today at the Mayfair House of Bridge, 119 West 57th Street. For the first time the topranked experts of the American Bridge Association, which has long provided for the tournament requirements of black players, will play a long head  to  head match against a group of internationally famous stars.

title: Police in Philippines Deny Moslems Seized a Town
description: MANILA, March 5 (AP)National police headquarters denied today that a band of armed Moslems had attacked Iligan on Mindanao Island and seized the provincial capital.

title: Diplomacy in the Living Room
description: Nina DeNur, a nativeborn Israeli, says she is in the United States looking for Arabs.

title: SAMUELSON BACKS NEW ECONOMICS
description: With the air of a heavyweight champion who knows the weaknesses of all his opponents, Prof. Paul A. Samuelson defended the new economics at the New School for Social Research here yesterday.

title: RATE OF JOBLESS FELL IN FEBRUARY FOR A 2D MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The nation's unemployment, rate declined in February for the second consecutive month, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Urban Death, or Resurrection
description: I look at the cities and recognize that so much must be done to make them livable communities once again. A large part of the responsibility lies with city officials whose job it is to govern creatively by both responding to the people and also leading, educating and enlightening them. Our city governments have faltered in this respect, having become so rigid as to strangle most efforts at creative reform.

title: Occidental Chairman Issues Statement on S.E.C. Action
description: The chairman of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced last night that a permanent injunction had been entered, with the consent of Occidental and himself in the United States District Court here in an action brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: BATT LOCKHARD SPAIN
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., March 5Bati Lockhard Spain, a former executive of the IngersollRand Company in New York, died yesterday in the Francis E. Parker Memorial Home after a long illnesi. He was 83 years old and lived at 122 North Sixth Avenue, Highland Park.

title: Knapp Panelist Sworn In
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday swore in John E. Sprizzo, an associate professor of law at Fordham, as a member of the fiveman Knapp Commission to investigate allegations of corruption in the Police Department. Mr. Sprizzo, who was in the Organized Crime Section of the Justice Department from 1959 to 1963 and later an assistant United States attorney, replaced Arnold Bauman, who resigned to work full, time at his law practice.

title: Letters to the Editors
description: To the Editor: In his article on the draft Senator Kennedy writes,  if we are to force some of our young men to fight the continuing war in Indochina But that is the question: Are we to force our young men to fight this war?

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Books of The Times
description: EVERYBODY KNOWS AND NOBODY CARES. A novel by Mason Smith. 213 pages. Alfred A. Knopf, $5.95.

title: Talks in Prague Reported
description: VIENNA, March 5Kathpress, the Austrian Catholipress agency, said today that secret negotiations were under way in Prague between a ranking Vatican envoy and Czechoslovak officials.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: GOVERNOR PUSHES BILL TO CURB SMUT
description: ALBANY, March 5Governor Rockefeller urged the Legislature today to bar the display of pornographic materials in public places or places easily visible from public thoroughfares.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President sent  his urban community development message to Congress. Later in the morning the President met with Chairman Paul W. McCracken of the Council of Economic Advisers, Treasury. Secretary John B. Connally Jr., Federal Reserve Board Chairman Arthur F. Burns and Director George Shultz of the Office of Management, and Budget. The President had an afternoon meeting with Governor Rockefeller of New York. The President also met with this National Security Council.

title: Ombudsman for Prisoners
description: SALEM, Ore., March 5 (AP) An ombudsman is to be appointed soon to represent the 1,160 inmates of the Oregon State Pehitentiary. John Galvin, director of the state Corrections Division, said yesterday he and Prison Superintendent Hoyt Cupp were considering a list of 18 candidates submitted by the inmates to speed processing of grievances.

title: Hanoi Bids People Prepare to Smash Assault
description: HONG KONG, March 5Premier Pham Van Dong has called on the people of North Vietnam to increase their support to the South and be prepared to smash any war act against the North.

title: Sharif Khan Beats Leddy In Pro Squash Racquets
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 5Sharif Khan advanced to the quarterfinal round in defense of the North American professional squash racquets championship tonight. He defeated Jim Leddy of the Yale Club of New York, 1510, 157, 158 at the ChalfonteHaddon Hail Club.

title: U.S. Missionary. Expelled From Taiwan, in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, March 5 (AP) An American missionary expelled yesterday from Nationalist China acknowledged today that he had had private talks with Taiwanese friends on the subject of independence.

title: NASSAU CUP SAIL IS TAKEN BY DORA.
description: NASSAU, Bahamas, March 5 Dora won the Nassau Cup today, Running Tide clinched the season's S.O.R.C. title, Sorcery crossed the finish line first and Andante II, a little Glass E boat, was the surprise a the fleet in the final event of the Southern Ocean Racing Conference.

title: Party Leader Killed
description: CALCUTTA, March 5 (AP)A prominent local politician was killed early today in a new outbreak of the terrorism that is threatening to disrupt West Bengal's participation in India's parliamentary elections.

title: Antiques: Art Deco Silver Is Plentiful
description: Art Deco silver collectors are finding enough material on the market to get fussy about what they buy.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, March 5A transportation system patented this week proposes to shoot people and freight through a tube at more than 400 miles an hour. Thevehicle, with no power aboard, is to be propelled by differences in steam pressure ahead and behind. Patent 3,566,800 was granted to Dr. Raymond Chuan of the Susquehanna Corporation's Atlantic Research division in Costa Mesa, Calif., and Norman V. Peterson, a Los Angeles consultant. The concept has been experimentally verified in laboratory tests under partial sponsorship of the Department of Transportation's Federal Railroad Administration.

title: John C. Vander Pyl, 83; Led MachineMetals Firm
description: POUND RIDGE, N.Y., March 5John Cornelius Vander Pyl, who retired as chairman of American Machine and Metals, Inc., (now Ametek, Inc.) in 1957, died yesterday in his home at Fancher Road. His age was 83.

title: 2 RUMANIANS GAIN IN INDOOR TENNIS
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 5 (UPI)Ion Tiriac of Rumania came from a 15 game disadvantage in the first set to win it, 75, and then went on to defeat Thomas Koch of Brazil today in the quarterfinals of the National Indoor tennis tournament.

title: Army Routs Rochester
description: ROCHESTER, March 5 (AP) Army built an early lead and made it stand tonight in defeating Rochester, 7056.

title: Two Vigorous Veterans
description: Two veteran musicians, both in years and in number of appearances with the New York Philharmonic, began the orchestra's program in Philharmonic Hall on Thursday night. They were Karl Bohm, who was starting a threeweek engagement as guest conductor, and Claudio Arrau, the piano soloist. In Brahms's Piano Concerto No. 2 in B flat, they denied their years with the vigor and concentration of their performance, and they affirmed them with the breadth and sensibility of their approach.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Alabama Station Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission said today it had dismissed a petition by blacks in Mobile, Ma., who challenged renewal of the broadcasting license of Mobile television station WALA.TV. The commission rejected accusations that Universal Commtmioations Corporation had distorted or omitted news coverage of Mobile's Negro community.

title: GAS CLOUDS ON MOON ARE AGAIN DETECTED
description: HOUSTON, March 5 (AP)Scientists at the Manned Spacecraft Center here said today that instruments on the Moon have again detected evidence of gas clouds.

title: C.A.B. Backs Mohawk Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board approved today the plan of Mohawk Airlines to offer roundtrip fare discounts of 33 to 35 per cent off normal coach fares for groups of 10 or more persons, between Chicago and Minneapolis and 19 other cities, from June 21 through next Sept, 10.

title: Letters to the Editors
description: To the Editor: Thousands of Americans share great concern for developments in West Germany now unfolding as a result of the recently negotiated BonnMoscorw treaty. Having discovered that Communist economy is no match for Western technology, the Kremlin ruling clique is attempting to get West German technological know how to bolster its sagging economy.

title: U.S. DENIES GRANTING ANTITRUST, IMMUNITY
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The Justice Department asserted today that it had not granted antitrust immunity to United States oil companies for coordinating their negotiations with oilproducing countries. But the department refused to state precisely what it had told the oil companies.

title: 200 Delegates Mark World Day of Prayer
description: More than 200 representatives, nearly all women, of 15 Protestant, Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches yesterday gathered at Riverside Church to mark the annual observance of World Day of Prayer.

title: STATE DRUG UNIT HEARS PHYSICIANS
description: Dr. Max. Fink, a professor of psychiatry at New York Hospital, told, a state group studying narcotic drugs at a hearing yesterday that governmental funds should be made available to consider using drugs other than methadone to control heroin addiction.

title: Germans to Meet on Passes
description: BERLIN, March 5 (AP)East Germany today accepted a West Berlin proposal to begin talks tomorrow on passes for Easter visits in the eastern sector.

title: Art Review
description: Whatever the art agenda has lacked this season, no one can complain that it's short on Italian drawing. Last fall Wildenstein's staged a perfectly splendid exhibition from one of the major lodes  Oxford's Ashmolean Museum. The Metropolitan Museum is currently presenting a brilliant drawing spectacular, The Eighteenth Century In Italy (through March 21). And now the New School Art Center, 65 Fifth Avenue, weighs in with its own pithy contributionOne Hundred Italian Drawings from the 14th to the 18th Centuries, a slice from the famed Janos Scholz collection.

title: EARNINGS OF BASF FELL 13.3% IN 1970
description: BASF, A. G., of West Germany announced yesterday that it had earned $84million in 1970, a decline of 13.3 per cent from the $97million profit reported in 1969.

title: Hopes for Settlement Dim In Newark School Strike
description: NEWARK, March 5  Hopes for a settlement in the fiveweekold teachers strike here in the foreseeable future were virtually nonexistent today.

title: BISHOP BIDS NUNS STAND BY SCHOOLS
description: Religious orders who have withdrawn teaching nuns and brothers from many Roman Catholic schools were reminded yesterday by a highranking member of the church that they may be abandoning., the schools at a time, when the church urgently needs them.

title: Sound Start by the President
description: The messages President Nixon has sent to Congress on the manpower and urban development parts of his revenuesharing plan reflect an admirable willingness to adapt his program to make it more responsive to valid criticisms.

title: Classes in Race Relations Ordered for Armed Forces
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird announced today a major new program that will require every man in the armed forces to attend classes in race relations.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The military's job is to fight and not to lead social revolutions.

title: Drama: Based on Rain
description: A newbut don't get too excitedmusical, Look Where I'm At! opened last night at Theater Four, where once Mart Crowley's boys had their band on 55th Street. At least I presumed it opened. I saw it Thursday night on its final preview. If prudence prevailed and the producera Miss Jean MerieLeerelented, I imagine she would have telephoned the paper. At the final preview they looked as though they were going to fight through to the bitter end, which is probably all very right and courageous.

title: Illustrated Version Of Obscenity Study Brings Indictments
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP)Three corporations and four individuals were indicted today in connection with the publishing of an abbreviated text of a Federal pornography report, accompanied by allegedly obscene pictures.

title: Transit Nominee Backed
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) Herbert F. DeSimone, former Rhode Island Attorney General and unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor last year, was endorsed yesterday by the Senate Commerce Committee for the post of Assistant Secretary of Transportation for the environment and urban systems.

title: Last Family Housed In Nurse Residence Moved Out by City
description: The last of 44 welfare families housed at the Margaret Fahnestock Nurses Residence since they occupied the offices of Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman in January was moved from the residence yesterday and assured of an apartment.

title: Samara of Penn Captures I.C.4A LongJump Title
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 5 Each long jump pit has, a personality, Fred Samara said today. But not every pit has feeling. You know, soul.

title: Braves Win on Jackson's Hit
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 5 (UPI)Sonny Jackson's tworun seventhinning triple broke a 22 tie today and gave the Atlanta Braves a 42 victory over the Montreal Expos in the Grapefruit League opener for both teams.

title: Muslim's Grandson Seized
description: CHICAGO, March 5 (UPI)Herbert Muhammad Jr., 21yearold grandson of Elijah Muhammad, leader of the Black Muslirn sect, was arrested today by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents for allegedly refusing induction into the military forces.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEES, PRESIDENT ON AID
description: WASHINGTON, March 5Governor Rockefeller came to the White House today to praise President Nixon's revenuesharing program and to ask that it be raised.

title: Art: Whistler and His Contemporaries
description: The large loan exhibition called From Realism to Symbolism: Whistler and His World, which opened this week at Wildenstein & Co., 19 East 64th Street, is an event to ponder as much as a show to see. Although the paintings and graphic art of the legendary American artist James McNeil Whistler (18341903) dominate the exhibition, this is very far from being a oneman show. The explicit aim of the exhibition is to look at Whistler's relations with his contemporaries as a means of examining the complexity of the various progressive developments of the late 19th century.

title: Campaign Fund Left By Dirksen
description: PEKIN, Ill., March 5 (UPI)The ful linventory of the late Senator Everett McKinley Dirksen's estate, filed today in Tazewell County Probate Court, disclosed that Mr. Dirksen had $53,379.43 in unspent campaign funds in a Washington lock box when he died.

title: 2 Pipe Bombings in Detroit
description: DETROIT, March 5 (UPI)Pipe bombs destroyed two mailboxes and caused minor damage to a bank early today after the police received telephone warnings from two persons who said they were members of the radical Weatherpeople organization. There were no injuries.

title: Boy, 3, Killed in Newark In Robbery of Neighbors
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., March 5 (AP)A 3yearold boy was killed tonight by a bullet fired during a $115 holdup, the police said.

title: Lord Harlech at Fulton, Calls for. Atlantic Unity
description: FULTON, Mo, March 5 (Reuters)Lord Harlech, fornier British Ambassador to the United States, tonight called for a strong Atlantic community to save the world from war, tyranny and selfdestruction as, a result of the increasing environmental problems.

title: Zambia Is Accused by Portugal In Kidnappings in Mozambique
description: LISBON, March 5  Portugal accused Zambia today of responsibility for the kidnapping of 11 civilians of Portuguese nationality by Mozambique nationalists based in Zambia.

title: 74 AUTOS TO GET NEW SAFETY AIDS
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 The Department of Transportation issued a compromise safety standard today that calls for frontseat passive restraint system such as the air bag on 1974 models of all passenger cars.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have just endured the agony of reading President Nixon's foreign policy report (State of the World). Reflecting its primary authorship by security adviser Henry Kissinger, the report conveys a tone of pontifical pretension and injured benevolence. It is a, gratuitous insult to the intelligence of every informed reader.

title: COLUMBIA STOPS PRINCETON, 7162
description: The waters of the Columbia swimming pool were calm, but Pete Carril wasn't.

title: Yahya and Bhutto Confer
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March President Yahya conferred today with Zulfikan Ali Bhutto, leader of West Pakistan's dominant Pakistan Peoples party on the crisis in East Pakistan that followed this week's postponement of a constitutional assembly.

title: 12 DEPUTIES FREED IN COAST RIOTING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 5After losing six straight jury trials, the Government last night asked and was granted dismissal of three remaining Federal indictments against sheriff's deputies who were accused of mistreating people during the people's park riots in Berkeley in May, 1969.

title: Jackson, in Split With President, Backs Peking's Entry lnto U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, the most hard line antiCommunist among the Democratic Presidential prospects, said today that the United States should accept as inevitable the early admission of mainland China to the United Nations.

title: ISRAELI AID URGED FORSOVET JEWS
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 5The determination of American and Canadian Jewish leaders to expand Israel's economy, enabling it to receivethose Soviet Jews who may be permitted to emigrate, was expressed in strong terms here today.

title: 2 Specialists Fined $25,000 and Given BigBoard Rebuke
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that the advisory committee of its board of governors had censured and fined two specialists, who make markets in stocks assigned to them on the exchange's trading floor.

title: Security of Israel's Borders
description: Secretary General Thant's appeal to Egypt and Israel to Maintain the Suez ceasefire should give President Sadat the sanction he needsand undoubtedly wantsto refrain from renewing hostilities when his selfimposed deadline expires tomorrow.

title: U.S. Discloses Figures On P.O.W.'s and Missing
description: WASHINGTON, March 5The White House made public today the following recapitulation of American prisoners of war and men missing in action to clarify President Nixon's statement at his news conference last night that there are 1,600 Americans in North Vietnam jails under very difficult circumstances at the present time:

title: Albany Democrats Propose Measures To Aid Consumer
description: ALBANY, March 5  Democratic leaders of the Legislature today proposed a sevenpoint consumer protection program, which they said was designed to end abuses that have been permitted to exist far too long.

title: Precedents Outlined
description: WASHINGTON, March 5 (AP) Current Japanese proposals to the United States for voluntary restraints on textile exports are similar to voluntary restrictions already placed on Japanese exports to Britain, Canada and Australia, the United StatesJapan Trade Council said today.

title: The AllTime Fascination Bout
description: The birds of paradise now will flock to Madison Square Garden on Monday, will arrive In glittering latterday revisions of the horseless carriage. They will bear themselvesnearly aloftwith a constantly revitalized sense of what is fabulous. Fashions proletanian throng. A swirling, deathless flash, multicolored costly fabric housing male and female. All this and much more from America's clamorous, glamorous freelance aristocracy, all masquerading as boxing fans, doing grabbag dance steps in front of the arena. Pastel garments, faces of the rainbow

title: Squaring a Debt to the I.L.O.
description: The appointment of former Chief Justice Earl Warren to a key committee of the International Labor Organization, provides an appropriate setting for rectifying the error Congress made last year in cutting off United States payments to the I.L.O.

title: SLAYING ORDER FOR MYLAI DENIED
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 5  The commander of the American task torce that assaulted the hamlet of Mylai ordered his officers to respect the lives of South Vietnamese civilians, the intelligence officer of the force testified today at the courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: Broadcast of Fight Barred to Many G.I.'s
description: Many military servicemen around the world will be unable to hear the blowbyblow radio account of Monday's heavyweight championship fight between Joe Frazier and Muhammed Ali.

title: Finley Paints a Picture Of Optimism at Stevens
description: We are In a solid financial condition and have taken steps to counteract the recent drop in sales and profits, John D. Finley, chairman of J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., said yesterday.
