description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., March 6Miss Barbara Ann Howard and Peter Alan King plan to be married in July.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Nixon Congratulates Trudeaul
description: THURMONT, Maryland, March 6 (AP)President Nixon telephoned his congratulations today to prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada, who was married Wednesday. Mr. Trudeau, honeymooning at a ski resort near Vancouver, British Columbia, invited the President to visit Canada soon. The President is spending the weekend at Camp David.

title: Edward Barrington Stott Weds Miss Janie Warner in Barbados
description: Miss Janie Warner and Edward Barrington Stott, both of Vail, Colo., were married yesterday in Barbados, W. I. The Rev. D. M. Lyder, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony on the front lawn of the St. James Parish home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. R. Miles Warner of Southport, Conn.

title: Commercial Fireflies
description: Fireflies  flying beetles, actuallyhave long attracted not only one another but also countless children, poets, lyricists and, much more recently, scientists. The latter have been especially interested in the phenomenon known as bioluminescence or living light.

title: Letter
description: To the Editor: Though I enjoyed Israel Shenkees article Tract Record (Jan. 24). I was disappointed at the lack of attention paid to one of America's most prolific radical periodical editorsLouis Fraina. He is mentioned only as one of the contributors to Marxist Quarterly, under the name Lewis Corey, which he did not assume until after 1925.

title: Eastern Kentucky Scarred by Strip Mining, Looks to T.V.A. Suit
description: LOTT's CREEK, Ky., March 5When the mountain comes, slipping down onto the road; all rocks and logs and mud, the residents of Lott's Creek remember the bulldozers and the coal strip miners.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Nets Crush Cougars, 127 to 112;
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 6 (AP)  The New York Nets pulled away in the third period tonight and scored a 127112 victory over the Carolina Congers in an American Basketball Association game.

title: The Good Word
description: Since Wilfred Sheed, last month, covered every base and battened down every hatch (including the kinds of letters that will be received in response to his selfinflicted hemlockery), it is difficult for a smallfry freelance reviewer to answer his charges. How shall I respond, Mr. Sheed? Shall I open my bag of shiny phrases or leave them in the corner with the Partisan Review? What should I feel, Feelings Maven?

title: Claire's Knee: Close to a Perfect Movie
description: WHEN Eric Baner's My Night at Maud's opened here last year, it received unanimous praise as muchI'm afraidfor the fact that its hero and heroine spent a night together in the same bed without having sexual intercourse, as for the more positive pleasures of its burnor, Its insights, its irony and its bookish wisdom. Such was the ecstasy of relief expressed by some critics that you might have thought that they'd not simply been watching movie orgies, but that they'd been forced to participate in them.

title: OffDuty Transit Patrolman Held in TollBooth Holdup
description: An offduty Transit Authority patrolman and a civilian were arrested last night in an alleged attempt to hold up a subway toll booth in the Bronx.

title: L.I.U. RETAINS TITLE IN GYMNASTIC MEET
description: NEW LONDON, Conn. March 6Long Island University, the defending champions, retained its team title in the North Atlantic Gymnastics League today in the nineteam meet at the United States Coast Guard Academy.

title: Sierra Leone Alters Traffic
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone, March 6 (Reuters)Drivers in this West African country have switched to driving on the righthand side of the road. The Government decided on the move 15 months ago to bring traffic into accord with neighboring Liberia and Guinea.

title: IN STRIFETORN CITY
description: IN STRIFETORN CITY

title: Ft. Greene Will Finally Get a Pool, but Not the One It Was Promised
description: Fort Greene in Brooklyn is finally going to get its swimming pool from the city, but it won't be the unusual, yearround facility originally promfeed more than three years ago.

title: PAUL STEWART DIES; A SCOUT LEADER, 75
description: Paul A. Stewart, a leader in the Boy Scout movement and former superintendent of Concord Baptist Church, Brooklyn, died Wednesday in the Veterans Administration Hospital in the Bronx. He was 75 years old and lived at 11402 197th Street, St. Albans, Queens.

title: Stamps
description: SUNDAY, July 4, will witness the inauguration of a series of postage stamps commemorating the American Revolution, Postmaster General Winton M. Blount has announced. The new series may provide an annual stamp leading to the 1976 bicentennial celebration, to be held mainly in Philadelphia, which will also be the site of an international stamp exhibition that year.

title: BOYS AND CLINTON GAIN P.S.A.L. FINAL
description: Two free throws by Ernie Douse with six seconds remaining yesterday gave Boys High School of Brooklyn an 8078 victory over previously unbeaten Taft in a Public Schools Athletic League semifinal playoff contest at Qeens College.

title: When the West was won and a civilization was lost
description: The old man Kiowa George Poolaw, who lived not far from my grandmother's house on Rainy Mountain Creek, died without having learned to read or write. But among his effects there was found a ledger in which he had kept a pictographic calendar of events, a history of the Kiowa tribe, from 1832 to 1900. Kiowa George was a deliberate man, and his method was simple; he set down the one or two most important events of each year and let it go at that. Such was his concept of history.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Embroidery, with its connotations of gaiety, romance and youth, generally gets a lot of attention from fashion designers in the spring season. This year, embroidery is playing a larger role than ever, indicating that there is hope for the dressedup look as opposed to the dresseddown look of Levis, jeans and sweat shirts.

title: 5 Killed in Gang Fight At Cleveland Cycle Show
description: CLEVELAND, March 6 (AP) Five persons were killed and more than 20 others, including a policeman, were injured tonight when a fight broke out at a motorcycle show bewteen two gangs of cyclists. The police said they made several arrests and used tear gas to disperse the gangs, which fought with guns, knives and chains.

title: SCHOOL IN QUEEN WILL STUDY OCEAN
description: The water of Jamaica Bay Will be an integral part of the teaming process at the $20million Beach Channel High School now under construction Rockaway Beach, Queens.

title: Land Deal Spurs Talk of G.E. Move to Connecticut
description: The General Electric Company has taken an option on 66 acres of undeveloped land in Fairfield, Conn., in a move that touched off speculation that all or some of its corporate headquarters might be shifted from Manhattan.

title: Cuban Mackerel Crisis Subsides Off Florida Keys
description: KEY WEST, Fla., March 6Four Cuban fishing boats have returned to the open sea after almost touching off hostilities between two sovereign powers the United States and Florida.

title: For Young Readers
description: The six years between 1939194 have already grown obscuted. The villains and heroes have died or grown oldbut the impact ef World War II is still powerful. Past bltmders have createdpresent crises. This is dearly shown by Col. Red Reeder, a muchdecorated veteran of that war who has written a twovolume history for teenagers, THE STORY OF THE SECOND WORLD WAR (Hawthorn). Illustrated with official photographs and maps, the volumes are concise, readable and jampacked with information.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Messrs. Weiss, Gilman and Chaney ominously state that the opinion of the Supreme Court permitting caseworkers to enter homes of welfare recipients marks the beginning of frightening era in the Court and in our country. [Letter Feb. 25.1

title: ALGERIA SEEKING SUPPORT OVER OIL
description: ALGIERS, March 6Algeria has appealed for the support of the underdeveloped world in her confrontations with France over the control of oil deposits here.

title: Heinemann to Visit Rumania
description: VIENNA, March 6 (Reuters) President Gustav Heinemann of West Germany will pay an official visit to Rumania from May 17 to 19, the Rumanian press agency Agerpres reports.

title: SAMUEL CAUMAN, AUTHOR, 61, DIES
description: Samuel Cauman, author, editor and art historian, died yesterday of a heart ailment at his home, 420 Riverside. His age was 61.

title: Why Florida's Season Suddenly Caught On
description: MIAMI BEACHEarly last month, a prominent New Yorker called a hotel executive here to request reservations for the last three weeks of February. He expected no trouble in getting a room in his favorite hotel during this recession period.

title: Carolyn McInerney Will Be Married
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., March 6Miss Carolyn McInerney and F. Gerard McGrath plan to be married here in May. Miss McInerney is en official assistant in the corporate lending division of the First National City Bank in New York, and her fianc is In the corporate finance department of Blyth & Co., also in New York.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: RECENTeconomic signposts are offering little encouragement to the optimists in Washington and Wall Street. Most of the current data suggest that the robust runup in business activity projects by the Nixon Administration for 1971 still is some distance away.

title: Carolyn Rotter Bride Of Armand R. Versaci
description: MADISON, N. J., March 6  Miss Carolyn Sutherlin Ratter was married this afternoon to Armand Russell Versaci, son of Dr. and Mrs. Armand D. Versaci of Barrington, R. I. The Rev. Donald S. Bachtell performed the ceremony in the Presbyterian Church of Madison.

title: Letter to the Editor 25  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: You aim to be a critic? Here's a handy hint. Review an awful picture, Acclaim it without stint. Conversely, choose a

title: The New Wave: Excitement and Humor
description: SEE, I was black before It was popular, sings John KaSandra. He's one of the new wave of black performers, songwriters, poets and preachers who are defining the black experience in songs as powerfully as black writers have defined it in literature. They are the pop parallels to the avantgarde jazzmen  Archie Shepp, Pharoah Sanders, Sunny Murray, the late Albert Aylerwho have performed the same task in nonverbal music. Not many have broken through to a white audience yet, but it's only, matter of time.

title: Lamhut Dancers Offer First View In a New Studio
description: If you were a choreographer and came into a pristine white studio with clear unbroken space and a dreamy floor as vast as a prairie, would you laugh, run, shout, leap, call, bounce off the walls and start making a dance?

title: Rutgers Posts 16th Victory, Seating Penn State, 8470
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., March 6Rutgers shot 52 per cent from the field and 80 per cent from the foul line tonight as it made a final bid to impress the National Invitation Tournament selection committee with an 8470 victory over Penn State.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: During the past year there have been numerous statements by government officials and others to the effect that too many young physicians are going into research, thereby depriving the country of badly needed medical practitioners, and that the medical schools are stimulating this trend. In part based on such opinions, reductions in biomedical training programs have been justified.

title: ARCARI RETAINS HIS RING CROWN Defeats Henrique in Junior Welterweight Battle
description: ROME, March 6 (AP)Bruno Arcari of Italy, despite having been cut over both eyes, retained his World Boxing Council junior welterweight crown with a 15round decision over Joao Henrique of Brazil before 9,000 fans today.

title: Price Increased to $1 By Morning Telegraph
description: The Morning Telegraph, which to the racing fan is a daily compendium of racing information, will increase its price from 75 cents a copy to $1 starting tomorrow, the day, of Aqueduct's opening.

title: NATO UNIT TO STUDY POLLUTION CONTROL
description: BRUSSELS, March 6  Experts from Canada, the United States, France and Belgium, meeting this week at the headquarters of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, have drawn up a threeyear program for the study of methods to control the pollution of inland waters.

title: Cowboys, Saints and Oilers To Play a Benefit Series
description: DALLAS, March 6 (AP)A fouryear series of preseason National Football League games involving the Dallas Cowboys, the New Orleans Saints and the Houston Oilers was announced today by Bill Seay, president of the salesmanship Club of Dallas.

title: ISRAEL BOND SALE TOPS $107MILLION
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 6A recordbreaking preinaugural sales total of $107.2million in Israel Bond subscriptions was announced tonight before an overflow assemblage of 2,000 American and Canadian Jewish leaders.

title: MARILYN COCHRAN IS SKIING VICTOR
description: LA PLAGNE, France, March 6 (Reuters)Marilyn Cochran of Richmond, Vt., won her second event in the French national skiing championships today, the special slalom, thus taking the combined title.

title: A.B.C. PIN TOURNEY OPENS ON 264 NOTE
description: DETROIT, March 6 (AP)Gary Van Luven of Port Huron, Mich., highlighted the action on the first two squads today as the 68th annual American Bowling Congress Tournament opened at Cobo Hall.

title: Frazier and Ali: Morality Drama Unfolds
description: With all the elements for a memorable international sports spectacle, Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier will settle the controversy over the world heavyweight boxing championship tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Nixon Proclaims Law Day
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) President Nixon has proclaimed Saturday, May 1, as Law Day, calling for Americans to honor not merely the law, but the law givers and above all those citizens who keep the law, He requested the display of the flag on all public buildings.

title: Laurie Jean La Fontaine to Be a Bride
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., March 6The engagement of Miss Laurie Jean La Fontaine to Carl Burckly Schellenberg of Washington has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph La Fontaine. The marriage Will take place on May 15.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Which stock groups did best in the market's big march from last year's lows to the midFebruary recovery peak?

title: JUDGABLE, $63.20, IS VICTOR IN DONN
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 6 Saul Nadler's Judgable, in front from the start, held off Snow Sporting by a nose today to capture the $50,000added Donn Handicap at Gulfstream Park before a crowd of 19,908.

title: Gymnastique Moderne Pioneer Finds Sport Flourishing Here
description: ARLINGTON, Mass.Mrs. Eva Balazs says she has always championed the strenuous life.  She has skied down the most tortuous slopes of Europe and the United States, undergone survival course in the Arctic highlands and practised gymnastics for more than 40 years. Now, at the age of 48, she is pioneering a Soviet sport in this country.

title: UTAH G.O.P. IRKED BY WHITE HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, March 6Utah Republicans, in an angry letter to national party leaders, have sharply criticized the White House's handling of the 1970 political campaign in their state.

title: Esposito Says Service Is Key to Politics
description: A young man in Brooklyn has a problem about his draft status. A family wants to move from one housing project to another. A neighborhood is worried about a threatened decline in ambulance service. A homeowner is threatened with the loss of his toolfilled backyard butkie.

title: 2 Patrolmen Shot in Uptown Section In Unrelated Cases
description: Two policemen were in fair condition in Harlem Hospital yesterday after being shot in separate incidents in upper Manhattan.

title: Overdoing Benign Neglect?
description: THE position of the black composer in American society is like that of the Harlem boy who was playing with a white Catholic friend in the Church School yard when a priest came over to ask him if he were a member of that parish. The boy, without thinking about it, shot back, Are you kidding, man It's bad enough being black.

title: St. ohn's Downs Providence, 7965, for 1,000th Victory
description: St. John's University became the fourth college to win 1,000 basketball games yesterday when the Redmen rallied to beat Providence, 7965, before 3,791 fans at Alumni Hall in Jamaica, Queens, and an Eastern television audience.

title: Chinese Group Strives to Close Generation Gap
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., March 6There is a Chinese saying, Kok ba quor doi, that means: I am my father. It could be freely translated as, In China there is no such thing as a generation gap:

title: New Buses Start Arriving For Service on Queens Lines
description: More than 100 new airconditioned raidoequipped buses will, soon be, in service on Queens streets.

title: FOR THE RECORD
description: To THE EDITOR: If Saul Friedman's letter in the Magazine of Feb. 14 was meant to repair the damage done the N.A.A.C.P. in his article last October, the cure is worse than the ailment. He claims no intent to slur, but the N.A.A.C.P. stands charged with an unethical practice in that, according to Mr. Friedman, we obtained a Department of Housing and Urban Development contract on the pledge that we would perform it. Instead, says Mr. Friedman, we farmed it out to Westinghouse subsidiaries, which did the actual work.

title: Jessica Mitford to Join Suit To Open Jail to Newsmen
description: SEATTLE, March 6Jessica Mitford, the author, announced here today that she would join with the SeattleTacoma Newspaper Guild and a Tacoma newspaperman, Dwight Jarrell, lin a suit to open the McNeil Island Federal prison to newsmen.

title: L.I. Urges U.S. to Consider It As Separate Statistical Entity
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 Nassau and Suffolk counties as trying to secede from the New York metropolitan areafoe statistical purposes at least.

title: La Salle's Ken Durrett WantedBy 2 Leagues
description: The mails have been flooded with wanted posters, the kind usually found on post office walls. But these came out of the tiny press office at. LaSalle College in Philadelphia and they tell of the different teams Ken Durrett has shot up.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: Article 10  No Title

title: Thee Handlers: Durham a Calm Voice
description: After each of Joe Frazier's workouts, Yancey Durham strolls toward the spectators.

title: Jane Grenley Bride on Coast Of E. C. Hanes
description: TACOMA, Wash., March 6 Miss Jane Scott Grenley and Eldridge Copenhaver Hanes were married here this afternoon in the Raynor Chapel of the Annie Wright Seminary by the Rev. Dr. Herbert C. Lazenby of Seattle, an Episcopal priest. The bride is an alumna of the seminary and of Skidmore College.

title: Student to Wed Susan Elkins
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, LI., March 6Mr. and Mrs. Stanley M. Elkins have antounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Renee Elkins, to Peter Alan Bergman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving T. Bergman of Lawrence and Hollywood, Fla. A June wedding is planned.

title: Sarris Vs. SimonWho Won?
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Economics Of Suez Reopening: Consumer Benefit
description: Speaking strictly in terms of economics  if that is possible in the explosive and delicate potpouri of Middle East affairs  the opening of the Suez Canal would appear to be an unqualified boon to almost every country in the world.

title: Graebner and LoyoMayo In L.I. FundRaising Tennis
description: Clark Graebner, the new United States indoor open tennis champion and the East's No. 1 player, will be the principal attraction of a charitable fundraising exhibition benefiting the Visiting Nurse Service of Huntington Township, L.I., at 8:30 P.M. Friday.

title: Morgan's Island Mansion Is Again for Sale
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., March 6 An 83room mansion built by J. P. Morgan on an offshore island here that was once occupied briefly by Soviet diplomats and is now used as a novitiate by Roman Catholic nuns is for sale for a million dollars.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The 1971 model of the supersonic transport is quieter and cleaner, its backers have announced, than those bad old SST's you read about last year. For hearings before the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Transportation last week, they also unveiled a new political propulsion system: A 30day, $350,000 lobbying drive by aerospace companies and unions determined to save this rich development project from the Congressional ax that very nearly, dispatched it last winter.

title: Egypt Due to Hold Fire
description: CAIRO, March 6Irritated by a focus of world attention on the Suez Canal ceasefire instead of on what Cairo regards as the basic issues of an ArabIsraeli settlement, Egyptian leaders appeared determined today to allow the ceasefire to lapse, while keeping their guns silent for the time being under a voluntary withholding of fire.

title: UTILITY IN ACCORD ON THERMAL HEAT
description: CHICAGO, March 6The Northern Indiana Public Service Company broke the power industry's solid front this week by agreeing to build a cooling tower at its Bailly nuclear generating plant, which would eliminate the need to discharge hot water into Lake Michigan.

title: Padres Top Tokyo Nine
description: YUMA, Ariz., March 6 (UPI) Nate Colbert's pinchhit tworun homer in the eighth inning gave the San Diego Padres a 42 victory today over the Tokyo Orions.

title: BOONE THE GREAT VICTOR AT BOWIE
description: BOWIE, Md., March 6 (AP)  AlJo Stable's Boone the Great, driven hard in the final 100 yards, nipped Royal J. D. by a nose today to win the featured $27,500added Prince George Stakes at Bowie.

title: M. H. Kaplan to Wed Barbara Erlanger
description: RYE, N. Y., March 6Mr. and Mrs. Martin S. Erlanger have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Jeanne Erlanger, to Michael H. Kaplan, son of Mrs. Arthur Kaplan of New York and the late Mr. Kaplan.

title: 1Design Craft Compete Today At Sea Cliff Y. C.
description: SEA CLIFF, LI., March 6A Fireball Class sloop, a 16foot dinghy, will be among the craft at the Sea Cliff Yacht Club's onedesign tryout day that begins at 11 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Dead End for the Prisoners
description: President Nixon's determination to maintain American troops in South Vietnam as long as there are American prisoners in North Vietnam offers no practical promise for release of the captives. It is in effect a formula whose unintended result is more likely to prolong indefinitely the agony of the war and the anguish of the prisoners and their relatives.

title: Women's Lib Essence: It Costs $3 an Ounce
description: Take a half dram of hellotropin, four drops of musk and 10 other ingredients and, presto, Women's Lib Perfume at $3 an ounce.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH most dooityourselfers have used plywood for paneling and for constructing furniture builtins or cabinets, many are not really familiar with the various grades and types that can be purchased. As a result, they sometimes spend more than is necessaryor they may be disappointed in the final appearance or longterm durability of their finished projacts. Readers can eliminate or minimize problems of this kind by simply acquainting themselves with a few basic facts about modern plywoodshow they are graded, and what sizes and types are most widely available.

title: The Developing Views of the News
description: The evolution of the editorial from 1500 to 1800, tracing the appearance of opinions on the news in broadsides, pamphlets, newsbooks, ballads, etc., on through early newspaper comments in America. Mildly interesting, quite specialized.

title: MURPHY DIFFUSES POLICE PLANNING
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has ordered each of the city's 76 precicts to develop more innovative planning to meet the problems of the individual commands.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Within the next few weeks, squads of volunteer political activists will flock each evening to the spacious, sparsely furnished headquarters of the new public interest lobby called Common Cause to man a bank of telephones.

title: Sandra Margareten Is'Fiancee of Rabbi
description: Jerome Margareten of Forest Hills, Queens, and Hunter, N. Y., and Mrs. Betty Margareten of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sandra Ilene Margareten, to Rabbi Ben Zion Kirsch. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Shlomo Kirsch of Brooklyn.

title: BucketandMop Boom
description: Soaring volume on the stock market in recent weeks has kept a littleknown, nonglamorous industry even busier than usual.

title: East Pakistani May Declare Secession
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 6 (Reuters)Followers of Sheik Mujibur Rahman expect him to declare the independence of East Pakistan at a rally tomorrow despite the efforts of President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan to prevent a secession.

title: Women in London Hold Biggest Rally For Equal Rights
description: LONDON, March 6Nearly 4,000 singing, chanting, placard waving women marched through downtown London today in Britain's biggest demonstration for women's liberation.

description: Article 12  No Title

title: ANGLICANS BACK WOMEN AS PRIESTS
description: LIMURU, Kenya, March 6The first Anglican Consultative Council agreed this week that women could be ordained as priests under certain conditions.

description: To THE EDITOR:

description: Article 13  No Title

title: Peculiar People, All Right, But What About Them?
description: IF you could figure out why Julie Harris isn't half as interesting as Estelle Parsons in Paul Zindel's And. Miss Reardon Drinks a Little, you'd probably know exactly what was wrong with Mr. Zindel's new play. It's not Miss Harris's fault. She works as precisely and as urgently, in her proudsparrow way, as ever. Certainly it isn't Miss Parsons's. You can't blame an actress for being too good. But Miss Harris is meant to be the center of the play, and the center just won't assert itself.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: In reference to Richard Gilman's article, The Femlib Case Against Sigmund Freud (Jan. 31), Karen Homey did not for the most part leave Freud's basic views on women unchallenged. In fact, she departed so radically from his views that she fell out of grace with him, left Berlin, came to the United States in the early thirties and subsequently founded the American Institute for Psychoanalysis in 1941.

title: Lorraine Ditz To Be a Bride
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., March 6Miss Lorraine Ditz and Thomas Waldrop Moore Jr., 1970 graduates of Stanford University, plan to be married in June.

title: Marquette Routs Xavier, 7658, and Closes Regular Season With 270 Record
description: CINCINNATI, March 6 (AP)  Undefeated, No. 2ranked Marquette overcame a 10point deficit late in the second half and defeated Xavier of Ohio, 7658, today in the final college basketball game of the season for both teams. It was Marquette's 27th victory.

title: Astros Win in 11 th
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 6 (UPI)Houston scored an unearned run in the top of the 11th inning today to spoil Kansas City's Grapefruit League opener, 6.5, even though the Royals collected four of the game's five home runs.

title: 7 Killed in Vietnam Crash
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 6 (AP)Five Americans and two South, Koreans were killed yesterday in the aerial collision of a United States helicopter and a Korean light observation plane, the United States command reported. The report said the collision had occurred 10 miles west of the coastal city of Quinhon.

title: Wisconsin Retains Big 10 Title As Matzdorf Ties Jump Mark
description: MADISON, Wis., March 6 (UPI)Pat Matzdorf, a 6foot3inch junior, equaled the American indoor highjump record today with a leap of 7 feet 3 inches and helped Wisconsin capture its fifth consecutive Big Ten Championship with 57 points today.

title: Muhammad Ali: Man of Controversy
description: In his decade of discord Muhammad Ali has inspired devotion or antagonism, but never indifference.

title: Peter von Raits Becomes Fiance Of Alix Austin
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., March 6 The engagement of Miss Alix Merle d'Aubign Austin to Peter de Peyster von Baits of Bedford has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Victor Austin, parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs, Eric A. von Raits of Oyster Bay, L.T.

title: Stockhausen: Mystic or Muzak?
description: ERIK SATIE, that peculiar little figure in squarely set derby and pincenez who composed some of the most serious jokes in history, continues to preside in spirit over our avantgarde. Satie's detestation of music that must be listened to with one's head in one's hands and his espousal of a purposely banal and decorative musique d'ameublement (furnishings music, or as we would now say, background music) have been guiding contemporary composing styles for many years. It is a line that runs straight from Debussy to John Cage. But in recent years, composers have been pushing Satie's witty little ideas into philosophical, technological and acoustical realms that might have delighted his ironic sense. For, mirabile dicta, what the Satie road has led to is sound that seems to be decorative background but demands to be listened to seriously, like Satie's Socrate.

title: Music
description: THE most interesting thing about the Stockhausen program with the New York Philharmonic, the other week, was the audience. Instead of the elderly clientele who dote on their Mozart, Beethoven and Tchaikovsky, there was long halt., there were miniskirts and hot pants, there were bearded boys in sweaters and denims, there was even a suspicious odor that sort of resembled tobacco. Philharmonic Hall was crawling with kids, and it was a kind or audience that the New York Philharmonic has never attracted.

title: Bill Robinson Hits Homer
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 6 (AP)Rick Reichardt's tworun single in the sixth inning today sparked the Chicago White Sox to a 41 victory over the Cincinnati Reds.

title: Letter to the Editor 27  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: I don't know very much about the movies, but think that John Simon is one of the finest living writers of humor and fiction. Specifically, I want to thank you for printing his picture along with his short story. It is very comforting to know that Mr. Simon looks nothing like Barbra Streisand.

title: Braves On Top, 120109
description: BUFFALO, March 6 (UPI)Don May scored 25 points as the Buffalo Braves snapped sevengame losing streak with a 120109 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers in the National Basketball Association today. The Cavaliers had beaten the Braves seven times.

title: Dodgers Speed Pays Off
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 6 (UPI)Richie Allen's bat and Willie Davis's speed rallied the Los Angeles Dodgers to two runs in the ninth inning today for a 54 victory over the Atlanta Braves.

title: Suede carries on
description: Suede, which has enjoyed skyhigh popularity this winter, is not about to be grounded during the warm weather ahead. What was once thought of as chillchasing gear Baas been stripped of lining, handled with great sophistication, made softer and, on occasion, even made washable. The success of the suedespecializing shops that have sprung up all over the city attest to the current high regard for leather and it is no flight of fancy to assume that men will fer little resistance to sporting their suede right up to the dog days of summer.

title: TURKEY CONTINUES HUNT FOR AIRMEN; RIOTING SUBSIDES
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 6The police and troops continued to search today for the guerrillas who kidnapped and threatened to kill four United States airmen.

title: Jersey A. C. L. U. to Join Defense Of 3 Accused of CrossBurnings
description: HGHTSTOWN, N.J., March 6The New Jersey branch of the American Civil Liberties Union has agreed to help defend three men from this area arrested on charges of crossburning.

title: Too Many Hats?
description: The investing public always has been a little suspicious of the wheeling and dealing that can take place on Wall Street. So it is no surprise that the potential for serious conflict of interest exists in the brokerage business.

title: Art Mailbag,
description: To THE EDITOR: GENE THORNTON has gotten silly. He describes Eugene Smith's photographs, including those of an ancient Spanish village, a southern midwife and the view from his window as news pictures needing captions to be understood. He claims that Smith's photographs were made at the mercy of the public's insatiable passion for pictures of the day's news and that he (Smith) must  point his camera at whatever the maelstrom of current events brings to the surface.

title: G. I.'S OVERSEAS TO HEAR THE FIGHT
description: The Armed Forces Radio and Television Service and the chief financial backer of the world's heavyweight championship boxing match between Joe Frazier and Muhammad All agreed yesterday on selective expansion for American servicemen overseas of a blowbyblow radio account of the fight tomorrow night.

title: Everton Routs Colchester, 50, in Cup Soccer
description: LONDON, March 6 (Reuters)  The Cinderella story of Fourth Division Colchester United ended in disaster today when it was routed, 5.0, by Everton, the English League champion.

title: Pirates Win Slugfest
description: BRADENTOWN, Fla, March 6 (AP)  The Pittsburgh Pirates defeated the Phladelphia Phillies, 1817, in an 11inning preseason game today that included 39 basehits, nine of them home runs.

title: Architecture
description: REVOLUTION is not always a call to the barricades. Some revolutions oan even put you to sleep. Try reading zoning law, for example; it's as dry as dust and as dull as the law books and a numbers game to the uninitiated.

title: 5th Philadelphia Candidate
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 6 (AP)The fifth Democrat to declare his candidacy for Mayor of Philadelphia is 27yearold Albert Sprague, a member of Local 141 of the Lithographers and Photo Engravers International Union. He plans to run as the working man's candidate.

title: Et Al.
description: A lively history of the oil industry told from a severely critical stance. Early buccaneering, needless destruction of oil reserves by speculation, imperialistic battles in underdeveloped countries, political manipulations by the oil lobby. An intemperate book about various aspects of the industry previously covered in separate histories, here drawn together in a readable fashion.

title: How Great Aunt Mary Sailed Away With The World Cruise Set
description: SURROUNDED by nearly 30 of her relatives, Great Aunt Mary, 62 year old retired elementary school teacher, was seated in the smoking lounge on the promenade deck. For the next two hours, until the ship cast off, she would be the center of attention at a family reunion. Then, when her relatives had gone ashore, the moment she had conjured with for nearly 40 years, since she had first stood in front of a class, would arrive. Great Aunt MaryMiss Mary Critelli on the passenger listwould start her voyage around the world.

description: WESTWOOD, N. J., March 6Miss Anne Emelia Gray and Paul Winfield Moore plan to be married on April 17 in the Grace Episcopal Church here.

title: Damp Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Clive Barnes's implication that the judgment of those who paid $1 or $2 for their tickets for the Bejart ballet was of less value than those who paid $6.50 was extremely insulting. And there were many of us who did pay $6.50 night after night and never felt in the least bit shortchanged.

title: Columbia Retains Fencing Crown
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 6Columbia University clinched its 14th Ivy League fencing title in the last 16 years today by defeating Princeton, 1611. The Lions finished their season with an overall record of 91, wonlost. They are 5.0 in league competition.

description: JERUSALEM, March 6 (Reuters)Members of the Baha'i faith in Israel will be granted the status of a recognized community, the Cabinet has decided. They may now set up their own communal courts to rule and record in matters of birth, marriage and death,

title: U.S. Cancellation of Visit By Enterprise Stirs Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 6The lastminute cancellation of a visit to Chile by the United States aircraft carrier Enterprise has dismayed the Chilean military and reinforced the most antiAmerican elements around President Salvador Allende GosSens.

title: Letters
description: Richard Gilman' article is an extremely insightful, sensitive and constructive interpretation of Freud's misogynist ideas and assumptions. All I can say is that it's about time an article like this was written While the article was written by a man, the saliency of the issue and many of the arguments against Freud were raised by women. The article itself is thus evidence of the clearer  understanding and broadening of perspective that is possible when women listen to men and men listen to women.

title: Boeing Will Modify Its 727 and 737 Jets
description: CHICAGO, March 6 (UPI) Edward E. Carlson, president of United Air Lines, has announced that the company will modify 65 per cent of its Boeing 727's and 737's so they will leave virtually no exhaust trails.

description: ALBANY, March 6The state police, an allmale force since the establishment of the division 54 years ago, will soon have women mentbers if a bill Governor Rockefeller submitted to the Legis'attire today is approved.

description: LINCOLN, R. I., March 6 (AP)  Tuinadek scored an upset victory in the $7,500 Lakewood Purse today before 17,158 fans, the second largest crowd of the season, at Lincoln Downs.

title: Blues Band Plays on Flatbush Ave.
description: In the last two months a blues band has grown in Brooklyn and a blues club has taken root on Flatbush Avenue. The club is the NightCap, a worn, unprepossessing looking bar at 570 Flatbush Avenue, a few blocks from Prospect Park, which had rock bands blasting in its back room for seven years until the Blues Busters moved in, early in January, and began to reorient the club musically.

description: TORONTO, March 6 (UPI)Dave Keon's 34th goal of the season helped the Toronto Maple Leafs gain a 22 tie in a brawlfilled contest with the Chicago Black Hawks tonight.

title: Common Market Begins New African Aid Program
description: BRUSSELS, March 6  The European Common Market has allocated a grant of $46million to African countries associated ed with its as a first installment of a $900million air program.

title: Movies
description: WHATEVER happened to Father Chic O'Malley? As casually portrayed by Bing Crosby in Going My Way and The Bells of St. Mary's, he jauntily strolled through a world in which his likable easygoing personality was able to transform teenage hoodlums into choir boys, to persuade hardened businessmen to become paragons of charity, to deter young lovers from premarital sex, to move prostitutes to reform, and even to convert an old Irish pastor into a golf enthusiast. A little crooning by Father O'Malley of such profoundly religious lyrics as Up ahead is rainbow hill, going my way seemed to be all that was needed to encourage people to mend their ways.

title: Syrian Flights Reported
description: TEL AVIV, March 6 (AP)The Israeli military command said that Syrian planes flew over Israeli positions in the occupied Golan heights of Syria today.

title: Letter
description: To the Editor: Rowse's remarks are certainly justified and overdue. It is curious, however, that a man so straightforward and honest should fail to perceive that what is wrong with the T.L.S. is not the predilection of its current editor for the critical views of F. R. Leavis, but the fact that its reviews are published anonymously.

title: The Nation
description: It is a sport that knows no season, requires surefootedness, persistence and political acumen. It is called WilburWatching, and the object is to guess what Wilbur Mills Is thinking. As chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, the Arkansas Democrat decides in large meiAure what taxes the nation will pay and how Federal progrems will be financed; as chairman of the House Committee on Committees, he decides what Congressmen will sit on what committees. Because he is often enigmatic and uncommunicative, observers are constantly looking for any signs of his thinking, and the signs are most oftenuntil the last momentconflicting. Thus last week as the comparative merits'of the revenuesharing program as against Federalization of welfare were being discussed in Mr. Mills's committee, witnesses emerged with conflicting views as to where he stood on the matter. Presumably, only Mr. Mills knows for sure.

title: Future Social Events
description: Seeds and Prunes March 10The legendary tricome hat of the Persian exterminator who was hanged by the Israelites is memorialized in tasty triangular cookies at Purim festivities. They are fine with soft drinks and wine. If you also have folk dancing and folk singing in Yiddish and Hebrew they seem even more gastronomically in. Members of the New York League for Histadrut think so and will serve them at their Purim Party, 7 P.M., at Histadrut Town House, 33 East 67th Street. Contributions at the door, $3 for nonmembers. Norman Uris is president of the League.

title: Et Al.
description: A massive collection of mostly Third World revolutioninprogress polemics, essays, reports. Countries included: China, India, Vietnam, Korea, Indonesia, Palestine (sic), Iraq, Morocco, Algeria, the Congo, South Africa, Portuguese Africa, Cuba, Venezuela, Guatemala, Colombia, Puerto Rico, Uruguay, Bolivia, Quebec, BlackBrown America (Chicanos and Panthers). All the biggies are here: Mao, Lenin, Huey, Eldridge, Giap, Fanon, Che, Kim I, Sung. Much of the material is new in English. Very assertive. A mass of disparate war cries.

title: KNICKS BEAT CELTICS, 112104;
description: The Knicks rode a brilliant firstquarter's shooting to a 112104 victory over the Boston Celtics last night at Madison Square Garden and clinched a berth in the National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: Knicks Have Mixed Feelings Over Bucks Streak
description: The Knicks National Basketball Association record of 18 straight victories was broken Friday night, as Willis Reed put it, before the print in the record book was dry.

title: LEGISLATORS SNAG SAN JUAN CENTER
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., March 8 What is probably an unparalleled opportunity to conveirt more than 200 acres into a housing, business, recreation and transportation center in the heart of a major city is runfling into legislative difficulties here.

title: Gershwins Have Son
description: A son was born Feb. 27 to Mr. and Mrs. Marc George Gershwin of New York in the LyingIn Hospital. Mrs. Gershwin is the former Miss Andrea Gordon. Her husband, who is with Harris, Upham & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange, is a nephew of Ira Gershwin, the lyricist, and the late George Gershwin, the composer. The child has been named Adam David.

title: Sarris Vs. SimonWho Won?
description: To THE EDITOR: I'd like to register a vote for John Simon. His excerpted article was witty, informative, andsay what you will  tasteful. Simon's ability and appeal were only enhanced by the immediate juxtaposition c? Sarris's re, ply. I, for one, prefer a writer who uses odor di fernina to describe what Sarris very tastefully calls a woman's smell. But I don't want to list specific comparisons. Suffice it to say that if Sarris's admittedly ad hominem response is the typical American answer to the Dracula of Critics, I prefer Transylvanian criticism.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Seals, Flyers Play 44 Tie
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 6 (UPI)  The California Seals scored three goals in the third period today to gain a 44 tie with the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Junior College Post Filled
description: FERRUM, Va., March 6 (AP) Dr. Joseph T. Hart of McLean has been elected the eighth president of Ferrum Junior College. He will succeed Dr. C. Ralph Arthur, who died Oct. 13, 197'. Dr. Hart's election to the presidency of the largest junior college in the United Methodist college system was announced Wednesday by Dr. James G. Snead of Roanoke, chairman of the Ferrum board of trustees.

title: Two Days in the Life of The Most Chicken Member of the French Alpine Club
description: GLACIERS often make groaning sounds from their depths as they move, like elderly people coming down flights of stairs, and one of the crevasses moans slightly as step forward. This seems to mestanding there on a tiny, sharp ice ridge leading between two monster crevasses high in the French Alpslike a bad omen, and I retreat. While I am thinking what to do next, I have the sudden conviction that of all the 50,000 members in good standing of the French Alpine Club am the most chicken. This goad works to the extent that I try the ridge again, starting with the other foot. I now begin to wonder what will happen if I slip. This reflection is needless for clearly what will happen is that I will fall into the bottom of one of the crevasses. No doubt climbing is somewhat crazy, but there is a profound satisfaction in conquering one's deepest fears, a sort of spiritual satisfaction which in this age of televised and predigested experience is all but disappearing. Let me go back to the beginning of this day.

title: NEW CANAAN AIDE QUESTIONS ZONING
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn. March 6A Town Selectman here said this week that affluent suburban communities such as this one had not accepted their share of the burden of housing the poor now borne by the central cities.

title: Motorsports Award To Radosta of Times
description: The first prize in the news writing division of the 1970 competition of the National Motorsports Press Association has been awarded to John S. Radosta, motorsports writer of The New York Times. The prize consists of $100 and a pewter trophy.

title: Music
description: AT the Cherry Lane Theater in the spring of 1953, Lucia Dlugoszewski played a new piano piece she had composed especially for an avantgarde concert given there. Being of a poetic turn of mind, she devoted copsiderable thought to writing the title of the piece. It was The space of March, April and May has turned the world on its tender side, and we have to turn the same way.

title: Letter to the Editor 22  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR: Thank you for John Simon and Andrew Sarris. They have collaborated on a scathing satire, perhaps the most penetrating parody of intellectual manners ever written. I congratulate them for their courage in pursuing to the very limit this timely expose of our cultural bankruptcy. I suggest that in the future, instead of using space for reviews of mediocre plays and films, you establish a regular feature called Sports of the Arts and Leisure Section. Keep up the good work, and may the best man win in the World Series of Culture.

title: FORD FUND GAVE 235MILLION IN 70 $1.0Million Drop in Grants by Foundation Reported
description: The Ford Foundation, the countly's largest private foundation, spent $235million last year, or $1.9million less than the previous fiscal year, it reported yesterday.

title: Lieut. Atwood Collins 3d Weds Miss Cynthia Mallory Williams
description: BALTIMORE, March 6Miss Cynthia Mallory Williams was married here this afternoon to Second Lieut. Atwood Collins 3d, U.S.A. The Rev. Robert Patterson performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Redeemer.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Last October, with some customary Washington fanfare, the Administration announced a program whereby deposits in banks owned by Members of minority groups would be increased by $100million within a year. The program, developed by the Advisory Council on Minority Business Enterprise, the United, States Treasury Department and the National Bankers Association, was to be a joint Governmentprivate sector effort.

title: MAIL CLERKS OPPOSE NEW HIRING SYSTEM
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., March 6 The 700member postal clerks union here is protesting a postal experiment under which Civil Service examinations are eliminated for clerk, carrier and mail handler positions.

title: Yes for a Young Man's Fantasies
description: FOR 33yearold playwright John Guare, the worst was over. He had endured the, Off Broadway premiere of his slapstick tragedy, 'The House of Blue leaves, at the Truck and Warehouse Theater by simply downing eight bourbonsstraight.

title: Dance Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Maurice Mart's defensive letter awakens no sympathy in me. Neither am I swayed by his turntheothercheek, forgive them, they know not what they do attitude toward what he claims is the bad treatment he received at the hands of certain journalists.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Trashing
description: Oldfashioned lady writers and oldfashioned revolutionaries often found pseudonyms a useful device. But since today's hip rebels seem to measure their success by column inches and TV news footage, Why an alias for the author of this novel? One possibility, simpleminded but often effective, is that the author is up to the same thing as the perpetrators of The Confessions of Maria Monk or The Protocols of the Elders of Zion.

title: COAST QUAKE LEFT PSYCHIC TREMORS Thousands, Still Suffering Mental Aftershocks
description: VAN NUYS, Calif., March 6 When the earthquake hit Los Angeles last month Dennis was a welladjusted sixyearold. Since then, he has insisted on sleeping in the same bed with his threeyearold sister, the baby in the family. And any time his mother raises her voice he pleads, Please don't yell, please don't yell.

title: The Panama Affair
description: A plodding, conscientious history of the building of the Panama Canal. The narrative bogs down, perhaps necessarily, in

title: Kinsella, Spitz and Hall Excel In Indiana SwimTeam Victory
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 6 (AP)Spearheaded by triple winners John Kinsella, Mark Spitz and Gary Hall, Indiana amassed a record 601 points tonight and gained its 11th straight Big Ten swimming title.

title: DOUBT ON VIETNAM EPORTED IN POLL Gallup Finds Public Lack of Confidence in President
description: WASHINGTON, March 6The same lack of public confidence in Vietnam policies that faced President Johnson in 1967 now confronts President. Nixon, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: But, Poppa, the stock market's been going up for nine months. Let's try to take the company public again!

title: Child for the Silvers
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., March 6  A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Howard Paul Silver on Feb. 17 in St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston. Mrs. Silver is the former Miss Janet Denenholz of Great Neck, L. I. Mr. Silver is a vice president of Euro Foods, Inc., New York, specialty food importers. The child has been named Hayley Anne.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 6An effort will be made in the Appellate Division in Brooklyn Monday morning to get Colombo released on bail from the Nassau County jail, where he is being held on jewelrobbery charges.

title: Maryland Wrestlers Retain Atlantic Coast Loop Title
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., March 6 (AP)Maryland won six individual titles and rolled up 107 points today as they captured the Atlantic Coast Conference wrestling championship for the 18th consecutive year.

title: Stage: Deaf man Glance
description: Robert Wilson is an originalthe first and last Robert Wilson. He has created a new nonverbal, postWagnerian epic theater composed partly of time and boredom, and partly of pastichecollage. At the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Friday night he gave us Deafman Glance, and it ended, very, very early yesterday morning. It had lasted rather more than three hours without an intermission. And indeed without even an explanation.

title: A Critical Season for Evergreens
description: AT this time of year, the evergreens which have served their purpose by looking alive all winter, may need some special care to insure their continued growth. Actually, the dangerous period in their wintering is not yet over, so here are some thoughts about their care this spring.

title: Uruguay's Tupamaros Hurting Tourism
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 2By scaring off masses of Argentine tourists with threats of violence, Uruguay's Tupamaro guerrillas have severely damaged their nation's economyan achievement that is among their announced objectives.

title: ESPOSITO EXCELS AS BRUINS WIN, 63
description: PITTSBURGH, March 6 (UPI) Phil Esposito's three goals helped Boston break two national Hockey League records tonight as the Bruins defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins, 63.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: 2 VIETNAM CENTERS FOR PRESS TO CLOSE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 6 (AP)  The United States Military Command announced this week that the last two press centers in South Vietnam will be closed March 31. The command said the step was being taken for reasons of economy.

title: FrenchGerman Maneuvers
description: QUIBERON, France, March 6 (Reuters)French and German troops will carry out special maneuvers near this town in western France between May 15 and 19, the French Army said today.

title: Flower Shows to See
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 714: You can grow somethingand help fight pollution as you beautify your own corner. With this theme, the Philadelphia Flower Show opens today with exhibits covering 150,000 square feet. Fourteen nurseries have planned space and more than 2,500 varieties of flowers will be shown. The setting will be a continuous garden design with freeform space interspersed with broad walkways. The hub of the show will be horticultural classes rimmed by plants and flowers suitable for apartment balconies. Mass plantings will include a walkthrough rose garden, a marigold garden, and an azalea, glen with an eightfoot waterfall. The show's largest exhibit will be an orchid wonderland. Flower arranging demonstrations by members of Allied Florists will be held daily at 10:30 A.M., 12, 1:30 P.M., and 8:30 P.M. Place: Philadelphia Civic Center. Time: 10 A.M. to 9:30 P.M., Monday through Saturday, and from 12 noon to 7 P.M. both Sundays. Admission: $2.50 for adults; 75 cents for children.

title: Ingredients in the City School Crisis
description: Financial legerdemain, backroom negotiations and political manipulation strew the devious path that has led to the present bitter fight about the city's school expenditures, with the threat of severe curtailment of educational programs.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Red Sox Beat AllStars
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., March 6 (UPI)Carl Yastrzemski had three hits, including a home run, to lead the Boston Red Sox to a 52 victory today over a team of players from the Minnesota Twins, Detroit Tigers and Cincinnati Reds.

title: Street People Are Now Tougher Breed
description: DENVER, March 6  For America's lost children of the streets, the flowers once again have wilted and love has taken on an angry face.

description: Article 8  No Title

title: Susan Penny Is Bride of Lawyer
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., March 6Miss Susan Penny, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wilford Bochat Penny of Garden City and Sherman, Conn., was married here this afternoon to Joe Tood Taylor 3d. Hisparents are Mr. and Mrs. Taylor Jr. of Salisbury, N. C.

title: Louisville, age 12.
description: The fans with the cigars and the hats turned down will be there, but boxing be nothing when I'm gone, the man born Cassius Clay once declared. Herewith, scenes from Ali's career leading up to tomorrow night's match with Joe Frazier.

title: Reader's Report
description: When James Lisle takes a job with the publishers who

title: Sammis and Gray Gain
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., March 6 Jesse Sammis 3d and Gordon Gray of the Field Club of Greenwich, Conn., the defending champions, led the way into the fourth round of the national platform tennis doubles championship today at Fox Meadow Club. Seven other seeded teams also survived as the field of 128 pairs was reduced to 16.

title: Sterling and the E.E.C.
description: PARISWhile negotiators in Brussels are Wrangling over how much Britain would pay in her first year of European Common Market membership, another point of contention  sterling itselfis developing behind the scenes.

title: Columbia Appoints Yost Member of the Faculty
description: Charles W. Yost, former United States delegate to the United Nations, has joined the faculty of Columbia University's School of International Affairs. He will also serve as adviser to the United Nations Association of the United States.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, March 6So the boys, as we call them, are coming back from the war, but what are they coming back to? And what are they bringing back with themwhat thoughts, what dreams, what habits?

title: Portrait of Canada
description: Bright and slick, with good photographs. More a travel book than a national character study. A New York Times Book.

title: 340 Negroes Win Scholarships In 7th National Merit Program
description: EVANSTON, Ill., March 6 The names of more than 340 winners in the seventh National Achievement Scholarship Program for outstanding. Negro students have been announced by Edward C, Smith, president of the National Merit Scholarship Corporation.

title: To THE EDITOR: Sarris Vs. SimonWho Won?
description: To THE EDITOR: Since I am a friend of John Simon, I will probably afford Andrew Sarris an opportunity to shriek with glee by coming to Simon's defense. Throughout, Sarris returns to the fact that Simon, by being unfortunate enough to be foreign born (Yugoslavia) and to speak with an accent (modified Bela Lugosi?), is disqualified as a critic of anything American. By this Birchite standard, Toqueville should he ignored, too, and Sarris, for that matter, should drastically revise his high opinion of Otto Preminger. Wrapping oneself in the flag to argue looks no less demagogic in a movie reviewer than in a Vice President.

title: Art
description: EACH decade in world art recently has had its International Style, its peculiar look which is recognizably and certifiably uptotheminute without being exactly wantgarde, appears somehow equally at home for equally alien) in any of the world's art capitals, and generally proves irresistible to the juries of international art competitions. In the 1940's it was surrealist, in the 1950's it Was expressionistic and in the 1960's it was an olio of Pop, by and Kinetic rapidly subsiding in favor of bigscale abstraction of the sort suitable for contemporary public places, whose design it both complements and, perhaps, has somewhat influenced. Work in this last vein tends to be elegant, blatantly rather mechanical in its esthetics and very expensivelooking.

title: Doctor and 5 Women Aides Die in Arkansas Air Crash
description: HARRISON, Ark. March 6 (UPI)Dr. Phil L. Deal, 41 years old, and his office staff of five young women were killed today when the private plane in which they were riding crashed a half mile short of the runway at Boone County Airport.

title: Status at High Noon: The Lunch Clubs
description: Blood relatives don't count, but corporate families do. How much money a man has, the schools he attended, whether or not he is listed in the New York Social Register or other such social indexes don't apply to membership in the growing number of Manhattan's private executive luncheon clubs.

title: Television
description: THE Columbia Broadcasting System struck a magnificent blow for progress in television with its recent CBS Reports, an hour of hardhittlng reporting that was impeccable in its integrity, absorbing in its revelations and a priceless guideline for electronic journalism.

title: Cheese it, Italian style
description: Before pizza hit these shores and that was, if you will, less than 30 years agomozzarella was primarily known in the U. S. as the molten cheese in veal and eggplant parmigiana. Today, of course, it is a standard supermarket item. And yet, few Americans appreciate its potential. Mozzarella is the principal ingredient in both recipes here: a deepfried luncheon dish called mozzarella in carrozza (carrozza means railroad car, and by huge stretch of the imagination a fantasyprone person might see a slight resemblance) and deepfried cheeserice eggs that go well with roasts.

title: Poles and Vatican Talk Of Date of Papal Ttip
description: ROME, March 6A Polish prelate in the Vatican said today that plans for a visit to Poland by Pope Paul VI this year had reached a stage where dates were being discussed. The journey would be the first by a pontiff to a Communist country.

title: Dance Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR: I had never seen the Bejart ballet, nor any of its dancers (except Suzanne Farrell, of course), until their opening night at the Brooklyn Academy. I came rather inclined not to like them, since I prefer classical ballet to modern dance and avantgarde: shenanigans, and I had been led to believe that Mart's group was anything but classical came as a skeptic and stayed to marvel at the beauty of the dancers, the purity of their technique, and the strength of BeRift's choreography.

title: HARVARD REPORT URGES A NEW POST
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass, March 6A special committee at Harvard University has recommended the appointment of an officer to oversee the nonfinancial aspects of the university's investment policy.

title: MICHIGAN BEATS SPARTANS, 8863
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., March (UPI)Henry Wilmore sparked Michigan in the second half today with 18 of his 26 points to keep secondplace Michigan alive in the Big Ten chase with an 8863 victory over crossstate rival Michigan State.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONOne day in 1969, while musing about the possibilities and obstacles before him, Richard Nixon turned to his aides grid intoned two sentences th'ht have since been printed and framed and now hang on countless walls in the offices of his subordinates at the White House and the Executive Office Building.

title: 76ers Top Pistons, 121115
description: PHILADELPHIA, March (AP)Archie Clark and Hal Greer scored 28 points each to lead the Philadelphia 76ers to a 121115 victory over the Detroit Pistons tonight.

title: Et Al.
description: Memories of the death camps by a survivor, the author of House of Dolls. Images of death, suffering and degradation follow on one another like scenes from a recurrent nightmare. Obsessive, unforgettable.

title: Sarris Vs. SimonWho Won?
description: To THE EDITOR: In this period of antidrama and overfilmic film wherein talents bleed unrecognized and few know what art is and fewer care, the John Simons are utterly necessary. He is heartless but courageous: one of the few to state that the success of No, No, Nanette reflects a bankrupt theater, hit or no. But he is a critic, standards and all, whereas Sarris is a parasitical opportunist and no critic at all.

title: Louis Armstrong Takes to Horn In His Comeback at the Waldorf
description: Louis Armstrong, who is a sort of walking Smithsonian Institution of jazzhe carries so much of its history and development in his personhas reopened his institutional doors after a long illness and is putting the collection on display once again at the Empire Room of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Maoist Youths in Ceylon Attack the U.S. Embassy
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 6 The United States Embassy was attacked this morning by 200 demonstrators, mostly young men, who climbed the embassy walls and threw Molotov cocktails at the building.

title: U.S. SEEKS TO LIFT SKILL OF WORKERS
description: A study of innovative programs throughout the country for upgrading workers skill and pay has been completed for the Federal Labor Department's Manpower Administration to fertilize the thinking of decisionmakers.

title: Mets Defeat Cards, 109;
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 6It was like old times. George Weiss threw out the first ball, Stan Musial stood with a bat in his hand and took it, Casey Stengel put on a chest protector and tried to catch it, Joan Payson clapped her handsand three hours later, the New York Mets scored four runs in the ninth inning to defeat the St. Louis Cardinals, 109.

title: KAHNS REACH FINAL IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 6Topseeded Sharif Khan and secondseeded Mohibullah Khan, cousins from Karachi, Pakistan, battled into the final of the North American squashracquets championship at ChalfonteHaddon Hall Racquet Club today.

title: 28 Appeal Convictions At Democratic Convention
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 (AP) A group of 28 demonstrators convicted of interfering with the police during the 1968 Democratic National Convention appealed today to the Supreme Court, saying that they had the constitutional right to protest peacefully.

title: An Archeological Find Named Iris Love
description: Iris Love, above, pictured last summer at an excavation site Knidos, in what is now Turkey; at right, with the plan of Aphrodite's temple, which she discovered in Knidos in 1969. At far right, she discusses at a New York archeological meeting last December the head she says is from a longlost statue of Aphrodite by Praxiteles a claim that has agitated authorities in and out of the British Museum, which owns the relic. Here, the fragmentary head is projected on a screen with the missing portions drawn in.

title: FAMILY WINS FIGHT OVER ARMY EVICTION
description: FORT CAMPBELL, Ky., March 6The authorities at this base will not evict a black mother and her seven children, who were recently ordered to leave the base by Monday.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Incinerator Expansion Plan at Harbor Opposed
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., March 6Hempstead Harbor, bordered by green estates, smoky factories, and broad beaches, is undergoing a critical period for its survival as an environment for the birds and fish that live in its waters and the people who live on its shores.

title: Brenda Bergquist Is Engaged To John Kessler, Gem Importer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Floyd A. Bergquist of Chevy Chase, Md., have announced the, engagement of their daughter, Miss Brenda Bergquist, to John Whitlock Kessler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Kessler of Woodmere, L. I. A June wedding in Washington is planned.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON Ever since late 1969, Israeli diplomats have been expecting a showdown with the Nixon Administration over the terms of an ArabIsraeli peace settlement. Some thought the time had arrived last week.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: Article 11  No Title

title: Ohio State Wins, 6867
description: EVANSTON, Ill., March 6 (UPI)  Ohio State gained at least a tie for the Big Ten basketball championship tonight by beating Northwestern, 6867.

title: Late. Surge by Princeton Downs Cornell Five, 87.86
description: ITHACA, N. Y., March 6Princeton squeaked out an 8786 victory over Cornell tonight before a sparse crowd of 500 and olosed out its Ivy League season.

title: The World
description: STOCKHOLM  A young Swedish union official sat dowr to dinner in the Grand Hotel the other night and quickly orderer a double whisky. Ridiculous! he said angrily. They say nov that it's a class war. Nonsense I'm a Socialist, a radical. Sine when do Socialists fight wa against the working man?

title: Business
description: In recent months, many of America's major corporations have taken steps to meet public demands that they look beyond mere profitmaking and consider the impact of their activities on the society as a whole. What remains uncertain is the real significance of these changes and the effect they will have on corporate policy.

title: Worldwide Televising of Fight Is the Biggest Item in a $25Million Gamble
description: Rumania just came in, said Dick Rubin as he hung up on a black telephone that seemed to glow red. They call me all day. They wake me up at night, 3, 4 o'clock. I've got bags under my circles.

title: 28 Elderly Men Die in Fire At Clinic in Zurich Suburb
description: GENEVA, March 6Twentyeight elderly men patients died early today in a fire at the University of Zurich's psychiatric clinic at Burgholzli, a suburb of Zurich.

title: Angels Defeat Cubs, 52
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif. March 6 (UPI)Jerry Moses collected two hits and drove in the deciding run today as the California Angels defeated the Chicago Cubs, 52, in their Cactus League opener.

title: Local Boards Say They'll Defy Order to Cut School Programs
description: The city's 31 decentralized school boards announced yesterday that they would defy the Board of Education's order to lay off teachers and curtail educational programs because of an anticipated $40million shortage in the current school budget.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  Four years ago the affluent society began to discover, incredulously, widespread hunger amidst its plenty. Senators Joseph Clark and Robert Kennedy bore personaland angry  witness to this fact after a trip through the hovels of the Mississippi Delta. Soon, there arose a national demand for Federal action.

title: Baseball Signings
description: PHILADELPHIATony Taylor, Infielder; John Briggs, outfielder, Don Money, third baseman.

title: Snob Zoning Fought
description: ALBANY, March 6An Assemblyman introduced three bills this week to prohibit what he called snob zoning in New York that prevents the poor and minority groups from moving to the suburbs.

title: Voyage by Bus
description: The author, his wife and six kids see the. American West on a renovated bus. Leonard Wibberley, Dublin born, author of The Mouse That Roared and a long list of other light novels, nonfiction books and juveniles, has a nice touch.

title: JOB OPINION GIVEN BY ETHICS BOARD Party Officials Held Eligible to Occupy City Positions
description: Mayor Lindsay's chief local legislative liaison man was cleared by the Board of Ethics yesterday to continue in that post although he is the Liberal party's Manhattan chairman.

title: Son to Mrs. Petchesky
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Harry S. Petchesky of New York on Feb. 15 in the Klingenstein Pavilion. Mrs. Petchesky, a Ph.D. candidate in political science at Columbia University and an instructor of political science at Columbia College, is the former Miss Rosalind Pollack.

title: Ann Marston, 32, Is Dead; Was Miss Michigan in'60
description: DETROIT, March 6 (UPI)Ann Marston, an archery prodigy and former Miss Michigan, died today from a stroke which had left her unconscious and paralyzed since Tuesday.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Frank Robinson Named Manager for a Day
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 6Frank Robinson of the Baltimore Orioles will manage a combined allstar team of other major league players against the New York Yankees here next Saturday. He has accepted an invitation to do so from Lee MacPhail, vice president and general manager of the Yankees.

title: COPING WITH THE CRUSH SOME TIPS
description: THE BEST WAY to insure getting a room during this crowded Florida season is to work through a travel agent, according to a local package tour wholesaler. They can check a hundred hotels, and it doesn't cost you any more, he explains.

title: News of Dogs
description: The American Kennel Club has reached another milestone.

title: MULTIETHNIC PAPER PUBLISHED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, March 6A new publication calling itself the nation's first multiethnic newspaper made its appearance here this week.

title: J. C. Snead's 66 for 206 Leads Dickinson by Shot in Doral Open
description: MIAMI, March 6A famous golfing name, Snead, was at the top of the list in the $150,000 Doral Eastern open tourney today. But it was Jesse Carlyle Snead instead of his illustrious uncle, Sam, who was the pacesetter by one stroke after 54 holes with an aggregate of 206.

title: John Perry Weds Barbara Doubleday
description: ANNISQUAM, Mass., March 6So that they could hear the sound of the ocean waves; Miss Barbara Doubleday and John. Ferguson Weir Perry had no music at their wedding here this afternoon, when Rev. J. Alwyn Bradford of the United Church of Christ performed the ceremony on the rocky beach, below the summer home of Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Atwood of Wellesley, the bridegroom's cousins.

title: WINGS GAIN DRAW WITH 0:15 TO PLAY
description: DETROIT, March 6The Detroit Red Wings, trailing by goal, scored in the last 15 seconds tonight to tie the New York Rangers, 22, in a National Hockey League game at the Olympia.

title: Which Party, John
description: Which Party, John

title: Cornell Sextet Takes Sixth Ivy Title in Row
description: ITHACA, N. Y., March 6Cornell clinched the Ivy League hockey title today for a record sixth straight year by beating Brown, 51, in Lynah Rink.

title: U.S. REVIEWS ROLE IN ANTIRED RADIO
description: WASHINGTON, March 6 President Nixon has ordered a study of alternative methods of financing the United States Government's two chief clandestine radio stations, Radio Free Europe and Radio Liberty, qualified sources report.

title: Movies
description: IF you want to see the police in action, try dialing 911. If that doesn't work out, might as well wait for The New Centurions, the movie version of Joseph Wambaugh's novel about the lives and hard times of three Los Angeles cops, pictually, the film will cover five years in their respective careers  from their rookie days in 1960 to the Watts riots in 1965. Richard Fleischer is set to direct the drama, beginning next summer, for the production team of Irwin Winkler and Robert Chartoff and Columbia Pictures.

title: LETTERS
description: Marylin Bender's article How to Be Profitably Hip (Feb. 14, 1971) states that the expression hip capitalist was coined in the February issue of Rags, the new fashion monthly that is the Women's Wear Daily of the underground press. Craig Karpel's article Das Hip Kapital, which was published in the December, 1970, issue of Esquire, uses and defines the terms hip capitalist and hip capitalism.

title: Horse Show News
description: The victor of the Anton J. Roper Trophy, will be decided today at the last of the Secor Farms winter horse show series In White Plains. Sharon Kofmehl's March Hare from the Ox Ridge Hunt Club in Darien, Conn., is in the lead with 25 points, followed by Page Estes's Dinkie with 20; Jennifer O'Neill's Spur of the Moment with 14, and Shelly Stettner's Booth Bay with 13. The trophy is awarded to the horse that accumulates the most points in any one division during the three Secor shows. It is awarded in memory of the former Secor president who died three years ago.

title: Brunswick Hospital at Amityville Expanding Again
description: AMITYVILLE, L.I., March 6  The Brunswick Hospital Center here, which has been involved in more than $7million worth of construction in the last five years, expects to break ground soon for a new laboratory and reception area.

title: Brooklyn Bar Group Will Honor a Justice
description: The annual Rapallo Award of the Columbian Lawyers Association of Brooklyn will be given to M. Henry Martuscello, an associate justice of the Appellate Division, Second Department, at a luncheon on May 15.

title: Newark General Strike Planned
description: NEWARK, March 7 (AP)The president of the New Jersey A.F.L.C.I.O. threatened today a citywide job action to shut the city down tight in support of the Newark teachers strike, now beginning its sixth week.

title: Job Recruiting on Campus Is Off Sharply
description: EVANSTON, III., March 7The class of 1971 is caught in the second surge of a twoyear downward trend in job opportunities for college graduates, a trend that is seen in some quarters as the most precipitous since the Great Depression.

title: PLANES JOIN HUNT FOR 4 111 TURKEY
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 7 (AP) Reconnaissance planes and Jeeps provided by the United States for opium control, Joined today in the search for four kidnapped American airmen.

title: ROBERT DORFMAN, 64, AD SPECIALIST, DIES
description: Robert Dorfman, an advertising specialist for 34 years, died yesterday at University Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived at 251 East 32d Street.

title: DEFALCATION CLAIM REPORTED REJECTED
description: The Depositors Corporation, a $228million bank holding company based in Augusta, Me., announced yesterday that the Maine Bonding & Casualty Company had formally, refused to pay a $2.2million claim to coverdishonest and fraudulent acts committed in the Freeport, Me., office, of the Depositors Trust Co.; the company's largest subsidiary.

title: Tapestries? Well, Not in the Classic Sense
description: They conjure up images of unicorns, knights jousting, women playing lutes, lofty, stony Gothic castles. But they can also be elephant heads, transparent tubes, waterfalls, telephone switchboards, constructions that viewers can walk into and be enclosed.

title: Cordobes Calls City Fantastic
description: In the early afternoon, the sun cleared the rain and mist from the view and Manuel Benitez, El Cordobes, went to the window of the Rainbow Room to look out at the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I would like to put in a good word for the Bell Telephone Company.

title: For an Israeli Soldier, a Time of Watching and Waiting
description: TEL AVIV, March 7It's hard to know how the common Arab feelshe has to leave his wife and family to fight, just as we do. It's not easy for us and it can't be easy for them.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Article 8  No Title
