title: Fire and Ice
description: On a bitterly cold afternoon in February, fire started in a frame attached house in the Bronx and rapidly spread to two adjoining buildings. Twentyone families were driven into the icy street. The Red Cross quickly set up a shelter in the school hall of a church, served coffee and sandwiches to the families and presented toys to the children. Red Cross took twelve of the families to a hotel for the emergency period and transported others who preferred to crowd in with relatives or friends. Red Cross is still helping several of the families to get relocated.

title: CANADIENS DEFEAT RED WINGS BY 41
description: DETROIT, March 7 (UPI)Frank Mahovlich scorched his old teammates for two goals today in leading the Montreal Canadiens to a 41 nationally televised National Hockey League triumph over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: Lesson From Norway
description: In a cynical world which seems to give ever more currency to the description of a diplomat (read any public official) as one who lies in state, the news from Norway should not be overlooked. Premier Per Borten originally told the Storting that neither he nor any of his staff had leaked certain confidential information that concerned Norway's chances for membership in the European Common Market.

title: Dacca Strike Ends
description: DACCA, East Pakistan, March 6  The sixday general strike that had been called by Sheik Mujib ended today, and the city returned to full activity, with shops and other businesses reopening and public transportation resuming.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a former member of the Landmarks Preservation Commission of New York City, I find it heartening indeed that the city's chief executive has acted so effectively to preserve the remarkable buildings and site of Sailors Snug Harbor on Staten Island.

title: Mother, Novelistand Once a Detective
description: Mrs. Anthony Minsk doesn't look like a former detective, but for 12 of the 14 years she was on the Transit Authority's police force that's exactly, what she was.

title: Old Copper Mining Town in West Seeks away to Head Off Its Doom
description: BISBEE, Ariz., March 6 U.S. 80 plunges into the side of Mule Mountain through halfmilelong tunnel and emerges along a ridge overlooking a steep canyon.

title: Copter Crew in Laos Saved
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, March 7 (Reuters)  Seven crewmen of an American helicopter shot down over Laos on Friday were rescued today after being stranded for 48 hours in an area surrounded by North Vietnamese troops.

title: NIXON OPTIMISTIC ON A SUEZ TRUCE
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (UPI)President Nixon said today that the United States and Soviet Union were exerting a restraining effort on the Arabs and Israelis and that he did not expect either side to resume hostilities.

title: Purchasing Agents Feel Recession Now Over, Survey Indicates
description: While a boom is still conspicuous by its absence, it would appear that the 196970 recession has ground to a halt, according to a survey of purchasing agents.

title: Soviet Wins Biathlon Relay
description: HAEMEENLINNA, Finland, March 7 (UPI)  The Soviet Union won the world biathlon relay championship today with Norway taking second place and Poland third. The United States finished 11 th in the 13nation field.

title: Russel Takes Giant Slalom In French Title Ski Meet
description: LA PLAGNE, France, March 7 (UPI)Patrick Russel won the giant slalom title today at the French ski championships. Alain Penz finished second and took the combined title.

title: Advertising:
description: It would appear that the, Association of National Advertisers is putting Its weight behind the Council of Better Business Bureaus and not the proposed National Advertising Review Board of the American Advertising Federation, as the body to handle advertising industry self regulation.

title: Fans Abroad Will Hear Bout in Native Tongues
description: When Don Dunphy, tonight's fight announcer at ringside in the Garden, cites Muhammad Ali's fast hands this will have to be translated into lao lao mue for the rabid fans in Thailand watching over home television.

title: SSTFateful Gamble
description: Before the month is out, Congress will have to vote on whether or not to continue funds for the SST. The big guns of the Administration have accordingly laid down a barrage calculated to change Congressional minds  particularly in the Senate, which first rejected further funds and then compromised with temporary financing to the end of March. The House Appropriations Committee has already succumbed by voting its approval of the requested $290 million in development costs.

title: G.O.P. Cautious on 72 Senate Races
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 Republican stategists, who seriously overestimated their chances of gaining control of the Senate ln 1970, are taking a much more cautious view of 1972, sobered by uncertainty as to how well President Nixon may run.

title: SANFORD.R. KNAPP
description: MOUNT KISCO, N.Y., March 7Sanford R. Kriwv, president of the TaylorKnapp Mining Company of Philipsburg, Mont., died yesterday at his home, after a long illness. He was 66 years old and lived on McLain Street here and in Philipsburg.

title: Jonathan Farkas Weds Kimberly A. Harcleroad
description: Miss Kimberly Ann Harcleroad was married in the Central Synagogue here yesterday afternoon to Jonathan Dale Farkas, youngest of the four sons of George Farkas, founder and past chairman of Alexander's, the department store chain, and Mrs. Farkas of New York. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Carolyn Beatty Harcieroad of New York and John Harcleroad of Atlanta, a retired vice president of Don the Beachcomber, International, a restaurant chain in Honolulu and Hong Kong.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, March 7  Six years ago tomorrow the first American ground combat unit, 3,500 marines, landed in Vietnam. Their announced mission was to protect U.S. bases. As late as June, 1965, a State Department spokesman said that was still the role of the rapidly growing American force  thougth if fired upon, he said, our troops naturally return the fire.

title: Philadelphia Faces a Strike
description: PHLADELPHIA., March 7 (UPI) Transit workers voted unanimously today to authorize a strike March 15 that could paralyze the city's public transporation network.

title: 40,000 Expected at Aqueduct Opening
description: New York's longest season of thoroughbred racing gets under way at Aqueduct today, with an off track likely for the horses but fast footing a certainty for the horseplayers.

title: O.E.O. Project Brings Hope AndControversy to Ramapos
description: RINGWOOD, N. J.  For 150 years tawnyskinned people with Dutch family names have lived here in somnolent isolation and hard times.

title: Aqueduct Entries
description: Aqueduct Entries

title: COLOMBIA FACES GENERAL STRIKE
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 7 Colombia's power structure continued closing ranks today behind President Misael Pastrana Borrero, who faces a test of strength tomorrow against an alliance of opposition forces ranging the political and ideological spectrum.

title: RED CHINA CHARGES BOATS ARE HARASSED
description: HONG KONG, March 7 Communist China issued a strong protest today against what it called a deliberate provocation by the United States and South Vietnam against two Chinese fishing boats in the Gulf of Tonkin.

title: INSTITUTE WEIGHS RATE NEGOTIATION
description: Negotiated commission rates for stock transactions would tend to concentrate institutional trading on the New York Stock Exchange but also would be likely to drive some brokerage firms out of business.

title: Michael Lorimer Plays Bach Fugue on Guitar
description: Michael Lorimer, a young West Coast guitarist who studied with Andres Segovia and teaches at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music, made his New York debut at Tully Hall Saturday night. Everything about Mr. Lorimer and his playing bespoke the serious musician: his modest stage manner, his studied avoidance of bravura display pieces, his leisurely tempos, his wellthoughtout, meticulously execiited ideas.

title: NETS TURN BACK SQUIRES, 123121
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. 1., March 7 (AP)  Manny Leaks sank two free throws with three seconds left to enable the New York Nets to beat the Virginia Squires, 123121, in the American Basketball Association today for their 10th victory in the last 12 games.

title: COURT HOLDS UP ALL SCHOOL CUTS PENDING HEARING
description: A State Supreme Court justice temporarily blocked the City Board of Education last night from implementing severe economy measures that were to take effect today.

title: PILL FOR GIRL, 16, STIRS THE BRITISH
description: LONDON, March 7A British doctor's decision to tell the parents of a 16yearold girl that she was taking contraceptive pills has raised a set of moral and ethical questions among doctors and spurred wide public debate.

title: Sharif Khan Retains Crown In Pro Squash Racquets
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 7Sharif Khan of Detroit won the North American professional squash racquets championship today for the second year. He rallied and turned back his cousin, Mohibullah Khan, of the Harvard club of Boston, 715, 158, 1215, 15.4, 1511, at ChalfonteHaddon Hall.

title: Buildings Seized in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 7 (Reuters)  About 100 people who said they represented the homeless today occupied seven unfinished blocks of apartments in central Santiago. Policemen were sent to prevent incidents but no immediate action was taken to dislodge the squatters.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Editorials like The Hillsides of Jerusalem (Feb. 17) denouncing Israel's housing construction plans in Jerusalem as a serious threat to the future of the Holy City and to the cause of peace are not conducive to creating a realistic atmosphere for genuine peace in the Middle East.

title: Bullets Win Crown In Central Division By Defeating Suns
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 7 (AP)The Baltimore Bullets clinched the Central Division championship in the National Basketball Association tonight with a 117108 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: SNIPER HITS 3 RIDERS AND KILLS HIMSELF
description: GREENWATER, Wash., March 7 (UPI)A leenaged sniper atop a 100foot cliff fired at passing automobiles today, wounding at least three persons before killing himself.

title: Carr in EastWest Game
description: DAYTON, Ohio, March 7 (AP)Austin Carr of Notre Dame has been named to play in the EastWest college AllStar basketball game on April 3 at the University of Dayton.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 8, 1971 ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: MRS. ARTHUR A. EBERLE
description: DANBURY, Conn., March 7  Mrs. Catherine Schmiech Eberle, wife of Arthur A. Eberle, former controller of the New York Academy of Medicine, died here yesterday. She was 83 years old and lived at Huckleberry Hill Road, Brookfield.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Feb. 24 letter of Charles F. Luce, chairman of the board of the Consolidated Edison Company, is misleading for several reasons.

title: HAROLD DANZIGER
description: Harold Danziger, of 6441 Saunders Street, Rego Park, Queens, a member of the national advertising and publicity department of Columbia Pictures, died yesterday in Kings Highway Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 67 years old.

title: Creation of Slums Linked To Rural Food Shortages
description: CHICAGO, March 7 (AP)Food shortages in rural areas create slums in cities, an Alabama researcher says.

title: 5 Stab Man to Death In Village Apartment
description: A 24yearold Greenwich Village man was stabbed to death last night when he went to answer a knock at his door, the police said.

title: Shearson, Hammill and Amex Name Executives for Key Posts
description: Two highlevel executive appointinents in the securities industries were disclosed over the weekend.

title: News Analysis
description: The impact of the Joe FrazierMuhammad Ali fight on the world of communications will extend far beyond tonight. The effect thus far of the closedcircuit presentation already bears out many contentions of broadcasters who have opposed payasyousee TV on economic and public service grounds. The electronic life is going to change. Even if every seat in 350 theaters and an unknown number of hotels, motels and cable systems is sold out, the TV audience in the United States will be one of the smallest in the history, of the medium. The total number of persons watching the fight, live is unlikely to exceed two million or so, a figure of minuscule proportions in comparison with the audience for an old movie on free TV.

title: Tickets to Nowhere, Texas
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., March 7 (AP)Hundreds, and possibly thousands, of bogus $10 tickets to San Antonio's closedcircuit telecast of the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier fight tomorrow night am being circulated throughout the city.

title: BRANDT'S POLICY FACES BERLIN TEST
description: BERLIN, March 7Willi Danzl, a successful Berlin businessman in his late thirties, shook his head thoughtfully and said: I find the present German Ostpolitik extremely dangerous. If we Berliners lose our West German citizenship, I shall close up and leave.

title: James Franklin Plug Marries Carla J. Carbaugh in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 7Miss Carla Josephine Carbaugh, a program analyst with the legal services program at the Office of Economic Opportunity, was married here this afternoon to James Franklin Flug, chief counsel of the Senate Subcommittee on Administrative Practice and Procedure. Rabbi Joseph I. Singer performed the ceremony at the Shoreham Hotel.

title: Nixon Asserts He Is a Progressive  T. R., Not F.D.R.
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 President Nixon, who has refused to grant interviews to individual American reporters, spent part of a morning early last month with Peregrine Worshthorne, a British columnist for The London Sunday Telegraph.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In regard to your editorial, I would like to know what the basis is for considering East Jerusalem Arab territory. There was a sizable Jewish population in the Old City before 1948. When the Arabs gained control over East Jerusalem, they made the Old City empty of Jews.

title: Syria Aids, Vietcong
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 7 (Reuters)Syria donated five tons of medicines and a ton of cloth to the Vietcong today as a token gift for what was termed their struggle against imperialism.

title: Missing Arizonan Found
description: PRESCOTT, Ariz., March 7 (AP)  A 21yearold combat veteran, Eugene Lanman of Prescott, was found near here today, weak but in satisfactory condition, after being lost 25 days in the mountains. A family sightseeing in a fourwheel drive vehicle found him lying on a rocky hillside, crying faintly for help, sheriff's deputies said.

title: HYMAN CHIPURNOI, CANDY DEALER, 101
description: Hyman Chipurnoi, a retired candy and food importer, who celebrated his 101st birthday on Feb. 10, died yesterday at his home, 10440 Queens Boulevard, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Cynthia Joy Gardstein Is a Bride
description: Miss Cynthia Joy Gardstein and Arthur Joel Zucker were married here at noon yesterday. Rabbi Harvey M. Tattlebaum performed the ceremony in the Terrace Room of the Plaza. Dr. and Mrs. Henry F. Gardstein of Brooklyn and Lido Beach, L. I., are the parents of the bride, whose husband is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Zucker of Lido Beach.

title: Advertising:
description: When Mayor Lindsay included a tax on advertising in his new tax package, it wasn't exactly a bold new concept.

title: Dianne Chilgren Makes Town Hall Piano Debut
description: Dianne Chilgren dispatched her debut, recital at Town Hall late Saturday afternoon with crisp efficiency. Since the program consisted of rather objective, surfaceskimming piano music, her businesslike approach seemed generally appropriate.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Paladins Have Coach, Will Travel
description: After Fordham accepted an atlarge bid and was paired, with the Southern Conference champion in the National Collegiate Athletic Assooiation playoffs, Digger Phelps, the Rams coach, inquired about the health, of Bryan Adrian of Davidson. Adrian, the Wildcats scoring ace, has been injured for much of this season.

title: Capital Air Crash Linked To Shift of Plane's Cargo
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP) The forward shift of improperly secured cargo probably caused the fatal crash of a twinengine air taxi cargo plane as it approached Washington National Airport here after a flight from New York, last July 2, the National Transportation Safety Board said today.

title: Ball in Florida Recalls Era of Lapos;Orangerie
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 7The rich and elegant are never happier than when they're whooping it up for charity, and they were at it again last night at the kind of extravaganza that's typical of weekends in this wealthiest of the nation's resorts.

title: News Analysis
description: Several weeks ago, Arthur Nettslint the former Mayor of Minneapolis who is now a professor of public affairs at the University of Minnesota, told the Congress of the National League of Cities that the time had come to give up and admit that the future belongs to the suburbs.

title: Page Squash Racquets Victor
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., March 7 (AP)Palmer Page of Penn defeated Eliot Berry, 1416, 156, 1513, 153, to win the singles title of the national college squash racquets tournament today. Penn won the team title with 33 points.

title: British Post Offices Reopening As Workers End 47Day Strike
description: LONDON, March 7Most of Britain's post offices will reopen tomorrow after a 47day strike, the country's longest major strike since 1926.

title: Ralph J. Damiano, 81, Dies; Led Jersey Funeral Group
description: LONG BEACH, N. J., March 7  Ralph J. Damiano, former president of the New Jersey Funeral Dirctors Association, died here yesterday at Monmouth Medical Center, His age as 81.

title: Economists Lace Optimism With Wariness
description: Several leading economistseach with a very different analytic viewpointtook a look at business prospects for 1971 over last weekend. All were convinced that the economy is now on an upward slope, but this optimism was liberally laced with caution that difficult problems of economic management lie ahead.

title: North Stars Top Flyers, 31
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., March 7 (UPI)J. P. Parise scored in the third period today to break a 11 tie and lead the Minnesota North Stars to a 31 victory over Philadelphia.

title: Amy Beth Lohman Is a Jersey Bride
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 7 Miss Amy Beth Lohman, who expects to be graduated in May from the Temple University School of Dental Hygiene, and William Howard Lieberman, a sophomore at the Temple School of Dentistry, were married here this afternoon.

title: Text of Message to Jarring From Israel
description: JERUSALEM, March 7 Following is the text of Israel's message of Feb. 26 to the United Nations intermediary, Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, as made public tonight by the Israeli Foreign Ministry, The document was submitted in English, by Yosef Tehoah, Israel's representative at the United Nations.

title: City May Seek New Borrowing Power to Get. Through the Year
description: Mayor Lindsay's administration was expected yesterday to be forced to seek new borrowing authority from the Legislature to get through its current fiscal year.

title: Experience Buoys Eglevsky Dancers
description: Whatever the Eglevsky Ballet Company isand its program Saturday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music left one in pleasurable doubt  it deserves local support not only from its home base on Long Island but also from the larger New York dance public.

title: Yuriko's. Company Presents Program Of Her Own Dances
description: It Is the Moments of stillness that I most often remember after a Yuriko concert: the sight of a man and woman framing each other's faces with cupped hands or the poignancy of a woman turning her head to avoid the gaze of a man looking at her. Yesterday afternoon Yuriko and her company presented a program of her choreography at the Kauffman Concert Hall of the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A.

title: LIONEL GOLUB, 70, LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: Lionel Golub, a lawyer, who had been active in community affairs, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 915 East 17th Street, Brooklyn. His office was at 261 Broadway.

title: HERBERT EVANS, FOUND VITAMIN E
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 7 (AP)  Dr. Herbert McLean Evans, who discovered vitamin E in 1922, died yesterday at Alta Bates Hospital. He was 88 years old.

title: NEW FINANCIAL AID MAPPED FOR I.O.S.
description: Major European and Amerllean financial institutions were reported yesterday to be preparing to lend Investors Overseas Services, the giant mutual fund group, between $5million and $10million in new working capital.

title: BELFAST MARCHERS ATTACK ARMY POST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 7 (AP)Gasoline bombs, rocks and bottles were thrown in belfast on Sunday night when 40 women, dressed in militarystyle uniforms and wielding sticks, led a march past a paratroop headquarters.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you get one of those insurance offers in the mail promising to pay you a thousand dollars a month when you go to a hospital whether you're sick or hurt or see one of those ads in the paper promising to pay you $100 a week extra cash money while you're in the hospital can you tell if you're getting a bargain? Can you tell if the company is worth dealing with?

title: Gun Lesson Ends in Death
description: ST. LOUIS, March 7 (AP)The police said that Thomas Brown, 34 years old, was killed today when his aunt, Amy Collins, accidentally shot him while he was giving her instructions on how to handle a shotgun to ward off burglars.

title: Orioles Beat Yankees on Homer in 9th 43;
description: MIAMI, March 7 Neither Rob Gardner nor Mike McCormick made an encouraging showing today in the first round of their battle for a permanent place on the New York Yankee pitching staff. Gardner gave up two runs in the fifth inning and McCormick was tagged for a leadoff homer by Chico Salmon in the ninth inning, a blow that gave the Baltimore Orioles a 4.3 victory.

title: Barney Balaban Dead at 83; Headed Paramount Pictures
description: BYRAM, Conn., March 7Barney Balaban, honorary chairman of Paramount Pictured Corporation and a leader in the film industry since 1936, died today after a short illness at his home, 251 Byram Shore Road. He was 83 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I've been taking cabs to and from work for eleven years. As a matter of principle I'll never do it again. I won't buy the 50 per cent fare increase.

title: FRONTS ARE CALM
description: JERUSALEM, March 7Is ra el today made public her proposals for detailed and concrete peace negotiations with the United Arab Republic, moments after Cairo formally terminated the sevenmonth ceasefire along the Suez Canal.

title: Sammis and Mangan Duos In Platform Tennis Semifinal
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., March 7 Jesse Sammis 3d and Gordon Gray, the defending champions, won two matches today to reach the semifinals of the 37th annual national platform tennis doubles tournament at the Fox Meadow, Tennis Club.

title: The Better Bet?
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation has deeply offended the New York Stock Exchange by proposing to run promotional ad saying: If you're In the stock market you might find this a better bet.

title: ChildAbuse Cases Are to Be Reported To One Office Here
description: A centralized Emergency Children's Service, to receive all reports of suspected child abuse and neglect 24 hours a day, seven days a week, was announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sonny Liston Was asked once to comment on Muhammad Ali's incredible speed. Speed, snorted Liston. How fast he go? He faster'n the wind? He kiss a bullet? He run through hell in a gasoline sportcoat and live to talk about it? Huunh. Like Joe Louis say, you can run, but you can't hide. Liston was the first of nine championship opponents defeated, basically, by Ali's speed. He just moved too fast for them, skipping away from good punches, never still long enough to suffer a combination, firing his own punches too quickly to be escaped.

title: YOUNG PEOPLE GIVE GLITTERING CONCERT
description: After six seasons and 50 New York concerts by the Cosmopolitan Young People's Symphony Orchestra, it is no longer surprising to find these local high school and music college instrumentalists playing like professionals. It is a pleasure to report that they did so again at Philharmonic Hall Saturday afternoon, under the expert guidance of William Smith, assistant conductor of the Philadelphia Orchestra.

title: Nation's Steel Producers Find No Significant Drop in Demand
description: PITTSBURGH, March 7 Steel officials did not see any significant drop in demand last week.

title: Woman, 36, Is Slain In Hotel Suite Here Rented by Company
description: A 36yearold woman was found stabbed to death yesterday afternoon in her upper West Side hotel suite, the rent on which was paid for by a Fifth Avenue concern headed by Lowell M. Birell, a onetime multimillionaire financier convicted of stock fraud.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: RANGERS TRIUMPH OVER KINGS BY 42; STRING REACHES 8
description: At the moment Jack Kent Cooke appears in better shape than his Los Angeles Kings hockey team, which, despite its regal colors, dropped a 42 decision last night to the Rangers.

title: Actress Visits Angela Davis
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 7 (UPI)Jane Fonda the actress, visited Angela Davis, the black militant, in Marin County Jail and talked with her about everyone joining forces to stop repression in this country and abroad.

title: Soviet Tanks Seen in Laos Are Not Latest Models
description: Descriptions of the Sovietbuilt T54 tank seen in Laos indicate that the vehicle being used by the North Vietnamese is not the latest model.

title: DURANT W.ROBERTSON
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 7 Durant W. Robertson, a former executive of the National Lead Company of New York, died at Princeton Hospital yesterday. He was 84 years old and lived here at 38 Wiggins Street.

title: Hanoi Denies Capture
description: HONG KONG, Monday, March 8 (AP)The North Vietnamese radio today called the announcement that South Vietnamese troops had captured Tchepone a deliberate falsehood invented to cover up the true fact that the Saigon puppets and U.S. aggressors have been and are being defeated everywhere in southern Laos.

title: KANSAN TAKES LEAD IN DETROIT BOWLING
description: DETROIT, March 7 (AP) Rich Black, 28yearold Kansas City star, took the allevents lead with 1,883 as competition started today In the American Bowling Congress tournament in Cobo Arena.

title: Sale of Stock for Casey Is Reviewed
description: WASHINGTON, March 7The man personally selected by William J. Casey to handle sale of stock in a company Mr. Casey headed had been expelled from the securities industry by the Securities and Exchange Commission for a stock manipulation.

title: Jersey Lottery Exceeding Expectations
description: TRENTON, March 7While New York State's lottery has failed to meet expectations, the New Jersey lottery has become so successful in its first three months that extra drawings have had to be scheduled to give away mounting surpluses.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 17 editorial on Jerusalem evinces a lack of discernment as well as of sensitivity.

title: Garment Maker Flourishes by Weathering the Gaff
description: As I figure it, I've had the equivalent of at least seven lifetimes on Seventh Avenue, mainly because I've learned to stand the gaff, said Alfred Hazan the other day.

title: 5 Police Shot, Robber Dies In Times Sq. Gun Battle
description: A detective lieutenant and four patrolmen were wounded and a holdup man was killed in a gun battle in front of a movie theater on West 47th Street last night.

title: Jan Peerce Substitutes For Shirley Verrett
description: The illness of Shirley Verrett brought Jan Peerce to Philharmonic Hall yesterday afternoon as a latehour replacement on the Hurok International Series. Mr. Peerce, who had sung the previous night in Miami, began his recital in good voice and improved as he went on. In fact, for a tenor who will be 65 years old in June, his performance was a remarkable display of vocal quality and power. At this rate, he may sing forever.

title: Marco Polo Is Named Best at Pekingese Club Specialty
description: Norman J. Cacciatore, an appraiser for the Alabama State, Highway Department, came up with the right appraisal yesterday at the 107th specialty show of the Pekingese Club of America at his Ch. Caccia's Marco Polo was chosen best in a field of 107 at the Holiday Inn here.

title: Crowds Hail McGovern in Wisconsin, Where He Says the Primary in 72 Will Be Critical
description: MADISON, Wis., March 7Senator George S. McGovern spent 55 hours in snowcovered Wisconsin this weekend, enough time to convince him and many of his supporters that he can make a strong showing in the state's 1972, Presidential primary, a little less than 13 months away.

title: Transit: Ink Gets Redder
description: The 2.5 million people who ride the subways, buses and commuter railroads to and through New York City each weekday will pay $150million less this year than it costs to run the transit systems.

title: POLICE GUARD FRAZIER AFTER DEATH THREAT, TIGHTEN SECURITY AT GARDEN FOR ALI FIGHT
description: Eight detectives were guarding Joe Frazier and his manager, Yancey Durham, yesterday following a death threat to the world heavyweight boxing champion regarding his title fight with Muhammad All tonight at Madison Square Garden.

title: Policy Panel Backs Rizzo
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 7 (AP)Frank L. Rizzo, the former Police Commissioner, moved a step closer to the Democratic Mayoral endorsement this weekend when the party's City Policy Committee endorsed him.

title: Oil Companies Revise Offer to Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 7 Western oil companies presented a revised offer for higher payments to the Libyan Government today as the negotiations approched Libya's Tuesday deadline. There was no immediate Government reaction.

title: 6 COAST SOLOISTS PERFORM LAZAROF
description: Six members of the Los Angeles Soloists arrived at Town Hall Saturday night and brought with them five recent compositions by Henri Lazarof, a 39yeareld, Bulgarianborn composer who currently teaches at the University of California, Los Angeles. Mr, Lazarof's pungent style has its origins in Bartk, but he has extended the idiom's expressive possibilities with considerable flair and resourcefulness.

title: Harnum Delaware, Coach
description: NEWARK, Del., March 7 (AP) The University of Delaware has appointed John Harnum as head basketball coach to succeed Dan Peterson, who resigned last week to enter private business, Harntun, head basketball coach at Susquehanna University for the last two years, was freshman coach at Delaware under Peterson from 1966 to 1969.

title: BOND OFFERINGS CONTINUE HEAVY
description: The corporate bond market last week sailed headlong into the heavy March volume it had prepared for by raising interest rates during much of February, and it came through rather well. This week will be equally difficult.

title: Cape Kennedy, Hurt by Cuts in Space Funds, Seeks Tourists and New Industry
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., March 7The economic slump that made Cape Kennedy and the rest of Brevard County a depressed area after cutbacks in the space program appears to be bottoming out.

title: Wail Street's Riddle
description: The hottest Issue on Wall Street today is whether mutual funds, life insurance companies, pension funds and other large financial institutions should be admitted to membership on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: 1,000 U.S. PLANES BOMB FOE IN LAOS AND IN CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 7  The United States continued widespread bombing raids today, sending more than 1,000 planes into action against enemy forces In Laos and Cambodia.

title: Uruguayans Ask Charter Change to Reelect Chief
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 2Friends of Uruguay's President, Jorge Pacheco Areco, have opened a campaign to reelect him to a new fiveyear term next November even though he is barred by the Constitution from succeeding himself.

title: The Army and General Koster
description: WASHINGTONThe Army made a grave error last January in dropping all charges in connection with the Mylai massacre against Maj. Gen. Samuel W. Koster, former superintendent of West Point and commander of the Americal Division at the time its subordinate units participated in the original assault on March 16, 1968.

title: Wrecks in the Busy Channel Are Upsetting Britain
description: LONDON, March 7British ship officers and maritime officials are distressed about the standards of seamanship in the narrow, busy English Channel. They charge that, especially among flagofconvenience vessels, standards are dangerously lax.

title: Auto Strike Gets Some of Blame for Drop in Plant Allocations
description: Capital appropriations by manufacturers in the fourth quarter of 1970 fell 7.6 per cent under the level of the third quarter and were 19.5 per cent below those of the fourth quarter of 1969, The Conference Board reported over the weekend.

title: NEANY CRITICIZES NIXON'S PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations today called the Nixon Administration's old economic game plan a failure.

title: NASTASE DEFEATS GRAEBNER IN FINAL
description: HAMPTON, Va., March 7 (AP) Ilie Nastase, Rumania's top player, became the United States indoor tennis champion today by defeating Clark Graebner of New York City, 75, 6.4, 76, at Hampton Coliseum.

title: Counterattack Possible
description: HHESANH, South Vietnam, March 7 South Vietnamese troops at the town of Tchepone were reported to be consolidating their newly gained positions on the Ho Chi Minh Trail today in anticipation of a possible counterattack from the north.

title: Carol Hall's Songs At the Bitter End Show Her Growth
description: Carol. Hall, who writes songs that, are very much her own and who has a way of singing them that is pretty much her own, is pulling everything together with remarkable rapidity at the Bitter End.

title: Theater: Equity Library Cast Shines in Tuddigore
description: Gilbert and Sullivan's Ruddigore? On the small stage of the Equity Library Theater? That's right, and a spanking good production it is. The current show at the uptown Master Theater, 103d Street at Riverside Drive, is a generally fine endeavor, neatly staged, zestfully played, skillfully sung  often superbly. Furthermore, the show, running through March 21, is free, if you choose to ignore the box office sign suggesting a contribution of $1.50.

title: Ski Jumping Postponed
description: ISHPEMING, Mich., March 7 The 84th edition of America's oldest ski jumping fixture, the Ishpeming Ski Club meet, was deferred today until March 21 because of high winds.

title: Thesis Provides Clues on Undercover Police
description: A rare look at the secretive New York police unit that collects, intelligence about dissident individuals and groups has been obtained from a master's thesis written by a top police official and a subsequent interview with First Deputy Police Commissioner William H. T. Smith.

title: Hawks Down Royals, 122112
description: Hawks Down Royals, 122112

title: Radiation Symposium
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 7 (UPI)Scientists from 17 countries will attend a symposium on biological effects of radiation at the Australian Atomic Energy Commission research establishment at Lucas Heights near Sydney, starting next week.

title: Johnny earson in Hospital
description: Johnny Carson entered a hospital here yesterday for treatment of hepatitis. The National Broadcasting company said it was not known how long the star of the network's latenight talk show would be out. Joey Bishop, who once had his own talk show in competition with Mr. Carson, will replace him, N.B.C. said.

title: $168Million Satellite Network Is Proposed by MCI Lockheed
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP), The MCI Lockheed Satellite Corporation proposed today to build and operate a domestic satellite communications system that would cost $168million.

title: Cards Top Mets, 52
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 7Two of the New York Mets younger jobseekers, Ken Singleton and Leroy Stanton, hit home runs off Bob Gibson of the St. Louis Cardinals today. But the Cardinals recovered in time to win, 52, and even the exhibition series at one decision apiece.

title: CEASEFIRE ENDS IN MIDDLE EAST;
description: CAIRO, March 7President Anwar elSadat declared tonight that he would not extend the ceasefire with Israel along the Suez Canal, but he emphasized that Egypt would continue to cooperate in diplomatic efforts to achieve a Middle Eastern peace accord. The ceasefire expired tonight.

title: CECIL C. MERRIFIELD, BROKERAGE OFFICER
description: WILTON, Conn., March 7Cecil C. Merrifield, executive vice president of Dean Witter International, a subsidiary of the national brokerage house of Dean Witter & Co., died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 44 Westport Road. He was 67 years old.

title: SOUTHERN SCHOOLS SEEN IN NEW PHASE
description: ATLANTA, March 7 (UPI)According to a group of highranking Nixon Administration officials Who conferred yesterday with representatives of Southern school systems, enforcement of school desegregation in the South is no longer a problem.

title: Jersey City Strike Set
description: JERSEY CITY, March. 7 (AP) Members of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes, A.F.L.C.I.O. voted unanimously tonight, to strike the city schools tomorrow morning to press demends for their first contract With the city.

title: Clean Reactors Delayed in Drive For Atom Power
description: The White House has decided that, instead of pressing for the development of clean fusion reactors, it will throw heavy budgetary support behind a new type of atomic power production that, like today's reactors, manufactures hazardous radioactive byproducts.

title: Tiger, Tiger Burning Low
description: The decline of humor is no laughing matter. Reports that college humor magazines are running out of fun and finances is distressing in a world badly in need of laughter and satire. If Princeton's Tiger and Harvard's Lampoon seem irrelevant to collegians and advertisers, the country may be in deeper trouble than even the most dismal headlines suggest.

title: False Alarms Rise; Lowery Bids State Increase Penalties
description: Fire Commissioner Robert 0. Lowery, citing a 38 per cent increase in false alarms over the last two months, called upon the Legislature yesterday to stiffen the penalties for offenders.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Mrs. Court Is Victor
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, March 7 (AP)  Mrs. Margaret Court, the No. 1 woman player in the world, avenged an earlier loss to Evonne Goolagong by beating the young Aborigine, 36, 76, 62, today in the final of the Centennial open tennis tournament.

title: Freshmen Participation Perils Villanova Eastern T rack Reign

title: Arts Abroad
description: PARISA century after Marcel Proust's birth, the first volume of his complete correspondence, dated, annotated, corrected and considerably supplemented through the efforts of Mr. Philip Kolb, professor at the University of Illinois, has just appeared. Proust's letters make strange and, In the final account, exciting reading. The first impression, however, is rather unpleasant. Exceedingly preoccupied with social life, snobbish, affected, ornately trifling, nothing in the young Marcel points to the author of one of the greatest novels of all time  at best, these letters explain the findesiecle mannerism of the early writings.

description: CLEVELAND, March 7A longsmoldering grudge between two motorcycle gangs broke into open warfare here last night, leaving five persons dead, 20 Injured, and 84 arrested.

description: George L. Burr, a financial consultant and former banker, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 81 years old and lived at 12 Hatch Terrace, Dobbs Ferry, N.Y.

description: MIAMI, March 7  Jesse Carlyle Snead won his second tournament in two weeks today by scoring a final 69 for a 72hole aggregate of 275 in the Doral Eastern open. He indicated ha would like to emulate his noted golfing uncle, Samuel Jackson Snead.

description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 7 (UPI)The State Department of Public Health, reported today that women in California had more illegitimate children than the national average and that the rate for white women in the state was increasing. The report was based on findings in a study of births during 1966 and 1967.

title: Calle Wins 20Mile Run
description: Augustin Calle of Brooklyn captured the 12th annual Mike Hannon Memorial 20mile run yesterday over a course in the Bronx. Calle was Clocked in hour 49 minutes 28 seconds. He finished 600 yards ahead of Ed Walkowitz of South Hadley, Mass., who was timed in 1:51:11.

description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 7 Ceylon's Prime Minister, Mrs. Sirimauo Bandaranaike, announced in the House of Representatives tonight that the Government had decided to call out all branches of the armed forces to insure the maintenance of law and order throughout the country.

title: Astronauts Take a Day to Relax For Noon Parade Here Today
description: The three Apollo astronauts and their wives spent a quiet yesterday in rainy New York, the day before a noon parade down Fifth Avenue in their honor.

title: Screen: A Series of Minor Victories: The Tender Moment' Is at 34th St. East Shows Understanding of People in Love
description: Of all the kinds of movies, perhaps the hardest to write about is the movie of romantic pathos, which is a principal backbone of the many-backboned film industry. It is hard because we assume that everything has been said about it (and, really, very little has been said), because we have never, despite a lot of propaganda to the contrary, achieved an articulate respect for erotic impulses, and because critical response still favors big subjects over little ones, public event over private nuance. Thus the paradox of a critical establishment that two years ago proclaimed, to pick at random, "Medium Cool" as significant cinema and now complains that it is being "manipulated" (a favorite word) by "Love Story."And thus it would be easy to demolish Michel Boisrond's "The Tender Moment," which opened yesterday at the 34th Street East. A musical score, piano and orchestra, (Francis Lai) so corny it might make Elmer Bernstein blush; a collection of attractive occupations and preoccupations for the characters that is as self-evidently stage decoration as are the interiors of the terrific or, at the very least, charming apartments in which everybody livesall of it eyewash or earwash and all of it as traditional, as conventional and potentially moving as, say, the pastoral conceit in lyric poetry of the Renaissance.Olivier (Renaud Verley), the young protagonist of "The Tender Moment," is more of a literary extremist, preferring Eluard or Middle English love poetrywith both of which he courts Frdrique (Nathalie Delon), an older woman of 25 and mistress of an even older racing car driver (Robert Hossein), who has so far given up the ghost, he'd as soon marry the girl. Olivier meets Frdrique over a traffic violation, follows her to a fabulous Alpine ski resort, where he beds her (Hossein is off racing the Indianapolis 500), returns with her to Paris, neglects his studies, leaves home, wins his womanand finally gives her back to her loverwhose claim is not only prior but, Olivier realizes, considerably more permanent.What one derives from this material, aside from the pleasures of its various wish fulfillments, has a lot to do with how one responds to the manner of a pickup, to the understanding of a first night, to the whole drama of sexual attraction. For it is in such matters that Boisrond reveals his skill, his reticence, his decency, his feeling for a kind of psychological truth that is uncluttered either by earthshaking revelation or moral condemnation. His understanding of people in love, like his employment of the pathetic fallacy (a fine rain storm at the end to accompany Olivier's self-exile), belongs to a series of minor victories in very ordinary modes. But the victories, if small, win valuable ground, and they are why "The Tender Moment," for all its no surprises, is a refreshing experience.The cast is serviceable, if undistinguished, and Nathalie Delon (Alain Delon's wife) happily suggests healthy appetites in the kind of role that too often feeds on Victorian mush. The minor parts (especially Bernard Le Coq as a pal and beautiful Katia Cristina as Olivier's family's all-purpose live-in maid) are especially well-handled. But in "The Tender Moment," everything in the world plays a background to love, and it is as if Paris streets and mountain ski-trails really did contain and define all the important lessons and pleasures of the soul.

title: Policeman Garbed as Rabbi Kills His Armed Assailant
description: A patrolman dressed as a Hasidic rabbi and acting as a decoy in an area hit by a recent rash of muggings of Jews shot and killed an unidentified man who attempted to mug and rob him last night on the Lower East Side.

title: Bridge: Precision Club Team Victor In Invitation Tourney Here
description: The allstar Precision Club touring team scored a convincing victory here Friday In a strong invitation team tournament. Benito Garozzo and Giorgio Belladonna of Rome, and Robert Jordan and Arthur Robinson of Philadelphia, with the system's inventor, Charles Wei of New York, as nonplaying captain, headed a field of 12 teams with a score of 74 victory points of a possible 110.

title: Sedgman Beats Barth
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 7 (AP)Frank Sedgman of Australia, the 1952 Wimbledon champion, upset 23yearold Roy Barth of San Diego in the first round of the $56,000 Dunlop Australian open tennis tournament today. Several other Americans were advanced.

title: Sabres Top Canucks, 6.3
description: BUFFALO, March 7 (AP)Gil Perreault equaled the N.H.L. record for goals by a rookie as he recorded his 33d and 34th of the season to lead the Buffalo Sabres to a 63 victory over the Vancouver Canucks tonight.

title: PATRIARCH KIRIL, 70, OF CHURCH IN SOFIA
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 7 (Reuters)Patriarch Kiril, the head of the Bulgarian Orthodox Church, died today in Sofia at the age of 70, the Yugoslav news agency Tanyug reported.

title: Spain Lifts the Curtain on Income Tax
description: MADRID, March 7A Spaniard's religion may be a subject of public display and his love life a subject of confidences to his friends, but he holds his income in the most sacred privacy.

title: Wilt Sparks Lakers
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., March 7 (UPI)  Wilt Chamberlain tallied 20 points and dominated the boards with a season high of 32 rebounds tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers rallied to defeat the Chicago Bulls, 117108.

title: RAIL UNION DELAYS THREATENED STRIKE
description: CLEVELAND, March 7 (AP)A spokesman for the United Transportation Union said tonight that an agreement had been reached postponing threatened selective railroad strikes until Thursday at least.

title: Woman, 60, Dies in Fire
description: Mrs. Catherine Lane, 60 years old, died yesterday Morning when a twoalarm fire swept her thirdfloor apartment at 1411 Madison Avenue; near 98th Street. ThTe blaze, discovered at 8 A.M., was brought under control by 8:35 A.M. The fire traveled up an air shaft and damaged, an apartment on the fourth floor and one on the fifth floor.

title: NEW DEMANDS SET BY EAST PAKISTANI
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 7 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, East, Pakistan's nationalist leader, offered breathing space today in the Pakistan crisis by issuing new demands rather than forcing a break with the western wing of the country.

title: Death Laid to Balloon Gas
description: A man identified as David E. Thomas, 21 years old, of 3422 98th Street, Corona, Queens, died at Bellevue Hospital early yesterday after, the Medical Examiner's office said, he had inhaled a gas, Freon12, which is used to inflate balloons. The police said that the victim had been found unconscious at the Fillmore East, a rock concert hall at 105 Second Avenue, and that he was pronounced dead at the hospital about 2 A.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a letter published Feb. 16, two scientists prominent in nuclear weapons research criticized C. L. Sulzberger's recent suggestion that discriminate tactical nuclear weapons be considered for NATO in lieu of large numbers of ground forces.

title: Jordanian Official Killed
description: AMMAN, Jordan, March 7 (Reuters)  Palestinian guerrillas seized a Government vehicle in Amman today and an official of the Premier's office was killed in the shooting that followed, an official spokesman said.

title: Man In the News
description: BERLIN, March 4In the intricate diplomatic web being spun around Europe, an energetic young politician reflects the constant fear here that the center of the webWest Berlinwill one day be forgotten in the hurry of building outward, that its special and vulnerable position will be compromised for the sake of peace on a broader front. We would not last long, remarked Dietrich Stobbe, at age 32 the floor leader of the Social Democratic majority in West Berlin's House of Representatives. We want the American, British and French troops to stay, not merely as guests or allies, but as occupying powers.

title: STREAKING BRUINS SUBDUE BLUES, 41
description: BOSTON, March 7 (UPI) The Boston Bruins raised their victory string to seven and I their unbeaten pace at home to 125 games tonight as Bobby Orr sparked them to a 41 triumph over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Nine Killed in West Bengal In New Election Violence,
description: CALCUTTA, India, March 7 (AP)Nine persons were killed today in West Bengal despite a buildup of troops and policemen to insure peaceful elections in the state Wednesday.

title: Stage: Blood, New Musical by Writer of Stomp
description: There are two kinds of dramatic confusion. There are plays that are confused and plays that are confusing: in the first instance it must be the fault of the play or production, in the second it might be the fault of the critic or audience member so confused.

title: The Threat to Privacy
description: Privacy, said the late Prof. Clinton Rossiter, is an unbreakable wall of dignity  against the entire world. Today, that wall is crumbling. It is being undermined by government snooping and by persistent manipulation through public relations posing as public information. Independence of thought and action is subverted through secret intrusion and subtle indoctrination.

title: Chess: Experience Bows to Youth In Manhattan Club Event
description: The 94yearold Manhattan Chess Club, stamping grounds for nearly every American player of note during this and earlier generations, has begun the club championship, a 15  man round robin.

title: Knicks Set Back Celtics, 116 to 110
description: BOSTON, March 7The Knicks, on the verge of clinching the championship of the National Basketball Association's Atlantic division, accomplished something today they had been unable to do in 24 previous years. They swept a season series from the Boston Celtics by topping the former perennial champions, 116110, at Boston Garden.

title: Bomb in Negro Church
description: TEXARKANA, Tex., March 7 (UPI)  A firebomb that sputtered but failed to explode was discovered in a Negro church early today and was extinguished before it caused any damage. It was the fourth fire in a Negro church in two days and the second definitely caused by a bomber in two days.

title: Nixon May Attend Ceremony
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 (UPI)President Nixon is expected to attend the dedication of the new Lyndon B. Johnson Library and School of Public Affairs at the University of Texas in Austin on May 22.

title: Enemy Supply Traffic increases North of Saigon's Drive in Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 7The flow of enemy supply trucks along the Ho Chi Minh Trail to the area of South Vietnamese operations in southern Laos has doubled in the last few days to return to the level it reached before the invasion of Laos on Feb. 8, American military sources here reported today.

title: 4 Held in Smuggling Charge
description: MIAMI, March 7 (AP)Four Miamians were arrested yesterday after United States officials recovered 680 pounds of marijuana floating near Miami Beach. Charged with conspiracy to smuggle were Michael Lowry, an insurance salesman; Wynn Dwyer, a selfemployed jeweler; Linda Packwood and Carolyn Brunstrum. The marijuana was thrown from a Caribbean cruise ship and found two miles from shore floating in packages of six to eight feet in length.

title: Y.M.Y.W.H.A.Halls Offer Diversified Music Bills
description: Now and then it, is healthy for any art if someone will grab it. by the shoulders and give it a good shake. Lately: that has been happening a lot in music, and one of the more determined shakers has been Max Pollikoff, the violinist. His latest venture, Gallery of Music in Our Time, has been giving us a fresh perspective on the churchly ritual of the formal concert, reports of whose death are certainly exaggerated, but not beyond credibility.

title: DR. JUDSON D. IVES
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 8 Dr. Judson Dunbar Ives, biology professor emeritus at CarsonNewman College, Jefferson City, Tenn., died today at St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived at 23 Lynn Court, Darien, and in Pine Bluff, N. C.

title: Bing Undergoes Surgery
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., March 8 (UPI)Dave Bing, the Detroit Pistons allstar guard, underwent minor surgery today to repair his fractured left cheekbone. He is not expected to miss tomorrow's home game with the Phoenix Suns.

title: HARTKE CAUTIONS ON U.S. RAIL ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Senator Vance Hartke warned today that nationalization of American railroads was a distinct threat if there was a financial collapse of the industry.

description: Joe Frazier is the master of the boxing world. The 27 yearold Philadelphian realized his dream last night when he won undisputed claim to the heavyweight championship.

title: Advertising:

title: HIS MAJESTY HURT AND OUT FOR YEAR
description: MIAMI, March (UPI) His Majesty, one of the leading 3yearold colts in training for the Triple Crown races, suffered a broken bone in his right front ankle during the $155,000 Flamingo Stakes at Hialeah last Wednesday, Darby Dan Farms announced today.

title: AMEX STOCKS RISE IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: The American Stock exchange scored its third consecutive advance yesterday as most issues rose in active trading.

description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., March 8  Dr. Jean Wilson Day, a 40yearold assistant professor of chemistry at Rutgers University, was bludgeoned to death in her bedroom near the university's Piscataway campus early yesterday morning.

title: Carolina Whites Sentenced For Overturning School Buses
description: DILLON, S. C., March 8 (UPI)  Prison sentences ranging from four months to a year were handed down today against three white men convicted of rioting in connection with the overturning of school buses carrying black students to a newly integrated schools.

title: Voluntary Restraints to Begin July 1 for a 3Year Period
description: TOKYO, March 8The Japan Textile Federation, which represents all major groups in the textile field, declared today that, it would voluntarily restrict exports of textiles to the United States for a threeyear period beginning July 1.

title: ZOLA SHAULIS EXCELS IN BACH'S GOLDBERG
description: Zola Shaulii, pianist, one of the two winners Of the 1971 Naumberg Piano Competition; had won another competition as, long ago as 1960, when she was 17: the Bach International in Washington. And she has been signed by Deutsche Grammophon to record the Bach Goldberg Variations this spring.

Neither is as risky as predicting elections, conventions, primaries, etc. Nevertheless, just one year before the primaries begin, here is on'e man's foolhardy formsheet on the Democratic prospects, such as they are:

title: Saigon Says Its Marines
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, March 9 (AP)Two hundred fifty North Vietnamese soldiers were reported killed in Laos yesterday in a battle with South Vietnamese marines who were heavily supported by artillery barrages and American air strikes.

title: $100,000 REWARD OFFERED IN BEAST
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 Congressional leaders announced today that private sources had offered a $100,000 reward for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the person or persons who bombed the Capitol a week ago.

title: Leftists View Chilean Election as Test
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 8  Chile's Communist and Socialist party workers are being urged by their leaders to win a great battle for the Government against its enemies in municipal elections April 4.

title: Defense Minister In Australia Quits, Criticizing Gorton
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 8 Defense Minister Malcolm Fraser resigned from the Cabinet today, charging Prime Minister John G. Gorton with significant disloyalty to him.

title: Joint Jersey City Petitions Held Valid for Recall Election
description: JERSEY CITY, March 8City Clerk Thomas F. X. Smith announced today that two rival insurgent political organizations that were independently seeking the removal of Mayor Thomas J. Whelan had filed enough petitions between them to force a recall election.

title: DR. BERNARD ZIFFER, LAWYER, DIES AT 85
description: Dr. Bernard Ziffer, an international lawyer, died Sunday at his home, 50 East 96th Street. He was 85 years old.

title: Issues for a New Society
description: NEW HAVENI do not see how anyone who seriously undertakes to look at our present society can proceed without first addressing himself to the problem of advanced monopoly capitalism and its relationship to the impoyerished majority of the world. The facts speak louder than ideology.

title: January Retail Sales Rose By 1.5% on Revised Basis
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (Reuters)Retail sales rose 1.5 per cent in January, to a seasonally adjusted $31,034,000,000 from $30;537,000,000 in December, the commerce Department reported in a revision of an earlier report.

title: 2d Trial of Mrs. Crimmins Is Postponed Until Monday
description: Justice George Balbach yesterday ordered that the second trial of Mrs. Alice Crimmins begin next Monday in Queens Supreme Court. It had been scheduled to start tomorrow.

title: Italy's Faltering School System Beset From All Sides
description: ROME March 8The Italian educational system is in a state of disarray.

title: ELECTION DAY SALE OF LIQUOR BACKED
description: ALBANY, March 8The Assembly gave final legislative approval today to a bill repealing the longtime ban on the sale of alcoholic beverages on primary and election days.

title: Value Line Names Keystone in a Suit
description: BOSTON, March 8 (AP)Arnold Bernhard & Co., Inc., and Value Line Funds of New York filed a $40million damage suit today against Keystone Custodian Funds, Inc., and a subsidiary for allegedly failing to provide contracted fiscal and other services for the plaintiff.

title: MINE SAFETY FINES PUT AT $1MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)The Interior Department announced today that it had proposed fines totaling more than $1 million against 600 coal mines for safety violations.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The multimillion dollar fight in Madison Square Garden last night was worth every glorious, heartbreaking penny. Rarely does anything so expensive live up to advance billing or exceed expectations. But the wildly exciting exhibition of primitive savagery that Joe Frazier and MuhamMad Ali put on over 15 exhausting rounds was an epic that fit the price tag.

title: Santa Fe Orders More Cars
description: CHICAGO, March 8 (AP) The Santa Fe Railway said today it has ordered 500 more covered hopper cars for delivery before this year's grain harvest. The $8million order of 100ton capacity cars increases 1971 purchases of such cars to 1,300.

title: CON EDISON HEAD SCORES AIR CODE
description: The Consolidated Edison Company said yesterday that one section of the airpollution code proposed last November by the Lindsay administration could create a serious hazard that could lead to brownouts and even blackout.

title: I.B.M. to Offer MediumScale Computer
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday a new computer aimed at the heart of the multibillion dollar dataprocessing marketthe mediumscale user.

title: Abacus, Leasco Plan Tie After Sale of Bank Stock
description: In a complex, threeway deal the Abacus Fund, Inc., announced a preliminary agreement to sell its 25 per cent working control of the Security National Bank, Huntington, L. I., and then merge into the Leasco Corporation.

title: College Without Campus
description: By opening new avenues toward the college degree without fixed requirements for campus attendance, New York State's educational leaders have moved into the vanguard of academic reform. Supported by the Carnegie Corporation and the Ford Foundation, plans are now complete for major external degree programs and for the establishment of a college within the State University system that, while having no classrooms of its own, will eventually direct undergraduates throughout the state independent studies. This development should be viewed as the beginning of a nationwideand eventually worldwide network of offcampus higher educationan approach which, in fact, is also strongly recommended in the report of the Administration's task force on higher education, issued yesterday.

title: DRAFT EXEMPTION BARRED TO CRITICS OF A SINGLE WAR
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The Supreme Court ruled today that young men were not entitled to draft exemptions as conscientious objectors if they objected only to the Vietnam conflict as an unjust war and did not oppose all wars.

title: You Can't Take the Country Out of Blip
description: To Dean Burch, chairman of the F.C.C.:

title: SCHOOLCOST RISE IS ANALYZED HERE
description: The New York City school operating budget has increased more than 300, per cent in the last 10 years, while the number of students has risen only 16, per cent.

title: Abortion Fund Proposed
description: KINGSTON, R. I., March 8 (AP)A bill that would establish a student abortion loan fund at the University of Rhode Island has been introduced in the two student governing bodies, the student senate and the graduate student association. Funds for such loans would be taken out of the undergraduate student activities tax. The student senate has sole authority to distribute the money collected under the tax.

title: U.S. NEWSMAN'S CAR DAMAGED IN MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW, March 8A car belonging to an American news correspondent was vandalized today while he was visiting the apartment of a Soviet film director who has sought permission to emigrate to Israel.

title: PROFIT LAG IS SHOWN BY UTILITY CONCERN
description: The General Public Utilities Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday highs in sales and revenues for 1970 but a decline of 1.8 per cent in net income.

title: American Motors and Union Agree on Expiration Date
description: DETROIT, March 8 (UPI)The American Motors Corporation and the United Automobile Workers agreed today on the expiration date of a new fouryear contract. Negotiations on other issues continued.

title: Saigon Enacts Reforms To Cut Rate of Inflation
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8  A series of economic reforms were enacted here over the weekend by the South Vietnamese Government to check inflation during a period of high Government expenditures.

title: Panel Challenges U.S. College System
description: WASHINGTON, March 8A study group report initiated and endorsed by top officials in the Nixon Administration challenged today the traditional institutions of higher education and called for an intensive national effort to develop an alternative system.

title: LONDON HINTS IT HAS OPEN MIND ON RB211
description: LONDON, March 8 (Reuters)  The Government today indicated it is ready to reconsider terms of its plan to love the RB211 engine project contracted by RollsRoyce, Ltd., for the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Transit Impasse Continues
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 8 (UPI)No new talks were scheduled today in a labor dispute that threatens to halt this city's bus, trolley and subway systems next Monday. Members of the Transport Workers Union voted unanimously yesterday to walk off the job at 12:01 A.M. March 15 if agreement is not reached on a new contract. Wage talks reached an impasse late last week.

title: STOCKS RISE A BIT IN HEAVY TRADING
Two Policemen In Gunfight Reported in Good Condition
description: A detective lieutenant and a patrolman wounded Sunday night in a gun battle off Times Square were reported in good condition yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital.

title: Historian, at a Seminar for Senators, Urges Curb on President's War Power
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Henry Steele Commager, who introduced generations of students to American history, conducted a seminar at a Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing today and reinforced the senators fears that the President was Infringing on, the warmaking power of Congress.

title: All Is Silent on Way to Hospital
description: Muhammad Ali left his dressing room after his fight with Joe Frazier last night the same way he entered earlier in the daysurrounded by bodyguards.

title: Turkish Toughness Pays Off
description: The Turkish Government's tough stance toward the kidnappers of four American airmen has paid off. The great relief at the release unharmed of the four hostages must be accompanied by deep satisfaction that Turkey refused to negotiate with the leftwing revolutionaries and that the United States, in support of this stand, ignored the demands for $400,000 in ransom.

title: Employes Monitoring Fight For Comsat Beat the Price
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) A special group of about 120 Comsat employes watched the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier fight free of charge tonight over rented color television sets at Comsat headquarters.

title: Beanie Suggests Schools Spend'72 Funds in Crisis
Rates for U.S. Treasury Bills Decline at the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Treasury bill rates eased at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Referee Mercante Calls. Punches Best He's Seen
description: The man closest to the action, Arthur Mercante, the referee, came away surprised that it lasted so long after watching some of the best punches I've ever seen.

title: Cambodia Drive Stalled
description: SAIGON, March 8Informed American sources said today that most of the South Vietnamese operation against North Vietnamese troop concentrations and supply depots in Cambodia had come to a halt following the death of its dynamic first commander, Lieut. Gen. Do Cao Tri.

title: U.S. Troops in Vietnam Down by 4,000 in Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8 (AP)  The United States command announced today that American troop strength in Vietnam was reduced by about 4,000 men last week, reaching the lowest level in almost four and a half years.

title: Excerpts From High Court Opinions on Selective Conscientious Objection to War
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Following are excerpts from the opinion by Justice Thurgood Marshall, writing for the Supreme Court majority in Gillette v. United States and Negre v. Larsen, in which the Court held that young men must be opposed to all wars, not just the Vietnam war, to qualify as conscientious objectors, and from a dissent by Justice Williams O. Douglas:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: Little Gain Seen in a City U. Tuition
description: The city contended yesterday that giving increased scholarship aid would nearly wipe out any savings to the state if tuition fees were imposed on City University students.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: Religious Strife Persists in Philippine Province
description: COTABATO, the Philippines, March 8 (AP)The pistolpacking mayor of Midsayap, where there has been religious violence, reached under his brown knit shirt and pulled out crucifix.

title: Nixon Starts Eye Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) President Nixon opened today a campaign by Research to Prevent Blindness, Inc. to enlist some 10,000 eye physicians. In ceremonies at the. White House, the President presented plaque to Dr. A. Edward Maumenee, the director of the Wilbur Ophthalmological Institute at Johns Hopkins University, naming him as the first ophthalmological associate of the voluntary organization.

title: 1968 DERBY VERDICT IS APPEALED AGAIN
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., March 8 (AP)The State Racing Commission formally filed its appeal today of the Circuit Court decision which held that Dancer's Image should get firstplace money for winning the 1968 Kentucky Derby.

title: High Court Clears Haywood to Play for Sonics
U.N. Officials Hopeful
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 8United Nations officials made it clear today that they expected the indirect ArabIsraeli peace talks through Dr. Jarring to continue despite the new stalemate between Egypt and Israel and the end of the formal ceasefire.

title: Arnold Bernstein Dead at 83; Built Atlantic Shipping Fleets
description: Arnold Bernstein, who refared from the shipping business in 1959 after a 40year career, died Saturday of a heart ailment in Ocean Ridge, Fla. He was 83 years old and had a home also at 61 Bernard Road, New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: Newark School Strike Enters Sixth Week
description: NEWARK, March 8  The Newark teachers strike continued into its sixth week today with the teachers union and the Board of Education no closer to a settlement than they were when the strike began.

title: WEST FARES BADLY IN LIBYA OIL TALKS
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 8The negotiations over Libya's demands for increased oil revenues are going badly for the American and other foreign companies involved, Western sources said today.

title: Jelic Named Coach at Pitt
description: PITTSBURGH, March 8 (UPI) Ralph Jelic, 37 years old, who played fullback and halfback for the University of Pittsburgh in the midnineteenfifties, was named today as Pitt's defensive backfield coach. He succeeds Tom Fletcher, who resigned last week to join the Boston Patriots.

title: Daily Mail and Sketch of London to Merge
Battler for Education Samuel Daniel Wright
description: Like a lot of other people, Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright was looking forward yesterday to seeing the fight between Muhammad All and Joe Frazier. But regardless of the outcome at Madison Square Garden, Mr. Wright was assured of having another kind of fight to occoupy his attention today.

title: Louisville, Ali's Hometown, Is Hoping for a Rematch
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., March 8 (UPI)A crowd of about 16,000 in the city where Muhammad Ali grew up under the name of Cassius Clay walked out of Freedom Hall in disappointment tonight. But many said they expeted a rematch.

title: Manchester Publisher Baans Fight Accounts, Hits at Ali
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., March 8 (UPI)  William Loeb, the publisher who had banned all advertising in his newspaper for the FrazierAli fight because of Ali's refusal to enter the army, said today all news accounts of the fight would be prohibited, too.

title: ILLINOIS PAIR PACE BOWLING AT DETROIT
description: DETROIT, March 8 (UPI)Al Haase and Hank Thullen of Palatine, Ill., rolled a total of 1,326 to take the regulardivision doubles lead at the American Bowling Congress tournament today.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 8There is only one 97pound weakling left in America. Surprisingly, no one in the Government seems to care. I have talked to men on Secretary Laird's Pentagon staff about the danger of a 97poundweakling gap, the last 97pound weakling told me recently, but they say there is already too much Congressional complaining about stockpiles for them to risk starting a new program just now.

title: ATTEMPT TO LIMIT REPORTING FAILS
description: Promoters of the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier heavyweight championship wight tried and failed yesterday to restrict news agency coverage of the bout.

title: Calm Along Canal
description: CAIRO, March 8 (Reuters)Complete calm prevailed along the Suez Canal today, where Egyptian troops were on full alert following the ending of seven months of ceasefire.

title: Wall's Fall Closes 42d St.
description: Crosstown traffic on 42d Street was disrupted for more than half an hour shortly after noon yesterday after section of brick wall fell onto the roof of the Bryant Theater 138 West 42d Street, The police diverted traffic and cordoned off the sidewalk in front of the theater after a 20footby20foot section of brickwork in tenstory adjacent building fell to the onestory structure. There were no injuries.

title: 4 U.S. Agencies Urged to Act Against Bias in Home Financing
description: WASHINGTON, March 7 Thirteen civil rights and public interest organizations filed petitions today asking four Federal agencies to move for the first time against racial discrimination in the private sector of home mortgage financing.

title: Advertising:
description: A top marketing man at Miles Laboratories last night sang the praises of Alka Seltzer advertising done by Jack Tinker & Partners (whidh doesn't have the account any more) and of Doyle Dane Bernbaeh (which doesn't have it any more, either).

title: Report on Peace Talks In Paris Is Retracted
description: PARIS, March 8 (AP)  An American pacifist group quoted as having said today that there had been recent private peace discussions, later retracted the statement.

title: M'ALINDEN IS VICTOR OVER ALI'S BROTHER
description: Don McAlinden, the latest import from the British Isles, made his American debut last night in the Garden a convincing effort. Although crude and awkward, the heavyweight from Coventry pummeled Rahaman Ali, Muhammad's younger brother, and won the majority vote of the officials.

title: For Patient, a Night to Join Audience
description: Each week about 1,000 patients of mental hospitals and narcotics. treatment centers enjoy a free night out here. They are seated as house guests at theatrical, musical and sports events because of the work of a former pianist named Michael Jon Spencer.

title: Venezuela Increases Taxes
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 8 (AP)Venezuela ordered an increase in taxes today on for eign oil companies of about $500million a year. The increase will take effect March 18. Industry sources said it probably would affect fueloil prices on the United States East Coast.

title: If Nixon Fails to Ran, Rockefeller May Try
description: ALBANY, March 8Governor Rockefeller refused to say today whether he would seek another term as Governor, but he did not rule out the possibility of seeking the Presidency if President Nixon decided not to seek reelection in 1972.

title: 2 ONI.S. 201 BOARD RESIGN IN PROTEST
description: Two pioneers in the city's school decentralization fights have resigned from the governing board of Harlem's Intermediate School 201 complex, charging that black principals and teachers show the same contempt as their white counterparts toward the black community.

title: A $1,000aSeat Bid Is Rejected
description: A Madison Square Garden executive turned down a $20,000 offer for 20 seats, $1,000 for each ticket, nominally worth $150 apiece.

title: Court Forbids Job Tests That Screen Out Negroes
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Supreme Court ruled 8 to 0 today that employers cannot use job tests that screen out Negroes without realistically measuring their qualifications to do the work.

title: Military Governor's Oath Blocked in dust Pakistan By TILLMAN DURDIN
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 8The Chief Justice of the High Court here refused today to swear in the new military governor for East Pakistan appointed in West Pakistan last week by President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan.

title: Colombo, Released In Bail, Joins Group Picketing the F.B.I.
description: Joseph Colombo Sr., released on bail from the Nassau County jail yesterday afternoon, joined a group of demonstrators from the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League in picketing the Manhattan headquarters of the Federal Bureau of Investigation in the early evening.

title: BusinessSpending Plans For 71 Revised Upward
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Businessmen have revised upward their plans to invest in plant and equipment this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: I.D.S. SHAREHOLDERS MEET NEW CHAIRMAN
description: About 25 major shareholders of Investors Overseas Services met for two and a half hours last night with Robert L. Vesco, the company's new chairman, to ask questions and discuss I.O.S.'s new reorganization plan.

title: Mary Perry, 83, Actress Of Stage, Movies and TV
description: Mary Perry, a character actress, died Saturday at Sanger's Nursing Home, 500 West 57th Street. She was 83 years old. Miss Perry was born in Gainsville, Ga., and came to New York more than 50 years, ago. She appeared in Bury the Dead, Let Freedom Ring, Brother Rat, The Traveling Lady and All the Way Home among other plays.

title: BONN AIDE CAUTIONS ON PACT WITH EAST
description: BERLIN, March 8Egon Bahr, a West German official, today dampened hopes for an early EastWest German settlement following a session in East Berlin with his East German counterpart, Dr. Michael Kohl.

title: Ottawa Urges a Canadian Pipeline for Alaskan Oil
description: TORONTO, March 8  The Canadian Government is pressing Washington to forget about a transAlaska oil pipeline in favor of a line that would bring Alaskan oil to the United States by way of Canada's Northwest Territories and prairie provinces.

title: BUCKS BEAT SONICS FOR 20TH IN A ROW
Penn Guard's Injury May Give Fordham Added Playoff Break
description: Pennsylvania's misfortune may trun out to be another boost to Fordham's chances in the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament that starts Saturday. If these teams make it through the first two rounds they will meet in the third round or Eastern Regional final on March 20, at Raleigh, N. C. The Quakers may be weakened during the playoffs by the loss or limited action of Steve Bilsky, one of their fine guards.

title: GORDON WGREGOR OF AIR CANADA, 69
