description: MONTREAL, March 8Gordon Roy McGregor, one of the Royal Canadian Air Force's outstanding combat fliers in World War II, and the man almost wholly responsible for developing Air Canada (formerly TransCanada Air Lines) to its present status, died in Montreal General Hospital today after a brief illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Chou Back in Peking
description: PEKING, March 8Premier Chou returned to Peking today from Hanoi.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: 37 Hurt in Ohio Bus Crash
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 8 (AP)  Thirtyseven persons were injured today, four seriously, when a chartered bus overturned at a freeway interchange north of Columbus. The bus, operated by White Lines of Oxford, Ohio, was carrying 39 persons from Cox Municipal Airport in Dayton to Cleveland.

title: Charles Enters R.A.F. For Training on a Jet
description: CRANWELL, England, March 8 (UPI)  Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, entered the Royal Air Force today as a flight lieutenant.

title: 6 HARPER EDITORS PLAN SHOWDOWN
description: Six top editors of Harper's Magazine are expected to act as a unit and remain or resign together at a meeting this evening with John Cowles Jr., chairman of the board of Harper's.

title: An Average Campaign Day in West Bengal: 10 Political Murders
description: CALCUTTA, India, March 8 There were 10 political murders in Calcutta and other parts of West Bengal yesterday just about an average day of terrorism for this disturbed state during the current election campaign.

title: Swiss Say Taiwan Official Defected to Red China
description: GENEVA, March 8  Sun ChiChou, a Chinese Nationalist diplomat who disappeared Thursday from his hotel here, has defected to Communist China, the Swiss authorities said today.

title: GetEven Specials Back For DayNight Bettors
ST, JOHN'S PICKED FOR N.I.T. BERTH
description: St. John's, La'Salle, Hawaii, Georgia Tech and Syracuse were named yesterday to the National Invitation Tournament, bringing the field to 10 teams. Six berths remain to be filled for the basketball tournament, which ,will open at Madison Square Garden with an afternoon tripleheader andan evening doubleheader on March 20 and conclude a week later.

title: Residents of Harlem See Start Of Their Own Apartment House
description: The owners of the 14story, 98family apartment house that will rise on the southwest corner of Harlem's 147th Street and Seventh Avenue, watched excitedly yesterday as a roaring bulldozer dug a foundation and five trucks hauled away dirt and rubble.

title: Mediator in FirePay Impasse Submits Confidential Proposals
description: Eric J. Schmertz, chairman of an impasse panel in the firemen's contract dispute with the city, recommended settlement terms yesterday. He did not make the details public, explaining that the presentation to both parties was confidential. The Schmertz recommendations were reported to include proposals on the key economic issues, involving pay increases and pensions, as well as on the length of contract.

title: Executive Changes
description: Scripto, Inc., announced yesterday In Atlanta the election of Herbert W. Sams as president. Previously executive vice president, he succeeds Arthur L. Harris who has been named chairman of the company's international operations and who will remain a director of the parent company. The changes will become effective April 1.

title: Frazier Outpoints Ali and Keeps Title
description: In a classic 15round battle, Joe Frazier broke the wings of the butterfly and smashed the stinger of the bee last night in winning a unanimous 15round decision over Muhammad Ali at Madison Square Garden.

title: KNOCKDOWN BLOW IS PERFECT ON TV
description: Those yetuncounted Millions who viewed last night's fight over closedcircuit television saw the knockdown blow in the 15th round not once but 16 tithes, thanks to the technology of instant replay.

title: Ramsey Clark and Paul O'Dwyer Join Defense in Berrigan Case
description: A team of four lawyersRamsey Clark, Paul O'Dwyer, Leonard Boudin and Addison Bowmanhas agreed to undertake the defense of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and his five codefendants when they stand trial on charges of conspiring to kidnap a Presidential aide and blow up heating tunnels in Government buildings in Washington.

title: Dr. Meyer D. Berger Dies; Ear, Nose, Throat Specialist
description: Dr. Meyer D. Berger, an ear, nose and throat specialist, died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 616 East 18th Street, Brooklyn. His office was at 681 Ocean Ave., Brooklyn.

title: Mills Praises Move, Urges. Others to Act
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Representative Wilbur D. Mills welcomed today the Japanese textile industry's announcement of restraints on exports to the United States and strongly implied that the United States industry should accept it.

title: TV Viewers Get Bout North of the Border
description: EDINBURG, Tex., March 8 (UPI)  While thousands stood in line and paid stiff prices to see Muhammad All fight Joe Frazier tonight, residents along the Rio Grande border watched it on television in the comfort of their homes.

title: Quiet Columbia Revolution
description: An experimental course, spawned in part, by the 1968 strike at Columbia University, has been keeping its students in class for as long as 13 hours a day in what some of the students consider constructive revolution.

title: Alumnae Aid Vassar Book Sale
description: WASHINGTONIve come for the books, the whitehaired woman said crisply to the startled young housewife.

title: Johnson's Pilot to Retire
description: AUSTIN, Tex., March 8 (AP) Brig. Gen. James V. Cros, who was the pilot of Air Force One while Lyndon B. Johnson was President, will retire April 10 at the age of 46. General Cross commands the 75th Tactical Reconnaissance Wing at Bergstrom Air Force Base.

title: Cab Riding Down 20%; Industry Sees Danger
description: A spokesman for the fleet taxi industry said yesterday that if public resistance to the new taxi fares continued at the same rate as last week, it would destroy the industry.

title: Radio Gives WorldWide Fight News
description: Radio stations throughout the world made the best of the blackout on live coverage of the heavyweight championship fight between Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali. Networks and stations relied on roundbyround summaries of the news associations and used their staff sports commentators to generate excitement in. the intervals.

title: Shift of Best Troops to Cambodia and Laos Worries Saigon Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 8  An apprehensive mood reigns. in the :co'untryside around Vietriarn:s capital city, whose, defense has. been left to irregulars and auxiliary forces while nearly 50,000 of Saigon's best troops have been moved out of the country to fight North Vietnameae troops in Cambodia and laos.

title: Israeli Forces on Alert
description: JERUSALEM, March 8 (Reuters)Israeli troops were on state of alert today as they faced Egyptian forces across the Suez Canal without a mutually accepted ceasefire.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: Dear Mr. Carroll:

title: EDUCATION ARTICLES WIN AWARDS FOR 4
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The National Council for the Advancement of Education Writling announced today its 1970 awards for excellence in education writing. Two staff members of The New York Times were among the winners.

title: Dolphins Sign Theismann, Notre Dame Quarterback
description: MIAMI, March 8 (UPI)The Miami Dolphins signed Joe Theismann, the Notre Dame quarterback last season, to contract today, but didn't announce the terms.

title: Gas Discovery Is Reported
description: Panarctic Oils, Ltd., reported yesterday that its welt On King Christian Island in the Canadian Arctic Was a major natural gas discovery. Panarctic, a consortium of Canadian Governmint sand investorowned oil and mining companies, declined to. disclose gas flow rates.

title: Kennedy Rider Seeks Vote In the District of Columbia
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, introduced today a proposed constitutional amendment to give the District of Columbia full voting representation in Congress.

title: Senate Panel Urged to Retain Health Network
description: WASHINGTON, March 8A parade of witnesses before Congress today protested Federal plans to dismantle the United States Public Health Service hospital network/ as Government aides said closing would be delayed to enable local officials to take over the institutions.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: Goal for Brooklyn TB Unit
description: The board of directors of the Brooklyn Tuberculosis and Respiratory Disease Association yesterday termed the TB rate in the borough a city, state and national disgrace, with the number of cases in some areas as high today as they were 50 years ago. A budget of $381,356 was approved for the 197172 fiscal year.

title: Students at I.S. 44 Give W eill's Opera Zesty Full Measure
description: New York City's school crisis was front page news on Sunday, as parents, teachers, students and friends of Intermediate School 44 jammed Carnegie Recital Hall for the acid of ambitiously creative project that could well become a first casualty of the announced budget cuts.

title: Protests Interrupt City Welcome for Astronauts
Brokerage Houses Merge
description: BOSTON, March 8 (AP)Hutchins Mixter and Parkinson, Inc., of Boston announced completion today of a merger with Woodcock Cummings Taylor & French of Philadelphia, under which the surviving concern will bear the Hutchins name. Both are investment brokerage firms established more than a century ago.

title: Market Place:Churning Hint Stirs Umbrage
description: Robert F. Fomon, the engaging new president of E. F. Hutton, lit the fuse last week. He raised the specter of brokerage houses churning their Most important accounts  those that they manage for a fee while collecting commissions on the transactions themselves.

title: 4 in Dune Buggy Killed
description: HARBOR CITY, Calif., March 8 (UPI)Two children and two, adults were killed yesterday when the dune buggy they were riding in collided head on with another vehicle on the Pacific Coast Highway. Dead were Lonnie Carrillo, 29, of Lomita, Calif. his son, Lonnie Andrew, 6; Fred Crittenden, 29, of Highland, and his daughter Caren Renee, 5.

title: Daley Assails Plan to Construct LowIncome Housing Projects in White Areas
description: CHICAGO, March 8Mayor Richard J. Daley denounced today a plan to build smallunit, scatteredsite public housing in white neighborhoods under a twoyearold Federal court order.

title: Outside the Ring, Another Dazzling Spectaclethe Spectators
description: They came to the Fight of the Century dressed in the faShions of the minute.

title: Safe Detergent Is Seized as Harmful
description: About 2,000 cases of two laundry detergents that have been widely advertised as safe, for the environment were seized by Federal marshals in Queens and in Maryland yesterday because they were allegedly extremely dangerous, toxic and hazardous to people.

title: Wings Reassign Monteith
description: DETROIT, March 8 (UPI)The Detroit Red Wings today reassigned Hank Monteith, a left wing, to their Fort Worth farm club in the Central Hockey League.

title: A GENERAL STRIKE IN COLOMBIA FAILS
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, March 8 (UPI)A 24hour general strike, called by a section of organized labor to protest the rising cost of living, failed today. The Government called it a subversive plot.

title: Tariff Unit Holds Workers In 7 Plants Ineligible for Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Tariff Commission ruled today thet workers in seven shoe manufacturing companies were not eligible for adjustment assistance relief from import competition.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: Muskie Urges U.S. Press Lisbon to Quit African Territories
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, March 8Senator Edmund S. Muskie said today that the United States should try as hard as we can to persuade Portugal to give up her African territories.

title: U. S. BACKS THANT ON BID TO ISRAEL FOR WITHDRAWAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 The United States today endorsed Secretary General Thant's appeal for a pledge by Israel to withdraw her forces from all Egyptian territory.

title: Nonransom Policy Adopted
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 United States officials said today that the Administration had adopted a policy of not paying ransom in cases of political kidnapping.

title: STEEL OUTPUT POSTS 0.3% DROP IN WEEK
U.S. Business Called Wary
description: SAIGON, March 8 (UPI) David M. Kennedy, United States ambassador at large, told American businessmen in South Vietnam today that United States business was not ready to invest in this wartorn country.

title: Jersey City Schools Shut
description: JERSEY CITY, March 8Jersey City's 40 public schools were closed today by order of the School Superintendent after 425 noninstructional personnel struck for higher wages.

title: Five Men Doomed by Cuba
description: HAVANA, March 8 (Reuters) Five men captured after an abortive landing in eastern Cuba last September, have been sentenced to death by firing squad, it was announced here. Two other men captured after the landing have been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment, a television announcement said.

title: Turkey Acts on Hijacking
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 8 (Reuters)The Supreme Court of Appeal today overturned previous rulings that two hijackers of a Soviet plane had acted on political grounds and were not liable to extradition. The Soviet authorities have demanded the extradition of the two men, Pranas BrazinskasKoreivo, and his son, Alglerdas. Today's, court decision that they committed a criminal offense means their fate is now in the hands of the Turkish Government.

title: Ballet: Mitchell's Troupe
description: In a remarkably short time Arthur Mitchell's Dance Theater of Harlem has established itself as a force in the dance world. Last night, after little more than a year of existence, it opened its first Broadway engagement, at the ANTA Theater. This marks the beginning of the last week of the City Center American Dance Season, which will also see appearances by the companies of Erick Hawkins and Don Redlich.

title: Back to the Whipsaw
description: Once again railroad labor has wrecked moves to eliminate some of the featherbedding that has long undermined the financial health of the railroads and the security of rail jobs. The breakdown of talks covering unionized train crews is particularly disappointing because it comes after three other rail unions have voluntarily agreed to new contracts that hitched substantial pay increases to modifications in archaic work rules.

title: Natural Resources Department
description: Government reorganization and revenue sharing may not add up to a second American Revolution, in President Nixon's soaring phrase, but they are disturbing enough to raise the hackles of many influential people in the permanent bureaucracy, in Congress and in the various lobbies. This is particularly true for the proposed regrouping of social and economic programs and of six Cabinetlevel departments; but it is even true for the more familiar and widely supported plan to transform the Department of the Interior into a coherent Department of Natural Resources.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The Image of a leathertough outdoorsman that have endeavored to maintain for many years has suffered irreparable harm.

title: Decision Satisfies Most Buffs
description: They roared. They applauded., They chanted AhLee and they chanted Joe. They even booed occasionally.

title: Books of The Times
description: The National Book Award machine clanked and squeaked into its terminus last week. Behind it lay a trail of worthy books, rejected poets, and Erich Segal draped in an illfitting mantle of dignity. Safely into the roundhouse, the N.B.A. machine exploded into a junkpile of overcrowded cocktail parties, dissenting views, hurt feelings, and salubrious citations. And the final sound one heardthe laSt galosh in Fibber McGee's closetwas Shirley Hazzard dropping off the Western continental shelf, the very late discovery having been made that the author of the final fictioncandidate The Bay of Noon was a citizen of Australia and therefore by the rules of the game no contender at all. Yet lo and beholdwho would have believed it?when all was said and undone, it was not at all a bad pile of books that the machinery had offered us.

title: An Educational Reversal
description: Two months ago the State Legislature unanimously passed a bill again extending the life of the city's Interim Board of Education for another year, this time until June 30, 1972. In part, the Legislature's action was motivated by a desire to put off until next year a decision on how a permanent school board should be selected.

title: Hayes Refused Salary During Rockets Slump
description: SAN DIEGO, March 8 (AP)  The owner of the San Diego Rockets said today that Elvin Hayes, the star of the National Basketball Association team, refused to take his pay until the Rockets got out of a twomonth slump.

title: 30 Missing in Ecuador Slide
description: QUITO, Ecuador, March 8 (Reuters)At least 30 persons were feared killed tonight when a huge landslide buried cars and buses on a mountain highway between Quito and Quayaquil, the police reported.

title: 3 MORE FROM N.F.L. CALLED BY U.S. JURY
description: CLEVELAND, March 8 (AP) A Federal grand jury investigating possiole antitrust violations in the National Football League questioned today the Cleveland Browns owner, Arthur Modell; the San Francisco 49ers quarterback, John Brodie, and the Baltimore Colts tight end, John Mackey.

title: One Colonel Denies a Bribe
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) An Army colonel denied to Senators today that he ever accepted bribes in Vietnam. A second colonel testified he was tricked by a general into taking one.

title: High Court Lets Stand Maryland Ban on Curious
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The controversial Swedish film I Am Curious (Yellow) became enmeshed in a curious legal snarl today as the Supreme Court deadlocked over whether the film is obscene.

title: Patman Introduces Legislation To Regulate Financial Concerns
description: WASHINGTON, March 8Chairman Wright Patman and eight other members of the House Banking Committee introduced legislation today aimed at reducing the economic power of banks and other financial institutions.

title: TRIAL OF MEDINA ORDERED BY ARMY
EARLY LOSSES CUT IN FUTURES PRICES
CHOU ENDS A TRIP TO NORTH VIETNAM
description: HONG KONG, March 8Pre mier Chou Enlai and Chinese Communist leaders have visited North Vietnam in a surprise development believed to be linked to the, war situation in Indochina.

title: HARRY PRESTON DIES; LED PAPER CONCERN
description: Harry Preston, a retired paper manufacturer, died yesterday at his home 880 Fifth Avenue. His age was 72.

title: Report Asks Nixon To Enlarge Budget In Drive on Hunger
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Administration must greatly enlarge its new antihuhger budget if it is to meet President Nixon's announced policy of covering all eligible poor people, according to officials of the recent White House Followup Hunger Conference.

title: RELIEF CUT ASKED IN STATE BY G.O.P.
description: ALBANY, March 8A broad range of cuts In Governor Rockefeller's proposed record budget of $8.45billion, ranging from slashes in welfare allotments to postponement of $110million in previously enacted pay increases for state employes, were recommended today In a series of 10 reports sent by Senate Republicans to their majority leader, Senator Earl W. Brydges of Niagara Falls.

title: WORKERS PROTEST AT 14 HOSPITALS
description: Technicians in 14 of the city's public hospitals staged sporadic work stoppages yesterday in dispute over union representation.

title: From an Attic, a Love Of Early. U.S. Songs
description: Recognize the words? Probably not. They are lyrics of popular 18thcentury drinking song that an imaginative versifier named Francis Scott Key later rewrote as The StarSpangled Banner. These, and other bits of early American show biz, will be the subjects of Angela Talbot's first New York concert Sunday at 8:30 P.M. at Carnegie Recital Hall, where the Massachuketts soprano will sing a medley of songs from the Federal period.

title: Foreman Pulls Modest Switch: Challenges A liFrazier Loser
description: You can't rush success, George Foreman said yesterday at Madison Square Garden before the AliFrazier fight. You've got to take your time. You just have to lay low until the time comes. That's what I'm doing.

title: Brooklyn G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI)  The Defense Department said today that Pfc. Gerald Johnson of Brooklyn had been killed in the war in Southeast ??.

title: Canada Deports Hijacker
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, March 8 (Reuters)Chappin Scott Paterson, a 19yearold United States Army inductee who hijacked a Western Airlines jet to Vancouver on Feb. 25, was deported to the United States today. A deportation order was carried out after a judge here ruled that he could not interfere.

title: Agnew, at Parley, Stresses Indian Rights and U.S. Role
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., March 8 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew said today that American Indians must have the right to govern their lands and their resources but the Federal Government must continue to provide financial support,

title: At 104, She Looks Forward to Car Rides and Eating Out
description: It's a shame people don't ask Mrs. Mary Ringo Walker Harper out for automobile rides more often. She enjoys it so much.

title: VICTOR DE PAUW, 69; ARTIST DREW WEST
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., March 6  Victor De Pauw, a painter and lithographer represented in several major museums, died today in Southampton Hospital Eifter a short illness. He was 69 years old and lived at 30 Osborne Lane.

title: Suprethe Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, March 8The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: FIVE MARKS FALL IN EASTERN TRACK
description: Boys High posted a National flatfloor record for the mile relay last night when it clocked 3 minutes 21.2 seconds at The Eastern states schoolboy indoor championships 102d Engineers Armory.

title: KASANOF IS NAMED TO LEGAL AID POST
description: Robert Kasanof, a former trial lawyer for the Legal Aid Society, has been appointed the attorneyincharge of the society's Criminal Courts branch, Orison S. Marden, chairman of the board of directors, announced yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridge: High Standard of Play Marks AllStars Match With Blacks
description: The allstar PrecisionClub touring team continued its winning streak Saturday with a hardfought victory here over the national champions of the American Bridge Association.

title: 40,025 See Good Behaving Win at Aqueduct Opener
description: As expected Aqueduct Race Track had the biggest sports crowd in town yesterday, drawing about twice.. as many fans ($5 tops) as the heavyweight championship fight ($150 tops) did at Madison Square Garden. The turnout for the opening of the local, thoroughbred racing season was 40,025.

title: A Drug Amnesty Program Announced by Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP)  An amnesty program for airmen who voluntarily admit using drugs and seek medical help was announced today by Gen. John D. Ryan, Air Force Chief of Staff.

title: MRS. IRVING WALLACH
description: Mrs. Saralta Crown Wallach, a retired public school teacher and the wife of Irving T. Wallach, a vice president of the real estate concern of HelmsleySpear, Inc., died yesterday in Beth Israel Medical Center after a long illness. She was 67 years old and resided at 242 East 19th Street.

title: HornRims His Trademark
description: A pair of inexpensive, hornrimmed eyeglass frames without lenses, the shy expression of a somewhat bewildered adolescent and singletrack ambition made Harold Clayton Lloyd the highestpaid screen actor in Hollywood's golden age of the nineteen twenties.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Resignations. President Nixon accepted the resignations of Pierre S. du Pont 4th, of the Air Quality Board, and Peter J. Peterson as a member of the General Advisory Committee of the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency. Mr. du Pont was recently elected as Representative from Delaware and Mr. Peterson was recently named an assistant to the President for international economic affairs.

title: Arab Guerrilla Movement Reported to Have Financial Problems
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 8  The Palestinian guerrilla movement is having financial difficulties. Its budget has shown a deficit for the first time since the movement began six years ago.

title: U.S. Doubts Chinese Move
description: WASHINGTON, March 8American officials said they, saw no evidence that the Chinese were about to commit troops or volunteers to the war. They said they had no evidence to substantiate press reports over the weekend that Chinese troops were being massed near the border of Laos.

title: 19, Officials and Impresarios Sentenced for Fraud In Rome
description: ROME, March 8 (AP)  A Rome tribunal has convicted 19 Government officials and threater impresarios of fraud or misuse of state subsidies by collecting for operas and plays that were not staged. Six persons were acquitted.

title: NIXON MEN OFFER A SCHOOL AID PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 8 (UPI)The Nixon Administration proposed today that states be required to spend a fixed amount for education of the poor under the President's revenuesharing plan.

title: Alabama Youth Hijacks a Jet, Which Lands in Miami
description: MIAMI, March 8 (AP)16yearold high school sophomore boarded a National Airlines jet today, at Mobile, Ala., drew a pistol and forced the crew to fly him to Miami, where he surrendered peacefully.

title: Fire Marshal Is Made Deputy Commissioner
description: Vincent M. Canty, the city's chief fire marshal since 1966, was appointed first deputy fire commissioner yesterday.

title: Park Says Seoul Is Studying Plans for Vietnam Pullout
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 9 (UPI)President Chung Hee Park of South Korea says his Government is studying a timetable for eventual withdrawal of the 50,000 South Korean troops in Vietnam but that no immediate pullout is planned.

title: Switzerland Hockey Victor
description: BERN, Switzerland, March 9 (AP)Switzerland maintained its lead in the world ice hockey championships tonight by defeating Yugoslavia, 85.

title: A SAFETY LAG FOUND ON CHARTER FLIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (UPI)Willard J. Smith, assistant Transportation Secretary, told the Senate Aviation Subcommittee today that some flybynight charter operators hid behind the law in order to use unsafe planes and illtrained pilots.

title: TV: Inside a Celluloid Washington, Cliches Intact
Dr. Barry Wood Is Dead;
description: BOSTON, March 9Dr. WilHam.Barry Wood Jr., who became one of the preeminent bacteriologists in the United States after a sports career at Harvard, where he was an allAmerica football player, died today of a heart attack. He was GO years old.

title: Grid Star, Bacteriologist
description: Lean, tall and dedicated Barry Wood starred in hockey football and baseball at Harvard while establishing a national reputation as a tennis player as well.

title: Student Senate at City U. Urges Faculty to Give Up Its Pay Rises
description: City University's Student Senate called on the faculty and university staff yesterday to give up $25million in negotiated salary increases for the coining fiscal year amid charges that the majority of this faculty was mediocre and not worth the present pay.

title: Daley Scores Housing Order
description: CHICAGO, March 9 (AP)Mayor Richard J. Daley said today that Chicago would build public housing with its own money rather than agree to Federal District Court desegregation order to put most of Federally funded housing in white neighborhoods, The Mayor said he would announce within a few days details of a plan to construct between 7,500 and 10,000 lowincome housing units.

title: Mills Panel Weighs an Increase In Family Assistance to $2, 800
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 The House Ways and Means Committee, outdoing the Nixon Administration, is discussing an increase to $2,800 in the annual income that the Family Assistance Plan would guarantee family of four.

title: 5 Stabbed at San Quentin
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., March 9 (UPI)Warden Louis Nelson ordered a general lockup of the prison's 3,250 inmates today after five prisoners were stabbed in less than 24 hours. Two of the victims were seriously injured. We are not entirely sure what is happening, but it appears we are dealing with retaliation between racial groups, a prison spokesman said.

title: Britons'Joke About Strike Leads to Serious Situation
description: LYE, England (UPI)It was all a gag, Doug Smith's friends said when they asked hint to make a teabreak speech calling for a strike at their steel plant.

title: Pin Money Getting Bigger for Weber
description: Dick Weber, professional bowling's career top moneywinner, admits that sometimes he gets tired of knocking down all those helpless pins.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent column James Reston faults the Nixon Administration for betting on a military resolution of the Vietnam war. With the record of the North Vietnamese at the socalled peace conference in Paris, what else can it bet on?

title: The World of Harold Lloyd
description: It is tempting to think nostalgically of Harold Lloyd as the symbol of an age of innocence, now long vanished. But it is also unrealand just a bit selfpitying. The 1920's and 1930's, when the boyish comedian with the hornrimmed glasses enjoyed his greatest fame, were anything but innocent. From the Valentine Day's massacre of gangsters to the Memorial Day massacre steel workers, from Teapot Dome to the Reichstag fire, they were decades of disillusionment and depression, culminating in the horrors of fascism and war.

title: Tennis Permits Increased To $15 for City Park Courts
description: The Parks Department has raised the cost of season tennis permits from $10 to $15. Junior permits for those under 17 years of age remain $3.

title: CERTAIN LAW ADS BACKED IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 Advertising by law firms, an activity that the legal profession has forbidden for more than a century, has won the highly qualified blessing of the ethics committee of the District of Columbia Bar Association.

title: U. S. Court Is Asked to Ban Abuses by Philadelphia Police and Name an Enforcer
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 9A coalition of organizations opposing police misconduct has asked the Federal District Court here to enjoin illegal police action and name a special master to enforce the injunction.

title: F.B.I. Reports Office Raid
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 9 (Reuters)The Federal Bureau of Investigation office at Media near here was raided early today and Government property removed according to an F.B.I. spokesman. In au anonymous telephone call to a Philadelphia reporter, a group calling itself the Citizens Commission to Investigate the F.B.I. said it had removed all the records.

title: 100 L.I.R.R. Police Call Protest Job Action
description: Abut 100 members of the Long Island Railroad police force called a job action early this morning, apparently to protest assignment policies, according to a spokesmen for the railroad.

title: 21 Officers of F.B.I. Criticize McGovern And Defend Hoover
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP) Twentyone senior officers of the Federal Bureau of Investigation have joined in defending J. Edgar Hoover against the criticism of Senator George S. McGovern.

title: West's Oilmen Wait For Libyan Decision On Offer of Increase
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 9Western oil companies waited anxiously today for the Libyan Government's decision on the companies offer of a substantial increase in tax and royalty payments.

title: Viva and 2 Arrested For Resisting Policeman
description: Viva, the novelist and underground movie star and Shirley Clarke, an independent film producer, and a third person were arrested Monday on charges of disorderly conduct and resisting arrest Viva, who gave her last name as Ander was also charged with harassment of a policeman.

title: Gerald T. Beal 4N Dead at 7S Chairman of Schroder Banking
description: Gerald F. Beal, retired board chairman of the J. Henry Schroder Banking Corporation and the Schroder Trust Company, died Menday evening at his home. He was 75 years old and lived at 860 United Nations Plaza.

title: GARRY G. OWEN
description: LEESBURG, Va., March 9Garry, G. Owen, who retired in 1.967 as a vice president and director of the Arabian American bil Company (Aramco), died Sunday at his home here after a short illness. He was 69 years old.

title: 2 Inmates at Auburn Testify to Beatings
description: AUBURN, N.Y., March 9Two inmates of the state prison here said today that guards had, punched; kicked and jabbed them with clubs several times since the prison was seized by prisoners for eight hours on Nov. 4.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial remarks on the severe financial needs of black colleges are certainly gratifying. As director of a training program in the field of development which serves nearly forty traditionally black schools, I am closely acquainted with the depth of their financial problems.

title: Ali: It's a Good Feeling to Lose, but I Won
description: With a green blanket and white sheet pulled over his body, Muhammad Ali spoke softly through a swollen jaw yesterday in his bed at the Hotel New Yorker.

title: Levitt Says State Is Facing Gap In Budget for This Fiscal Year
description: ALBANY, March 9With the end of its present fiscal year about three weeks away, the state faces a substantial gap between expenditures and the revenues needed to balance the budget.

title: Trudeau Back in Ottawa After Skiing Honeymoon
description: OTTAWA, March 9  Despite wintry blasts and 14 feet of snow, Ottawa gave Prime Minister. Pierre Elliott Trudeau and his bride of five days warm welcome home today.

title: Warsaw Asserts It Planted Spy in Radio Free Europe
description: WARSAW, March 9 (UPI)The Polish press agency, P.A.P., said today that Warsaw had planted an intelligence agent in Radio Free Europe's news room In Munich and that his account would be made public by Poland's news media.

title: 2 CHOREOGRAPHERS GIVE DANCE PROGRAM
description: Laura Pawel and Christine Loizeaux offered a dance program of interesting variety and puzzling unevenness Monday evening at the Cubiculo. Strongly shaped pieces were presented side by side with others by the same choreographer that almost totally escaped artistic control.

title: DEATH HERE TIED TO PANTHER FEUD
description: Police sources said yesterday that the killing here on Monday of a man whom the Black Panther party described as local field marshal was part of the growing rift between the New York and California factions of the revolutionary party.

title: GOULD MAKES BID FOR DICTAPHONE
description: Gould, Inc., announced yesterday it had proposed to acquire the Dictaphone Corporation, a leading manufacturer of dictating and recording machines.

title: BRITISH SURPLUS OF TRADE SURGES
description: LONDON, March 9Britain had a record surplus of $1.5billion in 1970 on current account, made up of trade and invisibles such as banking and tourism.

title: 56 Cyclists Facing Murder Charges In Cleveland Fight
description: CLEVELAND, March 9 (AP) Fiftysix motorcycle gang members were charged with firstdegree murder today in connection with a Saturday night battle in which five cyclists were killed.

title: New St. Luke's Headmaster
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., March 9Eric Moore has been named new headmaster at St. Luke's School, a private school for boys. Mr. Moore, who is 36 years old, is now chairman of the science department at the Shipley School in Bryn Mawr, Pa. He will, succeed James M. White, who will return to teaching.

title: Training for Disabled
description: For the young handicapped child early education is particularly important. He needs special help in learning group and individual skills to lay solid foundation for formal education. The Easter Seal Society of New York State is effectively demonstrating the value of preschool training for the handicapped young ster in a pilot project. Many children, after a year or two at the nursery school, are able to enter the regular publie school with their peers.

title: NEW WILLIAMS PLAY DUE TO OPEN JULY 8
description: CHICAGO, March 9 (AP)The Ivanhoe Theater announced today it would produce a new play by Tennessee Williams in July. The work, The Two Character Play, is scheduled for a 10week run opening July 8. The play had its world premiere at the Hampstead Theater Club, in the London suburbs, on Dec. 12, 1967.

title: JENNINGS LAUDED FOR HOCKEY ROLE
description: William M. Jennings, the president of the Rangers and a prime force in the National Hockey League's expansion, was honored last night for outstanding service to hockey, in the United States.

title: 2 PUBLIC EMPLOYES ROBBED IN BROOKLYN
description: Two public employes, school principal and an assistant chief medical examiner, were robbed yesterday in separate incidents in Brooklyn.

title: Hawkins Dancers in Of Love Premiere
description: Erick Hawkins is not everyone's cup of tea. Some might even require a chaser. But for those who simply swallow, not even hard, his choreography can reward with the most intoxicating of flowerpetaled flavors.

title: Compatibility Called Key to Building Plan
description: A bigger battle than the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier fight may be shaping up in Greenwich Village, where the city's best urban gladiators live. It is also where a hole on. West 11th Street has become a landmark of sorts, and the urban fight is about what will fill the hole. Because the town house explosion, as it is already known in instant revolutionary mythology, destroyed one house of a handsome mid19th century row officially designated as a city landmark, the Landmarks Preservation Commission must pass on the appropriateness of the replacement.

title: Israeli President Given Honor Here by Yeshiva U.
description: Zalman Shazar, the 81yearold President of Israel, was awarded an honorary degree of Doctor of Humane Letters yesterday by Yeshiva University.

title: U.S. Colonel Is Lost After Enemy Lures Helicopter to Laos
description: KHESANH, South Vietnam Wednesday, March 10 (AP)North Vietnamese troops lured an American field commander's helicopter into Laos with false smoke signal and then shot it down, United States officers reported yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Auto Show Here Shunned By Chrysler and American
description: DETROIT, March 9Two of the four American automobile makers, the Chrysler Corporation and the American Motors Corporation, will not take part in the International Automobile Show being held at the New York Coliseum next month. The two companies, both of which lost money last year, said they had withdrawn from the show for budgetary reasons. Privately, officials of the two companies also said they were angered by underthetable payments, their own dealers failure to support the show, and the damage done to cars by, vandals.

title: Aide to Mitchell Opposes Any Curb on Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON March 9A senior official of the Justice Department said today that the department will vigorously oppose any legislation that would impair the Government's ability to gather information about American citizens.

title: CALLEY DISPUTED ON ELM DEATHS
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 9The testimony of First Lieut William L. Calley Jr. that he had orders to kill everyone at Mylai except a few Vietnamese civilians who were to be used as human mine detectors was disputed today by a fellow officer.

title: No Life of Leisure For Diplomat's Wife
description: As the wife of the Italian Consul General in New York, Mrs. Vieri Traxler, who's as English as they come, munches and sips her way through rounds of luncheons, committee meeting's, fashion things, teas, cocktail parties, receptions, more cocktail parties, concerts, cultural and commercial events and dinners.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Floods. President Nixon ordered the director of the Office of Emergency Planning, George A. Lincoln, to formulate a Federal program to help prevent predicted severe flooding in the Middle West during the spring thaw. Most seriously threatened, according to the National Weather Service, are Minnesota, Wisconsin, northwestern Illinois, northern Iowa and parts of North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska and Missouri.

title: Welfare Hotel Residents to Get Housing Priority
description: The City Housing Authority announced several steps yesterday designed to move at least 100 welfare families month out of seedy hotels and into public housing.

title: Heinrich Gets 49er Post
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March (UPI)Don Heinrich. a former quarterback for the New York Giants, was named today as defensive backfield coach for the San Francisco tigers. Heinrich, who has been an assistant with New Orleans for the last two seasons, will replace Burnie Miller, who resigned to Lake a job with the Houston Oilers.

title: CAPITAL BUREAU AIDE IS LEAVING NEWSDAY
description: Joseph P. Albright, Washington bureau chief of Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, announced yesterday that he was resigning from the paper, effective April 15.

title: Hawaii Bombing Bill Voted
description: HONOLULU, March 9 (UPI) Persons convicted of illegally using explosives would get life prison sentences under a bill passed today by the Hawaii House of Representatives. The billi, which was sent to the Senate, also sets a 20year prison term and fine of up to $5,000 for persons convicted of using explosives to frighten others; or to cause property damage.

title: Memorial to Stokes Planned
description: LORETTO, Pa., March 9 (AP) St. Francis College will dedicate a new phySical education center to the late Maurice Stokes, an alumnuS and star Pro basketball Player who died last year after battling a disabling brain injury.

title: Judge Refuses to Move Hearing for Angela Davis
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 9 (AP)  A Marin County Superior Court judge refused today to move next week's pretrial hearing in the Angela Davis case to a larger courtroom.

title: Rogers Suggests Moscow Reduce Forces in Egypt
description: WASHINGTON, March 9Secretary of State William Rogers said tonight that it would be very helpful if the Soviet Union reduced its military contingents in the United Arab Republic as part of a Middle East peace settlement.

title: BOSTON U. ROUTS R.P.I. SIX BY 110
description: BOSTON, March 9 (AP)Don Cahoon and Steve Stirling led the scoring tonight as topseeded Boston University overpowered Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, 110, in the quarterfinal round of the Eastern College Athletic Conference hockey playoffs.

title: AMEX UP SLIGHTLY IN ACTIVE TRADING
Peter Basquin Shows Poise in Piano Debut Here
description: Peter Basquin is a 27yearold New Yorker who has won prizes in several piano competitions. He has made many recital appearances, has played a great deal of chamber music and teaches at Hunter College. On Monday night at Alice Tully Hall he made his formal New York recital debut. His experience before the public showed in performances that were beautifully poised and virtually noteperfect.

title: White House Cool to Curb By Japanese on Textiles
description: WSHINGTON, March 9The White House reacted unenthusiastically today to a Japanese decision to restrict voluntarily textile exports to this country.

title: GROUP WILL FIGHT FOR FOX PROXIES
description: After months of rumblings that a proxy fight for control of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation was imminent, the battle apparently got under way yesterday.

title: Abraham Kramer, President Of Drug Distributor, Dies
description: Abraham H. Kramer, president of United States Drug Corporation, distributors of drug sundries in Glendale, Queens, died yesterday in University Hospital after a short illness. He was 80 years old and lived at 6561 Saunders Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Laotians Under Heavy Attack
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 9 (AP)  North Vietnamese and Pathet Lao forces are attacking in both northern and southern Laos and the military situation is grave, the Defense Ministry said today.

title: Quake Shakes Monterey
description: MONTEREY, Calif., March (AP)An earthquake, the second in two days, rattled homes today in the Monterey Bay Area. No damage was reported.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, March 9The Joe FrazierMurhaanmad All heavyweight championship fight is over, but the battle( over the greedy promoters is just beginning. If they can sell their performers to the highest bidders, and black out home television for the poor folk why not the same grab for the pro football Super Bowl, the World Series and all other big sports and theatrical productions?

title: Frazier Asked to Talk To State Legislature
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March 9 Joe Frazier, the world heavyweight boxing champion, who spent his early years on his family farm in Beaufort, S. C., was invited today to address the State Legislature here at his convenience.

title: Harvard Topples Brown
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 9Dan DeMichele banged in a rebound shot at 15:03 of the final period to give Harvard a 43 victory over Brown in a quarterfinal game of the E.C.A.C. playoff tonight. The game was marred by a benchclearing brawl late in the first period during which officials gave out 29 minutes in penalties.

title: FIVE THEATERS JOIN IN CHILDREN'S FAIR
description: Five theater companies are participating in the current State Theater Fair for Children. The weekend programs, geared for youngsters from 5 upward, and sponsored by the New York State Council on the Arts, began last Saturday with performances by the Paper Bag Players.

title: Textiles: Is Peace Here?; Japanese Restraints Could Defuse Threatened Trade War With U.S.
description: At the beginning of January, when the 91st Congress dissolved, the threat of a disastrous trade war was imminent. It was temporarily staved off when the highly protectionist Mills bill was trapped in a Senate logjam.

title: KYROILOS VI DIES; COPTIC PATRIARCH
description: CAIRO, March 9 (Reuters)The Coptic Orthodox Patriarch, Pope Kyrollos VI, died here today of a heart attack suffered while talking to visitors at the patriarchal palace.

title: Princeton Gets Grant
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 9 The Carnegie Corporation has awarded Princeton University $103,000 to help finance twoyear study of education and public affairs.

title: GOVERNOR WEIGHS DRASTIC CHANGES TO CURB WELFARE
description: ALBANY, March 9Governor Rockefeller is considering a drastic revision of the state's welfare philosophy that could cut the influx of welfare recipients into the state and require ablebodied persons on welfare to accept employment in private industry or statecreated jobs.

title: Half a Century of Planning
description: MOSCOWIt will soon be half century since the establishment of the U.S.S.R. State Planning Committee and the beginning of a planned economy on a countrywide scale.

title: ExMathematics Teacher Left An Estate of Over $10Million
description: WATERLOO, N. Y., March A retired mathematics professor has left an estate in excess of $10million,

title: Yale and Connecticut Gain In U.S. Indoor Polo Event
Democrats Elect Californian
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP) Representative Phillip Burton of California was elected chairman today of the Democratic Study Group, an organization, of liberal and moderate Democrats in the House.

title: Sergeant Enters Plea
description: LOS ANGELES, March 9 (AP)  Sgt. Maj. William 0. Wooldridge and four other Army men pleaded not guilty yesterday to charges of conspiring to defraud noncommissioned officers clubs in Vietman. The other defendants are M. Sgt. William E. Higdon, Sgt. 1st Cl. William C. Bagby and two retired noncommissioned officers, Narvaez Hatcher and Theodore Bass.

title: Volunteers of America Week
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (UPI)President Nixon has issued a proclamation designating the current week as Volunteers of America Week. I urge our people during this week to express their appreci, ation and gratitude for the untiring and selfless work of the Volunteers of America and to continue their support of its activities, he said.

title: Another Man Is Shot in Belfast As I.R.A. Feuding Intensifies
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 9A milkman was shot In the face and critically wounded today as he sat at the wheel of his truck in Belfast.

title: Die Foerster Christel Due
description: An English adaptation by Herbert Kramer of the Viennese musical, Die Foerster Christel, will be given for one performance on March 19 at the Austrian Institute, 11 East 52d Street. The cast will include Jacqueline Kreaushel and James Wilson.

title: Algeria Gets French Demands
description: PARIS, March 9 (AP)France gave Algeria a list of demands today in response to that country's partial nationalization of Frenchowned oil con??ns on Feb. 24.

title: 70,000 Bid Post Office Shield Them From Smut
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP)More than 70,000 Amer icans have asked the Postal Service to shield them from advertisements sent out by smut peddlers.

title: ASHE AND LAVER VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March (Reuters)  Top seeded Rod Laver opened his bid for the Australian open tennis title today with a 75, 63, 61 victory over Colin Dibley, a member of the Aussie Davis Cup team.

title: It's One Way for a Family to Live in Harmony
description: The various duos and trios who will appear in a concert at the 92d Street YMHA this weekend will probably show some startling family resemblances. This might be surprising at Carnegie Hall, but not at the Y, for the occasion on Sunday at 2:30 P.M. will be the music department's 10th annual concert of family ensembles, each of which consists of a Y student and one or more members of his family. This year there will be sons playing with fathers, sisters playing together, cousins, a grandmother who both teaches and plays with her three grandsons, and even a young maron who sings to the piano accompaniment of her motherinlaw.

title: Rostropovich Is Expected Al British Festival in 1972
description: LONDON, March 9 (Reuters) A British impresario said today that the Soviet cellist Mstislav Rostropovich would take part in a British music festival next year, as part of a new cultural exchange.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a British immigrant to the U.S. of some ten years standing I have periodically debated the question of applying for United States citizenship. One factor in my unwillingness to fake this step has been a lingering pride in being British; a pride which has been renewed recently by several Times articles on the quiet pleasures of life in Great Britain.

title: Navy Yard Development Hopes Are Unfulfilled
description: Two years ago Mayor Lindsay formally received possession of the Brooklyn Navy Yard from the Federal Government and turned it over to a nonprofit corporation called CLICK.

title: 3 PULITZER WINNERS MAKE HARPER'S PLEA
description: Three Pultizer Prize winners are among a number of prominent writers who have signed an appeal to John Cowles Jr., chairman of the board of Harper's, asking that he rehire Willie Morris as editorinchief.

title: Texts Made Public
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 9The Egyptian authorities today made public the texts of a note sent Feb. 8 to the United Arab Republic and Israel by Dr. Jarring and the Egyptian answer delivered to him on Feb. 15.

title: Harvard Gets Court Order Against Seizure of Building
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 9 (UPI)  Harvard University obtained a temporary court order today to oust 25 women from a building they seized and renamed a women's center.

title: PARIS RIOT POLICE BATTLE LEFTISTS
description: PARIS, March 9 (Reuters)Fierce fighting erupted on Paris streets between riot police and hundreds of leftwing youths tonight.

title: Knishes and Latkes, Yes! But Chicken Wellington?
description: A breakthrough! cried Latzi Wittenberg, the chef, at his stand on the Starlight Roof of the WaldorfAstoria. Mission Possible in the kosherfood business.

title: MutualFund Industry Unit Set for NoLoad Category
description: The formation of a new mutualfund industry organization, the NoLoad Mutual Fund Association, was announced yesterday by DohaId S. Samuel, president of the Energy Fund and of Cedar Street Consultants.

title: Bank Merger Dropped
description: Marine Midland Banks, Inc., and the National Bank of Orange and Ulster Counties, Goshen, announced yesterday termination of the agreement concerning the possible merger of the Goshen bank into Marine Midland Bank of Southeastern New York, Poughkeepsie.

title: War Foe Quits Army; West Point Graduate
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP)First Lieut. Louis P. Font, the West Point graduate whose opposition to the Vietnam war has kept him out of Southeast Asia and in one controversy after another for a year, has submitted his resignation at the Army's request, he said today.

title: Genesco Cuts Garments by Laser Beam
description: The garment industry, still devoted to some handwork functions, has leapfrogged to the laser beam.

title: Hanoi Hails Peking's Might
description: HANOI North Vietnam March 9 (Agence FrancePresse) The North Vietnamese press, in its first comment on Premier Chou Enlai's fourday visit to North Vietnam that ended yesterday hailed the modern armaments and technology at the Chinese army today.

title: 60,000 Added to Payroll In Lindsay's First Term
Protest by Building Trades To Greet Nixon at Newport
description: PROVIDENCE, March 9 (AP) Jerome J. Kearney, president of the Rhode Island Building Trades Council, said tonight that 3,000 construction workers would have a peaceful demonstration outside Newport Naval Base when President Nixon visited there Friday.

title: MARKET EDGES UP AS TRADING RISES
Norwegian Labor Leader May Try to Form Cabinet
description: OSLO, Norway, March 9Trygve Bratteli, leader of the opposition Labor party, will call on King Olav V tomorrow and is expected to be asked to form a minority government.

title: JOHN R. MOORE,. 61, COPPER EXECUTIVE
description: John R. Moore, an assistant vice president of the Anaconda Company, died of a heart attack in his sleep yesterday at his home. He was 61 years old and lived at 1 West Washington Square Village.

title: Executive Changes
description: The AmericanSouth African Investment Company Ltd., announced yesterday the election of Frederic H. Brandi as chairman, succeeding Charles W. Engelhard, who died March 2. Mr. Brandi is the retired chairman of Dillon Read & Co.

title: BRITISH MAIL LINKS ARE BEING RESUMED
description: LONDON, March 9 (AP)Mail, telegram and telephone links between Britain and other countries were reported normal today after a 47day nationwide postal workers strike, which ended yesterday.

title: Architect Pleads for a Village Design
description: A young architect who wants to live on the site of an elegant Greek Revival house that was blown up on West 11th Street a year ago tried valiantly for an hour and a half yesterday to prove to the city's Landmarks Preservation Commission that he had designed an appropriate house for the Site.

title: U.S. EDUCATION CHIEF LINKS RIGHTS TO AID
description: Dr. Sidney P. Marland Jr., United States Commissioner of Education, said here yesterday that states failing to comply with the Civil Rights Act should be denied education funds in Federal programs.

title: U.S. Reports 1,600 Blasts In Raids on Arms and Fuel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Wednesday March 10  Mr strikes by United States fighterbombers in Laos reportedly set off 1,600 explosions of enemy fuel and ammunition supplies yesterday.

title: DAVID GOLDBERG
description: David Goldberg, a member of The New York Times Delivery Department since May 3, 1947, died on Monday. He was 64 years old and lived at 6135 98th Street, Rego Park, Queens.

title: PX INQUIRY IS TOED OF AWOL GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, March (AP)The Army's provost marshal in Europe told Senators today that a brigadier general went absent without leave at time his name was being mentioned in Senate testimony in connection with alleged corrupt activities in service club and post exchange systems in Vietnam.

title: A Free East Pakistan Demanded at Rally Here
description: Nearly 200 East Pakistanis demonstrated their support here yesterday for an independent East Pakistan. They marched with placards outside the United Nations, and about 50 later took over a meeting hall at the Pakistani mission.

title: Nixon in Interview, Says This Is Probably Last War
description: WASHINGTON March 9President Nixon in a rare ontherecord interview, said yesterday that the Vietnam war was ending and added In fact I seriously doubt if we will ever have another war. This is probably the very last one.

title: House Approves Proposal To Enlarge Crime Panel
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP)The House decided today to continue and enlarge its special crime study committee, with the tacit understanding that it would trim its budget and go out of business at the end of 1972.

title: A Justice Department Official Named to Prosecute Berrigan
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (UPI)William S. Lynch, an experienced trial lawyer who is a Roman Catholic, will be the chief prosecutor in the Government's case against the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and five others on charges that they conspired to bomb. Government buildings and kidnap a key White House aide.

title: Manager Foresees No Fights For Frazier Before Next Year
description: Joe Frazier returned to Philadelphia yesterday with the glory and the wounds from his conquest of Muhammad All in their world heavyweight championship fight at Madison Square Garden, but with his future as a boxer undetermined.

title: Turks Held 4 U.S. Airmen In Building Near Embassy
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 9 (UPI)Turkish officials said today that four kidnapped United States airmen had been held for five days in an apartment less than half a mile from the United States Embassy before they were freed last night. The police had apparently searched within 10 yards of the hideout without finding the men.

title: Agnew Aide Joins Dole Staff
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP) W. Ernst Minor, 39 years old, an aide to Vice President Agnew has been named an assistant to Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, the Republican National Chairman. Mr. Minor is a former broadcasting executive.

title: End of the Road
description: The Senate yesterday reached the end of the dismal road it has been traveling for the last six weeks. Having failed once again to reach a two thirds majority for closure, the advocates of a change in the filibuster rule abandoned the fight.

title: Move From Switzerland Being Weighed by I.O.S.
description: Investors Overseas Service, long rumored to be unhappy with its present base in Switzerland, is considering moving a large part of its operations out of that country, sources close to the situation disclosed yesterday.

title: Consumer Unit Proposes Regulation of Discount Ads
description: Consumer Affairs Commissioner Bess Myerson proposed yesterday a regulation designed to end bait and switching and other deceptive discount practices by retailers,

title: MARXISM BACKED BY SYNOD IN ITALY
description: ROME, March 9  Vatican theologians are examining proMarxist document that was adopted in principle yesterday by a Roman Catholic Church assembly in Italy's northernmost province. Its publication today attracted nationwide attention.

title: A MYSTERY FIGURE APPARENT SUICIDE
description: DENVER, March 9Mrs. Gloria Tannenbaum, the central figure in two unsolved Colorado mysteries, has died in a state hospital for the insane, apparently a suicide.

title: Test of Undeclared Wars Voted in Minnesota Senate
description: ST. PAUL, March 9The Minnesota Senate today passed, 43 to 21, a bill requiring the State Attorney General to test in Federal court the legality of any undeclared war upon the complaint of any Minnesotan Ordered to fight in it.

title: G. Me Chief Foresees Computer As Auto Safety Device in Decade
description: DETROIT, March 9  Electronic computers that could check automobile safety and pollution levels and point the way for fast and accurate repairs could be dncorporated in cars within 10 years, Edward N. Cole, president of the General Motors Corporation, said today.

title: No Decision in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP)  A State Department spokesman said today that review was under way but that no decision had been reached on ordering 1,100 Americans in East Pakistan to leave.

title: Advertising
description: In a business of many invitations, the invitation from LaRoche, McCaffrey & McCall was an unusual one. It was, Come see our newbusiness pitch. And that's what it turned out to be, the same sixman act used by the agency to attract clients. Reporters are not usually privy to such goings on

title: SAVINGS BANKS POST RECORD FOR INFLOW
description: The nation's mutual savings banks had a recordbreaking inflow of deposits of $800million during February, of which more than half was accounted Mr by banks in New York State, it was reported yes. terday by national and state trade groups for the banks. In both instances, the intake of funds was the largest for any single month, in the history of the business.

title: COMMITTEE BACKS CASEY FOR 2D TIME
description: WASHINGTON March 97The Senate Banking and Currency Committee by a vote of 9.3 reaffirmed today its approval of the nomination of William J. Casey to be chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Penn Central Seeking Sale of Holding Unit
description: WASHINGTON, March 9The trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company hope within the next two to three weeks to complete negotiations for the sale of the Pennsylvania Company. The investment holding company, which has a book value of $650million, is a subsidiary of the bankrupt railroad.

title: Hijacking Suspect, 16, Freed
description: MIAMI, March 9 (Reuters)Thomas K. Marston, 16 years old, charged with hijacking a National Airlines jet at the Mobile, Ala., airport yesterday, was released today in the custody of his father, Hardy Marston. The youth had boarded a New Orleansbound Boeing 727 and ordered it diverted to Montreal. Over Tennessee, however, the pilot persuaded him to give up his gun and flew to Miami.

title: Employe Believed Missing
description: MUNICH, March 9 (UPI)A spokesman for Radio Free Europe said today that he was unable to comment on the Polish report until we have name to deal with.

title: A BIGGER E.E.C. HELD BAR TO TRADE CURBS
description: Goeffrey Rippon, chief British negotiator for its bid for membership in the European Economic Community, said yesterday that failure to enlarge the Community Market might lead to a revival of international trade protectionism. Mr. Rippon, whose cabinet post is that of the Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster, spoke at the international dinner of the Harvard Business School Club of New York at the Americana Hotel.

title: UNCLEVANYA  MOVES TO THE CHERRY LANE
description: The Roundabout Theatre's production of Chekhov's Uncle Vanya has reopened off Broad way at the Cherry Lane Theater. When it was staged at the Roundabout, Clive Barnes, drama critic of The New York Times, wrote: Gene, Feist's staging... eschews sentiment, and is clear, solid and, just little, stolid. I enjoyed myself I love Chekhov and this was an honest, fair reading of the play. I recommend it, as night of theatrical insight, if not theatrical illumination.

title: 9 Trail Branches Reported Cut
description: SAIGON, March 9 (AP)South Vietnamese troops in Laos now have cut nine major branches of the Ho Chi Minh Trail network, Saigon headquarters reported today.

title: Screen: Nelo Risi's 'Dead of Summer':Jean Seberg Portrays Woman Going Insane
description: Nelo Risi's "Dead of Summer" is the story of one woman's rather too elegant (for my tastes) descent into lunacy, set in midsummer, mostly in a dazzlingly chic modern apartment that is isolated in the same, exotic North African landscape in which Andr Gide's "Immoralist" found liberation and Paul Bowles's existential bank teller attained swift, sweet nothingness. Even though Africa is now, in most areas, politically free and no longer dark, it remains fiction's favorite boneyard for incurable romantics.The English-language, Italian-French co-production, which opened yesterday at the Cinema Rendezvous, displaysor, rather, it exploits, for its own pretentious purposesall of the symptoms of its psychotic heroine, Joyce Grasse (Jean Seberg), the American wife of a German architect working in Agadir.Like Joyce, the movie stares at objects and people without blinking, without comprehension, seeing not objects and people but signs and omens, as well as reminders of some terrible event that might have happened, or might have been simply wished for and dreamt of.When Joyce wakes up on a Sunday morning, she is wearing a cocktail dress. A beggar stares at her from the scaffolding of a building across the way. She stares back. She turns on the shower and is splattered with sandy water that looks like blood. She later comes upon a life-size, inflatable rubber doll that could have been used as some kind of kinky sex object. After all, her husband is (or was) German, and from the larger-than-life photographs of him around the apartment, he looks like the sort of man who should be hiding out in Argentina.Has Joyce actually shot her husband and hidden his body in the laundry basket?It's rather difficult to tell, not because we share Joyce's confusion, but because the camera, which is anything but confused, arbitrarily lowers its gaze everytime we flash back to What Happened.According to this film's producers, Risi, the director of the highly regarded "Diary of a Schizophrenic Girl" (which I did not see), has attempted to create a new form of psychological suspense drama by omitting "explanatory particulars and postscripts." Instead, they say, he "makes strong demands on his audience's intellectual responsiveness with laboriously constructed scenes which are . . . rich in revealing, often subtle detail."The movie is richer in dcor than subtle detail, and the effect of Risi's ellipses is, paradoxically, to make a short story last a good deal longer than our interest can be sustained.There's a further paradox in that the thing that sustains our (at least, my) interest in the film is the physical presence of Miss Seberg, who is hardly the world's most interesting actress, even under the best of circumstances. She is, however, one of movies' most interesting objects. In the years since "Breathless" and "The Five-Day Lover" her beauty has "set," like plaster of Paris, attaining, curiously, a new perfection in definition as it has hardened. She moves with style, which is sometimes awkward, and behind that extraordinary mask, there is real intelligence.Risi apparently shares my enthusiasm for the star. Aside from a young man who plays her husband's Arab boyfriend, and a doctor who comes on to tell the lady, who has clearly lost her marbles, that "half of the people in the city are in the same shape" (which may be the most subtle line in the film), "Dead of Summer" is a one-woman show, a Seberg celebration that I can recommend only to other members of the committed band.

title: Brooklyn Concern Objects
description: WASHINGTON, March 9Herbert Monte Levy, a Manhattan lawyer who represents the only company using the postal lists, PentR Books, Inc., said his clients objected to virtually all of the law.

title: $348,246 TAX BLOW LANDS AFTER BELL
description: New York State wasted no time in claiming its cut from the purse of Monday night's heavyweight championship fight.

title: $275,000 Road Race Gets a Big Push
description: Coming so soon after the FrazierAli fight, a $275,000 road race offering the best drivers and cars of Europe and America makes only a small dent in the public consciousness. Yet in its way the Questor Grand Prix of March 28 at Ontario, Calif., should be a landmark in racing. Jackie Stewart, the world driving champion in 1969, considers It, the beginning of a new racing era. He sees it as an opportunity for everyone in the racing community. to help bring motor racing together with new audiences and new sponsors.

title: SWEDES DRAFT BILL TO CALL OFF STRIKE
description: STOCKHOLM, March 9 (UPI) Premier Olof Palme announced today that he would legislate to end the , crippling 39dayold conflict between the Government and 47,000 key civil servants.

title: Advertising
description: ABC Owned Radio Stations unveiled yesterday Compass, a new concept for retailers that it had commissioned Young & Rubicam to create.

title: Muskie Meets Cowon
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, March 9 (AP) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, had a 70minute meeting today with Nigeria's head of state, Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon.

title: NewleyHackett Duo to Tour
description: Anthony Newley and Buddy Hackett will go on a concert tour that will cover six cities from April 26 through June 27. The twoman show, sponsored by Mr. Hackett, will open at the Fisher Theater in Detroit and close at the Westbury (L. I.) Music Theater.

title: Frederick C. Gardner, 75, Dies; Was Retired President of Ebasco
description: MANHASSET, L. I, March Frederick C. Gardner, who retired in 1963 as president and chief executive officer of Ebasco Services, Inc., after 46 years in engineering, died yesterday at his home after a brief illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 25 Blackburn Lane, Munsey Park, Manhasset.

title: SECURITY NATIONAL WEIGHS STOCK BUY
description: HUNTINGTON STATION, L.I., March 9Patrick J. Clifford, chairman of the Security National Bank, said following the annual meeting here today, that he would meet tomorrow in New York to negotiate terms for the possible purchase of 25 per cent interest in his bank held by the Abacus Fund.

title: Federal Building Rocked By 3 Explosions in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, March 9 (AP)Three explosions rocked two Federal buildings in St. Louis last night, causing extensive damage to one. No one was seriously injured.

title: 2 CON ED UNIONS EXTEND DEADLINE
description: Two unions that had threatened to strike the Consolidated Edison Company at 12:01 A.M. today agreed late last night to extend their deadline until Sunday morning.

title: Taiwan Exporters Bar Plan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March (UPI)Nationalist Chinese textile manufacturers reversed today their stand and vowed not to go along with Japan in limit. ing textile shipments voluntarily.

title: Fight Telecast Reported a Financial and Artistic Success
RCA Net Income Declines 43%;
description: The RCA Corporation confirmed yesterday yearend predictions of lower earnings and sales in 1970. The annual report released yesterday, placed sales and other revenues at $3,325,562,000 against $3,409,853,000 in 1969. Net income fell by 43 per cent to $91,735,000, or $1.26 a share, from the $159,832,000, or $2.27 share, reported in 1969. Net income as a percentage of sales fell to 2.8 from 4.7 a year ago.

title: The Fight
description: The most appropriate visitor to the multimillior dollar spectacle at Madison Square Garden Monday night. was one Manuel Benitez, the leading matador of Spain. He was here not only to see the human mayhem but also to arrange for a closedcircuit telecast later this year a bullfight performance from Spain with the company that made a similar highly profitable arrangement for the AliFrazier match.

title: Hong Kong Meeting Set
description: HONG KONG, March 9Textile manufacturers here planned to meet to study the Japanese plan. There was no immediate reaction from the Government's Commerce and Industry Department.

title: Britain's Retreat From the Gulf
description: Sir Alec DouglasHome has dressed British policy for the Persian Gulf in the most attractive clothes available but the import of his message cannot be camouflaged: Britain will terminate its protective treaties with nine Gulf states and withdraw its operational forces from that strategic area by the end of this year. Thus has a Tory Government reluctantly adopted the policy laid down 1968 by its Labor predecessor:

title: Miami Star Fractures Neck
description: OXFORD, Ohio, March (UPI)Larry Garlcich, starting forward, was lost to the Miami of Ohio basketball team when he suffered a double neck fracture yesterday as he slipped during a gymnastics class. Miami meets secondranked Marquette Saturday in the opening round of the mideast regionals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament.

title: 10 Elected to New Hall of Fame for Songwriters
description: Ten writers of popular songs were elected to the Songwriters Hall of Fame on Monday night at the Hall of Fame's first annual awards dinner at the New York Hilton. The 10Alan Jay Lerner, Dorothy Fields, Duke Ellington, Harold Arlen, Harry Warren, Hoagy Carmichael, Ira Gershwin, Johnny Mercer, James Van Heusen and Rudolf Friml were chosen from 30 nominations made by the 1,600 duespaying members who have formed the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

title: WALTER D. SMITH, 48, AN ASSISTANT DEAN
description: Walter D. Smith, assistant dean of the Graduate School of Business at Columbia University, died Monday. night in St. Luke's Hospital after a short. illness. He was 48 years old and lived at 20 Old Hook Road, Westwood, N. J.

title: Saigon's Commander in Laos Drive Hoang Xuan Lam
description: SAIGON South Vietnam March 9Many times each day in the last four weeks Lieut. Gen. Hoang Xuan Lam has ducked uneler a 10 inch wooden beam to come out of his bunker, turned right along the green rows of sandbags that cover it In triple layers and looked out over the Khesanh hills to see his soldiers getting In helicopters to do battle in Laos. The commander of the South Vietnamese forces in Laos has seen many of them come back dead or wounded.

title: Senate by 8 Votes, Defeats Campaign To Curb Filibuster
description: WASHINGTON March 9 Southerners and conservative Republicans defeated again today the biennial effort of libera's and moderates to change Senate rules to make it easier to choke off filibusters in the Senate.

title: For Veronica Lake, the Past Is Something to Write About
description: She was a sultrylooking blonde with her hair falling over her right eye, and in the heyday of Hollywood's glamour era, no one was more glamorous than Veronica Lake. She was one of the leading female box office draws in the early forties, the star of 26 pictures, beauty, who was courted by such people as Aristotle Onassis, Tommy Manville and Howard Hughes.

title: Progress in Berlin Talks Reported by Soviet Envoy
description: BERLIN, March 9Pyotr A. Abrasimov, the Soviet Ambassador to East Germany, said today that the fourpower negotiations on Berlin were moving ahead slowly but surely.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For the first time I have paid the new taxi faresilent testimony to the ineptness of this city government in labor negotiations, and more importantly, to its repeated capitulations to special interest groups at the expense of the public, its rhetoric to the contrary notwithstanding.

title: Queens Church Vandalized
description: The First Methodist Church of Flushing at 3824 149th Street in Queens was vandalized sometime between Saturday and yesterday afternoon.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: To talk in terms of Congress restricting the use of American power in the face of our expanding fiasco in Indochina, now plain and visible to all, is unrealistic because it asks our Commander in Chief to command with his hands, tied behind his back. This is why recent repeated efforts in Congress to do that have failed.

title: U.S. Bombing Errors
description: SAIGON, March 9 (Reuters)  Bombs, napalm, rockets and gunfire from United States planes and helicopters killed eight South Vietnamese soldiers and injured 54 in two accidents east of Tchepone Friday, the United States military command reported today.

title: President of Brigham Young U., Major Mormon Figure, Retires
description: PROVO, Utah, March 9Dr. Ernest T. Wilkinson, one of the dominant figures in the educational effort of the Mormon church, announced today his resignation as president of Brigham Young University.

title: Murphy Tells Precinct Chiefs To Curb Crime or Be Replaced
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy announced yesterday that precinct captains and other commanders who were unable to lead an effective attack on crime will be replaced.

title: Groton Library Unit Bows To Court's Magazine Ban
description: GROTON, Conn., March 9Under threat of Circuit Court prosecution, the Groton Library Board voted yesterday to ban from Its shelves the February issue of Evergreen Review and to keep other, issues of the magazine out of Sight,

title: Clarkson Sinks Penn
description: POTSDAM, N. Y., March 9 Clarkson defeated Pennsylvania, 52, in a quarterfinal game in the E.C.A,C, playoff tonight. Clarkson, which led, 40, after two periods, was paced by Jerry Kemp, with two goals and two assists, and Steve Warr, with two goals, one massisted.

title: U.S. SAID TO PLAN A SHIFT ON PEKING
description: WASHINGTON March 9 The Nixon Administration appears to have concluded that much of the emotion and domestic political peril have been drained out of the issue of relations with Communist China and that the time is ripe for new initiatives.

title: A New Government Cancer Agency Opposed at Senate Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, March 9A Congressional proposal to set up a major new Government agency for the conquest of cancer ran into new opposition today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: POTATO FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Reports of rather heavy shrinkage of potatoes in storage sent futures prices up yesterday, on the New York Mercantile Exchange here. At one point potato futures prices were up 8 cents before dropping some under profit taking in rather heavy trading for this time of the year.

title: Let's Unite on Vietnarnization
description: WASHINGTON  Notwithstanding our past divisions over Vietnam policy, is it not possible for us to rally behind the President's Vietnamization program long enough to give it a fair trial?

title: HitRun Driver Kills Woman
description: Goldie Finkelstein, 77 years old, of 919 East 55th Street, Brooklyn, was killed last night by a hitandrun driver as she was crossing East 57th Street. Detectives were searching for the driver who was reported to have sped west on Avenue H.

title: Texts of Message From Jarring and Egyptian Government's Reply
