Miss Stapleton Plans Nuptials
description: MILLERTON, N.Y., March 13  The engagement of Miss Candace Lynne Stapleton to Bryan Reid Detchon has been announced by Dr. and Mrs. John G. Brinker, stepfather and mother of the prospective bride. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elliott R. Detchon Jr. of New York.

title: Mets Victors by 62 on 2Hitter, Snapping Dodger Streak at Six
Daylight Time Curb Asked
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)Two Kentucky Congressmen have proposed legislation to have daylight saving time in their'state only from Memorial Day to Labor Day. Daylight time is now required from the last Sunday in April to the last Sunday in October.

title: Karen Womer Wed To Donald Berns
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 13Miss Karen Adele Womer and Donald Frank Berns were married here this afternoon in St. John's Lutheran Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles R. Huffman. The Rev. Bernhard J. Johnson and the Rev. Jules J. Auger assisted.

title: Hanoi Calls Tchepone Drive a SevenAct Farce
description: HANOI North Vietnam, March 13 (Agence FrancePresse)The newspaper Quan Doi Nhan Dan said here today that the; South Vietnamese had played the final act of, their Tchepone victory comedy by announcing the evacuation of their troops from the city.

title: N.Y. U. Completes Rare Sweep In Intercollegiate Fencing Meet
On Wall St.
description: Before the sharp decline on Wall Street last year, a feature of the Eurobond market had been bonds with commonstock conversion privileges. More than a third of all the bonds sold in 1969 had this equity link. Convertibles were valued at $240million in 1970, or only a quarter of the 1969 total.

title: Peg, who is Eamon de Valera? Oh, I know! Hers the Jewish Mayor of Dublin; The Last of the American Irish Fade Away
description: CHICAGO.

title: Philadelphia Dedicates New Stadium April 4
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 13 (UPDDedication ceremonies Will be held April 4 at Veterans Stadium in South Philadelphia.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The public sector has never been concerned with the bottom line of a profitandloss statement. It can no longer afford the luxury of this benign neglect.

title: Approval of State Abortion Law Increases Among Obstetricians
description: A survey of specialists in obstetrics and gynecology in New York State indicates that twodthirds favor the new abortion law without qualification, according to the Albert Einstein College of Medicine.

title: Senate Chief in Turkey Defies Military and Asks Referendum
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 13 (AP)The president of the Turkish Senate defied the country's military leaders today by calling for a national referendum to determine real public opinion.

title: Ens. A. T. Cooper Weds Miss Toner
description: NEEDHAM, Mass., March 13  Miss Sherry Francis Toner and Ens. A. Thomas Cooper, U.S.N., were married here this morning in the Congregational Church by the Rev. Patrick C. Finleon.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, March 13 (Reuters)An autopsy on Mr. Young showed that he died of a cerebral hemorrhage, American civil rights sources said today. There were no external signs of injury to his head, according to the sources.

title: Movies
description: LAWMEN seem to be in order. Last week we noted the filmic future of the Los Angeles police as described by Joseph Wambaugh in his The New Centurions. Now it's the gumshoe's turn. Martin Ransohoff, head of Filmways, reports acquisition of the movie rights to Ross Macdonald's wellreceived The Underground Man, published by Knopf only last month.

title: Nassau Center Is Helping Retired Workers to Find Meaningful Work for Pay
description: ALBERTSON, LI, March 13 Nassau County's older residents who are seeking temporary or parttime work after their lifetime careers have ended are being aided by a federally funded program at the Human Resources Center here called Project Senior Abilities.

title: Rockwell Kent, Artist, Is Dead; Championed LeftWing Causes
description: PLATTSBURGH, N. Y., March 13  Rockwell Kent, whose rugged landscape paintings and memorable book illustrations won Ilirn an international reputation, died in the Champlain Valley Physicians Hospital Medical Center today after having suffered a stroke earlier this month.

title: PEACE MOVE IN LAOS IS PROPOSED BY INDIA
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 13 (Reuters) India has urged Canada and Poland, her fellow members on the International Control Commission to join in a fourpoint peace appeal, informed sources said today.

title: Groupies Moving West After Ban By Southampton
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., March 13This will be a family summer in Southampton. The groupies, those hordes of young sun worshipers who in past seasons have gathered at this elegant resort community, are moving westward  toward Hampton Bays and Westhampton Beach.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The New Jesuits
description: George Riemer, who spent seven years in the Jesuits, has looked up 11 of his old colleagues and subjected them to the ordeal by tape recorder. The result is an edited notebook that reveals in some depth a variety of occupations. It says very little about the youngest and liveliest 20 per cent of the Jesuitsthose under 30. Three of the deponents are in their fifties.

title: More Rhodes Scholarships Are Urged for Nonwhites
description: OXFORD, England, March 13 More than 120 Oxford dons have signed a petition calling for a fair representation of black students among Rhodes scholars coming to this country.

title: R. J. Costello to Marry Miss Nancy Hess
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., March 13  Miss Nancy Kellogg Hess, a junior at Vassar College, and Richard Joseph Costello, a junior at Marist. College, also in Poughkeepsie, plan to be married.

title: Auto Results: Good, Not Great
description: DETROIT  The automobile business, although better than it was last year, is not so good as Detroiters had hoped. Still, it seems to be on the way up.

title: Oil Parley Set
description: The seventh annual petroleurn conference of the Transportation center of Northwestern University will be held starting March 27.

title: Two Race Horses Perish In Blaze at Lincoln Downs
description: LINCOLN, R. I., March 13 (AP)Two race horses and a stable pony died when fire swept through a barn at Lincoln Downs yesterday. B. A. Dario, owner of the track, estimated the value of the barn at $50,000.

title: Hall of Fame Can't Get Out of Ground
description: Under a clear blue October sky in 1966 a groundbreaking ceremony for the college football Hall of Fame was held next to the Rutgers Stadium at New Brunswick, N. J., prior to the RutgersArmy game.

title: World ShotPut Mark Set by Soviet Woman
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, March 13 (AP)Nadezhda Chizhova led a strong showing by the Soviet Union today by setting a world shotput record of 64 feet 7 inches at the European indoor track and field meet. The previous women's record of 641 was set by East Germany's Margitta Gummel on Feb. 28 in Berlin.

title: Wriier Fiance Of Mary Dowd
description: WEST HARTFORD, March 13Dr. and Mrs. Donald R. Dowd of West Hartford and East Lyme, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Elizabeth Dowd, to Morgan McGinley 2d of Noank. He is the son of the late Mr. and Mrs. McGinley of New London.

title: FRENCHMAN FINDS SST'S. COSTS SOAR
description: WASHINGTON, March 13JeanJacques ServanSchreiber, Member of the French National Assembly and former chairman of the influential L'Express, said today that the Concorde, the BritishFrench supersonic transport airplane, looks to us, on this side of the Atlantic, like an industrial Vietnam.

title: LI. Strives to Bring Order to Muddled Bus System
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 13 Long Island is trying to bring back the bus. and offficial gay it isn't easy.

title: Senator Hughes, Backed
description: BOSTON, March 13 (UPI)formation of the Hughes Committee of Massachusetts1972, an effort to persuade Senator Harold E. Hughes of Iowa to run for the Democratic Presidential nomination, has been announced by Edmund Fleming and Michael Feldman.

title: TRAINING PROJECT HELPS TENEMENTS
description: East Harlem men are being trained as super superintendents in a new community program that has the dual goals of making productive citizens and eliminating health and safety hazards in the area's tenements.

title: The World
description: CAIROA young Egyptian soldier stood lonely watch beside a row of empty trenches at the edge of the town of Suez last week, occasionally casting a casual glance across the harbor toward the distant positions of Israeli troops on the Sinai Peninsula.

title: The art of the
description: The artichoke, one of the most elegant of vegetables, depends like snails and spaghettion embellishments to heighten its appeal. These may be sauces like hollandaise or mayonnaise or vinaigrette; or stuffings that range from sea food (even pureed oysters) to beef and pork and lamb. Artichokes are not the simplest of vegetables to cook because of that fuzzy choke in the center, but they're worth the effort. Two methods for preparing them are given along with two recipes for stuffed artichokes, one Armenian, the other French.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Jobless L.I. Engineers Are Learning to Be Teachers
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., March 13,  Thirty unemployed engineers expect to be back at work this year because of an experimental training program that is preparing them to become secondaryschool science and mathematics teachers.

title: Church Bells Wring Chorus of Protests In Yorkshire Village
description: DRIGHLINGTON, England, March 13  The sound of the Drighlington parish church bells ringing out in practice every Monday evening has brought discord to this Yorkshire village. People complain that the noise wakes up babies, drowns the television and interferes with children's homework.

title: Gail Pinkham Fiancee of Student
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., March 13Dr. Fred O. Pinkham, president of Education Management Services, Inc., of Greenwich and former president of Ripon College, and Mrs. Pinkham have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Louise Pinkham, to Thomas Dale Schumacher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dale C. Schumacher of Fullerton, Calif. The wedding is planned for Jtme 26 at the First Congregational Church.

title: Florida Farm Workers Hold Relief Aid Protest
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 13 (Reuters)More than 300 migrant workers peacefully demonstrated today near President Nixon's winter retreat here to back demands for relief aid after a major crop disaster in Southern Florida.

title: First Lady of the Passport Office  Expert or Ogress'?
description: WASHINGTONFor 15 years no Secretary of State has passed through the doors of the State Department's Passport Office here in Washington. Of course, one cannot say for sure why they have avoided the place, but it is not unreasonable to assume that it was because they feared they might seem to be intruding.

title: Byrd Seeks to Restore Citizenship to Gen. Lee
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., of Virginia has introduced a resolution for the posthumous restoration of United States citizenship to Robert E. Lee, the Confederate General, who pledged his allegiance to the Union four months after the Civil War ended.

title: Righteous Empire
description: The business of America may be business, as Calvin Coolidge once said, but it is at least as accurate and as important to assert that the religion of America is America. Each of these books, in its own way, provides documentation for that assertion.

title: Klondike 70
description: Reading about the development of oil in Alaska reminds one of Vietnam. The huge oil companies are like the military. They have already spent more than $1billion in exploring and leasing the incredibly rich oil deposits on Alaska's North Slope. Most of this financial commitment occurred before the public really knew what was going on. As a result the oil companies, like the Pentagon, have created a vested interest where none existed before. Now, when critics try to reevaluate the purpose and worth of the whole enterprise, the companies blandly point to their investment. Error has become its own justification. The process of destruction, in the Arctic as in Asia, crushes blindly ahead.

title: Frozen by death in the image of Third World prophet
description: In his short life, Frantz Fanon met at least three serious defeats. Born in Martinique, one of France's overseas departments, he thought himself French and white. Upon reaching the French capital to do his studies, he painfully discovered he was French West Indian and black, in a whitemetropolitan country.

title: Mulholland Overcomes Hex On EarlyMorning Bowlers
description: DETROIT, March 13 (AP)Wesley (Bud) Mulholland of Oxford, Mich., an assistant manager for an insurance concern, broke the jinx of the opening morning minorevents squad today by rolling a 1,875 for fourth place in the American Bowling Congress tournament's regular allevents division.

title: Robert Hartwell to Wed Pamela Pollak
description: WESTPORT, Conn., March 13Miss Pamela Pollak and Robert MacGregor Hartwell plan to be married here on April 3 at the Saugatuck Congregational Church.

title: For Seeds, a Near Patent
description: WASHINGTON  Breeders can soon obtain limited monopoly rights to new varieties of wheat, cotton, alfalfa, sorghum, cabbage, soybeans, garden beans, flowers and other plants reproduced from seed.

title: Herring Gull Becoming a Nuisance on Jamaica Bay
description: The herring gull is becoming something of a dangerous nuisance from New Jersey to Maine, and especially in the Jamaica Wildlife Refuge in Queens, because its expanding population is encroaching on other species.

title: CARNEGIE STUDY ON DISSENT FILED
description: The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education recommended yesterday that American colleges and universities adopt bills of rights and responsibilities that would apply equally to faculty, students, administrators, staff and trustees.

title: NIXON WILL SPEAK AT YOUNG'S GRAVE
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 13President Nixon will attend the burial service for Whitney M. Young Jr. in Lexington, Ky., Wednesday morning, the White House announced here today.

title: Where to Get Help
description: EVERY suburban community seems to have its own selfappointed horticultural expert. Advice is dispensed unsolicited, and may or may not be authoritative.

title: Medicine
description: The controversy started eight months ago in Omaha, Neb., with charges that school officials were handing out drugs to unruly children. It gathered force with the revelation that doctors across the nation were giving drugs to disturbed, over active school children.

title: $800Million Investment and 30,000 Jobs Are Hitched to Tristan
description: WASHINGTON, March 13At stake in the imperiled L1011 Tristar airliner project of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation is more than $800million in estimated invest= ment and 30,000 jobs, an inquiry shows.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON Japan put forth a peace, feeler last week in the longsimmering dispute over trade in textilesa dispute with major ramifications for the future of United States trade policy but the feeler was brusquely rejected by President Nixon.

title: Announcements

description: DETROIT, March 13The University of Michigan has offered a timetable for increasing the number of women faculty members and elimInating sex discrimination, but activist women are dissatisfied with the program,

title: Et A1.
description: A wellresearched, wellwritten account of the disastrous end of the Army of Tennessee in the western theater of operations during the Civil War. Of particular interest is Connelly's application of modern psychological approaches to the problems of battle.

title: Jane Fonda Antiwar Show Staged Near Fort Bragg
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N.C., March 13 (AP)Antiwar entertainers led by the actress Jane Fonda played to a full house at the Haymarket Coffee House tonight in a show spoofing United States involvement in Vietnam, the Army and President Nixon.

title: Miss Van Dyk to Wed
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 13 Mr. and Mrs. James Van Dyk have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Martha Lincoln Van Dyk, to Patrick James Ringer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Ringer of Vergennes, Vt. A summer wedding is planned. Miss Van Dyk, a senior at Green Mountain College, is a greatgranddaughter of the late Charles Monroe Lincoln, who was a foreign editor of The New York Times. Mr. Ringer, is a student at the University of Vermont.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Murder will out, and in doing so it provides an occasional footnote to history. Why did A. J. Foyt lose that 500mile stockcar race Feb. 14 at Daytona? Because his car was sabotaged. In a telephone interview from his shop at Stuart, Va., Glen Wood, chief of the Wood brothers crew that prepared Foyt's 71 Mercury, said the filler hose leading to the fuel cell had been de liberately kinked to impede fueling. Whoever did it knew what he was doing: the tampering worked.

title: Chapman Heads P.A.L. Drive
description: Alger B. Chapman, chairman of Squibb BeechNut, Inc., has been named chairman of the 1971 fund drive for the Police Athletic League. Mr. Chapman, who served as New York State Tax Commissioner from 1945 to 1948, is a former treasurer of the Republican State Committee. iHs son, Alger B. Chapman Jr., is a member of P.A.L.'s board of directors.

title: HANOI SAID TO GET CAPTIVE NEWSMEN
description: Journalists captured by the North Vietnamese in Cambodia are taken to Hanoi as a matter of policy, a North Vietnamese defector has reported. The statement appears in the current issue of a Hong Kong weekly, Far Eastern Economic Review.

title: Motorcycle Race to Aussie
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., March 13 (UPI)Kel Carruthers of Australia won a 100mile motorcycle race at Daytona International Speedway today in a warmup for tomorrow's 200mile road race.

title: President Appoints An Aide to Resolve Micronesia Impasse
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 13President Nixon acted today to break the deadlock over the future political status of Micronesia, the sprawling Paific territory the United States has been administering under a United Nations trusteeship for 25 years.

title: Wilmore: Best Since Cazzie Russell
description: The barometer for University of Michigan basketball success is Cazzie Lee Russell Jr.., now of the New York Knickerhockers. This season, Henry Wilmore, a youngster from Harlem, has revived the good old days at Michigan when the public address announcer used to say, Cazzie Rrrrussell, and the crowds went wild.

title: Leadership Needed
description: The most unassailable statement made by President Nixon in the interview with him published in this newspaper last week was that there has never been so great a challenge to U.S. leadership. Whether the President had in mind a challenge to the United States to show leadership in the world community, or a challenge to the President of the United States to show leadership within this divided country, the challenge is there on both counts. Yet nothing that Mr. Nixon said indicated that he has the slightest idea how to meet it.

title: Mrs. Spatt's Opposition Delays Acceptance of Fifth Avenue Plan
description: A zoning proposal, billed as the salvation of Fifth Avenue, was moving along toward approval as jaunty as an Easter Parade last week when a redhaired lady from Brooklyn stuck out a foot. Although the plan wasn't tripped up, it was delayed for at least two weeks.

title: Photography
description: WHEN I suggested last November, in a column on the arrest of photographer M. Richard Kirstel in Maryland, that his case could well prove to be the Scopes trial of photography, I had no way of knowing that that prognosis would turn out to be Uncannily accurate.

title: Hospital in Brooklyn Adds A DiabeticTest Program
description: The Brooklyn Women's Hospital, serving the BedfordStuyvestant and OceanHill communities, has begun a program to give its clinic patients diabeticscreening tests.

title: Television
description: LaughIn's versatile comic goes to helmet (hell mitt?) himself on his first special, Thursday night at 10 on NBC. Guests Bing Crosby, Elke Sommer and Billy De Wolfe lend Arte a hand.

title: Stamps
description: UNDER the aegis of the United Nations, 1971 is being observed, more or less universally, as the Year of International Support for Refugees. The United Nations issued three stamps for the occasion on March 12. Other nations are planning similar issues to stimulate donations to refugeeaid organizations.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The decision last month of Judge G. Thomas Eisele in United States District Court in Little Reck, Ark., which blocked, for the time being at least, further construction of a United States Army Corps of Engineers dam on the state's Cossatot River, pleased conservationists and gave new vigor to the National Environmental Policy Act of. 1969.

title: Does Rock Degrade Women?
description: LAST spring I sat through three hours of the film Woodstock alternating between feelings of enchantment and repulsion. Sure, there was all that magnificent music, along with the generous helpings of peace and love and grass. And yet I found something persistently disturbing about the idyllic spectacle on the screen.

title: Art
description: IT is difficult to specify exactly what it is that makes the latest paintings of Lester Johnsonnow on view in an impressive exhibition at the Martha Jackson Gallery, 32 East 69th Streetso formidable. Johnson, 52 and director of studies in graduate painting at Yale, was, in the past, a secondgeneration member of the Abstract Expressionist school. In the midfifties, his art turned resolutely figurative.

title: The Waiting Time
description: Clomacnois, in presentday Ireland, reminds the reader of nothing so much as Gopher Prairie. Here, Tracy, a pharmacist's daughter, faces the future bleakly as the wife of a cloddish bourgeois, her romantic dreams stifled by a parochialism so narrow as to be claustrophobic. Her life is dominated by what her sisterinlaw might think or what the village Pecksniff might think, and the most exciting coming event on the horizon is the menopause. Then, after husband Larry is transferred to London, she remains in Clomacnois long enough to rent their house and rediscover an old boyfriend who is now a successful film maker. (And he would take me, if I let him, back into the warm land of my natural desires.)

title: Voters Make If Official: It's the Fire Department
description: DIGHTON, Mass., March 13 (AP)Those fellows with red trucks and black raincoats who have been showing up to put out fires in Dighton for the last 50 years were not members of the fire department.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Frazier, Ill at Ease, Shuns TV Review
description: The oral Bout of the Century failed to take place yesterday when Joe Frazier refused to meet with Muhammed Ali on television to discuss last Monday's fight. Frazier simply did not appear for the scheduled morning taping of last night's Wide World of Sports, shown on the American Broadcasting Company network.

title: House Panel Ends Mine Blast Inquiry
description: HAZARD, Ky., March 13Charles Finley, the operator and part owner of the mine where 38 miners died Dec. 30, denied today any knowledge of nonpermissible explosives or other dangerous practices in his mine.

title: European Parliament's Chief
description: STRASBOURG, France, March 13 (Reuters)Walter Behrendt, a West Berlin Social Democrat, has been elected president of the European Parliament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The interested parties prosecuted their interests
description: Perhaps nowhere in the world, including Vietnam, has America's record as a foreign power been consistently sorrier than in the small West African country of Liberia. Or so it seems from reading this new work by Charles Morrow Wilson, a veteran tropical hand with experience in Liberia and the author of some two dozen books over the last 40 years.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM  The tourists are already pouring in, the intercontinental jets are full and so are the hotels. The sunny summer has arrived at the eastern Mediterranean. The entrepreneurs of Israel's travel industry are bracing themselves for another onslaught. Easter and Passover coincide this year, so Christian and Jewish pilgrims will be arriving at the same time in April. No one seems very much concerned that a new war might be about to break out with Egypt.

title: New Jersey Boys Win, 43, In PeeWee Hockey Playoff
description: LIMA. Ohio, March 13The Livingston, N. J., hockey club scored a 4.3 victory over Dayton, Ohio, in a triple overtime game today in the PeeWee Division regional playoffs of the Amateur Hockey Association.

title: W.H.O. Asks Medical Goods And Cash to Fight Cholera
description: GENEVA, March 13  The World Health Organization has announced an appeal for help to combat the spreading epidemic of cholera. Dr. Marcolino G. Candau, director general of the United Nations agency, has called on governments for contributions in medical goods and in cash.

title: For Long Beach, the Vacation Has Ended
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., March 18The city of Long Beach is in the final stages of a change from a summer resort area to a fulltime residential community.

title: POVERTY AGENCY PLANS PRINT SHOP
description: Youth in Action, the antipoverty agency in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, is planning to open. a $200,000 printing plant as part of a new emphasis aimed at making the community's residents producers rathers than receivers and landlords instead of sharecroppers.

title: Canada Dry Starts Recycling Project For Its Packaging
description: The Canada Dry Corporation announced yesterday that it was beginning its Operation Ecology, which will call for the use of recycled materials in all its packaging and in business stationery.

title: Mediate Takes Westerly At Lincoln Downs, Pays $7
description: LINCOLN, R.I., March 13 (AP)Mediate, a refugee from the claiming ranks, won his fourth race in seven 1971 starts with a halflength victory over Oxford Accent today in the $7,500 Westerly Handicap at Lincoln Downs.

title: U. S. Hopes to Keep Drunks Off the Road As New Safety Projects Get Under Way
description: DETROIT, March 13He has had six accidents in the last 10 years. One person has been injured and one killed. Since his first arrest for drunken driving in 1960, his license has been revoked twice yet he has continued to drive. He has picked up 19 major traffic violations, and he is still on the road.

title: R. S. Frary Jr. to Wed Irene Silberman
description: TENAFLY, N. J., March 13 Mr. and Mts. Irwin Silberman have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Irene Carol Silberman, to Richard Spencer Frary. Jr. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frary of Burnsville, Minn. A wedding in the summer is planned.

title: Brundage Facing Strongest Challenge
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, March 13Nine men met for eight hours today to decide the future of the winter Olympics. And they didn't even talk about it, not at the closeddoor meeting nor afterward when an official spokesman said: No comment.

title: For Seeders and Weeders
description: Pruning during the dormant season is simplified if tools are sharp; always scan the plant to be trimmed first, and then cut out thick overgrown or crossing branches; fruit trees, grapevines, trees, shrubs and hedges can all be trimmed now.... MULCHES should remain in place over perennial borders and evergreens until at least the end of the month, unless the weather becomes unusually mild; then remove mulches, gradually.... Lettuce, spinach, onion sets can be sown in the coldframe now for early harvest. ANNUALS should be sown indoors by now, especially petunias, snapdragons, browallia, impatiens, ageratum and other longseason growers; keep seedlings in a warm, sunny place and turn them frequently; never allow the soil to become dry but be cautious about overwatering.... TUBEROUS BEGONIAS should be given a head start indoors this month; set tubers in a moist medium such as peat moss and vermiculite mixed or peat and sand mixed; keep tubers warm, until buds begin to sprout, then put them in a sunny room.... Keep off the lawn until it is dried out; then lime, if needed, and fertilize.... Delay any soil digging until the ground has dried out completely.... ROSEBUSH pruning should not be started until the buds begin to break, usually when forsythia blooms.... Last call to sow seeds of the new hybrid geraniums for summer display.... New property owners, gardening for the first time, should have their soil tested.... Check evergreens around the home for any trunks or limbs damaged by winter's ice storms; remove any broken branches by pruning them back to the next largest branch; some squashed down plants right themselves naturally when the sun and warmer weather reach them.... HOUSE PLANTS are surging into new growth, now that there is more sunlight reaching them; start applications of house plant fertilizer about every three to four weeks, depending on the type of plant and its rate of growth.... Take cuttings of geraniums, lantanas, coleus, and other display plants for window boxes and borders.

title: Court Bars Professor From Stanford
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., March 13 A tenured Stanford University professor, along with several students and nonstudents, has been barred by a court order from the central portion of the campus in a dispute that some faculty members fear might set a precedent for dismissing teachers with unpopular views.

title: Change
description: Old weather lore says only that March will be windy, choosing not to prophesy even from week to week. But of one thing we may be sureMarch not only brings change but is change. You see it, you hear it, you feel

title: Growing Use of MindAffecting Drugs Stirs Concern
description: The mushrooming promotion, prescription and use of moodand mindaffecting drugsstimulants, sedatives, tranquilizers and the likeare drawing critical scrutiny from the Federal Government and the medical profession.

title: LAWMAKER LIVES AT A HECTIC PACE
description: ALBANY, March 13The legislator listed as H. Posner made his weekly return home from the State Assembly two days ago wink no certainty that any of his, pet nills would ever shine in the leaders eyes.

title: Mailbox:
description: To the EDITOR:

title: 24 Years in the Life Of Lyuba ershadskaya
description: A. first it was easy to listen to Lyuba Bershadskayait was all music. I was standing on a maroon carpet in a dark corridor outside her New York hotel roam, while from behind the shut door waves and waves of lovely Russian sounds flowed out. There was a bell to ring, and in the dimness I pushed it, but nothing happened only more and more of that skipping Russian tide, full of gdye and horosho and znayesh. The hallway was perfectly still; the only stir was the stir of this intricate birdlike foreign voice.

title: More Furniture May Be Plastic
description: Rising labor costs were cited among other factors accounting for an increased interest in plastics on the part of furniture makers during a discussion last week by the Richmond, Va., Society of Financial Analysts.

title: Southern Yemen Says Rebels, Aided by Saudis, Prepare to Attack
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, March 13  Defense Minister AU Nasser Mohammed said this week that forces hostile to the Government of Southern Yemen were reported to be camping near Beihan Province,, in the western area of the country. He called on the people of Southern Yemen to prepare to defend their country.

title: When Adam ate the apple, God lost His head
description: E. M. Cioran, two among whose halfdozen books are now, with the publication of The Fall Into Time, available in English, is a brilliant and original exponent of a rare genre, the philosophical essay. The taste for such writing, and especially for Cioran's, can for most of us only be an acquired one, but it is well worth acquiring. Quite apart from the inherent satisfaction of encountering a genuine style, Cioran offers a form of intellectual experience that helps to balance the preoccupations of an uneasy time.

title: The Bond Buyers
description: Who is buying the billions of dollars worth of bonds that companies have been telling? Precise answers are difficult, but a study published last week by the Bankers Trust Company pegs individuals and others as the biggest single group of buyerssome $10.7billion out of an expected net total of $20.5billion this year.

title: Y.A.F. SEEKS FUNDS TO AVERT CLOSING
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)Young Americans for Freedom, the voice of conservatism on the country's college campuses, says it is caught in a twoway financial bind and may be forced to shut down.

title: Police Head Ousted In Long Beach, L.I.; Investigation Asked
description: LONG BEACH, L.I., March  The Police Commissioner of this city was demoted yesterday and a State Senator has asked the Nassau County District Attorney to investigate the circumstances ,behind the reshuffle at the top levels of the city's Police Department.

title: Psychiatrist in Belfast Finds Children Are Deeply Disturbed by the Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 13Maeve, a timid 9yearold child, hears a loud noise on the street and faints. Emily, 10, suffers recurrent nightmares that her parents are shot. Tenyearold Marie recalls the rioting and has an epileptic fit.

title: Chinese Satellite Monitored
description: TOKYO, March 13 (AP)Japanese scientists said today they had monitored for three straight days what they believed were radio signals from Communist China's second artificial satellite, which was reported launched into earth orbit March 3.

title: Susan Hansen Sets Nuptials
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., March 13Miss Susan Marie Isabel Hansen and Michael Stanton Jeffries, both of New York, plan to be married on April 3 in the garden at the home of Miss Hansen's parents here on Biscayne Bay.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Janice Hosking Engaged To John. Brazil, Fellow at Yale
description: ALLENDALE, N. J., March 13Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Hosking have announced the engagement of Mr. Hosking's niece, Miss Janice Hosking, to John Brazil, son of Dr. and Mrs. Burton R. Brazil of San Jose, Calif.

title: Legislature's Special Panels Scrutinized
description: ALBANY, March 13  As legislators try to outdo one another in chopping away at Governor Rockefeller's proposed $8.45 billion budget, some are questioning the necessity of the plethora of patronagerich special committees and temporary commissions created by the Legislature with appropriations of about $2million a year.

title: The World
description: HONG KONGAs the United Statessupported South Vietnamese drive into Laos pushed ahead last week, the question again was raised here and in various world capitals: Will Communist China intervene in Indochina?

description: To the Editor:

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Over the fireplace in the sparely furnished, spacious 10th floor corner office overlooking Wall Street and William Street hangs a photograph of C. Douglas Dillon, farmer Ambassador to France. Under Secretary of State and Se'cretary of the Treasury, who once worked there as head of Dillon, Read & Co., Inc., investment bankers. Before Mr. Dillon occupied the post, it was held by James V. Forrestal, who became the lation's first Secretary of Defense after he left the New York financial community.

title: RUSSIANS QUIT SUEZ, MANSFIELD REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)  The Senate majority leader, Mike Mansfield, said today that he had been advised that Soviet troops had withdrawn from SAM missile sites along the Suez Canal, leaving advisers behind but United Arab Republic forces in charge.

title: The Radical Of 10 Downing Street
description: LONDON.

title: LETTERS
description: To The Financial Editor:

title: House by the side of
description: Carefree, casual and adventurousthat's what ski weekends should be. These qualities were built into this compact, multilevel house on Stratton Mountain in Vermont designed for a family of ski buffs. One door opens onto a ski trail so they can schuss right up to the house at the end of the day. Once inside, they store their gear in a lodgelike room (complete with a sauna and kitchenette) that doubles as the children's playroom. Not unexpectedly, the large kitch endining room complex is the hub of the house. Architects Hardy, Holzman, Pfeiffer joined two shedroof structures at opposing angles to create the exciting interiors and to vary the views from level to level and room to room.

title: University Is Helping Remote Indian Tribes in Southwest to Adopt Regulations of American Courts
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., March 12  For a few remote and small Indian tribes of the Southwest, this nation's courts are mysterious places, full of strange customs and nonsense, and almost completely at odds with their ancient traditions.

title: 4 U.S. Airmen Issue Statement
description: ANKARA, March 13 (Reuters) Four American airmen who were recently held captive for five days by leftwing Turkish extremists issued a statement today saying they bore no hard feelings against the people of Turkey.

title: The Nation; Surveillance:; Who's the SnoopinChief? Nobody Is Saying
description: WASHINGTON  The scholar testifying at a Senate hearing last week turned the tables on his questioners and put the Senators on the spot.

title: Sokolow and Oddy Advance In Squash Racquets Event
description: The team of Mel Sokolow of the Lone Star Boat Club and Roland Oddy of the New York Athletic Club will meet Pedro Bacallao and Baily Brown of the Princeton Club today in the final of the Lone Star squash racquets doubles tournament at the clubhouse, 240 West 54th Street.

title: Mormons Are Distressed by Razing of a 92 YearOld Tabernacle
description: COALVILLE, Utah, March 9 The splendid old Mormon tabernacle here has been reduced to a heap of rubble picked over by souvenir hunters who extract handmade square nails and carry off bits of crushed brick.

title: Music
description: SO the New York Yankees and the Football Giants made noises about leaving New York City; and New York City acted with great de, termination in the incredible crisis. The very thought of those two sporting organizations leaving the city was insupportable. Quickly Mayor Lindsay announced that New York City would purchase Yankee Stadium and modernize'it, at a cost of $24million. Anything to keep the Yanks and Giants happy. The Yankees are owned by the Colurnbia Broadcasting System, and presumably C.B.S. is also happy.

title: Reader's Report
description: Helen Hudson brings a breath of fresh air to the austere corridors of the asylum novel. To the problems of the patients in a psychiatric ward, she devotes the talents of a poet. Thus, one doesn't find case histories here, but elegies to the death of personality and of hope.

title: Paul Samuelson, Investor
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.By some immutable law of nature still to be digested by the computer, great beauties yearn to be admired for their brains, female Phi Beta Kappas for their sexiness and academic economists for their expertise in the market place.

title: Agency Subsidized by a Federal Grant Helps Puerto Ricans Here Get Loans to Set Up Small Businesses
description: About two months ago Stan Contreras approached a loan officer at the Chase Manhattan Bank and asked to borrow $15,000 to purchase a liquor stored.

title: About Baseball
description: A small but not insignificant step toward truly worldwide baseball competition was taken last week when the Tokyo Giants began a series of exhibition games with major league teams in Florida. They played the Baltimore Orioles, winners of the last World Series, on Thursday, and their hosts at Vero Beach, the Los Angeles Dodgers, on Friday night. Some day they may play in a real World Series. Japanese professional players have spent part of the training season with the Dodgers for several years, and individual players have appeared in some games. Many American teams have toured Japan after the regular season here. And a few years ago, of, course, Masanori Murakami was a regular relief pitcher for the San Francisco Giants.

title: Triple Bend, $6.40, Wins Stakes Race on the Coast
description: ALBANY, Calif., March 13 (UPI)Triple Bend, a Kentucky Derby candidate, came from behind and powered to a halflength victory today in the $25,000 added Contra Costa Stakes at Golden Gate Fields.

title: Miss Pamela Hilton Is Betrothed
description: ARDSLEY, N. Y., March 13 The engagement of Miss Pamela Hilton to Thomas A. Michaelson of Marblehead, Mass., has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Peter Hilton of Ardsley and Dorset, Vt., parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mrs. Arthur G. Michaelson of Larchmont and Pompano Beach, Fla., and the late Mr. Michaelson.

title: Et A1.
description: A study of the influence on foreign policy of our domestic attitudes toward China. Chinese did not start to arrive in this country in number until the 1850's. In the next 30 years, immigration rose precipitously, resulting in fear of competition from cheap Chinese labor and eventual passage in 1882 of the Chinese Exclusion Act. Professor McClellan reveals a curious ambivalence in America: on the one hand, the Chinese were considered barbarous and inferior: on the other, the Manifest Destiny people felt we should protect China (resulting in. the Open Door Policy) and ultimately civilize her. Underlying this confusion of feeling was America's insecurity about her role in the wide world and its rather grandiose thoughts about its role in the Far East. At any rate, American views of China have been stereotyped, uninformed and a product of wishful thinking. An interesting approach to the roots of our continuing and, on the whole, disastrous China policies.

title: JUDGE ORDERS AID FOR MENTALLY ILL
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 13A Federal court ruled here yesterday that patients involuntarily committed to state men tal institutions through civi procedures have a constitutional right to adequate treatment from a medical standpoint.

title: RareBird Hunt Halts Timber Cutting
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March 13 South Carolina officials agreed this week to postpone timber harvesting in a 10,000acre swamp.that may be the habitat of the ivory billed woodpecker.

title: Ethnic Pride at Stake in L.I. Soccer Games
description: Italians and Greeks are among my best friends, Bernard Themann, a 67yearold GermanAmerican, was saying the other day. During the week 1 get along with them just fine. But come Sunday afternoon, they gp on the one side of the field and I go on the other.

title: The British Taking Their Pleasure in Utter Discomfort
description: LONDONOn March 24, 1966, in icy sleet and driving rain, the Cambridge University eight was having its last full practice on the river Thames for the traditional annual race against Oxford UniversityThe Boat Race, as the English call itwhen the boat began to sink. The Cambridge crew did not abandon ship. They rowed on until the boat disappeared from under them.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Marriage on Relief: A Statistical Study
Beets, Beans and Peas
description: FRESH VEGETABLES from the garden can be harvested for most, if not all, the year here in the Northeast. Long before seed of annual crops can be safely sown, the thaws of late whiter start the new crop year. The perennial Japanese parsley, Mituba, grows fresh and green in the midst of melting snow. So do the smooth shiny rosettes of the edible wild plant wintercress or yellow rocket (Barbarea vulgaris).

title: Mailbox :
description: To the EDITOR:

title: MICHIGAN STUDIES RIGHTS OF YOUTHS
description: DETROIT, March 13A special Governor's commission has recommended that the age of majority here be lowered to 18 years from 21.

title: The World
description: SAIGON  Every afternoon at 4:15 when reporters gather for the war briefing, long known as the follies, an American officer reports that United States air power supplemented the capability of the South Vietnamese air force in operations in Laos the day before.

title: In Jakarta, Mansions  Rent for Hundreds a Month
description: The housing problem is not confined to New York. Hera is a report from The New York Times correspondent in Jakarta, Indonesia.

title: Thomas Becket
description: How many of those who read or have flocked to see The Canterbury Tales realize that but for Thomas Becket the tales would never have been told? Becket's own story can be read in glass and stone and illuminated manuscripts, as well as in contemporary biography, correspondence and saga. The 800th anniversary of his martyrdom was widely observed in the year just passed.

title: Liltin Tunes, Rhythmic Clapping and the Clopping of Jigs Spill Blarney Out of Irish Pub in Queens
description: Although there is liable to be a rising tide of blarney and brogues throughout Queens on Wednesday in honor of St. Patrick, there Is one spot, in Jackson Heights, where the brogueandblarney level will scarcely change. It is a bit of the ould sod called the Shieling, a vast, highceilinged pub that is filled with Irish songs and jigs and reels every Tuesday through Sunday night.

title: SHAZAR HONORED AT A SYNAGOGUE
description: Israel's 81yearold President, Zalman Shazar, wearing the traditional prayer shawl and a dark felt hat, joined yesterday morning the 425 worshippers filling the Orthodox Fifth Avenue Synagogue.

title: Listening to America
description: The best lack all conviction, while the worst / Are full of passionate intensity, said Yeats, and, from wherever we happen to be standing, we look at the current social and political scene and nod. Bill Moyers, former Special Assistant to Lyndon Johnson, and then publisher of Newsday, has had a look himself. Last summer he traveled 13,000 miles around the country. He is interested in no such extremes as best and worst; he is practical, and believes that this country and its present condition can be known and understood, and its problems in some way handled.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: He Talks Best at a Piano
description: PIANIST William Masselos is an endearing, nervous wreck of a man. Clearly unused to interviews, he presents the image of someone eager to communicate, but quite at a loss as to how to go about it. Words are not my element, he keeps saying. Or, I've stated this badly, or No, what I meant to say was... or I had this clear in my head a moment ago... only...

title: Dale Kahr Is Fiancee Of Arthur L. Moses
description: MIAMI, March 13  Mr. and Mrs. Monroe Hattenbach have announced the engagement of Mrs. Hattenbach's daughter, Miss Dale Kahr, to Arthur Laurence Moses, son of Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Moses of Riverdale, the Bronx, New York. The wedding will take place here in July.

description: I LOVE ships. On embarkation days, I often go down to the New York City docks to roam around the France, the Michelangelo, the Raffaello, the Rotterdam, the Bremen, the Queen Elizabeth 2 and any other transAtlantic passenger liners that might be in port.

description: Eightyearold Alfred has an I.Q. near that of a genius, but speaks in disjointed phrases and oneword sentences.Sevenyearold Ronald can read and spell better than most children his age, but often cannot answer simple questions such as How old are you?

title: David H. Erichsen Will Marry Miss Katechen C. Cardamone
description: NEW HARTFORD, N. Y., March 13Associate Justice Richard J. Cardamone of the Appellate Division of the Supeeme Court of New York, and Mrs. Cardamone, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Catherine Clarke Cardamone, to David Hans Erichsen, a Yale National Scholar. He is the son of Mrs. Hans Skabo Erichsen of St. James, L. I., and Mr. richsen of New York.

title: A COMPUTER LAG BY RUSSIA FOUND
description: The Soviet Union still lags behind the United States in the production and use of computers but has the raw technical potential to achieve something near parity within 10 years, an American expert said after a recent tour of Soviet computer centers.

title: Ski Boomtown
description: WATERVILLE VALLEY, N.H.This small New England town on the southern fringes of the White Mountain National Forest is finding out that fame does not pay its bills. Fame came overnight about five years ago, when Mount Tecumseh was opened to crowds seeking enjoyment on snowcovered slopes.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Is Seventh Avenue caught in a creative vacuum bounded between the midi on one side and hot pants on the other?

title: Miss Gretchen Wetzel Bride of Count von Rittberg
description: SOUTH NATICK, Mass., March 13  Miss Gretchen Elizabeth Wetzel was married here this afternoon to Cow HansGeorg von Rittbergt of Hamburg, Germany. The Rev. Archie D. McRee performed the ceremony at the Eliot Church, named for John Eliot, who preached to the Indians on the church site, Mr. McRee was assisted by the Rev. H. Paul Santmire, Protestant chaplain of Wellesley College.

title: They Don't Throw Sticks
description: On March 1 a bomb rocked the United States Capitol Building in Washington.

title: A PROCESS SERVER DRAWS A $500 FINE
description: A Federal judge last week Mined a process server $500 and placed him on probation for one year, following his conviction last month of violation of the civil rights of three persons.

title: Argentina's Beef Crisis
description: BUENOS AIRES The Argentines have eaten themselves into a serious beef shortage that threatens to undermine their economy and political equilibrium.

title: FREEMAN, EXENVOY, JOINS TV IN LONDON
description: LONDON, March 13  John Freeman, until recently the British Ambassador in Washington, has been appointed chief executive of London Weekend Television.

title: M.I.T. Picks Track Leaders
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 13The indoor track team of Massachusetts Institute of Technology has named its cocaptains for next seasonAl Lau of New York, a long jumper in his junior year, and David Wilson of Bala Cynwyd, Pat., a sophomore pole vaulter. Lau, versatile performer who was Tech's leading point earner as a. sophomore, also was cocaptain this past season.

title: Didman
description: His hero, suggests John Speicher, is a victim of socially engendered neuroticism"; all societal conflicts inflict sympathetic lesions on his personality. Besides topical reactions to militarism, racial guilt, class conflict and urban blight, Joe Didman has a few textbook Freudian hangups unattached to current events. As a cause or effect, he drinks enough to find himself going down the drain at a fearfui clip.

title: Jobs for 93,000 Women Is Aim of Westchester Pilot Project
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 13A pilot project to help the 93,000 collegeeducated women in Westchester County explore new patterns of employment was started this month by an organization that hopes to use this area as a model for a national program.

title: Sluggish at the Gate
description: If offtrack betting manages to meet its newest target date of April 8, it will probably have to get by at first with what it now regards as a backup system.

title: Study Scores City's Police And Courts as Inefficient
description: The first overall study of how well New York's police, prosecutors, courts and jails fight crime has concluded that they are neither efficient enough to create a credible fear of punishment nor fair enough to command sincere respect for their values.

title: U.5 U.S. to Help Open Pilot Alcoholic Treatment Unit
description: ALBUQUDRQUE, N. M., March 13A 40bed community alcoholism rehabilitation unit promoted and supported by four United States Government agencies and the New Mexico State Division of Vocational Rehabilitation will open soon in a former Albuquerque hospital.

title: Fares for Vehicles On S.I. Ferry Runs To Rise at Midnight
description: Staten Island ferry fares for vehicles wilt be raised at midnight tonight in the first, albeit relatively minor, taste of Mayor Lindsay's proposed $880.7million newtax package.

title: Courses and Classes
description: A CLINIC for home gardeners will be held on March 24 in the Westchester County Center, White Plains, N.Y. at 8 P.M. Sponsored by the County Department of Parks, Recreation and Conservation, the meeting will be free to the public and provide a forum for answers to many spring garden questions. The meeting will be conducted by Walter Androsko and Martin Gottleib, Cooperative Extension Agents.

title: Title for Central Washington
description: BOONE, N. C., March 13 (AP) Central Washington State College of Ellensburg won the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics wrestling championship today with victories in the 126pound and 134pound competition. Bloomsburg, Pa., was second and Bemidji, Minn., third.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: COUPONS WILL BUY A KIDNEY MACHINE
description: CORNWALL ON HUDSON, N.Y., March 13  The coupons arrive in boxes and mail sacks by the thousands and In envelopes by ones and twos. They come accompanied by typewritten letters, notes scribbled in pencil, or with no identification at all.

title: National Flower Is Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)Senator Howard H. Baker, Republican of Tennessee, has introduced a proposed joint Congressional resolution to make the marigold the national flower. The marigold was championed as a national floral emblem for many years by Senator Baker's fatherinlaw, the late Senator Everett McKinley Dirksen, Republican of Illinois

title: GRANT IS AWARDED ON CANCER RESEARCH
description: ST. LOUIS, March 13A 12million grant has been Awarded to Washington University in St. Louis by seven tobacco companies and a tobacco growers association for a basic research program on the immunological properties of cancer.

title: PAPERS IN RICHMOND YIELD ON HOME ADS
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)Attorney General John N. Mitchell has announced that the two daily papers in Richmond, Va., have agreed to eliminate real estate advertising practices that the Justice Department felt were racially discriminatory.

title: ECOLOGICAL CULPRIT?
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: When You Need Landscape Help From a Pro...
description: EVERY landscape architect could write a book called Clients I Have Known. Some case histories would be amusing, a few tinged with disappointment, but the great majority are happy accounts of collaboration between parties, resulting in a pleasant bit of landscape and a lasting friendship of sharing mutual interests.

title: Illinois Contractor Wins BarrelJumping Contest
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y. March 13 (UPI)Richard Widmark, a 33yearold building contractor from Northbrook, Ill., won the 21st world barreljumping tournament today with a leap of 15 barrels and 26 feet 7 inches.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. SUES ON ACCESS TO A MIGRANT CAMP
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)The Justice Department has sued for the first time seeking access to migrant workers living in labor camps so that the workers can be informed of Federal assistance programs available to them.

title: Those were Golden Days
description: NEXT time you go to Sardi's, look at the bronze plaque on the column, center aisle and to the rear:

title: Dover Teachers to Return
description: DOVER, N. J., March 13 (AP) Dover's public school teachers voted today to return to classes Monday pending the outcome of an appeal of a projected cut in the school budget. The Board of Education will appeal to State Commissioner of Education Carl M. Marburger about an intended slash in the budget by Dover's Board of Aldermen.

title: Writers Lampoon Leaders of State At Albany Show
description: ALBANY, March 13 (AP)Governor Rockefeller was portrayed as King Laughalot, who fended off a challenge to the throne of Camelot by Arthur the Pretender Goldbergonly to suffer through a big fiscal headache on the morning after.

title: News of the Camera World
description: UNDER the directorship of Jacob Deschin, former Photography Editor of The New York Times, Modernage Photo Services, Inc., 319 East 44th Street, New York 10017 has inaugurated a new program to encourage submission of photographic work for public exhibition from promising photographers who have talent, but who may not have previously had the opportunity to have their work shown. Material found acceptable will be hung without charge in one of Modernage's three public galleries (all in Manhattan).

title: Newark Paper Raises Price
description: NEWARK March 13 (AP)The price of The Sunday News of Newark, now 25 cents copy, will go up to 30 cents next week, the paper announced today. The increase was necessitated by rising production and newsprint costs, the paper said.

title: House Panel Opposing Nixon's Shifts on Foreign Aid
description: WASHINGTON, March 13President Nixon's plan to change the content and administration of the foreign aid program has encountered opposition from key members of the House Foreign Affairs Committee.

title: 7Man Cove Neck Police Unit Backed Up by Nassau's Force
description: To the 500 residents of Cove Neck, L. I., a thumb of estates and beaches jutting into Long Island Sound, law and order are represented by Chief Harry Porteus, his six men in blue, two police cars and a police horse.

title: THOSE RADICAL PROFESSORS
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: La Guardia College, on Old Factory Site in L.I. City, Will Offer WorkStudy Prograin
description: Fiorello H. La Guardia Community College, the newest and perhaps the most unusual of the City University's nine community colleges, is taking shape in a factory in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Law
description: The radical feminist TiGrace Atkinson, 32, was in the middle of a speech at Washington's Catholic University last Wednesday night, discussing the virginity of the Virgin Mary, when there was a commotion on the auditorium floor. I can't let her say that, shouted a woman as she ran to the podium and aimed a slap at Miss Atkinson. Miss Atkinson apparently deflected the blow, which landed on the microphone. The attacker turned out to be Mrs. Patricia Buckley Bozell, 43yearold sister of the columnist William F. Buckley Jr. and Senator James L. Buckley, and herself managing editor of a conservative Catholic monthly, Triumph. Declaring I think I established contact, she rushed from the hall with her husband, Brent Bozell, a senior editor of the magazine, knelt on the sidewalk to say a prayer, and rounded off the happening with another shout: To hell with Catholic University!

title: Alice Manning and Paul Wehn to Wed
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., March 13  Mr. and Mrs. Edgar A. Manning Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alice Elizabeth Manning, to Paul B. Wehn, a product coordinator in the college department of Random House/Alfred A. Knopf in New York. He is the son of Mrs. William Carmel of West Islip, L. I., and the late Donald Barndollar Wehn of Brooklyn.

title: Germans Who Complained of Airport Noise Get a Brand New Town
description: NEUOBERBOLHEIM, West Germany  The West Germans have come up with a practical solution to complaints about airport noise: Move the complaining village.

title: MICHIGAN GETS PLAN FOR FASTER TRIALS
description: LANSING, Mich., Match 13 (UPI)The Chief Justice of the Michigan Supreme Court has proposed a sixmonth limit on the interval between placement of a criminal charge and the trial.

title: Et A1.
description: A history of the conservation movement in the U. S., with special attention to the late 19th century, when activity began in earnest. Frank Graham describes the wholesale slaughter of wild lifethe American way in those daysand the subsequent revulsion. The story is rounded out with the descriptions of the presentday Sierra Club and Audubon societies, Rachel Carson and the passage of the Wilderness Bill. Gracefully written, committed.

title: Shinnecock Indians Resist Tempting Bids for Land
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., March 13The stubborn independence of the 200 Shinnecock Indians living in a reservation here has helped them to resist land claims and tempting real estate offers. But it has also led to the refusal of needed mortgage loans and educational help.

title: Nixon Depicts His Wife As Strong and Sensitive
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 President Nixon says his wife, Pat, who celebrates her 59th birthday Tuesday, is a woman of great strength of character and superb sensitivity whose passion for privacy prevents her from enjoying all aspectsof her role as First Lady.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, March 13Politics ain't beanbag, Mr. Dooley said, and that is exactly the way Representative Wilbur D. Mills sees it. In fact, at the moment, Arkansas gift to the Ways and Means Committee is playing the game so hard and so astutely that he has Mr. Nixon floundering and foreign diplomats watching openmouthed. The latter cannot quite grasp how, in the peculiar American system, one smallstate Congressman who by the accident of seniority heads an important committee can have (a) worked out an agreement with a foreign power, (b) thus concluded a negotiation that the Nixon Administration botched last year and (c) virtually killed the prospect of another importquota bill like the one that passed the House last year.

title: SUBURBS REVOLT ON CITY TAX PLAN
description: Taxation without representation is tyranny, the watchword and rallying cry of American patriots 200 years ago, is being heard once again  this time from suburban commuters opposing Mayor Lindsay's proposed payroll tax.

title: The Life and Death
description: LIKE Moslems to Mecca, they once came to The Wall, and The Neighborhood hummed with their crowded camaraderie. The Wall belonged to theni. It was theirs exclusively, a creation of their contradistinctive culture: an entire, windowless side of a long brick building on which was splashed a great, garish mural of a giant Jesus and a chorus of surrealistic disciplesand it was there at The Wall on the corner of Peachtree and 10th Streets in the heart of this city's hippie colony that all the lost children gathered in the evenings to bind up the day in a communion of castaways.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: 3 NAVY WRESTLERS WIN DISTRICT TITLES
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 13 Wade Schalles, a sophomore from Clarion State College of Pennsylvania, pinned topseeded Clyde Frantz of Penn State with a cradle hold after 1 minute 14 seconds of their 158pound bout tonight in the National Collegiate District Two championships at Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: PRIESTS TO GET ROLE AT SYNOD IN VATICAN
description: ROME, March 13The Vailcan announced today that Pape Paul VI would select priests from all over the world as nonvoting observers in the universal Bishops conference here next October.

title: Body Motion, Concentration and Prayer During Garden Bowling Action
description: More than once the number 13 has figured in the fortunes of Earl Anthony, who won the $85,000 Cougar open bowling tournament at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum yesterday before a crowd of 3,131.

title: Tigers Top Red Sox, 42, on Lonborg's Balk and Rodriguez's 2Run Homer
WARNING ISSUED ON GYPSY MOTHS
description: The New York metropolitan area can expect next summer what may be the worst invasion so far of gypsy moths.

title: The Nation
description: This city has been pressed to the wall, Mayor Lindsay said grimly last week, then officially announced his 10point, $880.7million survival tax package.

title: Mailbox :
description: To the Editor:

title: Gail Frances ightman Affianced
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 13Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Charles Wightman Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Frances Wightman, to Richand John Morgan, aisenior at Princeton University and son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Richard Morgan of Cincinnati.

title: Beverly Bryant To Be a Bride
description: Anouncement has been made by Dr. and Mrs. John A. Bryant of Magog, Quebec, of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Beverly Ann Bryant, to Timothy Cole Bradley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas H. Bradley of Lake Placid, N. Y., formerly of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Jane November to Be June Bride
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., March 13 Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. November have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Ann November, to Charles K. Ribakoff 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene J. Ribakoff of Palm Beach, Fla., and Worcester, Mass.

title: Fire Damages Filene Center
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (AP)An early morning fire today heavily damaged the $1.9million Filene Center for the Performing Arts, which is under construction in nearby Virginia.

title: Chinese Officers in Aden
description: WASHINGTON, March 13A mission of several dozen Chinese Communist officers has established itself at Aden in Southern Yemen, according to reports reaching the State Department.

title: Sandstorm Cancels PadresIndians Game
description: YUMA, Ariz., March 13 (AP)A sandstorm caused the San Diego Padres to cancel an exhibition baseball game here against the Cleveland Indians today.

title: Mrs. Korybut Married to Peter J. Unger
description: Mrs. Katherine Maffitt Korybut of New York and Southampton, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Peter J. Unger, a lawyer here. State Supreme Court Justice Jacob B. Grumet performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: Salaries
description: The Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc., was erroneously reported to be continuing a salary cut on some executive personnel in last Sunday's New York Times. Interpublic restored the cut as of Jan. 1, 1971.

title: President Says Politicians Need More Time to Think
description: WASHINGTON, March 13The problem with most politicians is that they talk so much they think too little, President Nixon believes, He wishes members of Congress would go home and contemplate a bit more often. And the one luxury he cannot get enough df in the White House is time just to read and think.

title: Mailbox :
description: To the EDITOR:

title: C. W. Post Takes Collegiate Track Conference Title for Third Year in Row
CHANNEL 9 NEWS HIT BY RECESSION
description: The television industry recession has hit WORTV, Channel 9, here, as part of a companywide budget reduction ordered for RKO Television. RKO owns WORTV.

title: Eurobond Market
description: PARISThe settling of international interest rates has produced a remarkable surge in newissue activity in the Eurobond market as corporations, international agencies, municipalities, and Governmentsincluding the Communist Government of Hungaryconsider borrowing in Western, Europe to meet growing capital needs.

title: Richey Heads the Field In Stamford Net Tourney
description: STAMFORD, Conn., March 13Cliff Richey will head a fourplayer field in the $5,000 Stamford invitation indoor tennis tournament March 19 through 21 at Stamford High School.

title: In the service of immediate cosmic reform
description: To read a great deal of Doris Lessing over a short span of time is to feel that the original hound of heaven has commandeered the attic. She holds the mind's other guests in ardent contempt. She appears for meals only to dismiss the household's own preoccupations with writing well as decadent. For more than twenty years now she has been registering, in a torrent of fiction that increasingly seems conceived in a stubborn rage against the very idea of fiction, every tremor along her emotional fault system, every slippage in her selfeducation. Look here, she is forever demanding, a missionary devoid of any but the most didactic irony: the Communist party is not the answer. There is a life beyond vaginal orgasm. St. John of the Cross was not as dotty as certain Anglicans would have had you believe. She comes hard to ideas, and, once she has collared one, worries it with Victorian doggedness.

title: Criminals At Large
description: John Dickson Carr, that respected veteran of the mystery novel, has been turning them out for some 40 years. And he turns them out in the classic style. Not for ,him the sex of the sixties, the toughguy dialogue, the cynical private eye. No. In a Carr novel, the proceedings are as stately as a brontosaurus munching its lunch. The stage has to be set. Characters have to be introduced. The plot is the thing, and the plot generally involves those things so dear to classic mystery fiction: the locked door, The Least Likely Suspect, the false clues, the close inside pitch that throws the reader off balance.

title: Foreign Notes
description: Since Kemal Ataturk founded modern Turkey after World War I, the country's military leaders have seen it as their duty to preserve his program of progress with stability. In 1960, when they believed the regime of Adnan Menderes was failing to comply with these aims, the military intervened and deposed Mr. Menderes, who was later hanged. Last week the military intervened again, to force the resignation of Premier Suleyman Demirel.

title: New York and New Jersey Congressmen Press for Gateway Park
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 Twentytwo months ago this week, Walter J. Hickel, then the Secretary of the Interior, held a news conference with Mayor Lindsay on a desolate, windswept beach area of the Rockaway Peninsula and announced plans for a bistate Gateway National Recreation Area at the entrance to New York Harbor.

title: Seor De Soto, We Hear You Loud If Not Too Clear
description: BRADENTON, Fla.  Visitors here are running the risk of attack by unruly gangs of 16thcentury buccaneers firing off harquebuses in clouds of black smoke as festivities build up for the official opening of Bradenton's 27th annual De Soto Celebration Week beginning next Sunday. The 250 local businessmen who make up the armored, swordwielding Crewe of Conquistadores will be capturing dignitaries, occupying the courthouse and putting public officials of Sun City to the stake, among scores of other shenanigans that are part of the reenacEment of the landing of Hernando de Soto on the local beach.

title: SOVIET CRITICIZES OFFICIAL NEGLECT
description: MOSCOW, March 13The Soviet Communist party today issued a wideranging denunciation of local Government agencies for failing to pay proper attention to the complaints of the people.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ST. PETERSBURG; Fla., March 13It was one of the few times Bobby Orr has had his feet on solid ground within ,the main arena. at Madison Square Garden:In the ordinary course of events he flashes over an iced garden surface for the Boston Bruins, plunging New York Ranger fans to the edge of despair by his wizardry. But this was no ordinary occasion. It was the FrazierAli fistic thriller a few days ago and the probability was overwhelming that Orr, aged 22, was the youngest frontrow spectator in the joint.

title: Botanic Garden Offers Horticulture for Youths
description: City youngsters who now may not know a tomato plant from a tulip will get the chance to harvest vegetables they themselves have grown at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden in a program that got under way yesterday.

title: The World
description: BONNWhy are all the talks so secret? a woman asked Mayor Klaus Schutz of West Berlin on a television show last Wednesday night. Is it because we shouldn't know we're being kicked around until we've collapsed and can be discarded?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: News of the Rialto
description: CASSANDRAS who believed that the League of New York Theaters and the various unions and guilds would never come to terms on limited gross contract for the Broadway theater have been, of course, driven into the shadows. On Jan. 5, officials for the negotiating parties were able to announce that agreement had been achieved after more than a year of talks.

title: Some Areas Seek to Halt Growth
description: LOS ANGELES, March 13Oregon's Department of Economic Development had a publication called Grow With Oregon, but recently the name was changed to Oregon Quality. Gov. Tom McCall often tells people, Come and visit us again and again. But for heaven's sake, don't come here to live.

title: Nassau Steps Up Cooperation With Law Agencies Across U.S.
description: MINEOLA, L.I., March 13The Nassau District Attorney's Office is depending more and more on cooperative efforts with law enforcement agencies across the country to counter organized crime in the country.

title: Sammis Duo Retains Title
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Match 13Jesse Sammis 3d and Gordon Gray of the Field Club of Greenwich, Conn., who headed the draw, won the national doubles platform tennis championship today for the third successive year. They defeated John Mangan of Manursing Island Club, Rye, N. Y., and Robert Kingsbury of the host club, seeded second, 36, 75, 64, 62, in the final round at Fox Meadow Tennis Club.

title: Mary Lou Cook Is Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., March 13  Miss Mary Lou Cook ant Gordon O. Martin were married this afternoon in tne Scarsdale Community Baptist Church. The Rev. Dr. Robert J. McCracken and the Rev. Paul V. Beam officiated. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Wayne F. Cook of Scarsdale and Mrs. Robert V. Martin of Bronxvine and the late Dr. Martin.

title: The World
description: U.S. NAVAL BASE, San Juan, Puerto Rico  The Soviet and United States Navies are plunging deeper into a game of I Spy played with complex and delicate electronic instruments across the seven seas. The game involves hundreds of ships and aircraft and thousands of men. Both sides argue it is necessary. But the Americans concede that in a game without ground rules there is always danger.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTON Weapons technology has become the common adversary of the two superstates whose representatives will meet tomorrow in Vienna for the fourth round of Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT). As new varieties of evermoredeadly weapons are developed, the United States and the Soviet Union find it increasingly difficult even to judge their respective missile strengths  much less agree upon a formula for mutual restraint.

title: Westchester State Women Win Swim 12th Year in Row
description: FLOURTOWN, Pa., March 13Westchester State College won the 26th annual women's intercollegiate swimming team championship for the 12th straight year with 245 points today at Springfield High School.

title: In Palm Beach,They're All Buying ArtOr Creating It
description: PALM BEACH, FlaHollywood's gone and New York is an urban crisis. But Palm Beach. that gilded, nevernever land of the very rich, can still be depended upon to supply more than its share of the nation's glamour.

title: Frances E. Sharpe Is Fiancee Of Stephen Richman, a Lawyer
description: MILWAUKEE, March 13Miss Frances Ellen Sharpe, a candidate for a doctorate in sociology at the University of California at Los Angeles, and Stephen Erik Richman, a New York lawyer, plan to be married here in late summer.

title: U. S. Backs Research On 1,000 M.P.H. Train
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., March 12 (AP)The Federal Government is backing research on a passenger train that would travel up to 1,000 miles an hour through a tube containing thin air and be propelled by electrical magnets chilled to 450 degrees below zero.

title: Selling Computers to Europe
description: The European market for electronic data processing equipment is growing so rapidly that combines are being formed to take some business away from the International Business Machines World Trade Corporation.

title: Conservation In the Garden
description: A GARDEN is a farm In miniature. A good gardener gives his property the same care and attention to detail that a successful farmer expends on his crops.

title: Fairness to the Aged
description: No group has suffered more from Inflation than the millions of elderly Americans dependent on Social Security benefits for most of the necessities of life. The need for liberalizing payments to the aged was clearly recognized by everyone in Congress last year, but action was frustrated by the Senate Finance Committee's mashing of Social Security changes, trade restrictions and welfare reform into a single hideous package.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  The development of the law covering conscientious objection has been an almost unbroken process of broadening the meaning of the phrase. But last week, the United States Supreme Court, by an 8to1 vote, finally put an end to that process. The Court, in two cases, told America's young men that they have no constitutional right to refuse to fight in wars they consider unjust.

title: CANADA WILL STUDY BIRTHS IN BARBADOS
description: OTTAWA, March 13  The new Governmentfinanced International Development Research Center announced this week that its first project would be a study of the sharply declining birth rate on the Caribbean island of Barbados.

title: COURSE ON CITIES TO LEAD TO M.A.
description: A master's degree program to train students for policymaking roles in urban affairs has been established by the Center for New York City Affairs of the New School for Social Research.

title: W. C. Fields and Elaine MayTwo of a Kind?
description: WHEN My Little Chickadee opened here in 1940, Frank S. Nugent, then the motion picture critic of The New York Times and a man who, on most occasions, displayed both wit and a sense of critical proportion, was reminded of a Noel Coward line about two empty paper bags belaboring each other, apparently in reference to the stars of the film, W. C. Fields and Mae West. Nugent then switched metaphors. The film, he said, is at low tide most of the time, in the quality of its humor, in the broad treatment of its players... in the calibre of the audience it seems intended to please and in the generally bad odor it exudes.

title: The Catalogue
description: From the writer who gave us The Experiment (lab sex) comes The Catalogue, a multiple fantasy inspired by artificial insemination. The star of this attraction is carried off on the wings of imagination by a duty roster of sperm donors. But when all is said and done, this is a gag novel which peters out well before the climax.

title: Boros and Palmer Gain Stroke Lead
Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 141 Forum Wins by Nose; Personality Third in Dash
description: Herbert Allen's Forum, the outsider in the betting, staged a comeback of a sort at Aqueduct yesterday. The 4yearold son of Jaipur won the $33,450 Paumonok with a thrilling closing rush, beating Alan Rosoff's Estimator Dave by a nose.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: It really wasn't a bad agency to work in. There were free lunches prepared by a former hotel chef and served in a beautifully paneled dining room. In the basement was a gym, complete with handball and squash courts. And if you needed a haircut you just dropped in on the resident barber Floice Quizenberry.

title: A Southern City Seeks Peace in Its Racially Troubled Schools
