description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., March 13One evening not long ago, in the middle of a television newscast, the image of a frumpy old woman flashed across thousands of screens all over this troubled community asking if anyone had heard about the terrible things happening in the schools.

title: August in Vermont Time to Befriend A Woodchuck
description: LAST summer was our broke summer; our usual vacation place, Fire Island, was financially out of the question. When we saw a newspaper ad for an exquisite fourbedroom ski house near the Sugarbush Valley ski area of Vermont, we decided to spend the month of August in unknown territory.

title: Robert Maurer, Louise E. Rose Plan Nuptials
description: The engagement of Miss Louise Ellen Rose to Robert 3. Maurer, executive director of the New York State Commission on Cultural Resources, has been announced by Mrs. Irving Rose of Brooklyn, mother of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Howard T. Maurer of Deerfield, Ill., formerly of Albertson, L. I.

title: Eastern Sloops Strong in Coast Event
description: An end to Southern California's domination in the Long Beach (Calif.) Congressional Cup series has been predicted for the threeday sailing competition that begins Thursday.

title: Lawyer to Wed Miss O'Brien
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 13The engagement of Miss Charlotte O'Brien to John J. Kenney, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Charles Kenney of Bayport, L. I., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Russell O'Brien.

title: Television; Anthony Quatle: Detective Stories? Never Read em
description: LET'S say you've been a serious actor for 40 years. You're far from being a doddering ancient, but you've acted In and directed scores of plays, with the accent heavily Shakespearian and the emphasis tending more toward honoring the Muse than Mammon. Well, then, does it feel _good to be starring on Broadway in, of all things, a tremendously successful whodunit? You bet your First Folio it does. Ask Anthony Quayle.

title: Michael Malone, Industrialist Who Served King Ranch, Dead
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., March 13Michael J. P. Malone, an industrialist, who represented the King Ranch of Texas for overseas development, died yes. terday in Lawrence Hospital:. after a short illness. He was 56 years old and lived at 85 Marquand Avenue and also in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Et A1.
description: A Harvard educated New York lawyer who previously edited two readers on early 60's civil rights cases and coauthored a play about Lee Harvey Oswald and did a more traditional anthology of profiles of Supreme Court justices, now writes his first booka survey of civil disobedience as a stimulus to legal social change throughout American history. Inevitably the book goes over familiar 50's60's material and comes up with the conclusion that our system has more viability than either the radicals or the Establishment has been willing to admit. Nothing new, nothing distinctives the historical material needs a historian, not a lawyer, no matter how fairmindedand Mr. Friedman is fairmindedhe may be.

title: CHIEF CRAZY LEGS TRIUMPHS IN PACE
Letter to the Editor 4  No Title
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The Shy Margin Investor
description: What's happened to the margin investor, that canny customer who buys stock on credit and thereby hopes, to leverage his gains?

title: Atlanta's Hopes for Rapid Transit Rise
description: ATLANTA, March 13Rapid transit, for many years a critical issue for residents of this Southern city, appears headed toward fruition as Gov. Jimmy Carter prepares to sign a bill authorizing a new possible source of revenue to help finance the system.

title: LIQUORI MILE VICTOR AS VILLANOVA CAPTURES TRACK
description: DETROIT, March 13Marty Liguori won his second race in less than 24 hours, and Villanova won its second National Collegiate indoor track and field championship today.

title: ACK ACK CAPTURES SANTA ANITA RACE
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 13Ack Ack, the erstwhile sprinter from the Forked Lightning Ranch, stretched his speed out for a mile and a quarter today and won the $145,000 Santa Anita Handicap wire to wire.

title: U. C. L. A. Defeats So. California By 7362 to Gain N. C. A. A. Spot
Dance
description: MUST the theatereven the dance theateralways be lit erary to be at its most immediate? The whole world loves a storywe want to know why Miss Reardon drinks a little, who made the lady of gingerbread, andin dance termswho sent the beauty to sleep. There are otlfer elements in the theater, 4wever, which are largely concerned with visual concepts of pattern and movement, and the temporal concepts of time.

title: Stamps
description: UNITED NATIONS stamps due in April will commemorate efforts of the Food and Agriculture organization's World Food Program; and in May stamps will he issued to commemorate the new building of the International Bureau of the Universal Postal Union in Berne, Switzerland.

title: The Law Of Delay
description: The Englishman with the improbable name of C. Northcote Parkinson is the author of, among other works, Always a Fusilier: The War History of the Royal Fusiliers, Edward Pellew, Viscount Exmouth, Admiral of the Red, and, of course, Parkinson's Law and Other Studies in Administration. The last namedpublished in 1957, when its author held the improbable title of Raffles Professor of History at the University of Malayawas exactly right for its time, focusing as it did on organizational problems and managing to take them both lightly and seriously. Even then, however, there seemed to be something a little wrong about the book, and exactly what was wrong is a lot clearer now.

title: Et A1.
description: An amiable translation of a popular German survey of ethology, much inferior to John Pfeiffer's The Emergence of Man or any other number of recent, genuinely innovative books on the subject.

title: Et A1.
description: Subtitled A Nazi in the Making, 19001926, this is a study of the Gestapo chief's formative years. Himmler was a fussy, pedantic, prissy kidhe broke up his brother's engagement because he disapproved of the girl and then wrote her to explain his actions. Scholarly, interesting. The author also did a study of Hitler's youth.

title: Elliott Roosevelt Quits Post
description: MIAMI BEACH, March 13 (AP)Elliott Roosevelt, the son of President Franklin D. Roosevelt, has resigned as executive director of the Miami Beach Tourist Development Authority because he was tired of being involved in political controversy. A recent audit of the authority said Mr. Roosevelt had failed to account for $2,300 in advances paid to him by the organization.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE dual purpose hutch type cabinet illustrated at right beconies a handy serving bar when the door across the bottom is swung open and locked in that position. With the door closed it becomes a display case for glassware, china or other decorative collections (adjustable glass shelves fit across the top section). Designed to simplify serving problems In apartments, family rooms, dens and similnr areas, the unit has wide shelves at the bottom for storing liquor bottles and other beverages, as well as an ice bucket, cocktail shaker and other accessories normally used when mixing and serving drinks.

title: Methadone Clinic in Bronx Closed by Staff Dispute
description: Albert Einstein College of Medicine has closed down a recently opened methadone maintenance clinic in the Bronx after a confrontation between school officials and the clinic's staff.

title: Canadian Gets Life in Terrorist Slaying
description: MONTREAL, March 13Paul Rose, a 27yearold itinerant Who occasionally taught school, was sentenced to life imprisonment today for his part in the slaying of Pierre Laporte, Quebec's Minister of Labor and Immigration, last fall by the separatist Front for the Liberation of Quebec.

title: BLACKS USE HOME FOR CIVIC CAUSES
description: The many black homeowners who live in several Queens communities in the Jamaica area have not only accepted that postWorld War  social phenomenon known as the Finished Basement, but they have also embraced it, cultivated it and given it new dimensions.

title: Sheila Clarke Prospective Bride
description: BOSTON, March 13Mrs. A. Clark Woodard of Boston and Stonington, Conn., has announced the engagement of her granddaughter, Miss Sheila King Clarke, to James E. Heard of Washington. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. James E. Heard of Lake Charles, La.

title: Joel Cheskin to Marry Page Brown in Spring
description: SUMMERLAND KEY, Fla. March 13  Mr. and Mrs. L. PageBrown of Summerland Key and Villanova, Pa., have aringunced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Page Brown, to Joel R. Cheskin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving W. Cheskin of Croton N.Y.

title: California First in Quake
description: WASHINGTON, March 13 (UPI)California recorded 130 earthquakes to lead the nation in 1970, the Commerce Department has reported. Alaska was second with 68. Unlike the Feb. 9 quake, which killed 64 persons in Southern California, none of the United States earthquakes in 1970 caused a fatality.

title: Mink Acclimatized in Urals
description: MOSCOW, March 13 (AP)American minks transplanted in 1970 to the eastern slope of the Ural Mountains have adapted well, the official Soviet press agency Tass has reported.

title: West Virginia Legislature Approves StripMine Bill
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 13 (AP) The West Virginia Legislature outraced a midnight deadline tonight and approved a stripmine control bill, pay raises for public school teachers and state police troopers, a public kindergarten program and a $32million tax increase package.

title: Miss Van Winkle Wed To William H. Lewis 3d
description: Miss Edwina WhitehOnse Van Winkle was,married here yesterday afternoon to William Hall Lewis 3d, who has been assigned by the First National City Bank to the international banking group of its AsiaPacific division in Tokyo.

title: Books:
description: HOW TO MANAGE YOUR COMPANY ECOLOGICALLY. By Jerome Goldstein, Rodale Press, distributed by David McKay Company. 1.19 pages. $1.95.

title: Brooklyn High School Blends Class Work and Jobs
description: Running into a truant officer on the street one day hardly seemed like good luck to Alexander Jennings. But the officer asked him a strange question:

title: Announcements
description: Engagements

title: CASINO CONCESSION AWARDED BY LISBON
description: LISBON, March 13Portugal has awarded a concession for the opening of three gambling casinos in the new resort area in her southernmost province, Algarve.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: PRESIDENT NIXON rejected as inadequate the Japanese textile Industry's offer to voluntarily curb exports to the United States. Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, who played an im portant behindthescenes role in the Japanese plan expressed disappointment at the President's statement and hinted he would not support the legislated quotas sought by Mr. Nixon.

title: Et A1.
description: A survey of JeanPaul Sartre's work, by the chairman of the Romance languages department at Wesleyan. Earnest, selfindulgent, thorough, goodwilled pedestrian. A stroll through the groyes of academe.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 13Here is the roster of new militant groups that have been formed In the past week:

title: DEFERRED TUITION OFFERED BY DUKE
description: DURHAM, N. C., March 13Duke University will offer a deferred tuition plan to a select number of good risk students, beginning this fall.

title: WagePrice Freeze Is Endorsed by 49% In a Gallup Survey
description: WASHINGTON, March 13More Americans would welcome wageprice controls than would reject them, according to a Gallup Poll released today.

title: Compte Deux Length Victor in $25,000 Rebel Handicap
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., March 13 (AP)  R. E. Lehmann's Compte Deux beat Mary Van Wyk's Arkansasbred Bixa by a length to capture the $25,000 Rebel Handicap at Oaklawn Park today.

title: Dr. Jacob Jacobowitz, 65; Known for Charitable Work
description: Dr. Jacob Jacobowitz, a retired physician known for his charitable service on the Lower East Side for many years, died Friday of a heart attack. He was 65 years old and lived at 6910 108th Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: McMahon Facing First Test As Australia's Prime Minister
description: SYDNEY, March 13Before returning from Canberra to his home in Sydney for his first weekend as head of the Australian Government, Prime Minister William McMahon took steps to attack problems inherited from his predecessor, John G. Gorton.

title: Schenk Sets World Record In 5,000Meter Skating
description: INZELL, West Germany, March 13 (AP) Ard Schenk of the Netherlands established a world record of 7 minutes 12 seconds, today for the 5,000meter speedskating competition.

title: Service Jobs Rise Rapidly
description: Services ranging from cleaning and pressing to haircuts, have been gathering momentum nationally as a fastgrowing component of the Gross National Product. An idea of the dimensions of this growth includes the fact that since 1947 six of every seven new jobs added in the nation have been service jobs.

title: the traveler's world
description: THE name Park Lane is resonant with memories for New Yorkers and visitors this side of the generation gap who recall with happy nostalgia the dignified, gracious, 488room hotel that became so well the east side of Park Avenue between 48th and 49th Streets from 1927 until June 30, 1965. Then it was engulfed by the economic wave of office buildings that swept up the avenue, overtaking the Sheraton Ambassador East, another grande dame of a hotel, and leaving only the WaldorfAstoria in the block above the Park Lane. The latter was tumbled down to become a 42story glassy office building at 299 Park Avenue, known as the Westvaco Building for its owner, the West Virginia Company, manufacturer of paper products and of developments.

title: FRENCH AIR STRIKE HELPS RAILROADS
description: PARIS, March 13The 6 o'clock train used to leave almost empty. It's been jammed the past few days.

title: Announcements
description: BIERMANEllen and Meyer, Congratulations on your 25th wedding anniversary. Have a good time abroad; Love.

title: Villanova Eliminates St. Joseph's, 93 to 75, in First Round of the N. C. A.
A funeral ship buffeted by gales of laughter
Mrs. Freda Ettinger, Taught Arts at Washington High
description: Mrs. Freda Stern Ettinger, who retired from the fine arts department of George Washington High School in 1958, died here Wednesday. She lived at 330 West 72d Street and in Sandy Hook, Conn.

title: The Nightingale That Roared
description: Years ago the frail young daughter of Jawaharlal Nehru delivered an impromptu speech in Durban, South Africa, that was so bold it stunned her audience respectable Indian merchants. It was as though nightingale had suddenly started to roar, Indianborn author Dom Moraes observed in a recent article about Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: United Fund Gets Drive Chairman
description: The appointment of J. Henry Smith, president and chief executive of the Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States, as general chairman for the United Fund of Greater New York's 1971 annual citywide appeal beginning May 4 was announced yesterday by J. K. Jamieson, chairman of the fund's board.

title: Exercisers and Researchers At  Y  Here Have Heart in Mind
description: Yesterday, some men found themselves wired for sound, aboard bicycles, pumping hard and going nowhere at the West Side Young Men's Christian Association.

title: ASHE BEATS LUTZ IN STRAIGHT SETS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 13 (UPI)Arthur Ashe moved into the final of the $56,000 Australian open tennis championship tonight by defeating Bob Lutz, 64, 6.4, 75.

title: Army Judge Fighting Bias in Germany Is Called Home for Talks at Pentagon
description: An Army judge, one of seven black officers and enlisted men who have asked that an Army, court of inquiry investigate housing discrimination against black American troops in West Germany, has been returned to the United States and has been talking with Pentagon officials for a week.

title: If Muni were only alive to play Sigi
description: Dear Nephew:

title: H. C. Barkhorn. Plans to Marry Miss Jean Cook
description: Miss Jean Davis Cook, managing editor of Town & Country magazine,and Henry Charles Barkhorn of Springfield., N. J., vice president and treasurer of Mutual of New York, plan to marry.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANY  He's convinced that we're going right down the road to disaster if we don't do something about the welfare problem.

title: Bridgeport Is Taking Steps To Clean Up Waterfront
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., March 13 (UPI)Shoreline property owners will receive a courtesy warning from the Bridgeport harbormaster to clean up debris within two months or face action by the United States Coast Guard.

title: Long Beach Gains Berth
description: LOGAN, Utah, March 13 (AP)  Ed Ratleff got 31 points tonight in leading Long Beach State to a 77.66 victory over Weber State and a berth in the N.C.A.A. Far West regional tournament next week.

title: Prying is a kind of rape achieved on terms of droit du seigneur
description: Technicians of the commercial laboratory and assembly line, as Russell Baker once pointed out, are motivated not by whether something should be built but solely by whether it can be built. From the disposable bottle to the S.S.T. plane, that is the law of our technocratic jungle; and since today's laser technology already makes it feasible to store a twentypage dossier on every American on a piece of tape that is less than five thousand feet long, Arthur R. Miller, a professor of law at the University of Michigan Law School and our guide through this corner of the jungle, wisely urges us to get ready for the era of the super electronic snoops.

title: Bruins Conquer Canucks, 6 to 3, Rallying for Four Goals in Second Period
R. &
description: Research and development, still a multimilliondollar matter nationally in both the public and private sectors of the economy, is being given a thorough systems approach by two Michigan professors.

title: Renee Bauchat, Student, Plans May Wedding
description: BELLEVUE, Wash., March 13Mr. and Mrs. James L. Bauchat, formerly of Sum:mit, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lois Renee Bauchat, to David Stephen Rosenbloom. He is the son of Carroll Rosenbloom, president mid owner of the Baltimore Colts, and Mrs. Anderson Rosenbloom of Margate, N. J. His fattier., who lives in Golden Beach, Fla., has turned over to him the daytoday operation of the world championship football team.

title: Parking Violator Fined $635
description: CLEVELAND, March 13 (UPI) Dolores Thomas, 22 years old, who had been termed by the police as the city's most. wanted traffic violator, has paid $635 in back fines on 81 outstanding parking tickets. I have only 17 tickets at home, Miss Thomas said when she paid her fines last Tuesday. I don't know how they can say I have 81.

title: British Bowing Out in Persian Gulf Area
description: DUBAI, March 13British officials in the Persian Gulf area are winding up the special treaty relationships Britain has with the seven Trucial States, Qatar and Bahrain. The British Foreign Secretary said recently that these treaty relationships would terminate at the end of the year.

title: Hope Is Offered to Hemophiliacs At Long lsiann Medical Center
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I., March 13A 4yearold boy was riding in the front seat of his father's car when the father was forced to stop the auto suddenly. It was a common occurrence on today's busy highways and the only injury that resulted from the quick stop was when the boy's head hit the car's dashboard lightly.

title: Art
description: Ar Wildenstein & Co., 19 East 64th Street, there is a large exhibition Just now called From Realism to Symbolism: Whistler and His World, which has been organized by the Department of Art History and Archaeology at Columbia University in cooperation with the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The idea for this exhibition, according to the preface of the substantial catalogue accompanying the show, grew out of a seminar given at Columbia in the autumn of 1969 in which the students looked at Whistler's relations with his contemporaries as a means of examining the complexity of the various progressive developments in the art of the later nineteenth century. The exhibition is intended neither as a conventional oneman exhibition, nor as a survey of the period. Its purpose is to explore international crosscurrents, using Whistler's friendships and connections as a focus.

title: First Gorilla Born in Britain
description: BRISTOL, England, March 13 (A.P)The Bristol Zoo has announced the birth of The Little Fellathe first gorilla born in Britain and the fourth in Europe. The zoo said that the 3 pound. gorilla was born to Caroline and Samson last Saturday.

title: Mailbox :
description: To the Editor:

title: 15 Years of Mistakes
description: FIFTEEN years ago, on March 24, 23 string players and a harpsichordist gathered on the stage of the New School's 500seat hall to play a program of Handel concerti grossi. The concert was given in the afternoon and repeated in the evening to accommodate the many who wanted to hear it. Tickets were priced at a dollar.

title: 4 In Worcester Die In Apartment Fire; 19 Others Injured
description: WORCESTER, Mass., March 14 (AP)Fire swept through a fivestory apartmentbusiness complex near the downtown section tonight, killing four per sons and injuring 19 others, the police reported. The police said most of the injured had been treated for smoke inhalation.

title: MUSIC'S ABSENCE MARKS 5 DANCES
description: Five dances by as many young choreographers had one thing in common in the Choreo concerts series Saturday after noon at the New Schoolrejec tion of live and taped music in favor of silence or the voice, in words or without.

title: Company Decides to Halt BladeinNewspaper Ads
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (AP)A company under Gov ernment attack for distributing razor blade samples in pack ages attached to newspapers said today that it would halt the practice.

title: Assad Sworn in Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, March 14 (Reuters)Lieut. Gen. Hafez AlAssad, 41 years old, was sworn in tonight for a seven year term as Syria's 14th Presi dent since the country won independence from France in 1943. The ceremony took place at a special session of Parlia ment.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 15, 1971

title: Little Theater of Deaf Stages Children's Skits
description: Yesterday afternoon at the Forum Theater in Lin coln Center, the Little Thea ter of the Deaf presented Journeys, a show that is instructive for the hearing and entertaining for the deaf and also has a theatri cal life of its own.

title: Cross Burned in Asbury Park
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., March 14  The police here are in vestigating the burning of a large wooden cross last night in a small park area in the heart of the business section. The 4by6foot cross made of 2inch boards wrapped in kerosenesoaked rags burst into flame suddenly as Special Pa trolman Perry Lameo ap proached it shortly after 9 P. M. The cross was attached to a telephone pole about 8 feet from the ground.

title: 2 FIERCE BATTLES IN LAOS REPORTED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 14  South Vietnamese forces in Laos fought two stiff battles over the weekend, an army spokesman said today.

title: Home to Visit U.A.R.
description: CAIRO, March 14 (Reuters) The British Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, will visit the United Arab Republic at the invitation of the Egyptian Foreign Minister, Mahmoud Riad. British officials here said that the visit was likely to take place in August or September.

title: French Opposition Parties Lead in Municipal Ballots
description: PARIS, Monday, March 15 Opposition parties appeared early this morning to have withstood a challenge from supporters of the Pompidou Government in elections yester day in 37,713 municipalities.

title: Black Hawks Rally To Tie Blues, 44, In Closing Minutes
description: CHICAGO, March 14 (UPI) The Chicago Black Hawks wiped out a twogoal lead by the St. Louis Blues three times today and earned a 44 tie in the National Hockey League game on Bryan Campbell's goal with 1 minute 40 seconds left.

title: David Silfen to Wed Lyn Gordon in June
description: The engagement of Miss Lyn Gordon to David M. Sil fen, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Silfin of New York has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jules M. Gordon, also of New York. A June wedding is planned.

title: 7 Killed in Utah Road Crash
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 14 (AP)  Seven persons, six of them members of one family, were killed last night in a headon collision between a car and a camper truck near Salt Lake City. The dead were iden tified as Phil Nunez, 33 years old, of Salt Lake City; his wife Susie, 27; four Nunez children, Randy, 14; Michael, 11; Debra, 9, and Dewayne, 6, and Lois Kendrick, 40, of Salt Lake City.

title: Interviewer Not Available
description: LONDON, March 14  Mr. Heren was on his way home from Israel today and could not be reached for comment on the terms of his conversation with Mrs. Meir. The Times had no comment.

title: Kostelanetz Blends Strong Forces for Song Cycle
description: Since Benjamin Britten's Les Illuminations is a song cycle that seems to grow more beau tiful with each passing year, and because Phyllis Curtin is a particularly fine interpreter of the work, it is reasonable, if a bit surprising, that Andr Kostelanetz should have fea tured it and her for the second time in three years in one of his Saturdaynight concerts with the New York Philhar monic. The first time was Feb. 10, 1968, the second took place Saturday evening.

title: Houdini Wins Tampa Jump
description: TAMPA, Fla,, March 14 Houdini, ridden by Steve Stephens, won the American Gold Cup with two perfect rounds today at Tampa Stadium before 12,000 spectators.

title: Chess : Zuckerman Tops Field of 23 In Continental Experts Play
description: Bernard Zuckerman, an American master from Brook lyn, led a field of 23 players in the Continental Experts sevenround Swiss system by winning with the score of 6 at the Hotel McAlpin. Second spot was taken by Lubomir Kavalek, a former Yugoslav master, 61, and third, at 52, went to Robert Byrne, a United States grand master who formerly lived in Indianapolis and now resides in New York.

title: COAST EDUCATOR WALKS TIGHTROPE
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 14After two months as State Superintendent of Public In struction, Wilson C. Riles has evolved a fancy tightrope walk that he hopes will keep him out of conflicts that would pre vent the reforms he hopes to achieve in state support of lo cal schools.

title: SONGS BY THE PATONS TOUR THE FOLKWAYS
description: An intrepid team of collectors of folk songs and traditional ballads, Sandy and Caroline Paton, dug deep into their song bag Saturday night to create a wide ranging program at the 92d Street Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Asso ciation.

title: JAPANESEEXPLORE U. S. TEXTILE MOOD
description: TOKYO, March 14After their initial shock over the stem tone of President Nixon's statement rejecting the Japa nese plan for unilateral re strictions on textile exports to the United States, leaders of industry and government in this country have settled down to await the outcome of the President's contest with Rep resentative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: British Strikers Defiant
description: LONDON, March 14 (AP) Ford workers voted overwhelm ingly today to continue a sevenweekold strike that has paralyzed the company's 21 automobile plants in this coun try. A meeting attended by 10,000 strikers at Dagenham, near London, erupted in yells of defiance against Henry Ford II, who arrived here yesterday.

title: NORDWIG BETTERS POLE VAULT MARK
description: SOFIA, March 14 (UPI)The second European indoor track and field championships ended today with a total of three world records bettered. About 300 athletes from 23 nations competed in the twoday meet.

title: Arts Abroad
description: DUBLINThe International Theater Festival now run ning in Dublin has more sig nificance than any of its 12 predecessors, for it introduces a new policy in national imagebuilding on the part of those who regulate such things. Henceforth. March is not to be exclusively a month of shamrock and sentimentality, and March 17 is not to be exclu sively a day of booze and green bowlers. St. Patrick's Day will continue to be celebrated with parades, carousing and much gaiety, but the jollifica tions in future will take place within a broad, cultural framework.

title: NATHANIEL ARNOT, NAVAL FURNISHER
description: BALTIMORE, March 14 (AP) Nathaniel duBois Arnot, a noted naval interior designer, died of heart ailment Thursday at his winter home, Cape Santa Marie, on Long Island, the Bahamas. He was 59 years old.

title: Volpe to Bid States Adopt No Fault Auto Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, March 14  The Nixon Administration will endorse no fault automobile insurance this week, urging states to adopt the system that covers injuries and losses di rectly regardless of the cause of an accident.

title: REPUBLIC CORP. REPORTS DEFICIT
description: The Republic Corporation, a diversified industrial company based in Los Angeles, reported yesterday a net loss of $22, 216,000 in its first fiscal quar ter, ended Jan. 31, in contrast to an operating profit of $1, I1778,000, or 20 cents a share, in the yearearlier period.

title: Bodies of 2 Boys Are Found
description: FAIRHAVEN, Mass., March 14 (AP)The bodies of two of three boys missing since March 6 were found today by scuba divers working for the police. The bodies, which were not identified, were found off Fish Island, about 300 feet from where the boys were last seen.

title: Ringmaster Is Best Doberman at Saw Mill
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 14 Five days a week Therese Laz zaro of Wassaic N. Y., teaches physical education at New Mil ford High School. On weekends she gets her exercise at dog shows.

title: French Nobel Biologist Says World Based on Chance Leaves Man Free to Choose His Own Ethical Values
description: PARIS, March 14One of the molecular biologists who cracked the code of life argues that science can now answer the question: Was God throwing dice when he made the universe?

title: Albany Notes
description: ALBANY, March 14Like the genie let out of the bottle, Governor Rockefeller's $8.4billion state budget with its staggering $1.1billion tax package hangs over the cur rent legislative session.

title: Board of Education Is Ready to Accept Greater City Control Over Budget
description: The president of the Board of Education, Murry Bergtraum, declared yesterday that the board would accept greater municipal controls over its budgeting procedures if those controls did not extend to edu cational policies.

title: Loan Plan On Doctors Is Pressed
description: DETROIT, March 14  A group of medical students here has proposed that stu dents who need money in denture themselves to towns that need doctors in ex change for college expenses.

title: Advertising:
description: Scandinavian Airlines Sys tem and Gaynor & Ducas are splitting.

title: Financial Problems Plague Schools Across the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, March 14  New York City is not alone; the school system of nearly every large city in the country is in desperate financial straits, and budget deficits, teacher layoffs and reduced services in the schools are the rule rather than the exception.

title: West Virginia Legislature Bars Total Halt in New Strip Mining
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., March 14The State Legislature has decisively defeated for this year a strong attempt to halt the spread of strip mining through out West Virginia, but the fight appears to be far from over.

title: ZUKERMAN IS SOLOIST AT BENEFIT CONCERT
description: Frederic Waldman and his Musica Aeterna Orchestra usu ally specialize in rarely en countered music, but they made an exception at Carnegie Hall Friday night, with a pro gram listing such staples of the repertory as Rossini's Silken Ladder Overture, Schubert's Fifth Symphony and the Men delssohn Violin Concerto.

title: City Proposes 2,600 MixedIncome Apartments on Yorkville Site
description: The City Housing and Devel opment Administration has pro posed construction of 2,600 apartments for lowincome and middleincome families in York ville.

title: QUASARS FAR OFF, SCIENTIST FINDS
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 14 (AP)  A young astronomer at the California Institute of Tech nology has discovered long sought evidence that mysterious quasars  intensely bright, starlike objects  are as dis tant as they seem.

title: Bridge: New York Team Leads Field Into Men's Finals at Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, March 14  A New York foursome led the field of 70 teams into the final session of the Men's Team Championship here to night at the American Con tract Bridge League's Spring Nationals.

title: CANADIENS DOWN PENGUINS, 5 TO 1
description: PITTSBURGH, March 14 (UPI)The Montreal ?? coasted to a 5.1 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight in a National Hockey League game.

title: Moorer Says Saigon Strike In Laos Is Nearly at Peak
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (UPI)Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said today that the South Vietnamese strike in Laos was just about at the peak and had severely disrupted North Vietnam's military operations.

title: 49 BOATS ARE LOST IN SHIPYARD FIRE
description: ESSEX, Conn., March 14 Fortynine pleasure boats, in cluding a new yacht valued at $250,000, were destroyed by fire here this morning after an explosion in the main storage and repair building of a ship yard.

title: College Chiefs Meet to Prepare for Their Biggest Fiscal Test
description: HARRIMAN, N. Y.For five days last week, 57 col lege presidents, and the rep resentatives of 10 more, dwelt in baronial style in an elegant country mansion here while they grappied with what is to many of them the paramount issue of the day: How their institutions can survive the financial crunch that is upon them.

title: APPOINTED JUDGES URGED AT PARLEY
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., March 14 (AP)  A national con ference on the judiciary agreed today that all state court judges should be appointed to long terms by a nonpartisan com mission rather than elected. The judges would be subject to removal if they did not do the job.

title: Mission Reported Completed
description: HAMNGHI, South Vietnam, March 14 (AP)  South Viet namese forces in Laos have ful filled their mission according to plans, their commanding general said today.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., March 14 (AP)The Buffalo Sabres incensed by a 91 loss 24 hours before, routed the Minnesota North Stars, 50, tonight.

title: OffDuty Policeman Shot
description: John Lambe, a 40yearold offduty patrolman, was shot three times in the head and body last night in an argument in the apartment of a friend, Herbirito Perez, 40, at 330 Third Avenue. Patrolman Lambe, who is attached to the West 21st Street station, was in critical condition at Bellevue Hospital. Mr. Perez, who suffered a gun shot wound in his right shoul der, was charged with at tempted murder and possession of a dangerous weapon.

title: A Soviet Magazine Distorts Book by Justice Douglas
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 A Soviet academic periodical has portrayed Associate Justice William O. Douglas of the Su preme Court as an apostle of liberalism who has lost his faith in democracy in a cen sored and distorted version of his latest book.

title: Bucks Bow by 125113 to Suns;
description: MADISON, Wis., March 14 (UPI)The Phoenix Suns got Lew Alcindor in foul trouble and kept their playoff hopes alive by handing the Milwau kee Bucks their third loss in a row, 125113, tonight.

title: Why Not John Lindsay?; Well, Because There Are Those Who Say He Is Unqualified
description: The carefully orchestrated perform ance of The Conversion of John Lind say (Aurelio, Opus 2) combined with the silence of New York Democrats who reject the suggestion that Lind say become the Democratic candidate for President in 1972, has left the im pression that all that is needed is for Mayor Lindsay to say I do and the New York Democratic party will make him its candidate. The impression is most misleading. There is, I believe, a majority of New York Democrats who reject the whole concept (while admiring the virtuoso perfomance).

title: New Procedures Help a Federal Court Reduce Backlog of Criminal Cases
description: A backlog of over 700 crimi nal cases has been reduced in Federal Court here by prosecu tors and judges who expect to dispose of the remaining cases within six months.

title: Celtics Conquer Bulls, 117104
description: BOSTON, March 14 (UP1) The Boston Celtics scored 15 straight points in the middle of the third period and went on to defeat the Chicago Bulls, 117104, today.

title: Clinton Topples Boys in Third Overtime for P.S.A.L. Basketball Crown
description: Led by Alfred Vialet's 23 points, DeWitt Clinton High of the Bronx beat highly favored Boys of Brooklyn in the third overtime period, 6361, for the Public Schools Athletic League basketball championship yester day.

title: Number of City Residents on Welfare Up 12% in Year as Long Island Rolls Increase 30%
description: New York City's relief rolls have risen 12.2 per cent in a year and Long Island's welfare rolls, swelled by defense cut backs and other economic troubles, have far outpaced the city's increase in proportion surging 30.7 per cent.

title: Bronx Theater Will House Museum for Minorities
description: A defunct movie palace in the Bronxthe old Fairmont Theater at 708 East Tremont Avenue  will in the near future house a little museum, an innovation in the area.

title: Shirley Verrett Sings Superb Azucena at Met
description: If there were no need for concern about the preservation of a beautiful voice, unreserved rejoicing would he in order for Shirley Verrett's triumph at the Metropolitan Opera Saturday afternoon.

title: Phillies' 2 Homers Down Koosman, 32
description: ST. PETERSBURG. Fla., March 14  Jerry Koosman became the first New York Met pitcher to work five in nings today  and the first to throw homerun balls in con secutive innings  as the Phil adelphia Phillies defeated the Mets, 32.

title: Laurence Wilson, Pianist, Offers Variety at Tully Hall
description: Laurence Wilson, the pianist who played at Tully Hall yes terday afternoon, has a very pleasing command of his in strument. His tone is velvety, his rhythm forthright and even, and he has an excellent ear for sonority, big and small.

title: 2 MORE CONCERNS BID FOR SATELLITE
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 The FairchildHiller Corporation and WashingtonTeleCommu nications, Inc., announced today that they planned to ask per mission tomorrow from the Federal Communications Com mission to construct and op erate domestic communications satellite systems.

title: New Rochelle Rites Held
description: NEW ROCHELLE, March 14 Hundreds of friends and neighbors joined by city offi cials and clergymen met here tonight at the Bethesda Baptist Church for a service dedicated to Whitney Young Jr., who was a resident of this city.

title: Elizabeth Eleven Beats Germans, 20, To Take South Lead
description: While New York Hota, leader in the North Group of the Ger manAmerican Soccer League, scored a close victory over Gottschee yesterday, the Ger manHungarians bowed to the GreekAmericans and allowed Elizabeth to take over first place in the South Group.

title: Accidental Bombing
description: SAIGON, March 14 (AP)  An American fighterbomber mistakenly attacked South Viet namese ground troops in Laos today, in the fifth accidental bombing of the campaign against the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a United States military spokes man said. Ten paratroopers were killed and 12 wounded.

title: EUROPEANS FIGHT CONTINENTAL CAN
description: BRUSSELS, March 14  The Common Market Commission is to tell the Continental Can Company, Inc., of the United States that its ownership of two companies making cans in Germany and the Netherlands gives it an abusively domi nant position on the market in northern Europe.

title: The New Red Cross
description: When an Army major was transferred from the New York area to Japan last summer, he left one daughter here in col lege. Within a month she had dropped out and gone with her boyfriend to the East Village, where they took up residence in his car. Soon both were far into the dope scene.

title: March We Must Not
description: With St. Patrick's Day fast approaching, the city's parade season is about to open. Another round of dis ruptions of urban life and trafficincreasingly numerous each yearwill soon begin.

title: Mrs. Meir Is Facing a Challenge In Parliament on Peace Efforts
description: JERUSALEM, March 14 Premier Golda Meir moved to day to try to head off an in ternal challenge to her Govern ment over the issue of whether the leadership had become too conciliatory in the international efforts for an ArabIsraeli set tlement.

title: Lakers 110100 Victors
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., March 14 (UPI)The Los Angeles Lakers continued to experiment for the playoffs tonight, but their practice session was good enough to hand the Detroit Pistons a 110100 defeat. Coach Joe Mullaney used all his play ers, including Earnie Killum, who scored his first point.

title: Network Heads Are Divided on Joint News Coverage
description: The presidents of the news divisions of the three major television networks were di vided yesterday in their opin ions of the proposal made last week by Fred W. Friendly for creation of an electronic news service.

title: Lawyer Is Fiance Of Miss Rothchild
description: Mr. and Mrs. Luigi Roth child of New York and Belleair, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marisol Helene Rothchild, to Michael Andrew Laux, He is the son of Mrs. Claire Laux of West port, Conn., and New York, and David Laux of Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: NASDAQ to TestQuote Third Market
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 The National Association of Securities Dealers, in a partial reversal of an earlier stand, has agreed to determine whether its new, automated stock price quotations system, NASDAQ, should be used by brokers who make offfloor markets in stocks that aye listed on exchanges.

title: Grand Diplomeby Magazine
description: England had first crack at it, then Canada. Now the same correspondence course will bestow its a Grand Di plome in this country to stu dents who learn to cook in their own kitchens in the manner of the great French Chefs. At least that's the way they're supposed to be able to cook after buying 72 issues of a new weekly maga zine called Grand Diplme, its editors say.

title: Felice Ader Bride Of David Ostrow
description: Miss Felice Eileen Ader was married here at noon yesterday to David W. Os trow. Rabbis Stanley Drey fuss and Max Routtenberg performed the ceremony in the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: POPE AGAIN DEMANDS VOICE ON JERUSALEM
description: ROME, March 14Pope Paul VI today reiterated the Vati can's longstanding demand for a role in any international de cision on the status of Jeru salem and Christianity's other shrines in the Holy Land.

title: Miss Aviva Joy Bornstein Bride Of Rabbi at Brooklyn Center
description: Miss Aviva Joy Bornstein of London and Rabbi David M. Feldman, for the last 10 years leader of the congrega tion of the Bay Ridge Jewish Center of Brooklyn, were married at the center yester day afternoon,

title: BOND MEN EXPECT DECLINE IN RATES
description: The credit markets became convinced last week that inter est rates once again are headed downward.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Dr. Mark M. Rubin Weds Gail Tanney
description: ALPINE, N. J., March 14 Miss Gail Joyce Tanney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. O. Morley Tanney of Engle wood, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Mark Michael Rubin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel Rubin of Jersey City. Rabbi Irwin I. Blank performed the cere mony at the Tamcrest Coun try Club.

title: Improved State Aid Urged For Nation's City Schools
description: WASHINGTON, March 14  State governments must over haul their unequal and mis matched methods of aiding overburdened innercity schools, a group of business executives urged today.

title: H. L. Susswein And Jane Riffin Marry in Jersey
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 14  Miss Jane Elizabeth Riffin and Harvey L. Suss wein were married here this afternoon in Temple Shomrei Emunah by Rabbi Jeshaia Schnitzer.

title: Couple Gives Up Travel to Teach and Learn at a College for MexicanAmericans
description: MERCEDES, Tex., March 10 This was the year that Mrs. Marta P. Cotera had hoped to spend in Europe with her hus band. Instead, she found her self installed on the second floor of a fallingdown mansion in the Rio Grande Valley of Texas, trying to put together a makeshift library for a con troversial new education cen ter for MexicanAmericans.

title: 3 Empty Tankers Beached At Israeli Oil Port by Gale
description: TEL AVIV, March 14Three empty oil tankers were blown ashore during the night in a 50knot gale at the Mediter ranean terminal, at Ashkelon, of the Elath to Ashkelon pipe line. All crews were reported unhurt.

title: Her Uphill Fight For Harvard H
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 14When Sue Cochran, a 19yearold sophomore at Radcliffe College, graduates, her degree won't be from the allgirl school but from its allmale affiliate, Harvard.

title: Transportation: A Failure of Mind
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Many people who are willing to concede that the railroad must be brought back to life are chiefly thinking of bringing this about on the very terms that have robbed us of a balanced transportation networkthat is, by treating speed as the only important factor, forgetting reliability, comfort and safety, and seeking some mechanical dodge for increasing the speed and automation of surface vehicles.

title: PALMER CAPTURES GOLF AT ORLANDO WITN BOROS NEXT
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 14 Arnold Palmer won his second tournament within a month to day and became golf's leading money winner of the year with a thrilling onestroke victory over Julius Boros in the Florida Citrus invitation.

title: Agronomists Seek Improved African Crops
description: IBADAN, Nigeria  Dr. James C. Moomaw sloshed across a tiny rice paddy in his high rubber boots, picked a couple of grains from a yellowing stalk, and scratched them with his fin gernail.

title: Two Federal Inspectors Deny Any Impropriety in Connection With Fatal Mine Explosion
description: HAZARD, Ky., March 14 They've ruined me. I'm going to retire under a cloud. But I don't mind for myself. I just don't like what they did to that boy.

title: Nureyev Dazzling Brussels Fans in Be jart Duet
description: BRUSSELS, March 14At the new Forest National arena here, Rudolf Nureyev is dancing in a long duet es pecially created by Maurice Bjart for him and Paolo Bortoluzzi, leading man of Bjart's 20thCentury Ballet. Set to Mahler's Lieder Eines Fahrenden Gesellen, this treats the theme of the songs abstractly to show a man traveling through life and suffering while he seeks his destiny.

title: Italian Cyclist Triumphs
description: SAN BENEDETTO DEL TRONTO, Italy, March 14 (UPI) Italo Zilioli of Italy won the sixth annual Tyrrhenian to the Adriatic cycling race today after leading the way since the second day of the fiveday event.

title: Rosewall Beats Ashe for Aussie Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 14 (AP)  Ken Rosewall of Australia took advantage of Arthur Ashe's 13 double faults and beat the American, 61, 76, 63, today for the $10,080 first prize in the Dunlop Aus tralian open, tennis tournament.

title: LEON SPACHNER, 87, THEATER MANAGER
description: Leon Spachner, a retired theatrical manager, who had been associated with S. Hurok and the late George M. Cohan, died Saturday in Polyclinic Hos pital. He was 87 years old and lived at 101 West 55th Street.

title: 301 OF THE WEALTHY SAID TO ESCAPE TAX
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (UPI)  There were 301 Americans with incomes of more than $200,000 who paid no income tax for 1969, ac cording to data released today by Representative Henry S. Reuss, Democrat of Wisconsin.

title: Nixons to Announce Betrothal of Tricia To Harvard Student
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 President and Mrs. Nixon will announce the engagement of their daughter Tricia to Edward Finch Cox, a Harvard law stu dent, at a gathering at the White House Tuesday night, informed sources confirmed today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.C.L.A. Shoots for No.5 As the Others Shoot for It
description: The annual guessing game is on: Is there a team capable of stopping the University of California, Los Angeles, from winning a fifth straight nation al championship? Is Marquette the team to do it? Or will it be South Carolina? Is there a sleeper in the field?

title: Visit to Jupiter
description: The mission of Pioneer Fthe spacecraft that will be launched next year to visit giant Jupiter and send back photographs and scientific dataopens some of the most exciting vistas yet in the entire space program. If accom plishedand there are many extraordinary hazards to be overcomethis mission would mark a major advance In man's understanding of a hitherto unpenetrated section of the solar system.

title: S. F. Techet Weds Joan Richards
description: RALEIGH, N. C. March 14 In St. Michael's Episcopal Church here today, Miss Joan Nelson Richards, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward N. Richards of Raleigh and Pine hurst, was married to Steven Francis Techet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank J. Techet Jr. of New York and Nassau Point, L. I. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. James D. Beckwith.

title: 200 Honor Whitney Young Here As U.S. Jet Flies In With Body
description: The body of Whitney M. Young Jr., executive director of the National Urban League, was returned to the United States late yesterday afternoon as about 200 dignitaries gathered on a taxiing strip at Kennedy International Airport to honor him.

title: Week's Votes In Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 Following are the votes of dele gations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yester day:

title: Tucson Open Is ReNamed
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 14 Another golf tourney on the pro circuit will have its name changed in 1972 to include that of a celebrity. Hereafter, the Tucson open, held during January, will be known as the Dean MartinTucson open, Joseph C. Dey Jr., pro com missioner, announced today.

title: Personal Finance
description: Automobile insurance rates, advancing steadily almost everywhere, will rise still fur ther before very long.

title: Embattled Radio Free Europe Defends Role
description: BONN, March 14  Shortly before midnight last Dec. 15, a 51yearold native of Poland named Andrzej Przewoski sat languorously in a groundfloor monitoring studio of the Radio Free Europe building in Munich listening simultaneously to two regional broadcasts from Po land.

title: W. Wendell Blancke, 62, Dies; ExEnvoy to 4 African Nations
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 W. Wendell Blancke, a retired Ambassador and Foreign Serv ice officer, died here this morn ing. He was 62 years old and suffered a stroke two weeks ago.

title: News Analysis
description: In explaining why he was proposing an $880.7million tax Increase, Mayor Lindsay cited three basic reasons for in creases in costs over which he would seem to have little con trol. But some Councilmen and budget experts have raised questions about this concept.

title: T.V.A. on Trial
description: When President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Senator George W. Norris conceived the Tennessee Valley Authority in 1933, they had a much more spacious con cept than merely the generation of cheap electricity. They envisaged a vast undertaking which would con serve the land and water, redeem the scars of exploita tion, and nourish rural and smalltown life in one of America's great river valleys. Their dream has largely been realized.

title: U.S. WOMEN BEST IN GIANT SLALOM
description: WILMINGTON, N. Y., March 14The United States finally bombed its way to direct hits today. In the threeday World Student Alpine. Racing Trials.

title: 600 British Soldiers Carry Out Big Security Check Near Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 14 (AP)Six hundred British soldiers, helped by helicopters, carried out today What was described as the big gest security operation in the last two years of strife in Northern Ireland.

title: Man In the News
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 14Most busy officials dis play a certain amount of ten sion and preoccupation, but not Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the Bengali nationalist who has emerged in recent months as the undisputed leader of the people of East Pakistan.

title: Tavern Damaged by Bomb
description: BELFAST, March 14 (Reuters)  A bomb tonight damaged a tavern on the outskirts of Bel fast near the spot where three British soldiers were slain last week.

title: The Wasted People
description: WASHINGTON  Because of the ground invasions into populous areas of Cambodia and Laos and the pound ings from the air that have reached a tempo of a thousand sorties a day, a new vale of tears is flowing across Southeast Asia.

title: Yanks Find New McLain Retains the Winning Habit
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 14The old Denny McLain and the new Denny McLain were on display at Fort Lauderdale Stadium today as the Washington Senators whipped the Yankees, 74, extending New York's losing streak to six games.

title: New Discount Chain Discussed
description: Recently, the heads of 10 regional discountstore chains around the country met in New York. Purpose: to dis cuss the advisability of founding a new, national chain of discounters with an nual sales in excess of $600 million. Reason: to obtain through a merger better pro tection in each company's area against new competition and to obtain better finan cial leverage.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: CLEVELAND, March 14 (UPI)  The Cincinnati Royals kept their playoff hopes alive to night by defeating the Cleve land Cavaliers, 115103.

title: Court and Conscience
description: The Supreme Court's 8to1 ruling upholding the right of Congress to limit draft exemptions for conscientious objectors to those who oppose all warsdenying ex emptions to objectors to particular warsresolves an agonizing constitutional dilemma by assigning broad priority to the security prerogatives of the state over the rights of individual conscience. There are weighty prac tical grounds for the Court's decision in the case of two conscientious objectors to the war in Indochina. But there are also reasons for serious concern about the implications for civil liberties in the treatment now ac corded selective conscientious objectors by Congress and by the highest court.

title: Alan Darnell to Wed Miss Joan Silverman
description: Miss Joan Silverman and Alan M. Darnell have made plans to be married in Sep tember.

title: City Pension Costs Snowballing
description: The city and state govern ments, which are now tight ening their belts to meet a fiscal crisis, face at least one expenditure whose relentless growth cannot be curbed, not now and not for at least 20 years.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: PORTLAND, Ore., March 14 (AP)The Portland Trail Blaz ers stormed from behind in the second half today and swept past the Buffalo Braves, 122 112, in a foulfilled National Basketball Association game. Sixtytwo personal and four technical fouls were called.

title: LEADER IN DACCA ACTS TO TAKE OVER
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Monday, March 15  Sheik Mujibur Rahman announced early today that he was taking over admin istration of East Pakistan.

title: Dole Accuses Democrats Of Radical Exhibitionism
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (AP)Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, the Republican Na tional Chairman, accused the Democratic party today of adopting the fashionable code of the New Left, radical ex hibitionism.

title: BRANDY'S PARTY WINS BERLIN VOTE BUT MARGIN SLIPS
description: BERLIN, March 14  The Social Democrats suffered losses, but retained a majority in West Berlin's parliament, in elections today that were widely considered a test of Chancellor Willy Brandt's pol icy of seeking to improve rela tions with the Soviet bloc.

title: Article 14  No Title
description: JERUSALEM, March 14 (AP) Snow fell On Jerusalem for the first time in three years.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, March 14The following is a Hat loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Augert, Miss Proell Win in Ski Finales
description: AARE, Sweden, March 14 (UPI)  JeanNoel Augert, world slalom champion, gave the French consolation for their defeat in the Alpine skiing by beating the World Cup victor in today's slalom, the last event of the 197071 series.

title: Folly on Textiles
description: President Nixon has angrily rejected the Japanese plan for restricting textile exports to this countrya plan submitted in response to an initiative by Chairman Wil bur D. Mills of the House Ways and Means Committee. Mr. Mills, a man not easily pleased, had welcomed the Japanese plan as one that might eliminate any strong Congressional push this year for compulsory import quota legislation. Such an outcome would have removed the danger of an international wave of protectionism and opened the way for a return to the more liberal trade principles that Mr. Nixon enunciated in his State of the World message.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Six months ago, Davey Feld was carried out of Madi son Square Garden by a squad of special policemen before a crowd of more than 10,000 waiting to watch the main event between Floyd Patterson and Charlie Green. Feld had been appointed by the New York State Athletic Com mission to referee the bout, but at the last minute Patter son supposedly refused to come out unless Feld was re placed. The chairman of the commission, Edwin B. Dooley, stood firm briefly; among the reasons he appointed Feld, he later disclosed in testimony, was the rumor that the Garden controlled the appointment of officials.

title: WASTEDISPOSAL AID BY STATE REQUESTED
description: ALBANY, March 14Gover nor Rockefeller asked the Leg islature today to authorize fi nancial assistance to local gov ernments to help them buy equipment for the disposal of solid wastes.

title: Kidnapped Airmen Here
description: by Turkish terrorists before be ing released on March 8, re turned here last night for 39 days of relaxation. They ar rived from Turkey on a Pan American World Airways plane.

title: NO PARTY VICTOR IN WEST BENGAL
description: NEW DELHI, March 14 West Bengal voters have failed to give a majority mandate to any one party for forming a state government there.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bombings Renewed In Ankara
description: ANKARA, March 14 (AP) Terrorists resumed their bomb ing campaign today, setting off explosives at the United States Consulate, a branch of the AmericanTurkish Trading Bank and offices of the rightwing newspaper Dunya. The bombs smashed windows but inflicted no casualties, the police said.

title: CITY OPERA PRESENTS RETURN OF BARBER
description: The Barber of Seville, ab sent from the New York City Opera's repertory since 1968, returned yesterday afternoon with a new conductor (Giuseppe Morelli), a new Almaviva (Jerry Jennings) and a new Basilio (Ara Berberian). Rossini's masterly music and its perfectly con structed libretto generated much aural pleasure and more than enough burlesque humor, this being one of those Barbers that teeter too far toward the harlequinade in staging.

title: British Steel Corp. Runs Into Problems
description: LONDON March 14  The stateowned British Steel Cor poration is running into serious financial problems, and some of its longrange expansion pro grams are being questioned by the Conservative Government.

title: DEMIREL ADAMANT IN TURKISH CRISIS
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 14 Suleyman Demirel, forced out of office as Premier by an armed forces ultimatum two days ago, called on his parliamentary supporters today to back him and his ruling Justice party in the present constitutional crisis.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DR. MORRIS J. BOYER
description: FORT LEE, N.J., March 14 Dr. Morris J. Boyer, a dentist who specialized in oral sur gery, died today in Pascack Valley Hospital, Westwood. He was 77 years old and lived here at 5 Horizon Road.

title: Lisbon General Reports Gains in Mozambique War
description: LISBON, March 14General Kaulza de Arriaga, the military commander of Portugal's East African territory, says that his forces have sealed off the main guerrilla infiltration points along the Tanzanian border and captured the insurgents' princi pal bases in northern Mozam bique.

title: RELIEF COSTS SET A RECORD IN STATE OF $3.27BILLION
description: ALBANY, March 14  The cost of providing welfare and Medicaid assistance for 1.8 mil lion people throughout the state in 1970 was a record $3.27 billion, an increase of $347.8 million over 1969, state welfare officials announced today.

title: UNION ENDS STRIKE OF CAN COMPANIES
description: Local presidents of the Unit ed Steelworkers of America ac cepted new threeyear contracts last night with three major can manufacturers, thus ending a 28day strike against the com panies.

title: Soviet Lifter Sets 2 Marks
description: ROSTOVONDON, U.S.S.R., March 14 (AP)  David Rigert of the Soviet Union broke two world records today on his 24th birthday with a total lift of 1,193.5 pounds in the mid dle heavyweight division and a jerk of 446.6 pounds. Tartu Karl Utsar of the Soviet Union set a world mark in the heavy weight division with a snatch of 370.7 pounds.

title: Kennedy Puts Vietnam Civilian Dead at 25,000 in 1970
description: WASHINGTON, March 14  Senator Edward M. Ken nedy has estimated that at least 25,000 civilians were killed in the war in South Vietnam last year and that 100,000 were wounded.

title: Transit Strike Called Off
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 14 (UPI)The city's transit work ers called off today a threat ened strike that would have halted buses, trolleys and Sub ways for about a million com muters. The Transit Workers Union revoked a strike dead line for 12:01 A.M. tomorrow after the Southeastern Penn sylvania Transportation Au thority agreed that any con tract settlement would be retroactive to tomorrow.

title: L. I. Boy Killed by Car
description: WYANDANCH, L. I., March 14  A 15yearold boy was killed here early today when he was struck by an automobile that sped away after the ac cident, the police said. The victim was indentified as David Banks of Wyandanch.

title: 2 Agencies Warn of Peril In Intravenous Drug Device
description: ATLANTA, March 14 (UPI) Two national health agencies warned yesterday that special care must be exerted in the use of an intravenous drug product, apparently contam inated by a faulty bottle cap, that has been connected with nine deaths in hospitals across the nation.

title: DR. MORRIS SCHWARTZ
description: Dr. Morris Schwartz, who had been a general practitioner in Queens for 35 years, died Saturday in North Shore Hospi tal, Manhasset, L.I., of a heart attack. He was 60 years old and lived at 8304 63d Drive, Rego Park, Queens. Dr. Schwartz had an office in Middle Village, Queens. He graduated from Long Island University of Bonn, and served a medical officer in the Army in World War II.

title: MISSING GIRL FOUND SLAIN IN L.I. WOODS
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., March 14The body of an 18yearold girl, who had been reported missing by her parents on the night of March 3, was found in a wooded area here by two boys yesterday afternoon.

title: Rangers Defeat Leafs at Garden, 1 to 0;
description: In a probable preview of the first round of the Stanley Cup playoffs, the Rangers and Toronto Maple Leafs mauled each other last night in a game that had startling plays and outstanding goaltending.

title: Prices Affecting Orders for Steel; Hedging Continues
description: PITTSBURGH, March 14  Hedge buying of steel con tinued last week but it was not clear what aspect of the future was worrying users the most.

title: Buckley, Parading in Buffalo and Set for State Tour, Seems to Be Raising His Low Profile
description: BUFFALO, March 14Sena tor James L. Buckley's ready smile vanished for an instant the other day when a news man in Washington asked why he had been keeping such a low profile since taking office seven weeks ago.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, March 14  Your emerging interest in the 1972 Demo cratic nomination  the protocandi dacy, as they call it  should be welcomed by all those critical of the proposal for an American supersonic transport. No irony is intended.

title: Calley Judge Bars Any Finding Of Involuntary Manslaughter
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 14  The jury in the court martial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. must convict or acquit him of premeditated mur der, murder or voluntary man slaughter in the alleged mass killing of Vietnamese civilians at Mylai, the military judge said today.

title: Catholic Charities Plans Added Help For Young Addicts
description: Catholic Charities of New York will open six new cen ters this year for the treat ment of high school drug addicts, the director of the organization said yesterday.

title: C.B.S. Reported Ready to Drop Sullivan Show After 23 Years
description: The Ed Sullivan Show will end its record 23year run this season, industry sources said last night.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 14 (UPI)  Tom Webster's 27th goal at 7 minutes 30 seconds of the final period proved the win ner today as the Detroit Red Wings defeated the Seals, 85, with fourgoal outbursts in the second and third periods. The Wings had not won in their six previous games.

title: Stronger State Statute Is Urged On BottleClub Permits and Fees
description: ALBANY, March 14After hours bottle clubs where scores of thousands of bibulous night people slake extralong thirsts would be subject to tighter li censing and revenue regula tions under changes being sought by the Attorney Gener al's office.

title: A. S. M. Hutchinson Dies at 91; If Winter Comes Brought Fame
description: CROWBOROUGH, England, March 14 (AP)A. S. M. Hut chinson, English novelist who wrote the 1921 best seller If Winter Comes, died at his home here today. He was 91 years old.

title: New Soviet Manned Orbital Flight Seen
description: MOSCOW, March 14The Chief Designer of Spaceships was quoted today as saying that the Soviet Union was pre paring another manned orbital flight of long duration as a prelude to the creation of a permanent space laboratory.

title: 500 G.I.'S AT DEBUT OF ANTIWAR SHOW
description: FAYEITEVILLE, N, C., March 14With a gusto once re served for cadence counts, the battalion of young soldiers raise their voices in a lusty re frain:

title: Returning to House Wright Called Fallingwater
description: MILL RUN, Pa.Even ob soured by the swirling snow, Frank Lloyd Wright's multi decked house called Falling water seemed majestic.

title: Ruckelshaus Asks a Delay On Alaska Pipeline Permit
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environment al Protection Agency, has asked the Interior Department to hold up a rightofway permit for a transAlaska oil pipeline pending a thorough study of the environmental advantages of a route through Canada.

title: Liontamer, Chow Chow, Takes Top Prize at Washington Show
Haywood Pours In 35
description: SEATTLE, March 14 (AP) Spencer Haywood and Lenny Wilkens combined in the fourth quarter tonight to pace the Seattle Sonics to a 124121 vic tory over the Baltimore Bullets. Haywood scored a career high of 35 points.

title: 2 Named to City Health Unit
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the reappointment of a labor leader and a Staten Is land physician to the 16mem ber board of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation. The two, who will serve fiveyear terms, are William Michelson, president of the United Store workers of the Retail, Whole sale and Department Store Un ion, and Dr. Daniel J. Paulo, a specialist in internal medicine and gastrointestinal diseases.

title: Hamilton, Pianist, Plays Classics at Town Hall
Bank Plans Zurich Office
description: The Bankers Trust Company announced over the weekend it has been given approval by Swiss authorities to open a wholly owned subsidiary bank in Zurich called Bankers Trust AG. The new concern, with capital of $4.65million, will provide investment' advisory and trustee services for inter national investors.

title: Greece Begins Census
description: ATHENS, March 14 (AP) Greece began its first general census in a decade today. The population, estimated at 8.5 million, was asked to make sure that a family member was at home to help the 70,000 rep resentatives of the National Statistics Service.

title: Ervin Appeals to Laird for Help With Army Surveillance Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. has appealed directly to Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird for a fuller explanation of the Army's threeyear surveillance of civilians that the Pentagon says ended last year.

title: Books of The Times
description: HOW TO CHANGE COLLEGES. Notes on Rad ical Reform. By Harold Taylor. 180 pages. Holt, Rinehart & Winston. Hardcover, $4.95. Paperback, $2.45.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Easing of Travel To China Called Near
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 (Reuters)The State Depart ment is expected to announce early this week the elimina tion of restrictions on travel by Americans to Communist China, informed sources said today.

title: Rose Signs, Gets $2,500 As CostofLiving Raise
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 14 (AP)  Petc Rose signed his 1971 contract with the Cin cinnati Reds today for an es timated $2,500 costofliving raise, ending his 14day hold out.

title: N.Y.U. STUDENT HELD AS A DRUG PUSHER
description: The Bronx police yesterday arrested a 21yearold student whom they described as a major distributor of drugs on the New York University campus.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: YOUTH, 16, RIDES TO HUNTER TITLE
description: WESTON, Conn., March 14 David Distler, a 16yearold high school student from Larchmont, N. Y., rode Alot to the regular working hunter division A championship and captured the Maclay Trophy today at the Nimrod Farm's horse show.

title: Advertising:
description: Facing up to one of the major questions of the day in the agency business, the American Association of Ad vertising Agencies has issued a position paper on the full service ad agency.

title: RABBI GOLDIN, 90, AUTHOR, IS DEAD
description: Rabbi Hyman E. Goldin, au thor, Hebrew scholar, educator and lawyer, died yesterday at his home, 1547 45th Street, Brooklyn. He was 90 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LITHUANIANS BACK 3 IN MIDTOWN PROTEST
description: About 200 adherents of the Lithuanian  American Action Committee demonstrated in Times Square yesterday after noon in behalf of three Lithu anians in political difficulty in Turkey and the Soviet Union.

title: Blaze Ruins Headquarters Of Jersey Firemen's Unit
description: LONG BRANCH, N.J., March 14A fire of undetermined cause Wrecked the headquar ters of the Atlantic Hose Com pany, a volunteer fire organiza tion opposite City Hall and Police Headquarters here, early today.

title: Knicks Gain Division Title as 76ers Bow
description: ATLANTA, March 14  The Atlanta Hawks, who will prob ably be the Knicks' opponents in the first round of the National Basketball Associa tion playoffs later this month, did New York a good turn today by defeating the Phila delphia 76ers, 108101.

title: O. EDWARD PAYNE, 80, HEADED NASSAU BAR
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., March 14 O. Edward Payne, a lawyer and former secretary and presi dent of the Nassau County Bar Association, died today in Glen Cove Community Hospital. He was 80 years old.

title: Theater: Racial Allegory
description: Derek Walcott's The Dream on Monkey Moun tain, which the Negro En semble Company presented last night at the St. Marks Playhouse, is a beautiful be wildering play by a poet. Mr. Walcott, a black Trinidadian, rightly sees the English lan guage as one of his ethnic inheritances, and he fell in love with it in a way that few people can.

title: F.T.C. MAY REVIVE TOBACCO WARNING
description: WASHINGTON, March 14 The Federal Trade Commission has notified Congress that it may revive a regulation requir ing a stiff health warning in cigarette advertisements.

title: Advertising:
description: Gilbert Advertising, which just recently got the Barton Bonbonnire business, con tinued its calorie Intake over the weekend.

title: Newark Air and Rail Plans Agreed To by Port Officials
description: James C. Kellogg 3d, chair man of the Port of New York Authority, and the authority's executive director, Austin J. Tobin, said yesterday that they had agreed on plans to acquire the Penn Central station in Newark and to build a rail link to Newark Airport.

title: Trains Hit Truck, Driver Safe
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 14 (UPI)A truck driver, Lloyd Green, 28 years old, of Orinda, escaped with cuts and bruises today when two trains going in opposite directions smashed into his vehicle and it was dragged for three blocks. We expected to find a body, a police officer said. But instead we saw his fingers gripping the side of the door and heard him call for help.

title: Amex Promotes Aide
description: Ralph S. Saul, president of the American Stock Exchange, announced over the weekend that Benjamin D. Krause, 34 yearold lawyer, has been pro moted to assistant vice presi dent in the membership com pliance division.

title: Custer Falls Again To Ten Wheel Drive
description: Ten Wheel Drive performed Little Big Horn, a rock ora torio written by Aram Schefrin and Michael Zager of the group, at Carnegie Hall yesterday. As sisting were the American Sym phony Orchestra, conducted by Stephen Simon, and a small chorus.

title: 2 Americans and Belgian Get German Science Prize
description: FRANKFURT, Germany, March 14 (AP)Two Americans and a Belgian received today the $27,300 Paul Ehrlich and Ludwig Darmstaedter prize for 1971, West Germany's top scientific research award.

title: Amex Prices Move to a 14Month High
description: Most issues on the American Stock Exchange advanced yes terday as the exchange's price index surged to its highest closing level in almost 14 months in active trading.

title: CAR SALES ROSE IN EARLY MARCH
description: DETROIT, March 15  Sales of new cars from March 1 to 10 were ahead of the similar week last year, but the General Motors Corporation made up the biggest gain.

title: SECOND CUT ORDERED FOR COFFEE EXPORTS
description: LONDON, March 15 (AP) The International Coffee Organ ization ordered today a second cut of 1.5 million bags in 197071 coffeeexport quotas. The first cut, of 1.5 million bags, took place 15 days ago when the composite daily price fell below 48 cents a pound and triggered firststage quota cuts.

title: Relief Rolls Here in Last Year Grew by 900 Addicts a Month
description: The number of narcotics ad dicts on New York City's relief rolls grew during the last year by nearly 900 a month, accord ing to the Department of So cial Services.

title: Yanks Drop 7th in Row, 53;
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 15It's Ralph Houk's credo that to accomplish what we set out to accomplish in spring training, we have to sacrifice certain things.

title: Most U.S. Priests Are Reported Opposing Mandatory Celibacy
description: BALTIMORE, March 15A majority of Roman Catholic priests in this country now op pose mandatory celibacy, Dr. John P. Koval, a sociologist at the University of Notre Dame, reported tonight.

title: U.S. Bill Rates Are Mixed At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 Treasury bill rates were mixed at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Richardson Says Data Banks Must Be Controlled
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 The Secretary of Health, Edu cation and Welfare, Elliot L. Richardson, said today that the nation must develop the means of controlling the, poten tial for harm inherent in the Government's computerized data banks of information on citizens.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: LONDON, March 15 (UPI) Henry Cooper risks his European, British and Com monwealth heavyweight titles against Joe Bugner at Wem bley tomorrow night in battle between an old lion and a young warrior.

title: SOVIET REPLACES ENVOY IN RUMANIA
description: MOSCOW, March 15The Soviet Union today named Vas ily I. Drozdenko, a ranking Ukrainian Communist party of ficial, as the new Ambassador to Rumania in a move seen as part of an overhaul of So viet diplomatic representation in several countries of Eastern Europe.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Not since the Hatfields and the McCoys were feudin' and fussin' at the Big Sandy in Kentucky has there been a struggle involving the Blue Grass State like the one ex pected Thursday night, when Kentucky and Western Ken tucky level their sights on one another in the second round of the Na tional Collegiate basketball tour nament.

title: India Bans Flights
description: NEW DELHI, March 15 Indian has banned flights of military aircraft belonging to any nation over Indian terri tory to East Pakistan, author itative sources said today.

title: New L.I.R. Ticket Seeks to Sidetrack Commuter Cheating
description: The Long Island Railroad said yesterday that it would introduce a tamperproof weekly commuter ticket on April 17. The ticket is designed to stop some of the cheating that a state audit indicated recently might cost more than $9million a year in lost fares.

title: U.S. Jet Squadron Shifted From Japan to South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 15 The United States trans ferred an Air Force wing of 54 Phantom fighter  bombers to day from Japan to a permanent base in South Korea to re assure South Koreans of its in tention to help defend this country.

title: Poland Seeks to Attract More Visiting Students of Polish Heritage From U.S.
description: CRACOW, Poland, March 10  The tall apartment house on the outskirts of this his toric city looks like any oth er, but it is a girls' dormi tory, and largely filled with foreigners.

title: HARRY FOGLER DEAD; REALTY LAWYER, 69
description: Harry Fogler, a lawyer, real estate investor, and leader in philanthropic and community causes, died Sunday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 930 Grand Con course, the Bronx.

title: Merger News
