description: Directors of Ling  Temco  Vought, Inc., made their first move yesterday to divest the company of its holding in Braniff Airways, Inc., by ap proving a plan for a nation wide underwriting group to make a secondary public offering of 4.5 mil lion shares of Braniff special Class A stock. Under a Federal court judgment arising out of a civil antitrust action, LTV is required during a threeyear period to divest itself of Braniff and the Okonite Company or, as an alternative, the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corporation.

title: Dayton Bowler Takes Lead In Singles and All Events
description: DETROIT, March 15 (UPI) Dale Whisler of Dayton, Ohio, captured the top positions in the regular singles and all events today at the American Bowling Congress tournament in Cobo Hall.

title: BOND PRICES RISE ON BULLISH NEWS
description: Bond prices rose and interest rates declined yester day, largely because of all the optimistic credit market analysis that was published over the weekend.

title: Dow Pierces 900 Mark, Ending With Gain of 9.86
description: You could almost hear the hooves thudding through the canyon of Wall Street yes terday.

title: VANOCUR NAMED N.B.C. ANCHORMAN
description: Sander Vanocur, a corre spondent for National Broad casting Company News, will become anchorman of the 6 P.M. newscast of WNBCTV, Channel 4, a station here owned by NBC The announcement was made jointly by Reuven Frank, president of N.B.C. News, and by Theodore Walworth, vice president and general manager of WNBCTV.

title: Young Find Democracy Works in a Cape Cod Town
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., March 14This little town at the tip of Cape Cod, which pokes out into the Atlantic Ocean like a beckoning fin ger, has always been a sort of haven.

title: Church Cooking Class In Brooklyn Is Robbed
description: Twentyfive women attend ing a cooking class in a Brooklyn church were robbed last night of $185 add ten wrist watches by three men about 5 feet tail, according to police.

title: Women Liberationists Quit Seized Harvard Building
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 15 (AP)  The group of wom en's liberationists who seized a Harvard University building nine days ago ended their oc cupation at 3 P.M. today, leav ing as the Cambridge police prepared to oust them. There were about 50 women in the group, plus a few children.

title: CITY IN ARGENTINA IS SWEPT BY RIOTS
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, March 15 (UPI)Thousands of strik ing workers took over parts of Cordoba tonight, burning and looting amid clashes with the police and causing a crisis for the Government of President Roberto Marcelo Levingston.

title: INCOME IS RAISED BY BELL CANADA
description: MONTREAL, March 15 (Ca nadian Press)Bell Canada re ported 1970 net income of $133.3million, or $3.52 a share, up from $113.7million, or $3.20 a share in 1969.

title: Two Networks Will Aid A Course for Minorities
description: The National Broadcasting Company and the Columbia Broadcasting System Founda tion will join the Ford Foun dation in sponsoring the fourth national summer pro gram at Columbia University designed to train members of minority groups for careers in broadcast journalism.

title: Hollywood Society: Some Stay Home or Golf, No One Has Tea
description: HOLLYWOODHollywood society, and there is such a thing, has a structure and ritual all its own.

title: JAMES L. HOLTON, 72, REAL ESTATE EDITOR
description: James L. Holton, editor of Real Estate Weekly, died yes terday, apparently of a heart attack, in his office at 614 East 14th Street. He was 72 years old and lived at 583 Fourth Street, Brooklyn.

title: Mrs. Jacobsen, Poet, Gets Library of Congress Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP) Josephine Jacobsen, a poet from Baltimore, has been named consultant in poetry to the Library of Congress for the 197172 term, the library an nounced today.

title: Man In the News
description: At a press conference in the Blue Room at City Hall yesterday, Mayor Lindsay, who wore a yellow shirt and maroon and white tie, an nounced that he had nomin ated as the city's first taxi cab commissioner Michael J. Lazar, who wore a yellow shirt and a red and white tie. After the Mayor had fin ished praising Councilman at Large Lazar as an able, experi enced public servant, and after Mr. Lazar's soontobe former colleagues from Queens essayed some Coun cilmanic intramural jests, Mr. Lazar noted that he and the Mayor had more in common than shirts and ties.

title: Stony Brook Dean Called Choice for Egeberg's Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 15Administration officials have offered Dr. Edmund D. Pellegrino, dean of the State Uni versity Medical School at Stony Brook, L. I., the position of the Government's top medical officer, sources at the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare said today.

title: Black Pupils End Boycott Of White Plains Schools
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 15 (AP)About 800 black pupils from kindergarten through the ninth grade returned to classes today, ending a boycott stem ming from a racial disturbance March 3 at White Plains High School.

title: Basques Seized, Spain Says
description: BILBAO, Spain, March 15 (Reuters)The Spanish police announced today that they had recently arrested 40 persons whom they allege to be mem bers of the Basque revolution ary movement known as ETA. The police said that those ar rested had planned to bomb a Government building, rob a bank and raid prisons at Se govia and Burgos to free ETA members.

title: $1.6Million Given By State to City For Traffic Signals
description: The city's plan to modernize the traffic signals at 700 inter sections in Manhattan came a step closer to fruition yester day when Governor Rockefeller announced a grant of $1.6mil lion to buy new signal equip ment.

title: 8 More States Sue Car Manufacturers In Air Pollution Case
description: LOS ANGELES, March 15 (AP)Eight states filed suit in United States District Court today, charging that major American Automobile manu facturers have conspired since 1953 to delay the development of atnipollution devices.

title: Hamburg Ship Blast Kills 4
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, March 15 (UPI)An explosion aboard the drydocked Swedish tanker Seven Stars rocked the Blohm and Voss shipyards to day. The police said that four persons were killed and two seriously inured.

title: MINORITIES PRESS PUBLISHING GOALS
description: Black, Chinese and Indian publishing companies, springing up across the country in re sponse to what they consider the racism of the traditional publishing industry, are seek ing control of their respective ethnic images as a major goal.

title: Council Approves Unit Pricing To Cover Most Grocery Goods
description: A bill to require unit pricing of most items sold in grocery stores in the city was passed last night by the City Council, after the courts had blocked such a requirement under exist ing statutes.

title: ITKIN ENTERS PLEA OF NOT GUILTY HERE
description: Herbert Itkin, a key informer and prosecution witness in cor ruption cases, pleaded not guilty in Federal Court here yesterday to conspiracy, brib ery and theft charges filed by a New York County grand jury in 1967 and 1968.

title: SOVIET PREPARING FOR THE AUTO AGE
description: MOSCOW, March 15The Soviet Union, thrust into the automobile age with the open ing of the gigantic Fiat plant on the Volga River, finds that planners have overlooked one small detail: how to get the thousands of cars from the as sembly line into the hands of the lucky buyers.

title: New Jersey G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (UPI)The Defense Depart ment announced today that Pfc. William L. Hashagen of Blairs town, N.J., of the Army, had been killed in the war in South east Asia.

title: Port Official Is Confirmed
description: TRENTON, March 15 (AP) The New Jersey Senate con firmed Philip B. Hofmann to day as a new Commissioner of the Port of New York Author ity. Mr. Hofmann, chairman of the board of Johnson & John son, was nominated earlier in the day by Gov. William E. Ca hill to replace Charles W. En gelhard, who died on March 2.

title: 4th Round of SovietU.S. Arms Talks Opens in Vienna
description: VIENNA, March 15United States and Soviet delegations met in the palace of the Aus Irian President here today for the formal opening of the fourth round of their talks on the limitation of strategic nuclear arms.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: BOSTON, March 15Al though there is no specific reference to it in the pro posed legislation, the future of Massachusetts's 6,000acre Hockomock Swamp is in volved in the fate of Senate Bill 780, which is scheduled for a hearing tomorrow in Room 473A of the State House at 10 A.M.

title: ACCUSING COLONEL FILES HIS CHARGES
description: ATLANTA, March 15  An Army officer preferred formal military charges today against a general and a colonel he has accused of ignoring reports of alleged atrocities in South Viet nam in 1969.

title: Nixon Deadline Lapses
description: WASHINGTON, March 15  President Nixon, with advice from Government lawyers in the trade field, allowed a 60 day deadline to lapses today without making a decision on the delicate question of import relief for the domestic shoe industry.

title: Scuffle Disrupts Kahane Talk
description: MONTREAL, March 15 (UPI) A scuffle broke out between Maoist followers and Jewish students at McGill University today when the Maoists heckled a speech by Rabbi Meir Kahane of New York, founder of the militant Jewish Defense League.

title: DRUG STUDY ASKED AT BROOKLYN BRIG
description: Representative Mario Biaggi, Bronx DemocratConservative, called yesterday for an Investi gation into the alleged wide spread sale and use of drugs at the Navy's correctional center in Brooklyn and the United States Naval Hospital in St. Albans, Queens.

title: U.S. Lifts Ban On China Travel
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 The United States today lifted its ban on travel by Americans to Communist China and dis closed that it was working through private diplomatic channels to bring Peking's Am bassador back to the Warsaw talks interrupted more than a year ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pork Ideas From 3 Lands
description: On the average, Americans eat about 65 pounds of pork a year, so the fact that pork prices have remained at rea sonable levels is pleasant news for the housewife. To add an international touch to pork on the menu, here are recipes that have their origins in Germany, Spain and China.

title: Inonu Assails Intervention Of Turkey's Army Chiefs
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 15 Ismet Inonu, the elder states man of Turkish politics, re buffed the chiefs of, his coun try's armed forces today by saying that their intervention in Government affairs Friday had so damaged the parlia mentary system that it could he healed only by new elec tions.

title: About Pro Hockey
description: In a move that could affect the Rangers a month from now, the Chicago Black Hawks yesterday called up an amateur goalie named Gilles Maloche to replace Gerry Desjardins, whose left elbow was broken in two places against the St. Louis Blues on Sunday.

title: Books of The Times
description: LAME DUCK. By E. M. Beekman. 242 pages. Houghton Mifflin Company. $5.95.

title: JOHN MAHER, HEADED CITY'S PAROLE BOARD
description: John C. Maher, chairman of the former City Parole Commis sion from 1928 until his retire ment in 1962, died Sunday in Calvary Hospital, the Bronx. He was 78 years old and lived at 1936 79th Street, Jackson Heights, ueens.

title: Carr of Irish Honored
description: Austin Carr of Notre Dame, only the second player in col lege basketball to score over 1,000 points in two seasons, was named player of the year by United Press International and winner of the third annual James A. Naismith Trophy yesterday.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Stern Metals Corporation has elected Martin H. Dubilier chairman. M. Dubilier, formerly presi dent and chief executive officer of Kearney National, Inc., succeeds Jerome Kohlberg Jr., who has been named chairman of the executive and finance committees.

title: WILLIAM H. BOLAND
description: RUMSON, N. J., March 15 William H. Boland, senior part ner of Boland, Saffin, Gordon & Sauter, a Wall Street bond house, died yesterday in River view Hospital, Red Bank. He was 63 years old and lived at 76 Rumson Road here.

title: Coach of Citadel Five Quits
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., March 15 (AP)  Dick Campbell re signed today as basketball coach at the Citadel.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, March 15Richard M. Nixon, like most Presidents, is easy to criticizeso easy, in fact, that there is a breed of Nixon critic that tries to have it both ways. They will declare in one breath that the President is a convinced cold warrior, antiCommu nist, and social Darwinian who will never change; in the next breath, they will denounce him as a totally unprin cipled political chameleon who will do anything to win an election and thinks of nothing else.

title: STOCKS ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London Stock Exchange closed narrowly mixed in quiet trading yesterday. Dealers were described as cautions over Britain's general economic sit uation, and over the Govern ment's latest set of unemploy ment figures which are due to be published Thursday. Govern ment bonds tended to retreat toward the market's close, aft er initial firmness based on hopes of interest rate reduc tions.

title: NORTHEAST SEEKING GUIDANCE BY C.A.B.
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP)  Pleading unbearable losses, Northeast Airlines has asked the Civil Aeronautics Board for some guidelines for the future now that Northwest Airlines has withdrawn from its merger agreement.

title: Pupils in Uniform
description: The State Senate has demonstrated its remoteness from reality by passing a bill permitting local school boards to institute junior Reserve Officers Training Corps in the high schools.

title: WILLIAM H. HUNDT
description: William H. Hundt, who re tired 15 years ago as vice presi dent of Luria Bros. & Co., iron and steel, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 77 years olld and lived at 20 East 68th Street.

title: POLICE HALT RALLY BY WOMEN IN LISBON
description: LISBON, March 15Police men with rifles and dogs charged a peaceful demonstra tion of nearly 3,000 saleswomen tonight in front of the Portu guese National Assembly and dispersed the crowd in two minutes.

title: Advertising:
description: Irwin Winston didnt miss the bus. He caught it and rode it to fortune and glory.

title: Social Science Gains Tied To Big Teams of Scholars
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 15A study of this century's great advances in social science has found that the most im portant social research in the last four decades has tended to emerge from large teams of scholars working in major in tellectual centers.

title: Mills Says He Will Stand Firm A gainst Nixon on Textile Quotas
description: WASHINGTON, March 15, (Reuters)  Representative Wilbur Mills, Democrat of Ar kansas, said today he plans to stand firm against President Nixon's move for legislation to impose mandatory quotas on textile imports.

title: SAIGON'S TROOPS REPORTED TO QUIT OUTPOST IN LAOS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, March 16South Viet namese troops abandoned a fire base in Laos under heavy enemy pressure overnight, leaving be hind their artillery pieces, mili tary sources said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DANA CORP. LISTS A BIG PROFIT DROP
Eban Confers in London
description: LONDON, March 15 (UPI) Mr. Eban and Foreign Sec retary Sir Alec DouglasHome conferred for one hour today.

title: G.A.O. ASSAILS USE OF SCHOOL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 The General Accounting Office accused the Nixon Adminis tration today of improper handling of funds designed to ease school desegregation.

title: 76ers and Bullets to Open Playoff Series on March 24
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 15 (AP)The Philadelphia 76ers, the runnersup in the National Basketball Association's Atlan tic Division, will play the first game of a playoff series with the Baltimore Bullets March 24 in Baltimore.

title: Sheik Mujib Is Popular With His Hindu Neighbors
description: CALCUTTA, India, March 8 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the East Pakistani leader, who is a Moslem, has become a folk hero to the Hindus of West Bengal, in India.

title: Salaries Rise for Heads of Banks
description: The heads of the nation's largest bankswhich enjoyed sharp increases in profits in the recession year of 1970 generally were rewarded with higher salaries last year. This was the principal conclusion to emerge from the annual survey by the New York Times of compensation of senior banking officials.

title: Khesanh Base Shelled
description: SAIGON, March 16 The allied base at Khesanh came under intense shelling yester day, forcing American helicop ters based there to scatter into the sky.

title: Israeli Occupation Role Condemned by U.N. Group
description: GENEVA, March 15 A reso lution condemning Israel's rule in occupied territories was ap proved today by the United Nations Commission on Human Rights, with fewer than half its 32 members voting.

title: Advertising:
description: Mary Joan Glynn is revers ing the usual order of things. She is going from a major ad agency into retailing, becom ing Bloomingdale's vice pres ident for advertising and pub licity. She will replace Ruth Straus, who is on a leave of absence.

title: DEMOCRATS SUING THEIR PARTY ON '72
description: WASHINGTON, March. 15 (AP)New York and California Democrats sued their party to day to apportion 1972 national convention delegates according to a oneDemocrat, onevote formula. They said that this would liberalize the conven tion, affect the presidential race and discourage thirdparty movements.

title: Johnny Mercer's Bright Career Is Traced in His Song Program
description: Johnny Mercer has written the lyrics for so many memo rable popular songs that he had to sing them in medleys to even scratch the surface of his re markable output as he traced his songwriting career Sunday night at the 92d Street Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Association. Mr. Mer cer's appearance was part of the Y.M.Y.W.H.A. series on Lyrics and Lyricists.

title: U.S. HOUSING LAW IS SCORED IN SUIT
description: CLEVELAND, March 15The first suit against a Federal housing law that has allegedly blocked suburban lowincome public housing was filed today in United States District Court.

title: CITY COUNCILMAN TO HEAD TAXI UNIT
description: City Councilman at Large Michael J. Lazar, Democrat of Queens, yesterday was named chairman of the new Taxi and Limousine . Commission by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Nixon Cancer Plan Hailed; Need for Funds Is Stressed
description: The American Cancer Society hailed yesterday President Nix on's budget request, for $100 million to expand cancer re search, but stressed that the money would not reduce the amount of support needed by the society.

title: Washington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 The Ides of March, 1971, mercifully failed to produce anything as dramatic as the stabbing of Julius Caesar in 44 B.C. or the abdication of Czar Nicholas in A.D. 1917. But they were not without portent, starting with Presi dent Nixon's declaration, dur ing an extraordi nary twohour television inter view, that he was not at all con cerned about his image or modest standing in the opinion polls.

title: JOSEPH E. HANSON, ADMAN AND AUTHOR
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., March 15Joseph E. Hanson, who as advertising director of L. Bamberger & Co. was instru mental in its establishment of radio station WOR, died today in Orange Memorial Hospital after a short illness. He was 77 years old and lived here at 366 Montrose Avenue.

title: Antiwar Performers to Sue For U.S. Support of Show
description: A troupe of antiwar perform ers who were refused permis sion by the army to stage their show at Fort Bragg, N. C., said yesterday that it would file suit against the Pentagon in Wash ington this week.

title: Longchamps, Inc., to Sell Luchow's for $2.2Million
description: Longchamps, Inc., restaurant chain operator, has agreed to sell Luchow's, an 88yearold landmark restaurant at 110 East 14th Street, to Irving and Mur ray Riese, who also operate res taurants here.

title: Seaver Excels as Mets Win
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 15 Tom Seaver missed five days of spring training when he re turned home to await the birth of his first child but in his second appearance on the mound today he proved he is right on target for his big assignment on opening day at Shea Stadium April 6.

title: President Orders Relief for Migrant Workers After Florida Crop Failure
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 15  President Nixon extended the concept of disaster relief today to include aid to migrant workers unemployed as a re sult of crop failures.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Buckley Asks Upstate Leaders To Aid Area Before U.S. Tries
description: BUFFALO, March 15Sena tor James L. Buckley urged, western New York business leaders today to return to volunteerism so that private groups could help solve the area's problems before a distant level of government tried to do it for them.

title: CARL HAUGEN, 53 BANKER, IS DEAD
description: Carl E. Haugen, who as a senior vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank super vised more than 100 branches in Queens, Brooklyn, Rich mond, Bronx, Nassau and Westchester Counties, died of a heart attack Sunday while driving between his home and church on Staten Island. He was 53 years old and lived at 395 Flagg Place in Dongan Hills.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 15Follow ing are the listings of this week's events of interest. All admissions are free unless otherwise indicated, though special credentials may be required in some instances. Best phone ahead to make certain.

title: CITY CENTER TO ADD AILEY DANCE SEASON
description: The City Center will sponsor a special season by the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater at its West 55th Street theater from April 27 through May 9.

title: Nonstop PayPrice Spiral
description: Settlement terms in the monthlong strike against three major can manufacturers make it evident that the wage price spiral is moving unslowed into 1971. The new three year pact, clearly a patternsetter for forthcoming pay talks in aluminum, copper and steel, duplicatesand in some respects expandsthe substantial gains auto work ers won last year in their contracts with the automotive Big Three.

title: No Indictments Produced With Links to Mall Work
description: ALBANY, March 15 (AP) A Federal grand jury, convened amid reports of misdoing at the $1billion South Mall project here, ended its work today without producing any Mall related Indictments.

title: RAYMOND C. SMITH
description: PELHAM, N.Y., March 15 Raymond C. Smith, who retired last year as vice president and secretary of Lawler Automatic Controls, Inc., in Mount Vernon, died yesterday at his home, 419 Third Avenue. He age was 75.

title: JAZZ LEGENDS JOIN IN BENEFIT CONCERT
description: A band studded with legend ary jazz musicians, Franz Jack son and his Chicagoans, made a rare appearance in New York Sunday afternoon at Downbeat, Lexington Avenue at 42d Street.

title: Most States Resist Nixon On BuildingPay Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 Many states are defying, ignor ing or otherwise not complying with President Nixon's call for states to suspend their support of construction industry wages.

title: Market Place: Miss D's Sad Market Tale
description: Who would have thought six months ago that leading stock market pundits today would be saying that the market looks a little high, that it's time for a consolida tionthat sort of spoilsport talk?

title: U.S. Fund Cutoff Imperils 2 Programs at St. Vincent's Hospital
description: Two chiefs of service at St. Vincent's Hospital said yester day they would probably be forced to abandon important programs because of an un expected halt in Federal financ ing.

title: News Analysis
description: ALBANY, March 15  Gov ernor Rockefeller doesn't back down easily or often but he has convinced even the skeptics here that he is indeed retreat ing from the recordbreaking $8.45billion budget he proposed six weeks ago and its stagger ing $1.1billion tax package.

title: New City School to Help ExAddicts
description: Mayor Lindsay officially opened yesterday what he called the nation's first public school that will seek to re habilitate former addicts while they continue their high school education.

title: Gamblers Anonymous Bids City Consider It a Safe Bet
description: Every once in a while I still get a flash, said Marvin Z. yesterday at the first an nual Gamblers Anonymous seminar in the metropolitan area.

title: Spain and Soviet About to Sign First Trade Accord Since 1939
description: MADRID, March 15Spain and the Soviet Union are on the verge of signing their first trade agreement since the Spanish Civil War.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MAN ACQUITTED HERE IN BROOKLYN SLAYING
description: A State Supreme Court jury in Brooklyn yesterday acquitted an insurance broker of charges of murder and assault, resulting from an incident in which he said he had been harassed by neighborhood youths.

title: Bigger City Election Unit Gains in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 15  The State Senate voted today to increase the membership of the New York City Board of Elections from four to ten and to give representation to the Bronx, Queens and Staten Island. The bill now goes to the Assembly.

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Now Down to 317,300
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 15 (Reuters)  The United States military com mand said today that as of March 11 the number of American personnel in South Vietnam had fallen to 317, 300, the lowest figure since Oct. 10, 1966.

title: The Road to Glory for Iowa GirlsBasketball
description: DES MOINES, IowaAfter a bumper corn crop, perhaps the most revered thing in the State of Iowa is a champion girl basketball player.

title: Gaullists and Leftists Gain In French Municipal Voting
description: PARIS, March 15 (AP)  Gaullists and leftists made some gains in the first round of France's municipal elections yesterday at the expense of the small, centrist and rightist parties. Runoffs will be held next Sunday in those districts, Including all of Paris, where no slate got a majority.

title: MORALES DEFEATS MULLIGAN ON MAT
description: Pedro Morales Culebra, Puerto Rico, pinned Black Jack Mulligan in 14 minutes 12 sec onds of their wrestling exhibi tion last night at Madison Square Garden. The victory en abled the 241pound Morales to retain his title, billed as the World Wide Wrestling Federa tion heavyweight champion ship.

title: Transportation: Human Enrichment
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.The process that has been undermining our trans portation system, with the progres sive elimination of all but motor vehicles and jet planes, is what the biologist, William Morton Wheeler, described in organisms as debuild ing.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 16, 1971

title: FIVE YEARS GIVEN TO DECAVALCANTE
description: NEWARK, March 15  Si mone Rizzo DeCavalcante, re putedly one of the top figures in organized crime in New Jer sey, was sentenced in Federal Court here this evening to five years in prison on charges of having been the mastermind of a $20millionayear interstate gambling syndicate.

title: Ford and Saar Discuss Plant
description: SAARBRUCKEN, West Ger many, March 15 (Reuters) The Ford Motor Company is considering the possibility of expanding its operation in the West German state of Saar land, it was announced here today.

title: White House Rejects Nominee For Environment Research Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 A system analysis specialist, who is an environmentalist, has been rejected by the White House as head of an Environ mental Institute, which Presi dent Nixon proposed to Con gress last month.

title: Educators Cite Problems of White Teachers in Black Schools
description: CHICAGO, March 15The most critical problem is getting white teachers who are com ing not to work out their own problems, but to give to the program, an administrator from a predominantly black col lege remarked.

title: Soviet Moon Vehicle Parked
description: MOSCOW, March 15, (Reu ters)  The Soviet Union's Lunokhod moon buggy has been parked because bright sun light was spoiling its television transmissions, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported today.

title: OFFTRACK BETTING URGED FOR NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 15 A committee appointed by Re publican members of the Nas sau County Board of Super visors today recommended off track parimutuel betting in the county subject to a referendum.

title: LOUISVILLE, DUKE, NORTH CAROLINA, PURDUE JOIN N.I.T.
description: North Carolina and Louisville, which just missed winning con ference titles, and Duke and Purdue were selected yesterday to complete the field of 16 teams for the National Invita tion Tournament, which begins Saturday morning at Madison Square Garden.

title: MARGIN LOWERED ON SILVER LIST
description: The minimum original margin requirement for the purchase of silver futures contracts was lowered yesterday to $1,000 by the governors of the Commodity Exchange, Inc. (Comex). The previous margin was $1,500.

title: In Capital, Endowment Unit Will Seek Opera Grant Aid
description: The National Endowment for the Arts is preparing to ask Congressional approval for a major Matchinggrant program in support of Amer ican opera companies. The ambitious program, part of an Administration plan for spending $60million on the arts and humanities in the coming fiscal year, is com parable in scope and signifi cance to the $3.5million al location of Endowment funds last year to 73 major and metropolitan symphony or chestras in 38 states.

title: Mills Reported Preparing U. S. Health Insurance Bill
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 Representative Wilbur D. Mills, who as chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee was an architect of Medicare and Medicaid, will put together a national health insurance bill this spring, Congressional sources said today.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES FULL SST FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP)The House Appropria tions Committee approved to day, 26 to 15, funds for con tinued development of a super sonic civilian aircraft.

title: Calley Jury Is Shown a Picture Of Women's and Babies' Bodies
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 15  The Government prose cutor in the courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. held a photograph of corpses of women, children and babies before members of the jury today and asked if they really expected Lieutenant Calley to admit that these were the enemies he killed at Mylai.

title: OCCIDENTAL SUED BY STOCKHOLDERS
description: A series of classaction dam age suits were filed yesterday against the Occidental Petro leum Corporation. Additional suits are expected to follow.

title: JACQUES GALEF, 89, FOUNDED GUN FIRM
description: Jacques L. Galef, president and founder of J. L. Galef & Son, Inc., a leading firearms wholesaler at 85 Chambers Street, died Saturday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 89 years old.

title: Paris Hails Backus After Decision Over French Boxer
description: PARIS, March 15France  indeed, all Europe  has now heard of Billy, Backus.

title: Layoffs Set at RCA Unit
description: The RCA Corporation an nounced yesterday that it planned to cut 115 workers from its Astro Electronics divi sion work force at Princeton, N.J., over the next several weeks. The layoffs were attri buted to Federal cutbacks in defense and space programs and were said to affect engi neers and production and ad ministrative personnel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SAN JUAN RIOTING AND BOMB STUDIED
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., March 15 The Federal Bureau of In vestigation is studying the pos sible link between Thursday's campus rioting here and a bomb placed in the local Selec tive Service office two weeks ago.

title: 6MILLION MISSING AT CHICAGO BANK
description: CHICAGO, March 15 (AP) The Cosmopolitan National Bank disclosed today that more than $6million in its funds were missing and had possibly been embezzled by a bank bookkeeper working with a longtime customer.

title: War in Laos Imperils the Survival of Meo Tribes
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 15 The tough and fierce Meo mountain tribesmen of Laos, re treating before the North Viet namese invaders, are nearing the end of the mountains and the limits of their strength. Their survival in their tradition al pattern of life has become a matter of concern to them and to their friends.

title: MRS. MEIR BESET BY WIDE CRITICISM
description: JERUSALEM, March 15  Premier Golda Meir's Govern ment headed defiantly today into a barrage of criticism, for eign and domestic, accused of being both too rigid and too flexible in defining its terms for peace.

title: Pope Says Church Groups Disseminate Slanted News
description: ROME, March 15Pope Paul VI, in an address to Roman Catholic information officials, charged today that liberal groups and centers within the church were disseminating harmfully slanted news.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS $300MILLION CUT IN STATE BUDGET
description: ALBANY, March 15Gover nor Rockefeller announced to day that he had decided to reduce his state budget pro posal by at least $300million so he could trim proposed tax increases and avoid disas trous economic effects.

title: Nixon Sees Realism
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 15 (AP)President Nixon ex pressed hope today that the constructive nature of the ex change that had marked pre vious sessions of the arms talks would continue in the fourth round.

title: LONESOME RIVER AQUEDUCT VICTOR
description: The Tartan Stable's Lone some River gained the victory in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday, although he finished second in the sixfurlong sprint for older horses.

title: Editor Tells of Interview
description: LONDON, March 15  Louis Heren, a deputy editor of The Times of London, denied today that his interview with Mrs. Meir had been off the record.

title: Laver Travels Far for Tennis Riches
description: Rod Laver and Roy Emer son returned here yesterday following a three  week, 30,000mile trip in search of tennis riches.

title: Soviet to Enrich Uranium for France
description: PARIS, March 15  France, until now dependent on the United States for her enriched uranium, announced today that she had concluded an arrange ment with the Soviet Union at a lower price that had no politi cal strings attached.

title: FRENCH BANDITS GET RANSOM AND ESCAPE
description: TOULOUSE, France, March 15This city was paralyzed for nine hours today as a gang caught in a bank holdup traded off some of their hostages for $76,600 and a path of escape.

title: Squires, Defying Ban, Draft 3 College Youths
description: Earl Foreman of the Virginia Squires defied the fouryear college notampering rule yes terday by selecting three under graduates during the American Basketball Association draft.

title: Ford Reaffirms His Gloomy View of Britain
description: LONDON, March 15Henry Ford 2d was wooed today by Prime Minister Heath and his three top economics ministers at a luncheon at 10 Downing Street. But the chairman of the Ford Motor Company later re affirmed his view that indus trial chaos was discouraging further Ford investment in this country.

title: Theater: Literate Import
description: Christopher Hampton's The Philanthropist is a good, funny, literate and literary play. The latest in this sea son's parade of British the atrical invaders, it opened last night at the Ethel Bar rymore Theater.

title: Defense Aide Says Agent Attended N.Y.U. Course
description: Assistant Secretary of De fense Robert Froehlke has acknowledged the presence of a military intelligence agent on New York University's Wash ington Square campus in a let ter to a university administra tor dated March 10, it was dis closed yesterday. Mr. Froehlke said his department would in hibit such activity in the fu ture.

title: STATE BANK CHIEF REJECTS CRITICISM
description: State Banking Superintend ent William T. Dentzer Jr. took strong exception yesterday to a charge by Assemblyman Franz S. Leichter that the State Banking Department served the banking industry rather than the public.

title: Pair of 3Division Leagues Being Studied by Baseball
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 15  A plan to realign each of baseball's major leagues into three fourteam divisions, something like the way pro football is divided, is under study, Joe Cronin said today.

title: RECORD BUDGET ADOPTED BY CITY
description: A $1.6billion construction budget for 197172, a record, was adopted unanimously last night by the Board of Estimate and the City Council, but only after several hours of wran gling.

title: Metropolitan A.A.U. Diving Is Captured by Desjardins
description: Peters Desjardins of the New York Athletic Club yesterday captured the Metropolitan Ama teur Athletic Union senior 3 meter diving championship with a score of 400.55.

title: Angela Talbot Bows With a Song Recital Of Early Americana
description: Angela Talbot, a Massachu setts soprano whose pioneering spirit and ingratiating person ality outshine her modest vocal attainments, minimized her weaknesses and maximized her strengths at Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night, thereby turning her New York debut into one of the freshest, most imaginative song programs of the season.

title: City Asks Higher Water Rates In Suburban Areas It Supplies
description: The city is seeking rate in creases designed to bring it 41.3 per cent more revenue for the water it provides for 38 communities outside the city, mainly in Westchester County. The increases would total about $1,227,000 a year, from $2,969, 000 under current rates to $4,196,000.

title: NIXON REVENUE PLAN CALLED FOOL'S GOLD
description: Hale Boggs, the House Demo cratic leader, yesterday called President Nixon's revenue shar ing for cities fool's gold and said that Congressional leaders were discussing alternative plans with mayorsof big cities.

title: Scaasi: A Return to the 50's?
description: There were plenty of things to notice in Arnold Scaasi's spring couture col lection if you took your eyes off the short pants.

title: 4 NATIONS THREATEN TO BAR OIL EXPORTS
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, March 15 (Reuters) Four Arab oil exporting countries warned to night they would cut off sup plies if Western oil Companies refused to meet Libya's demand for higher prices.

title: GREECE CONVICTS 4 OF GUERRILLA PLOT
description: ATHENS, March 15  The Athens special military tribunal today found four men guilty of having attempted to over throw the Greek Government by setting up a guerrilla group called The National Antidicta torial Army. Three of them were jailed.

title: CHAMBER RECITAL LIGHTS BIRTHDAY
description: There was no cake in sight to be cut, but everyone present shared in the gift: chamber music performed With the kind of transcendent skill and dedi cation that has become the hall mark of Alexander Schneider's New School Concerts. Seven teen wellknown musicians closely identified with Mr. Schneider's circle celebrated the 15th anniversary of the cham bermusic series in afternoon and evening programs Sunday in the school auditorium.

title: MEXICO SEES PLOT BY NORTH KOREANS
description: MEXICO CITY, March 15 (Reuters)Mexico charged to night that North Korea had trained a group of young Mexi cans in terrorism and guerrilla warfare and sent them home to fight for the establishment of a MarxistLeninist regime.

title: Knicks' Playoff Tickets To Go on Sale Tomorrow
description: The Knicks, with first place in the National Basketball As sociation's Atlantic Division fi nally secured, announced plans for the distribution of playoff tickets yesterday.

title: ExBonn Aide Robbed Near the Plaza
description: Franz Josef Strauss, the West German political lead er and former Finance Min ister, was robbed of more than $180 by two women early yesterday morning out side the Plaza Hotel.

title: LAWYER LINK CITED IN PX INVESTIGATION
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP)Earl F. Cole, a former general accused of aiding al legedly corrupt American busi ness enterprises in Vietnam, is represented by a Washington law firm closely linked to lawyers representing other major figures in the case, Senator Charles H. Percy said today.

title: A RIGHTIST GROUP EMERGES IN ITALY
description: ROME, March 15  A new political grouping, echoing the silent majority theme that has been heard in the United States, has taken root in Italy. It says it expresses the long muffled feelings of the major ity of Italians who are tired of disorders and abhor vio lence.

title: Sharp Clash Near Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 15 (AP) Fierce fighting was reported today between Gov ernment troops and enemy forces 13 miles northeast of Pnompenh. The Cambodian commander said his men were overrunning entrenched enemy positions by nightfall.

title: Bridgeport Police Are Accused at Hearing of Blocking Inquiry on Brutality
description: BRIDGEPORT, Tuesday, March 16A Connecticut state official charged in a public hearing yesterday that the Bridgeport police had blocked an independent Investigation in to five cases of alleged police brutality and that the minority community has largely lost con fidence in the Police Depart ment.

title: Hartke Proposes Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (UPI)Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, proposed today a cut of about $4.3billion a year in business taxes to stimulate the economy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Taxi Czar
description: Mayor Lindsay's selection of City Councilman Michael J. Lazar as chairman of the newly created taxi com mission comes as a distinct disappointment. It brings to the helm of a vital agency, at the very moment of its birth, an innocuous but ineffective local politico.

title: San Quentin Eases Rules
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., March 15 (AP)The San Quentin pris on authorities eased lockup conditions tody but kept 1,850 inmates confined in their east and south cell blocks except for two meal times a day. Three stabbings occurred in the pris on Saturday to bring the sec ond general lockup since last Tuesday.

title: BONAVENA'S WRIST BROKEN; FIGHT OFF
description: LOS ANGELES, March 15 (UPI)  Oscar Bonayena, a heavyweight boxer from Argen tina, suffered a broken left wrist in a minor traffic accident early today and will not be able to fight for four months.

title: Walworth Unit Gets Contract
description: BALA CYNWYD, Pa., March 15 (UPI)WalworthAloyco In ternational, a joint venture of the Walworth Company and Italian interests, has obtained a $25million contract to supply ball valves for a proposed 37, 000mile natural gas pipeline network to connect the Soviet Union and Western Europe.

title: A VISIT TO DACCA BEGUN BY YAHYA
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 15 President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan, arrived here to day to Study, the situation in East Pakistan and to hold talks that are likely, to determine whether this eastern part of the Pakistani nation will break away from the West and be come a separate country.

title: Bush Suggests U.N. Program
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Mar. 15George Bush, United States delegate, suggested to day that a dynamic United Na tions program to improve the environment could revive the interest of youth in the world organization. Mr. Bush made his first speech here as Chief American delegate at a meeting of delegates planning for the United Nations' global con ference on the environment to be held in Stockholm in 1972.

title: MRS. OLIVER DONALDSON
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., March 15Mrs. Grace Hickok Donald son, a fashion editor on the Sunday staff of The New York Times in the nineteenthirties, died here yesterday. The widow of Oliver D. Donaldson, former, chief makeup editor of The Times, she was 83 years old and lived at 1273 North Avenue.

title: Thousands Here Pay Tribute to Whitney Young Jr.
description: Thousands of mourners moved solemnly through the stately Riverside Church yester day to view the body of Whit ney M. Young Jr., executive di rector of the National Urban League, who died last week in Lagos, Nigeria.

title: Museum of Modern Art Here Halts Fund Drive in Slump
description: Because of the recession, the Museum of Modern Art has canceled plans for a $35million public fundrais ing drive and has suspended indefinitely all new building projects. Instead, it will try to raise $21.5million in en dowment funds from trustee, corporate and other sources, and do some remodeling of its premises.

title: Chase Backs Delay On Mohawk Default
description: Mohawk Airlines, Inc., said yesterday that the Chase Man hattan Bank had agreed to rec ommend to the airline's cred itorsof which it is one that they grant the company until March 29 to clear a $3.4million default on interest and prin cipal.

title: Moon Buggy Delivered
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., March 15 (Reuters)The multimillion dollar moon buggy designed to carry the astronauts on ex ploratory trips on the moon's surface arrived here today. The vehicle will be inspected before it is loaded aboard the lunar landing craft for the Apollo 15 mission set for launching next July 26.

title: Change in Pension Law Raises Death Benefits of Legislator's
description: During one of the final and most hectic days of last year's session of the State Legislature  when both houses were pass ing more than a bill a minute a single phrase was deleted from a complex pension law, raising the potential death bene fits for legislative leaders and some state executives to levels of $250,000 to $500,000 and more.

title: Power From the Barrel of a Gun
description: PEKINGThe children of the West ern world hear that Jesus is the best of all men. Jesus loves even, his enemies, and when His face is slapped turns the other cheek. The religion He has founded is that of Love. Jesus should be the model for all good little boys and girls, says the nice kind teacher before she hurries off to vote for an increased military budget.

title: Baseball is Sued For $25Million By Woman Umpire
description: Bernice Gera filed a $25 million suit yesterday against organized baseball because, in the words of her attorney, Mario Biaggi, a Democratic Representative, it has vir tually destroyed her career as a baseball umpire. The suit was filed in Manhattan Supreme Court.

title: New Premier of Australia Wins First Parliament Test
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 15 Prime Minister William Mc Mahon, passing his first parlia mentary test since taking office five clays ago, defeated a mo tion of no confidence in his Government in the House of Representatives today. The vote was 62 to 58.

title: One Juror Selected as 2d Trial Of Mrs. Alice Crimmins Begins
description: One juror was selected yes terday as the new trial for Mrs. Alice Crimmins, charged with murder and manslaughter in the, death of her two small children in July, 1965, opened in Queens Supreme Court yesterday.

title: Bridge: Men's and Women's Titles Go To Precision System Teams
description: ATLANTA, March 15Two New York teams playing the Precision System scored vic tories last night in the Ameri can Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals, in spite of an official change of heart that barred the use of two features of the system.

title: SIECEL APPEARANCES SHOW PIANIST'S ELAN
description: Jeffery Siegel, pianist, did double duty with the National Symphony at Philharmonic Hall on Sunday.

title: 3 Stockbrokers Disciplined By S.E.C. and the Amex
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the American Stock Exchange announced severe disciplinary actions yesterday against three stockbrokers accused of manipulating the shares of L'Aiglon Apparel, Inc., on the Amex. At the same time, the S.E.C. revoked the broker dealer registration of Brand, Grumet & Seigel, Inc., the brokerage house where the three men worked and where the alleged manipulation took place.

title: Drop in Industrial Output Follows a TwoMonth Rise
description: WASHINGTON, March 15  Industrial production declined in February following the auto strike rebound of December and January, the Federal Re serve Board reported today.

title: BILLCOLLECTION AIDE IS GUILTY OF PREJURY
description: Joseph Krozak, a 49year old executive of a billcollecting business that handled Medicaid payments, was convicted last night of lying when he denied that he had made payments to employes of the city Social Services Department.

title: Church Acts to Enlist CATV for Poor
description: Citing his concern that com mercial interests would domi nate the development of cable communications and deny ac cess to the medium by minori ties and the poor, the Rev. Everett C. Parker announced yesterday that the United Church of Christ would begin an advisory service designed to inform citizens of their rights with regard to CATV.

title: Swallowing a Lemon
description: The economic arguments against the supersonic trans port continue to pile up. In testimony before the Senate Appropriations Committee, Prof. George W. Rathjens of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology warned Con gress against buying a pig in a poke. He demonstrated that design changes intended to reduce the SST's severe noise level would almost certainly mean such increases in the plane's weight and operating costs that it could not be a profitable plane.

title: C.I.T. Unit Name Change Set
description: The C.I.T. Financial Corpora tion said yesterday it will change by the end of this year the name of all its consumer finance subsidiaries to C.I.T. Financial Services. Affected are the Universal C.I.T. Credit Cor poration; the Universal C.I.T. Finance Corporation; the Laur entide Finance Corporation; Home Finance Service, Inc.; and the Time Finance Company.

title: MORE MAKERS RAISE PRICE OF CONTAINERS
description: A 4 per cent increase in the price of corrugated shipping containers, initiated last week by the International Paper Com pany, was followed yesterday by the Union Camp Corpora tion, the H & D Container divi sion of the Westvaco Corpora tion, OwensIllinois, Inc., and the Inland Container Corpora tion.

title: Back to the SALT Mines
description: Resumption of the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) in Vienna yesterday finds both the Soviet and American delegates dug into rigid positions on nonessential issues. The deadlock that emerged after 55 sessions could well frustrate any chance of meaningful agreement unless both sides face up to the illogic of their respective stands.

title: Trading Suspension Lifted On Home Oil and Cygnus
description: TORONTO, March 15 (Cana dian Press)The Ontario Secu rities Commission has lifted its suspension of trading in the shares of the Home Oil Com pany, Ltd., and the Cygnus Corporation, Ltd.

title: George Paterno Renamed Kings Point Football Pilot
description: WEST POINT, L. I., March 15 George Paterno returned to day to become head football coach at the United States Merchant Marine Academy, a job the Brooklynborn coach held from 1965 through 1968.

title: 4 WELFARE BILLS OF REAGAN FILED
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 15Gov. Ronald Reagan's wel fare reform Program, which he has said will cut $740million from this state's public assist ance and Medicaid bills, was introduced into the. California Legislature today with five Republican sponsors.

title: AN INTERIM EDITOR NAMED AT HARPER'S
description: John Fischer, editor in chief of Harper's Magazine for 12 years until four years ago, has been called out of retirement to act as the periodical's inter im editor, William S. Blair, its publisher, anounced yesterday in a memorandum to adver tisers.

title: Cincinnati Bell Stock Split
description: Stockholders of Cincinnati Bell, Inc., approved yesterday a 2for1 split on authorized com mon stock raising the total to 10 million from the present five million authorized shares. Wil liam J. Whittaker, president, predicted 1971 earnings on a presplit basis would be better than the $13.1million, or $3.80 a share, reported in 1970. The company, formerly the Cincin nati and Suburban Bell Tele phone Company, is 26.5 per cent owned by the American Telephone and Telegraph Com pany.

title: 800 Dalton Parents Hold Debate On School and Its Headmaster
description: More than 800 Dalton School parents jammed into the school gymnasium last night for a meeting that ended, after nearly 3 hours of highdecibel and often hottempered rhetoric, with a decision to vote on the matter at issue by a mail ballot sent to the parents at home.

title: CAHILL PROPOSES FARM WORKER AID
description: TRENTON, March 15 Gov. William T. Cahill proposed leg islation today to improve the living and working conditions for migrant farm workers in New Jersey this summer.

title: FLAT TRACKS CITE CROWD, BETS RISE
description: The State Racing Commis sion released its annual report to the Secretary of State yes terday. The looseleaf volume of 58 Pages is a Comprehensive explanation of the operations of all phases of the 1970 thoroughbred activity in this state at the New York Racing Association's tracks  Aqueduct, Belmont Park and Saratoga  and the privately Owned Finger Lakes at Canandaigua.

title: FIRST BOSTON ASKS TO JOIN BIG BOARD
description: The First Boston Corpora tion, for many years one of the nation's leading underwrit ers of securities, has applied for membership on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: GUIDELINES URGED ON METHADONE USE
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP)  Two medical advisory groups reported today that methadone maintenancedaily doses of the syntheitc narcotic methadone to combat heroin addictionwas not feasible in the office practice of private physicians.

title: DAN RIVER CUTTING PERSONNEL BY 600
description: Dan River, Inc., a leading pro ducer of textiles, announced yesterday in Greenville, S. C., that it was cutting its personnel by about 3 per cent in a major costcutting move resulting from unprofitable operations.

title: Steel Production Up 1.3%
description: Steel production rose last week by 1.3 per cent from the level in the preceding weeks, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: King Heroin, Play on Addiction, Returns to Harlem
description: King Heroin is returning home to Harlem with some thing new added, a showcase of its own, the St. Philip's Community Theater, 207 West I33d Street. Starting tomorrow night, a twoweek engagement will enable New Yorkers to see a play which has drawn acclaim as a study of drug addiction.

title: Rail Union Chief Threatens Nationwide Strike in May
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (UPI)The head of the signal men's union complained today that his members were the lowestpaid of all railroad workers and threatened a na tionwide strike in May if sig nalmen's pay was not increased to the top of the heap.

title: Sports of The Times
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 15When Richie Allen was with us last spring, Dal Maxvill of the St. Louis Cardi nals was saying in St. Petersburg the other day, there were times when we wondered if his line drives would hit that building over there and turn it around.

title: Nixon, on TV, Attributes Youth Unrest to Loss of Old Values
description: WASHINGTON, March 15President Nixon believes that the fundamental cause of un rest among American youth is not the war, poverty or preju dice, but a sense of insecurity that comes from the old values being torn away.

title: Nixon Back in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 (AP)President Nixon returned to the White House at 8 P.M. today, ending his threeday va cation in Florida. Arriving with the President were his wife, their daughter Julie and their soninlaw David Eisenhower.

title: Adelphi Accepts Resignations of 3 Top Officials
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., March 15Adelphi University's board of trustees announced today that it had accepted the resig nations of the president and two vice presidents.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CONFEREES CLEAR 10% BENEFIT RISE IN SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, March 15 A SenateHouse conference committee approved today a 10 per cent acrosstheboard in crease in Social Security bene fits, but it cut from the bill that the Senate passed last Fri day the proposed new monthly minimums of $100 for individu als and $150 for couples.

title: 3 Coast Banks Cut Prime Rate to 5%
description: The Bank of America, San Francisco; the Security Pacific National Bank, Los Angeles, and the United California Bank, Los Angelesrespectively the na tion's largest, ninth largest and 15th largest banksreduced yesterday their prime lending rates on business loans to 5 per cent, their minimum rates on homemortgage loans to 6 per cent and the rate they pay on passbook savings to 4 per cent.

title: NASA ExAide Named Waste Group President
description: The appointment of Rich ard L. Lesher, a former as sistant administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, as pres ident of the National Center for Solid Waste Disposal, Inc., was announced yester day by Donald M. Kendall, chairman of the center and president and chief executive of Pepsico, Inc.

title: RELEASE IS DENIED TEACHER LEADERS
description: NEWARK, March 15  Su perior Court Judge Samuel All corn Jr. turned down a petition this morning for the release of the three officers of the New ark Teachers Union from jail as a possible step toward ending the sixweeklong teachers strike here.

title: Basketball Poll WRITERS RATINGS
description: The final college basketball ratings, with points tabulated on a 2018161412109876 54321 basis (firstplace votes in parentheses) and wonlost records.

title: Bar Association Reports Law Schools Almost Full
description: CHICAGO, March 15 (UPI) The American Bar Association reported today that law school enrollments were up nearly 20 per cent over last year and that almost all accredited schools were filled to capacity.

title: Tricia Nixon Moves Up Wedding Date to June 5
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., March 15 (UPI)  Tricia Nixon has moved up one week to June 5 the date of her marriage to Edward Finch Cox, a Harvard law student.

title: Bebe Daniels, Screen Star, Dies in London
description: Bebe Daniels, the movie star of the nineteentwenties and thirties died early today at her home in London. Miss Daniels, who was 71 years old, suc cumbed to a cerebral he morrhage after having had a number of strokes in recent years.

title: MRS. JOHN P. CAREY
description: Mrs. Kathryn Ward Carey, wife of John P. Carey, retired chairman of Carey Transporta tion, Inc., airport bus operators, died Sunday at her home, 1120 Park Avenue. She was 66 years old.

title: L.I. Nuclear Plant Opponents Testify
description: PORT JEFFERSON STATION, L.I., March 15  The immedi ate necessity for nuclear pow er was challenged today by Dr. James D. Watson, the Nobel Laureate, as the Atomic Energy Commission resumed its hear ing here on an application for the construction of Long Is land's first nuclear power plant.

title: Tigers Subdue Mets, 104, With SixRun Surge in Fifth
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 16 Life without Denny McClain still has its moments for the Detroit Tigers, and they en joyed several such moments to day as they whacked out a 104 decision over the New York Mets.

title: U.S. JUDGES MOVE TO CUT JURY SIZE FOR CIVIL TRIALS
description: WASHINGTON, March 16  The Judicial Conference of the United States has voted to re duce the size of juries in Fed eral civil trials below the tradi tional number of 12.

title: Nixon Grants Smith Interview for A.B.C.
description: President Nixon will ap pear in an exclusive televi sion and radio interview with Howard K. Smith of the American Broadcasting Com pany Monday from 9:30 to 10:30 P.M.

title: Hearing in Cyclist Case Set
description: CLEVELAND, March 16 (AP) The Cuyahoga County, grand jury is tentatively scheduled to meet in special session again next Monday to consider the case against 57 motorcyclists charged with firstdegree mur der in the slaying of five per sons at a motorcycle show here March. 6.

title: ROGERS COUNSELS ISRAELIS TO SEEK PACT FOR SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 Secretary of State William P. Rogers urged Israel today to seek security in a satisfactory political agreement with the United Arab Republic, guaran teed by an international peace keeping force, rather than in acquisition of territory.

title: TEACHER UPHELD ON PUPIL SEARCH
description: The right of a teacher to act as a parent in searching a youth suspected of possessing narcot ics has been upheld by the Appellate Term of State Su preme Court.

title: 10Year Power Outlook Is Held Bleak
description: When the torrid times come to the city this summer, push ing demand for cooling power to its annual peak, there is a real possibility that the Con solidated Edison Company will not have enough elec tricity to go around.

title: Miss Kellems Again Balks
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 (UPI)Vivien Kellems, 75 years old, of East Haddam, Conn., an nounced today that she had re fused for the third consecutive year to pay Federal income taxes, on the ground that tax laws discriminate against single persons. Instead, in a letter to Treasury Secretary John B, Connally Jr., she billed the Gov ernment for $76,323.40, which she said representts illegal taxes that the Government has taken from her over the last 20 years plus 6 per cent interest on the money.

title: Fordham on Delayed TV
description: WOR announced yesterday that it would televise on de layed tape tomorrow night's National Collegiate Eastern re gional semifinal basketball game between Fordham and Villanova from Raleigh, N. C., beginning at 8 P.M. on Chan nel 9.

title: Soviets Pin U.S.Matmen,64, But Wells, Sanders Score
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 16 (AP)The Soviet national wrestling team defeated the United States team last night, 64, but two world champions, Wayne Wells and Rick Sanders, scored decisions over their Soviet opponents.

title: SOUTH VIETNAMESE RETREAT 5 MILES FROM A LAOS BASE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, March 17  South Vietnamese forward units in Laos have reportedly with drawn five miles eastward to ward their own border under increasing enemy pressure.

title: Pennsy Will Sell Realty;
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 16 (AP)The financially troubled Penn Central Transportation Company said today it planned to sell real estate worth more than $390million and dispose of all other nontransportation assets where the sale will aid in the recovery of the nation's biggest railroad.

title: Massive School Aid Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 (AP) A huge increase in Fed eral support for elementary and secondary school education was proposed today by Representa tive Roman C. Pucinski, Demo crat, of Illinois, chairman of a House education subcommittee. Mr. Pucinski introduced a bill that would lead to the Federal Government's financing one third of the cost of such educa tion by 1972. The present Fed eral share is about 6 per cent.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 Tellers Say Boyle Ally Won U.A.W. District Race
description: PITTSBURGH, March 16 The reelection of Michael Bud zanosld as president of District 5 of the United Mine Workers was confirmed today by two of three tellers.

title: CONGRESS PASSES 10% BENEFIT RISE
description: WASHINGTON, March 16  Legislation providing a 10 per cent increase In Social Secur ity benefits for 26 million re tired people was rushed through both houses of Con gress today and sent to the White House.

title: Jersey Rate Rises
description: TRENTON, March 16 (UPI) Unemployment rose to 7.3 per cent of the total work force in New Jersey last month, the state reported today, increasing from 220,000 in January to 224,600.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: C.B.S.LineUp for Fall Omits OncePrized Country Comedies
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System formally announced last night the expected sweeping changes in its fall television schedule. The network is cast ing aside all vestiges of the ruralism that was once the net work's dominant trademark, dropping a record total of 13 shows with many nationally known names and introducing eight new attractions. Only four out of 17 returning cur rent programs will remain in their present time periods.

title: Sleepy Hollow H.S. Closed as Fighting Breaks Out 2d Day
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N. Y., March 16Sleepy Hollow High School was closed at 10 o'clock this morning and the 1,150 students sent home after racial tension threatened to become unmanageable, according to school officials here.

title: Couple in the News
description: Fast Eddie was his nick name in the days when he was lugging his bulging brief case from one extracurricular activity to another at the Trinity School here. But Ed ward Ridley Finch Cox has been just good friends with Tricia Nixon for six years. The slowmoving romance has kept gossip columnists busy try ing to monitor the couple's weekend and holiday visits at the White House, Camp David, San Clemente and Key Biscayne and at least one handholding meal at 21, the New York restaurant.

title: Pollution Law Challenged By Great Lakes Shippers
description: DETROIT, March 16 (AP) The Great Lakes Carriers As sociation filed a suit today in Federal Court here, contesting a new Michigan law requiring special antipollution devices on ships.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: PROSTITUTE DRIVE PRESSED BY POLICE
description: Strengthened police patrols, both uniformed and plain clothes, toured the district be tween Times Square and Cen tral Park yesterday in a drive against prostitutes.

title: BRUINS WIN, 114, SET MORE MARKS
description: DETROIT, March 16 (UPI) John Bucyk collected his sec ond goal of the game 3 minutes 3 seconds from the end of a 114 walloping of the Detroit Red Wings tonight to make the Boston Bruins the first team in National Hockey League his tory to have two 50goal scorers in a season.

title: Market Place:GAF Dissidents Amend Lawsuit
description: Dissident shareholders of the GAF Corporationled by Seymour Milstein, whose family owns $5million of GAF stockhave amended their suit against manage ment. The suit filed Monday, charged that the annual re port is misleading.

title: Hans Kohn, Historian, Is Dead; Constant Critic of Nationalism
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 16 Hans Kohn, a historian re nowned for analyzing the bit ter seeds of modern nation alism, died today at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania Hospi tal here. He was 79 years old.

title: Frazier Enters Hospital With High Blood Pressure
description: Joe Frazier was admitted to St. Luke's Hospital in Philadelphia yesterday for what his physician described as high blood pressure related to the world heavy weight champion's commit ments following his strenu ous victory over Muhammad Ali last week at Madison Square Garden.

title: Hawks Top 76ers, 130125, as Hudson, Maravich Collect 71 Points
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 16 (UPI)Lou Hudson and Pete Maravich combined for 71 points as the Atlanta Hawks de feated the Philadelphia 76ers, 130125, in a National Basket ball Association game tonight.

title: Advertising:
description: Samples of the new Per sonna 74 tungsten steel razor blade may not be finding their way into homes in newspaper inserts, but they'll be getting around.

title: LIFE TERMS ASKED IN BOMBING CASES
description: ALBANY, March 16 React ing to the rash of bombs placed recently in public build ings, Governor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today a bill that would provide a maximum sentence of life imprisonment for those convicted of detonat ing bombs or explosives in oc cupied buildings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cavaliers Win, 108103
description: CLEVELAND, March 16 (UPI) Bobby Smith scored a career high of 37 points and Walt Wesley sparked the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 108103 victory over the San Francisco War riors tonight.

title: Union at Bell Telephone Seeks 25% Raise in Year
description: WASHINGTON March 16 (AP)  Joseph A. Beirne, presi dent of the Communications Workers of America, said today that his union would demand at least 25 per cent in wage increases for one year for nearly 500,000 Bell Telephone System workers.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 For more than a decade one of the big spurs to water pollu tion abatement, in the opinion of many persons, has been the uncomfortable spotlight of pub lic attention focused on pol luters.

title: Upsets Mark Vote in Rockland as Suburbanites Go to Polls
description: Rockland County provided a few upsets in the elections held in four suburban, counties yes terday.

title: SAN JUAN CAMPUS OPENS TO FACULTY
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., March 16 The faculty returned today, without incident, to the Rio Piedras campus of the Univer sity of Puerto Rico.

title: Bridge: Many TopRanked Teams Trail In Vanderbilt Knockout Play
description: ATLANTA, March 16The Vanderbilt Knockout Team Championship went into its second round here this after noon with almost all of the country's top players on the first step of a ladder that can lead them to the 1973 world championship.

title: Bulls Beat Bullets
description: CHICAGO, March 16 (UPI) The Chicago Bulls led all the way tonight to beat the Balti more Bullets, 11399, and move within two victories of a play off spot in the National Basket ball Association.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: MARCH 16, 1971 THE PRESIDENT

title: Food Additive Is Assailed As Potential Cancer Cause
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 (AP)An Agricultural Depart ment official said today that his agency shared the concern of a medical specialist who be lieves a widely used food pre servative may cause cancer.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 The longsubmerged differ ences between Israel and the United States over the shape of a final settlement in the Mid dle. East were fully exposed to day in the almost simultaneous statements by Premier Golda Meir and Secretary of State William P. Rogers. Though neither country wanted it that way, the next phase of the search for a solu tion will involve negotiation between them rather than negotiation by them with the United Arab Re public and the Soviet Union.

title: Ohio Governor Outlines HighTax, HighService Plan
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 16 The necessity of raising taxes cost at least a halfdozen Gover nors their jobs last November, and governorships are coming to be regarded among politi cians as dead ends.

title: Citizens of the Corporation
description: One of the unheralded miracles of American business is that during a period when many traditional systems of authority are passionately contested in government, law enforcement, prisons, churches, education, and the military, for some examples  the internal government of the large corporation seems to have escaped all serious challenge.

title: Knesset Given, Bill to Help Soviet Jews Become Israelis
description: JERUSALEM, March 16 (Reu ters)The Israeli Minister the Interior, Dr. Yosef Burg, today introduced a bill in the Knesset, or parliament, that would authorize him to grant Israeli citizenship to any Jew who expressed a desire to come to Israel.

title: Ukrainian Rite Catho From U.S. Assail Vatican
description: ROME, March 16A group of Catholics of the Ukrainian Rite from the United States charged here today that the Va tican was sacrificing their church for the sake of closer relations between the Papacy and the Kremlin.

title: SUGAR ISSUE PRESSED BY BRITAIN IN TALKS
description: BRUSSELS, March 16  Brit ain's chief negotiator on Com mon Market membership warn ed today that developing coun tries of the Commonwealth faced political and economic chaos if the market's enlarge ment resulted in cutbacks in their sugar sales to Britain.

title: PRICES OF BONDS CONTINUE CLIMB
description: The credit markets gained more strength yesterday as bond prices continued to climb and interest rates kept moving downward, keeping intact the move that began one week earlier.

title: Excerpt From Speech by Premier Meir
description: JERUSALEM, March 16 (Reuters)  Following in an unofficial translation from the Hebrew is an excerpt from a speech given today in the Knesset (parliament) by Pre mier Golda Meir, dealing with the interview she granted last week to Louis Heren of The Times of London:

title: Mrs. King Among Victors In Tennis Preliminaries
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., March 16 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King, the No. 1, seeded player, beat Karen Krantzcke of Australia, 46, 64, 63, in a preliminary match of the K Mart invita tional tennis tournament today.

title: ExMayor in Jersey Pleads Guilty in Conspiracy
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., March 16 (AP)John R. Armellino, a former Mayor of West New York, N. J., has pleaded guilty to misconduct in office and Ob struction of justice in connec tion with charges of conspiracy to protect the gambling inter ests of Joseph Zicarelli, a re puted leader of organized crime.

title: IT'S A. B. A. TURN IN GARDEN AGAIN
description: The American Basketball As sociation will conduct its sec ond foray of the season into enemy territory tonight with a doubleheader at Madison Square Garden.

title: About Motor Sports
description: A championship program featuring such gutty cars as Corvette, Shelby Cobra, AMX, bigbore Camaros, Mustangs and Barracudas, Porsche 911 and 9146 and Alfa Romeo should make an interesting series. That is just what John Bishop is out to prove this season. Bishop, president of the International Mo tor Sports Asso ciation, has just set up the IMSA GT Series, which will offer races of at least 300 miles or three hours in length, most of them on road courses.

title: Norway Formally Names Minority Labor Government
description: OSLO, Norway, March 16  Norway's minority Labor Party, Government was formally named today by King Olav V and the outgoing coalition Gov ernment.

title: YANKS DEFEATED BY WHITE SOX, 80
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 16 (UPI)Tom Bradley, Terry Foster and Stan Perzanowski combined to hold the New York Yankees to four hits tonight as the Chicago White Sox scored an 80 victory in the first of two exhibition games in Vene zuela. The loss was the Yan kees' eighth in a row.

title: Chile Increasingly Blames International Conspiracy for Woes
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 16 As Chile's economic and po litical difficulties sharpen, the Government and the Marxist parties that support it are in creasingly blaming an interna tional conspiracy for their problems.

title: AUTO MEN ASSAIL AIR QUALITY RULES
description: DETROIT, March 16  The automobile industry opposed today cleanair proposals by the Environmental Protection Agency, contending that the standards were tougher than necessary for health and safety.

title: Ribicoff Offers Bill Requiring Integration of Suburbs
description: WASHINGTON, March 16 Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff of, Connecticut proposed today legislation that would require significant racial integration of schools and housing patterns in all the nation's suburbs.

title: Excerpts From Rogers News Conference
description: WASHINGTON, March 16  Following are excerpts from the news conference held here today by Secretary of State William P. Rogers:

title: California Vote Bill Gains
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 16 (UPI)The California State Senate approved today a pro posed constitutional amend ment to lower the voting age to 18 in all elections and en franchise an estimated total of 1.5 million young Californians. The measure was sent to the State Assembly. If approved by the lower house, it will be sub mitted to voters in June for ratification.

title: Executive Changes
description: Marsh & McLennan, an nounced yesterday the election of John M. Re gan Jr. as president, ef fective May 19, 1971. Mr. Regan, 49 years old, suc ceeds Henry W. Otis who is retiring from this posi tion and as chairman of the board of the Mar lennan Corporation, the parent company, after 35 years of service with the organization. His succes sor as chairman of Mar lennan will be named at a later date. Mr. Otis will remain a member of the boards of Marsh & McLen nan, of Marlennan, and of the Putnam Manage ment Company, Inc., a subsidiary. Mr. Regan, formerly executive vice_ presi dent of Marsh & McLennan, will also continue to serve as a director of the Marlennan Corporation. Mr. Regan joined the international insurance brokers and employe benefits consultants in 1946.

title: A Fashion Show to Whip Up Enthusiasm for a Cleaner New York
description: The weather was balmy, the pollution count low and the sun shone brightly on Central Park yesterday. The day should have inspired the crowd of 200, mainly women, who attended a lunch at the TavernontheGreen to rush out and help clean up New York.

title: Miss Churchill Quits As Queen of NATO Fete
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 16 (UPI)  Arabella Churchill, granddaughter of Sir Winston Churchill, withdrew today as queen of Norfolk's 18th an nual International Azalea Festival because she disap proves of war and modern weaponry. The festival is held each spring when azaleas are in bloom to salute the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, whose naval headquarters are here. A young woman from one of the 15 NATO mem ber nations traditionally serves as its queen.

title: Haywood Testifies Denver Misled Him on Contract
description: LOS ANGELES, March 16 (AP)Spencer Haywood testi fied today he could not under stand how his sixyear contract with the Denver Rockets to taled $1.9million, as publicized by the American Basketball As sociation club.

title: TURKISH PARTIES PLAN A COALITION
description: ANKARA, Turkey, March 17 Leaders of Turkey's four major political parties agreed in principle today to join a coalition cabinet to be headed by an independent, nonpartisan figure. Their accord smoothed the way out of a constitutional crisis that had threatened to end in a military coup d'tat since the military forced out Premier Suleyman Demirel last Friday.

title: Cairo Allows New Visit to Suez Line
description: ISMAILIA, United Arab Republic, March 16  The Israelis won't allow journal ists to visit their side of the front any more, but you can get a good view of it from here, an Egyptian major re marked today as he gestured across the Suez Canal at Israeli positions dug in be hind broad tangles of barbed wire.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: BUFFALO, March 16 (UPI) Nate Archibald scored 25 points and Sam Lacey added 23 tonight to lead the Cincin nati Royals to a 113102 victory over the Buffalo Braves before a Memorial Auditorium record crowd of 11,248.

title: City Board of Education Hears The Voluble Voice of the People
description: For the five members of the Board of Education last night was once again time for the vox populi, when citizens con cerned with city schools bring their complaints, suggestions, grievances, observations and sometimes admixtures of all four to 110 Livingston Street in Brooklyn.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON REGISTER A DROP
Rogers Denies That U.S. Policy Is Affected by Oil Off Vietnam
