description: The decline in industrial production last month and the slowdown of gains in income and construction make it increasingly improbable that the Nixon Administration will see its forecast of a $1,065billion Gross National Product realized this year.

title: NAVY DISCHARGED 6,700 ON DRUG USE
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 (UPI)John H. Chafee, Secre tary of the Navy, said today that the Navy and Marine Corps discharged 6,700 men last year for drug abuse.

title: YORKVILLE PROJECT MEETS OPPOSITION
description: Community Planning Board 8 rejected last night a city backed plan for 2,600 units of urban renewal housing on the Ruppert Brewery site in Yorkville.

title: The Theater: Pinkville Rages at War's Brutality
description: How brutaland, more im portant, how brutalizingis American military training? That is the very grave sub ject matter of George Ta bori's Pinkville, now at the American Place Theater.

title: Patterson to Fight Daniels
description: CLEVELAND, March 17 (AP) Floyd Patterson will meet Terry Daniels of Dallas in the 10round main heavyweight bout at the Cleveland Arena April 14. Daniels has a 2721 wonlostdrawn record.

title: Soviet Accuses China on U.S.
description: MOSCOW, March 17 (AP) The Soviet Union, breaking a long silence in its ideological warfare with Communist China, has accused the Chinese of playing a dangerous game by trying to improve relations with the United States.

title: Rape Charge Against Seven Dropped; 1 Hell's Angel Held
description: Charges against seven mem bers of the Hell's Angels motor cycle gang arrested last week in connection with the alleged rape of a 17yearold girl in an East Village leather goods store were dismissed yesterday by Criminal Court Judge Thomas G. Weaver.

title: More Jews Seek Exit Permits
description: MOSCOW, March 17 (UPI) A group of about 50 Jews went to the Soviet Communist party headquarters today to press their demands for permission to leave the Soviet Union for Is rael, Jewish sources said. Offi cials told them to return tomor row to receive answers to their petitions, the sources said.

title: O'Brien Declares the South Reconciled With Democrats
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., March 17 (AP)The Democratic national chairman, Lawrence F. O'Brien, said tonight the South had re sumed its rightful place in the Democratic party, and would play a crucial role in the 1972 Presidential election.

title: Manufacturers Trust Posts
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust announced yesterday the promotion to senior vice presi dents of Donald W. Baker and Lawrence H. Bober, formerly vice presidents. Mr. Baker will supervise region one of the metropolitan division consisting of 12 branches on the upper, East Side of Manhattan.

title: Queens Soldier Is Killed
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 (UPI)The Defense Depart ment announced today that Specialist 4 James T. Williams Jr., of the Army, from Jamaica, Queens, had been killed in ac tion in Southeast Asia.

title: Rumanians, With More Benefits, Are Being Urged to Work Hard
description: BUCHAREST, March 14 When President Nicolae Ceau sescu of Rumania met with a large group of artists and art critics here last month, George Aposto, a young sculptor, took the floor to complain how dif ficult it was for him to get wood to carve and how high his taxes were.

title: ClosedCircuit TV to Show Cordobes Bullfight June 13
description: El Cordobs, the renowned Spanish bullfighter, will appear on closedcircuit television in a live telecast of a bullfight from Jaen, Spain on June 13. Man agement Television Systems, which produced the closedcir cuit coverage of the Joe Frazi erMuhammad All fight, will similarly produce the coverage.

title: CELTICS SET BACK LAKERS BY 112104
description: BOSTON, March 17 (AP) The Boston Celtics held Wilt Chamberlain to a point in the first half, posted a 19point halftime lead and defeated the Los Angeles Lakers, 112104, in a National Basketball Asso ciation game tonight at Boston Garden.

title: Plan commission Approves 34th Street Heliport
description: The City Planning Commis sion approved a permit yester day for a new heliport on the edge of the East River at 34th Street to replace the abandoned facility on top of the Pan Am Building.

title: Delta Selected for Routes Between U.S. and Jamaica
description: WASHINGTON, March 17, (AP)  A Civil Aeronautics Board examiner recommended today the selection of Delta Air Lines over three other ap plicants for routes to Jamaica from Chicago and Atlanta.

title: A VIGOROUS FINISH ERASES STOCK ??
description: Stock prices snapped bad from a broad decline yesterday just as Wall Street analyst were clearing their throats to intone that the market needed consolidation after its dynamic gains.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Potomac Bill Offered
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 (UN)  Legislation authorizing Federal purchase of an amuse ment park across the Potomac River from Mount Vernon, the Virginia home of George Wash ington, was introduced today by Senator Clifford P. Case, Republican of New Jersey, in the interest of preserving the shoreline.

title: RATES FOR BILLS CLIMB SHARPLY
description: The Government's $5billion financing that was announced Tuesday drove Treasury bill rates up sharply yesterday, breaking off the prolonged de cline that had taken place with almost no interruption since September.

title: James Kreger in Triumph as Cellist
description: Since phenomenally good debut recitals do not happen very often, James Kreger's formal entry into the ranks of cello virtuosi at Carnegie Recital Hall Tuesday night must be accounted a memor able event. His appearance was sponsored by the Concert Artists Guild.

title: SEALS TOP PENGUINS ON EHMAN GOALS, 52
description: OAKLAND, Calif., March 17 (UPI)Gerry Ehman scored two goals in the final period tonight to spark the California Seals to a 52 National Hockey League victory over the Pittsburgh Pen guins. The victory ended a nine game streak in which the Seals had not won.

title: Extra Hour for Bars Approved by Governor
description: ALBANY, March 17Gov ernor Rockefeller approved a measure today permitting bars to open at noon on Sun days instead of at 1 P.M.

title: Program Like  Sesame Street Planned for College Freshmen
description: TUXEDO, N. Y., March 17.  Educators and education broadcasting specialists have been meeting at the Sterling Forest Conference Center this week to plan a venture that would adapt the techniques of the Sesame Street television programs to reach deficient highschool, and firstyear col lege students, and highschool dropouts.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW DECLINES
description: The London Stock Exchange drifted down yesterday, mainly because there were few buyers. The rise on Wall Street failed to overcome pessimism brought about by the imminent national engineering strike in protest against the Government's pro posed labor relations bill, and its forthcoming unemployment figures.

title: Cherry Blossom Time at the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTONMany new occurrences inevitably come with spring some pleasantwarmer weather, Japanese cherry blossoms; some not so pleasanta proposed higher defense budget, warnings of grave dan gers to this country because of new developments in Soviet weaponry.

title: ISRAEL DENOUNCES ROGERS PROPOSAL ON MIDEAST PEACE
description: TEL AVIV, March 17  Pre mier Golda Meir today led Is raeli denunciations of a pro posal for Middle East peace put forward by Secretary of State William P. Rogers.

title: MAX SCHLING JR.
description: DANBURY, Conn., March 17 Max Schling Jr., who retired in 1969 as chairman of Max Schling, Inc., New York flor ists, was pronounced dead in Danbury Hospital yesterday after having suffered a heart attack at his home. He was 56 years old and lived on Clear view Drive in nearby Brook field.

title: A Federal Panel Says the United States Must Choose a National Policy for Growth of Population
description: WASHINGTON, March 17 By the year 2071, the popula tion of the United States could be as low as 340 million or as high as a billion, and the nation must develop a policy geared to one of these limits, a Federal commission declared today.

title: The Way Out for Turkey
description: To head off an outright military takeover, Turkey's four major parties have agreed to participate in a coali tion government of national unity. Their decision seems the least damaging way out of the crisis precipitated last week when the military chiefs forced out the elected Government of Premier Demirel.

title: Governor Offers Plan to Speed Trials
description: ALBANY, March 17  In an effort to cut court delays, Gov ernor Rockefeller proposed a constitutional amendment to day to permit persons accused of most felonies to waive grand jury proceedings and indict ments.

title: GOULD ACQUISITION OF DICTAPHONE SET
description: Gould, Inc., and the Dicta phone Corporation announced yesterday that they had agreed in principle for the acquisition of Dictaphone by Gould, manu facturer of automotive, indus trial and consumer batteries.

title: Photo Believed a Clue in Murder
description: The police in the Crotona Park section of the Bronx circulated a photograph yes terday of a teenage girl in the hope that her identifica tion would help them solve the murder last month of a 75yearold Bronx realestate operator.

title: Nixon Leads Mourners at Young Funeral
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., March 17  President Nixon said today that A great nation will pay its respects to Whitney Young by continuing the work to which he dedicated his entire life.

title: Student Held in Slaying During U. of Puerto Rico Riot
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., March 17 A thirdyear student at the Uni versity of Puerto Rico was ar rested today and charged with the slaying of the commander of the riot police last Thursday during rioting on the Rio Pied ras campus.

title: Sports of The Times
description: One of the special guards, a Southerner who said he used to pitch circus tents and resent the publicity given to trapeze artists, pulled a gloved hand out of his pea jacket and pointed farther down Eighth Avenue, Why don't he get a license, that somgun gon' charge 50 cents for two pretzels, they both be cold.

title: Census Study Finds Income Shift From the Rich to the Poor
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The processes of government now shifts income from rich to poor with substantially greater effect than is commonly be lieved, according to a complex new study by two Census Bu reau experts.

title: Fox Film Corp. Picks New Chief After 2Month Delay
description: After a twoandahalf month interregnum, a new pres ident and chief operating offi cer was named yesterday by the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation.

title: Advertising:
description: Almost a record crowd was the way the Association of National Advertisers de scribed yesterday's attend ance at the Plaza for its workshop.

title: GOVERNOR TO DROP COMMUNITY BONDS FOR TRANSIT ISSUE
description: ALBANY, March 18Gover nor Rockefeller, in his latest fiscal retreat, has dropped plans for a community development bond issue of up to $10billion that he had described in his an nual message in January as one of his two most important legislative objectives.

title: BonnPrague Talks to Begin
description: BON, March 18 (Reuters) West Germany and Czechoslo vakia will start preliminary talks in Prague March 30 on a treaty to normalize relations, a West German Government spokesman, said today.

title: MRS. A. ATWATER KENT
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 18 (AP)  Mrs. A. Atwater Kent, widow of the pioneer radio manufacturer died yesterday at her home in Newtown Square. She was 86 years old.

title: Chaim Goldberg's Art Shown in Queens
description: It is no startling revela tion that the arts in most American communities were for a long time considered one of the most dispensable elements of the society. For tunately, such a jejune atti tude has changed somewhat and many citizens have dis covered the importance and the enjoyment of the arts within the culture. One con sequence of this interest has been the establishment of arts councils that have ap preciably enhanced the cul tural life in their respective communities. The Queens Council on the Arts, for ex ample, was founded in 1966 and, since then, has remark ably increased the cultural activity of its borough in both the performing and vis ual arts.

title: U. S. COPTERS LIFT 1,000 OUT OF LAOS; FIGHTING IS BITTER
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, March 19Hundreds of battered and weary South Vietnamese soldiers were lifted out of Laos by American heli copters yesterday after some of the fiercest fighting of their campaign against Communist supply lines.

title: A Meringue Pie Made With Oranges
description: In the menus below dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Exchange Rule Change Asks Flexible Rate on Big Trades
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that its board of governors had proposed constitution amend ments that would, if approved by a vote of the membership, allow commissions on portions of orders in excess of $500,000 to be negotiated.

title: Are the Master Technicians Mad?
description: LONDONConventional passenger planes, like conventional weapons, have their pros and cons. The pros and cons of supersonic planes are surely the same, simply raised to the supersonic degree.

title: City Teachers Will Get Return on Tax Error
description: A computer error involv ing the Federal surtax cost the city's teachers a total of $291,570 since last July 1, when the tax went from 10 to 5 per cent, a spokesman for the City Controller's of fice said yesterday.

title: Nixon Auto Insurance Plan Leaves Reform to States
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The Nixon Administration, dis carding the recommendations of a Transportation Department study, offered Congress today an automobile Insurance reform plan that would leave the legis lation to the states.

title: JUDGE IN DAVIS CASE EXPLAINS DEPARTURE
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 18 (AP)A judge said today that he had disqualified him self from the Angela Davis case because he was accused of prej udice and did not want to go through any hullabaloo on it.

title: Chinese Leaving Guerrilla Area In Borneo at Urging of Military
description: PONTIANAK, Indonesia, March 16  Thousands of ethnic Chinese farmers and river tradesmen have begun to leave the steamy jungles of central Borneo, where the In donesian Army has enlisted local Dyak tribesmen in putting down a small but tenacious guerrilla movement.

title: Screen: 8 Short Works
description: Steps Toward a New Con sciousness is the title of a program of short films that, according to David Bien stock, the Whitney Museum's film program director, at tempt to communicate and make visible some of the ex periences of the new Amer ican spiritual revolution.

title: Marquette's Streak Hatlted at 39;
description: ATHENS, Ga., March 18 (UPI) Ohio State ended Marquette's 39game winning streak with 6059 upset and Western Ken tucky routed the University of Kentucky, 10783, tonight in the Mideast Regional semifinals of the National Collegiate basketball tournament.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE AS VOLUME RISES
description: The stock market appeared to be consolidating some of its recent large gains yesterday as the list made a modest advance in active trading.

title: New City Dog Licenses
description: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals said yesterday it was now issuing New York City dog licenses, which expire one year from date of sale instead of on April 30, regardless of date of purchase, as under previous law. The society said permis sion to issue such licenses was granted yesterday when Gov ernor Rockefeller signed an lamendment to the dog license law. The new law  which raises the cost of the license to $6.10goes into effect May ??

title: 270 Penn Central Cars Found on Wrong Track
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 18 (AP)More than 270 Penn Central railroad freight cars valued at more than $1mil lion disappeared from the line's possession in the last year and turned up repaint ed on the tracks of a tiny Illinois railroad, United States Attorney Louis C. Bechtle said today.

title: Week's G.I. Death Toll In Indochina Put at 45
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 18 (AP)The United States command said today that 45 Americans were killed in combat in Indochina last week, an increase of one over the previous week. It listed 156 Americans wound ed, compared with 434 the week before.

title: PRESIDENT URGES MASS TRANSIT AID
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 President Nixon asked Congress today to send $2.56billion in Federal funds to states and cities to help build a bal anced transportation system that would reduce dependence on the automobile.

title: Estate of Mrs. Flora Whiting Estimated at $25Million
description: Mrs. Flora Ettlinger Whiting, widow of Giles Whiting, a man ufacturer of Persian rugs, has left an estate estimated at $20 million to $25million, accord ing to a will offered for probate in the New York Surrogate Court.

title: General Is Placed in Command Of StrifeTorn City in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 18 An Argentine Army commander took charge of the troubled city of Crdoba today after the Government declared the area an emergency zone.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Cambodia Is Vigilant and Restrained One Year After the Ouster of Sihanouk
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, March 18Cambodia today marked the first anniversary of the overthrow of Prince Noro dom Sihanouk with a ban on public demonstrations, an air of vigilance and a display of flags on public buildings.

title: U.S. Textile Views Explained to Japan
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  Japan has been officially in formed that the United States might in theory restrict textile imports through two provisions of existing law, but neither is under active consideration by the Government.

title: Pentagon Aide, Reporting Big New Soviet Missile Silos, Warns of Research Gap
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  United States intelligence of ficials say they have recently detected large new missile si los in the Soviet Union. The silos, they add, could be part of an intercontinental ballistic missile system that could make major United States wea pon systems obsolete in the late nineteenseventies.

title: EBAN SEES THANT AND THEN JARRING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 18  Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel met sepa rately today with Secretary General Thant and Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring and restated his na tion's determination to hold on to boundaries that it considers defensible.

title: Tigers Top Mets, 54, on 12Hit Attack as Lolich Hurls 6 Shutout Innings
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 18Gil Hodges's hour of decision drew nearer but not clearer today when the New York Mets lost to the Detroit Tigers, 54, for the second time in three days.

title: Meeting Seen as First Step
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Senior United States ?? said today that they ?? tomorrow's conference between Secretary of State Rogers and Foreign Minister Eban as a first step in a protracted and com plex diplomatic process.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Drops
description: OTTAWA, March 18 (Reuters) The average yield on today's weekly issue of $165million of 91day Government of Canada Treasury bills declined to 2.99 per cent from last week's 3.34 per cent.

title: U.S. AIDE CANCELS SENATE TESTIMONY
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 An Assistant Secretary of De fense today invoked a new rea son  a luncheon date  in declining to testify before the Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee in support of the Geneva protocol banning chemical and biological weapons.

title: Board May Get a Black Firm
description: A resolution of the issue of negotiated commission rates has apparently cleared away the final hurdle for the admis sion of the first blackowned securities firm to the New York Stock Exchange.

title: SST Grounded
description: It is uncommon for the House of Representatives to reject a recommendation of its Appropriations Com mittee. By a vote of 215 to 204, however, the House yesterday overruled this powerful committee and denied additional money for the supersonic transport.

title: 2 State Justices Appointed
description: Justices Samuel A. Spiegel and Joseph A. Brust have been appointed assistant administra tive judges of the Supreme Court, First Judicial District, it was announced yesterday.

title: SIX PLEAD GUILTY IN BOMBING PLOT
description: Six persons described by the police as members of the radi cal Weatherman organization pleaded guilty yesterday on the eve of their trial to charges of conspiracy to set fire to a group of buildings, one of which contains the offices of President Nixon's former law firm.

title: EXTENSION OF O.E.O. BACKED IN NIXON BILL
description: WASHINGTON March 18 The Nixon Administration sent to Congress today a bill to re new the Office of Economic Op portunity and Federal anti poverty programs for two years.

title: News of Skiing; Holderness Students Rate A+ on Slopes
description: Skiing continues to grow impressively at boarding schools in the North Country, but on few campuses is the enthusiasm for the sport as pronounced as it is at the Holderness School.

title: JOSEPH F. FEILY, LED CIVIL SERVICE UNION
description: ALBANY, March 18 (UPI) Joseph F. Feily, former pres ident of the New York State Civil Service Employes Associa tion, died yesterday in St. Peter's Hospital after a brief ill ness. He was 62 years old.

title: HANOI AND VIETCONG CONTINUING PROTEST
description: PARIS, March 18 (AP)The thief North Vietnamese and Vietcong delegates boycotted the Vietnam peace talks today for the third week in succession to protest against What they called United States plans to extend the war into North Vietnam.

title: AGENCY ASKS END OF DETENTION ACT
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  A House Judiciary subcommit tee heard testimony today urg ing the repeal of the Emer gency Detention Act that was enacted during the McCarthy era 21 years ago.

title: Modern Design Authorized For Town House Blast Site
description: A contemporary design will be accepted for the build ing on the site of the Green wich Village town house de stroyed by an explosion early last year, the Landmarks Preservation Commission said yesterday.

title: Dance: Pineapple Poll
description: The City Center Joffrey Ballet has restored John Cranko's Pineapple Poll to the repertory, with two new Captain Belayes: Dermot Burke, who danced the role for the first time last week, and Paul Sutherland, who made his debut last night.

title: Sports of The Times
description: TAMPA, Fla., March 18Although the Baltimore Orioles won the last World Series in emphatic style, the one fella who turned it into something of a personal triumph was Sparky Anderson, then the rookie manager of the Cincinnati Reds. Suddenly exposed to nationwide scrutiny for the first time, the chief mechanic for the Big Red Machine handled a difficult role in such refreshing fashion that he won friends and admirers in wholesale lots.

title: ARTS ADVOCATES ASK FOR MORE U.S. HELP
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (UPI)  The Federal Govern ment spends too much money on scientific research and not enough on literature, painting and music, two advocates of the arts told Congress today.

title: U.S. Expresses Regret
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The United States expressed deep regret today over Nor way's intention to establish dip lomatic relations with North Vietnam. A State Department spokesman said that the depart ment was notified yesterday by the Norwegian Embassy here that diplomatic relations would be established with Hanoi, and that the American Embassy in Oslo had been informed.

title: PRO MUSICA OFFERS A GERMAN PROGRAM
description: The New York Pro Musica's history goes back to Noah that's Noah Greenberg, the group's late founder and cata lyst, of courseand ?? its degree of excellence varies from year to year as members come and go, excellent it re Mains. The current Pro Musica, now directed by Paul Maynard, gave a typical program on Wednesday night at Alice Tul ly Hall, a survey, course in German Music of the Renais sance and Early Baroque.

title: Beame Says Late Filing by City Cost $2.5Million in Health Aid
description: The city lost nearly $2.5, mil lion in state and Federal Medic aid and Medicare reimburse ments because it ignored Warnings from the state on timely filings of claims, City Controller Abraham D. Beame Charged yesterday.

title: A Flamboyant Figure
description: Flamboyant, fasttalking and a daringly irrepressible maker of big deals, Leland Hayward was an almost legendary fig ure in the entertainment world.

title: 9.6% Rate Rise Won By Jersey Blue Cross
description: TRENTON, March 18 (UPI) The New Jersey State In surance Department an nounced new Blue Cross rates today, averaging a 9.6 per cent increase  roughly half of what had been sought.

title: CONTROL DATA CORP. UNVEILS COMPUTERS
description: The Control Data Corpora tion introduced yesterday a new family of computers, a method of tying the machines into nationwide timesharing systems and intentions to cap ture a greater share of the market in business data proc essing.

title: Dan & Phil & Edgar & John
description: WORCESTER, Mass.Two priests are sitting in their prison cells in Dan bury, Conn., separated from all contact with the outside world and yet send ing out shock waves across the coun try. This is an extraordinary achieve ment, even for Dan and Phil Berrigan, but they could never have brought it off alone. They needed accomplices. And these were eagerly supplied by the F.B.I., the Justice Department and the White House.

title: Hashish Found on Ship
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 18 (AP)Ten pounds of hashish, valued by Bureau of Norcotics officials at $15,000, was found aboard the destroyer Harold J. Ellison Wednesday when ship returned from a sevenmonth deployment to the Indian Ocean. A crew member, Robert Paccione, was charged with possession of the drug and is awaiting a summary court martial, a Navy spokesman said.

title: Addiction: Chemistry Is the New Hope, but Degree of Its Effectiveness Is Still Disputed
description: After five years of waiting and hoping, many of New York's elected officials are turning away from psycho therapy as a way to treat heroin addicts and are rely ing instead on chemistry.

title: A New Watchdog on Welfare Is Proposed in an Albany Bill
description: ALBANY, March 18Backed by the Assembly Speaker, the chairmen of the State Legis lature's welfare committees pro posed today that a new state office be set up to take over the watchdog tasks of wel fare departments.

title: Delta, Tristar Customer, Orders Five DC10 Jets
description: Hedging its bet in the tense poker game touched off by the collapse of RollsRoyce, Ltd., Delta Air Linesone of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's major customers for the troubled L1011 Tristar jet liner  announced yesterday that it had ordered five DC10 jets.

title: Flyers Halt Rangers, 21;
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 18 Bruce Gamble, who had yielded 20 goals in four losing efforts since he was acquired, sudden ly became a wall tonight as the Philadelphia Flyers halted the Rangers' 11game unbeaten streak with a 21 victory.

title: U.S. WORKERS IN SUIT TO END POLITICS BAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (UPI)A group of Government workers filed suit today to over turn the 30yearold Hatch Act, which prohibits the nation's 2.8 million civilian Federal em ployes from engaging in par tisan political activity.

title: POWER CUT LOSSES PUT IN MILLIONS
description: New York City estimated yesterday that $2.5million would be the cost of wages for any lost hour in which the workers in a city's high rise, sealedwindow office building had to be sent home because of a loss of electricity.

title: Head of Training Getting ChiefofDetectives Post
description: Assistant Chief Inspector Al bert A. Seedman, the Police De partment's director of training, will be named Chief of Detec tives today by Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy.

title: Executive Changes
description: Pan American Airways, Inc., announced yesterday that Donald M. Kendall James A. Linen 3d and Thomas J. Watson Jr. have been named to the board of directors. Mr. Kendall is president and chief exec utive officer of Pepisco, Inc.; Mr. Linen, chairman of the executive committee of Time, Inc., and Mr. Watson is chairman of the International Business Machines Corporation.

title: 2 Generals Face Demotion Over Roles in Mylai Case
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  Gen. William C. West moreland has recommended that Maj. Gen. Samuel W. Koster and the general who was his assistant in command of the Army division involved in the alleged masacre at the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai 4 be demoted and rep rimanded, Pentagon sources said today.

title: COLUMBIA, N.Y.U. GAIN IN FENCING
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 18The defending champion New York University fencing team was one of 12 schools to qualify all three of its fencers in today's opening round of the National Collegiate champion ships at the Air Force Acad emy. The final two rounds will be held tomorrow and Saturday.

title: Advertising:
description: J. Wesley Rosberg has re signed as president of Buchen Advertising, Inc., Chicago, after 25 years because of basic policy differences.

title: East Side Express Bus Route Sought
description: Permission to operate express buses during the rush hours along the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive, between Manhattan's Yorkville section and the finan cial district downtown, is being sought by the Transit Author ity, sources in the agency said yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: AT THE EDGE OF HISTORY. By William Irwin Thompson. 180 pages, Harper & Row. $6.95.

title: Yellow Fever in Angola
description: LISBON, March 18Luanda, capital of Portugal's West Afri can territory of Angola, is threatened by an epidemic of yellow fever, Portuguese press agencies reported today.

title: N. & W. AND C. & O. END MERGER PLAN
description: John P. Fishwick and Gregory S. DeVine, presidents respec tively of the Norfolk & Western and Chesapeake & Ohio Rail ways, announced yesterday that they had decided against the merger they proposed five and a half years ago.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: BOSTON, March 18Tra ditionally, in the northeast ern states, coastal and inland gunners disagree on the best time for the migratory water fowl hunting season.

title: Berets Chute Into Bay State And Are Met by Protesters
description: NORTH ADAMS, Mass., March 18A force of 105 Green Ber ets parachuted into Harriman Airport and the surrounding residential district today in a tactical combat training mis sion and were met by 1,500 onlookers, about 300 of whom were jeering antiwar protesters from Williams College.

title: Aid to Fishing Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)  Representative Michael J. Harrington, Democrat of Mas sachusetts, introduced today a $100million Federal program to help the fishing industry.

title: Store Sales Reported
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The Commerce Department to day estimated last week's de partment store sales at $631 million, virtually unchanged from the yearearlier $628mil lion. Last week's, total retail store sales were about $6,872, 000,000, up 5 per cent from $6,526,000,000.

title: Laver and Okker Reach Final in Tennis at Garden
description: A straightset victory over Dennis Ralston sent a refreshed Rod Laver into tonight's final round of the Tennis Champions Classic at Madison Square Garden.

title: TESTIMONY READ TO CALLEY JURY
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 18The jury in the Mylai mur der trial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. concluded its sec ond day of deliberations today by asking for a reading of the evidence of several Witnesses concerning a charge that Lieu tenant Calley had murdered at least 30 Vietnamese at the southern edge of the village.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaThe American way of life is a much battered apho rism that has been sadly tarnished by hostile propaganda both inside and outside the United States. With more than a touch of a sneer it has come to imply a kind of dislike for U.S. policy in Latin America where adver saries stress our inability to find quick solutions to burgeoning urban, race and ecological problems.

title: Vermont Drug Bill Voted
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., March 18 (UPI)The Senate passed to day and sent to the House leg islation allowing teenagers to obtain medical treatment for drug abuse and venereal disease without parental knowledge.

title: MURTAGH ASSAILS PANTHER DEFENSE
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh accused de fense lawyers yesterday of un duly prolonging the trial of 13 Black Panthers by asking wit nesses long lists of questions they knew were improper and would be disallowed.

title: This Collection Is Different: No Raised Eyebrows
description: Saint Laurent's harlots were there, looking cleaned up and as if they had found a more respectable line of work. Chanel's indestructible suits were there, looking as if they might be around for a second 50 years. And Valentino himself was there, as he seems to be everywhere in New York these days.

title: Soviet Party Congress, Opening March 30, Expected to Stress Stability in All Areas
description: MOSCOW, March 18The Soviet Communist party is near ing its all important 24th party congress with the emphasis on stability, peace and economic progress.

title: Man In the News
description: PNOMPENH, Carnbodia  He is the only voice of the Cambodian High Command.

title: Washington: For the Record March 18, 1971
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: GOODELL OPPOSING NIXON FOR '72 RACE
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Former Senator Charles E. Goodell, who was defeated last fall after drawing the wrath of the White House, is setting out to stir opposition within the Republican party to Pres ident Nixon's policies  and possibly his renomination.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: A 4th Market Now Emerges
description: While there is no hope at present that the Little Guy will get a break on commis sions charged on small stock transactions, he may take comfort in the fact that the Big Board is going to allow member Arms to negotiate the commissions charged in stitutions on large trades in the future.

title: Sabres' Rookie Sets Mark
description: BUFFALO, March 18 (UPI) Gil Perreault scored his 35th goal of the season tonight to break a 45yearold N.H.L. rookie record and added an as sist to move within three points of another mark as the Buffalo Sabres beat the St. Louis Blues, 53.

title: RELIEF RECIPIENT HELD IN HOTEL FIRE
description: A Woman resident of the city's oldest major hotel, the Broadway Central, was arrest ed on a charge of arson yester day after a twoalarm fire caused damage to more than a dozen rooms on the top two floors of the eightstory build ing.

title: News Analysis
description: Out of the environs of Burbank, Calif., comes per haps the most hilarious story yet on the application of the equal time provision for po litical candidates under the rules of the Federal Com munications Commission. In the weeks ahead the incident surely will be cited in Washington as an AliceinWonder land adjudication of the communi cations law with a payoff that confirms the wisdom of never trying to predict Nielsen popularity ratings. Because downtown Burbank has been a running gag on Laugh In, Johnny Carson on his February visit to the West Coast invited Dr. Jarvey Gil bert, Mayor of Burbank, to make a lighthearted gag ap pearance in a paper hat. There was no political sub stance to his performance of a few minutes, only Cham ber of Commerce badinage on the reputed glories of the California community.

title: Court Upsets Federal Ban On Belgian Marxist's Visit
description: A threejudge Federal court here, in a 2to1 decision, declared yesterday that the United States could not bar an alien visitor who preached anarchistic doctrines aimed at the forcible overthrow of the Government.

title: N.E.A. SAYS SOUTH CUTS BLACK JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 As Southern communities have eliminated their separate school systems for blacks, the number of black teachers and princi pals has decreased dramat ically, while the number of white teachers and principals has increased, according to Government statistics that were disclosed today.

title: Leland Hayward, Producer, Is Dead
description: YORKTOWN HEIGHTS, N. Y., March 18Leland Hayward, a multitalented entrepreneur of the theater world, died at his home here tonight after a long illness. He was 68 years old.

title: City Pensions Face Albany Hostility
description: ALBANY, March 18New York City will introduce do the Legislature next week a pen sion bill that will provide in creased retirement benefits for 121,000 municipal employes at an initial cost to city taxpayers of $30million a year.

title: ANTONIN BASCH, WORLD BANK AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Dr. Antonin Basch, economist, educator and author, died today at the Washington Hospital Center. He was 74 years old.

title: Loews Profit Picture Brightens
description: At the start of the annual meeting yesterday of the Loews Corporation, Laurence A. Tisch, chairman, announced that profits for the second fis cal quarter soared more than 100 per cent. After that, it was all anticlimactic.

title: Fordham Ousted
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 18 Villanova slammed shut the book on Fordham's fine success story of this basketball season tonight by beating the spunky, small Rose Hill mob, 8575, in the Eastern Regional semifinals of the National Collegiate Ath letic Association tournament.

title: DEBATE ON POLICY ERUPTS IN EGYPT
description: CAIRO, March 18Amid a tense feeling here that a show down is nearing for either a military or political settlement of the conflict with Israel, bit ter skirmishing has erupted among prominent Egyptian's over the nature of military, diplomatic and ideological chal lenges facing the Cairo leadership.

title: Amex Prices Show Gains
description: Prices moved higher on the American Stock Exchange yes terday in moderate trading.

title: U.S. Cites Gains in Laos Amid Reports of Setbacks
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The Nixon Administration sought today to maintain both its composure and its optimism in the face of mounting reports that the South Vietnamese were being compelled to retreat in Laos.

title: Cruguet and Miss Smith Register Upsets
description: Dan Patch of the illustrious name registered a surprise victory in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday. Compet ing against such wellknown and established, stars as Handsome Kid, Shining Sword, Climber and James town Court, the Eleanor Lichtenstein representative. scored by two lengths in the onemile event.

title: NIXONS TO ATTEND DEWEY'S FUNERAL
description: President and Mrs. Nixon will fly here today to attend the funeral of former Gov. Thomas E. Dewey. They will be accompanied by a delega tion that will include Secretary of State William P. Rogers; Attorney General John N. Mitch ell; Senators Jacob K. Javits and James L. Buckley of New York; Senator Hugh D. Scott of Pennsylvania and Robert H. Finch, a Presidential aide.

title: Soviet Accused of Using Drugs to Change Beliefs of Dissidents
description: MOSCOW, March 18  An appeal attributed to two dis sidents in a Leningrad psychiat ric prison hospital contends that drugs are being administered forcibly to inmates in an effort to have them change their political beliefs.

title: SEYMOUR SCHUMAN, POLLUTION EXPERT
description: PRINCETON, N. J., March 18 Dr. Seymour C. Schuman, a chemical consultant and an au thority, on solid waste manage ment, petroleum and coal, died today at Princeton Hospital after a heart attack. He was 54 years old and lived at 360 Jef ferson Road.

title: A.P.T.A. Honor and a Mother's Philosophy
description: Mrs. Max Stern says she just can't understand why the Manhattan Day School P.T.A. singled her out to be guest of honor at its fund raising luncheon this March 30.

title: Corporate Profits Down In 1970's Fourth Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Corporate pretax profits, in fluenced by the plunge in earn ings of the General Motors Cor poration, fell almost $7billion in the fourth quarter of last year to an annual rate of $77.5 billion, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: BRUINS CONQUER RED WINGS BY 73
description: BOSTON, March 18 (UPI)  John McKenzie's three goals and two by Phil Esposito led the Bruins to a 73 victory over the Detroit Red Wings tonight.

title: George Olsen, 78, Bandleader Of the 20's and 30's, Is Dead
description: PARAMUS, NJ., March 18 George Olsen, musician and band leader, perhaps best known as an recording star of the 1920's and 1930's, died here today on his 78th birthday. He lived at 711 Paramus Road

title: REGIONAL MARKETS STUDY SYSTEM TIES
description: Preliminary discussions have been held, by representatives of regional stock exchanges about the possibility of uniting their markets electronically, according to Elkins Wetherill, presi dent of the PhiladelphiaBalti moreWashington Stock Ex change.

title: ExMember of Exchange No Longer on Wall Street
description: Joseph Louis Searles 3d, the first Negro to become a mem ber of the New York Stock Exchange, took a look at Big Board volume yesterday a routine 17.91 million shares in this bull marketand gave a low whistle of appreciation.

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Cabinet, Including 4 Senior Members and 5 Newcomers, Assumes Office
description: NEW DELHI, March 18 Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's new Cabinet, with sharp changes at the middle level but no clue to any new direction of policy, was sworn in today.

title: Contract Dispute With 3 Unions Is Sent by City to Impasse Panel
description: Arvid Anderson, impartial chairman, of the Office of Col lective Bargaining, declared an impasse yesterday in the city's contract negotiations with the uniformed services and desig nated a threeman panel to recommend settlement terms.

title: KANSAS AND DRAKE GAIN IN MIDWEST
description: WICHITA, Kan., March 18 (UPI)Bud Stallworth spurred Kansas to 11 straight points early in the second half tonight and the Jayhawks joined Drake in the final of the National Col legiate Midwest Regional tourn ament with a 78177 victory over Houston.

title: Art Is Left by Hopper to the Whitney
description: The studio estate of the late Edward Hopper, cele brated painter of the Ameri can scene, has been received by the Whitney Museum of American Art. It comprises some 1,500 oils, watercolors, drawings and etchings.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pharmacy Owner Slays a Suspect In Holdup Threat
description: A Brooklyn Heights pharmacy owner, who shot a man trying to hold him up last month, yes terday shot and killed a man who entered the store in mid afternoon and threatened holdup.

title: Griffin Show Is Renewed
description: The Merv Griffin late eve ning talk show, whose future had been a matter of trade speculation, was renewed for the 197172 season, the Colum bia Broadcasting System an nounced yesterday. The prog ram, which now comes from Hollywood, was started in Oct ober, 1969.

title: Credit Markets: Yields Decline Again
description: The credit market's move to ward lower interest rates that began nine days ago continued forcefully yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market was slightly higher yesterday, but trading, as it has recently been, was sluggish.

title: MUSCOE BURNETT JR.
description: NAPLES, Fla., March 18  Muscoe Burnett Jr., a retired sales executive for the Union Carbide Corporation, Chicago, died today in Naples Commu nity Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: Pleasure Boat News
description: With the headache of Amer ica's Cup '70 still lingering, the New York Yacht Club announced this week that the aches and pains of America's Cup '73 were already being felt. With seven potential challengers waiting in the wings, the club's cup commit tee has tried to bar an upsetting situation by informing the challengers that they'll have to set up elimination trials themselves.

title: U.S. Oil Study Disputed
description: A study sent yesterday to the White House, the Depart ment of the Interior and the State Department asserts that a crudeoil price increase of 48 cents a barrell will be needed to encourage enough domestic oil exploration so that United States dependence on Middle East sources can be limited to 10 per cent of total demand through 1985.

title: A TV MONITOR TRAPS DOCTOR IN RAPE CASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (UPI)Dr. John L. Avery of Sil ver Springs, Md., was charged with assault with attempt to rape yesterday after a deputy county medical examiner testi fied that he and a woman detec tive had watched the attempt on a television receiver in an adjacent apartment.

title: Hope's Reaction
description: HOLLYWOOD, March 18 (AP)  I appreciate the Americans who have laid down their lives for our country, Mr. Hope said today. I got hooked on that thing, and if that stops me from getting awards, then I'll have to live with it.

title: Corrupters Is Scheduled
description: The Corrupters, a new play by Gertrude Samuels, will be presented next Tuesday and Wednesday at the Workshop of the Players Art, 333 Bowery, and repeated March 30 and 31. The play deals with women ad dicts and prostitutes, and has been directed by Dick Gaffield. The cast includes Jerome An nello, Robert Barger, Spence Berg, Colostine Boatwright, Maria Landa, Barbara Mont gomery and Ellen O'Mara.

title: Bridge: Most New York Teams Lose In Vanderbilt York Knockout Play
description: ATLANTA, March 18The New York representatives were almost wiped out in yes terday's play here in the Vanderbilt Knockout Team Championship, the premier event of the American con tract bridge league's spring nationals.

title: FEDERAL JOB STIRS A PROTEST IN WEST
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  Western members of Congress, asserting a proprietary interest in the Department of the In terior, have protested to the White House over the prospec tive nomination of an econo mist and systems analysis ex pert as Under Secretary of the department.

title: Art by Prisoners Reflects Reality as Well as Reverie
description: ALBANY, March 17 The handwriting was elegant and the letter read: I've finally succeeded in breaking out of my doldrums and have once again begun to paint with purpose and dedication which has eluded me.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: RULES FOR TOMBS ORDERED BY U. S.
description: A Federal judge ordered the city's Department of Correc tion yesterday to adopt and display comprehensive rules governing the conduct of in mates and guards at the Man hattan House of Detention for Men, also called the Tombs.

title: Soviet Space Chief Identified as Editor Of an Encyclopedia
description: MOSCOW, March 18  Val entin Petrovich Glushko, the reputed chief designer of the Soviet Union's rockets and mis siles, has been publicly identi fied as editor of the second edition of an official space en cyclopedia, just published here.

title: Perhaps the Best Persian Food in City
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Cred it cards are honored where indicated.

title: Song Cycle and Viola Sonata Show Hindemith as Craftsman
description: An indefatigable composer, teacher, conductor and instru mental performer, Paul Hinde mith managed to dominate a Large portion of the musical scene during his life. In his last years and after his death in 1963, his reputation and influ ence lessened. Yet his music is still played to a surprisingly large degree. A couple of works are in the standard symphonic repertory; others in the same category are played occasion ally.

title: Armstrong in Hospital
description: Louis Armstrong; the jazz trumpeter and singer, is in the intensive care unit of Beth Is rael Hospital, being treated for a heart condition, a hospital spokesman said yesterday. An aide to Mr. Armstrong said the 70yearold musician had en tered the hospital Tuesday for a checkup. After a previous ill ness, he began an engagement March 2 at the WaldorfAstoria, completing it Saturday night.

title: NIXON AIDE SEEKS NEW SST FUNDING
description: Clark MacGregor, counsel to President Nixon, said yesterday that the White House was hold ing intensive talks with key officials on alternate ways to finance the supersonic trans port if Congress finally shut off direct funds for the plane.

title: Investigating the F.B.I.
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has responded with predictable denials to charges of vindictive treat ment of its employes and obsolescence of its own bureaucracy. But the central question remains: is the F.B.I. as efficient as its mission requires and its own publicity proclaims? Senator George McGovern's call for an investigation of the F.B.I. is very much in order. It is in no way undermined by the blatantly political attack on the Senator by Clyde Tolson, the bureau's secondranking official, who merely illustrates by his impertinent and thoroughly improper comments the kind of problem such an inquiry ought to examine.

title: Former Aide Assails Brazilian Regime
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 18 A retiring general who is a former leader of the military backed regime has taken issue with the Government's con tinued authoritarian power.

title: Bonn Names Envoy to Israel
description: BONN, March 18 (AP)  Jcseo von Puttkammer, editor in chief of Vorwaerts, the So cial Democraic party weekly, wild become West Germany's new ambassador to Israel, the Foreign Ministry announced to day.

title: Mirza Offers Classic Sitar
description: Mahmud Mirza, the sitarist who played at the New York Cultural Center Wednesday night, is to these Western ears an extraordinary virtu oso on his instrument, and a fine musician on any con tinent.

title: An Appraisal
description: The work of Edward Hop per occupies a special and somewhat paradoxical place in the history of modern painting in America. For, decades he was our fore most realista painter whose homely and often desolate scenes of American life and the American landscape had come to exert an enormously wide appeal. Yet the popular side of Hopper's art, with its rich vein of pictorial anecdote and its evocation of familiar emo tions, was not the real basis of the critical fame he en joyed in the later years of his career. It was, above all, the esthetic integrity of Hop per's workthe extraordinary degree to which he was able to endow a very personal vi sion of American life with a stark and original pictorial formthat won him the ad miration not only of like minded fellow realists but of many members of the avant garde as well.

title: Rossini Resigns as N. Y. U.'s Basketball Coach After Worst Season
description: After a bitterly disappointing season in which his team lost 20 of 25 games, Lou Rossini resigned yesterday as head basketball coach of New York University, ending a 13year tenure. He had been under pressure from alumni distressed by N. Y. U.'s highest number of losses since the sport was instituted at the school in 1906.

title: PLYWOOD FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Plywood futures prices con tinued to rise yesterday as a result of Predictions that con struction will show an increase this year.

title: Knicks Score in Overtime
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 18 There was some concern to night when Willis Reed went to the bench after the opening 10 minutes. But the big Knicker bocker center returned in the sticky closing minutes of regu lation play, then hit two long jumpers to start the overtime period o help New York beat Phoenix, 131123, and eliminate the Suns from the playoffs in the Midwest Division of the National Basketball Association.

title: Fateful Talks in Dacca
description: Talks currently under way in Dacca between Pakistan's President, Yahya Khan, and Sheik Mujibur Rahman, leader of East Pakistan's Awami League, which com mands a majority in the new National Assembly, will decide the fate of Pakistan. They could also have a pro found influence on the future of neighboring India.

title: TREVINO, MELNYK LEAD GOLF ON 66'S
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 18 (AP)  Steve Melnyk, the only amateur in the field, carded a birdie at the final hole today and tied Lee Trevino for the firstround lead in the $125,000 Greater Jacksonville open golf tournament with sixunderpar 66. Play is over the 6,943yard Hidden Hills Country Club course.

title: EXCHANGE AIDE SEES STOCKHOLDER GAINS
description: The chief economist of the New York Stock Exchange yes Iterday denied the notion that the 19691970 bear market had persuaded many individual stockholders to pull out of the stock market for good.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.7 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 109.5 Tuesday from 108.8 last week.

title: Setback for Foe Reported
description: SAIGON, March 18 (AP) We are still in Laos, but con centrated near the Vietnamese border now, a South Viet namese headquarters spokes man said today.

title: Income Statistics
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  Following is a table showing the percentage of family income in various categories that is paid in taxes, both direct and indirect; the percentage of in come returned through various government payments, and the net percentage of taxes less payments:

title: Curb on Voting List Favored by Thieu Is Set Back
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 18A provision in a draft electoral law to limit the number of candidates in the October presidential election was defeated today by a large vote in the Senate.

title: The SinoSoviet Verbal Duel
description: Peking has effectively torpedoed any tendency abroad to assume that real relaxation or improvement has taken place in SinoSoviet relations. Using the centenary of the Paris Commune as the occasion, the Chinese have now published as virulent and scornful an attack on the Soviet leadership as any that appeared at the height of their polemical struggle in the mid1960's. The phraseology and style of this latest antiMoscow fusillade, moreover, is reminiscent of those earlier diatribes which foreign observers tended to attribute to Mao Tsetung personally.

title: Brodsky Joins Film Concern
description: Jack Brodsky has joined Ra star Productions, the company headed by Ray Stark, as vice president in charge of the corn pany's production activities here. He also will produce films for Rastar under the agreement. Mr. Brodsky and Elliott Gould have dissolved their partner ship in BrodskyGould, the pro duction company that filmed Little Murders.

title: Study Indicates 8.3% of Hospital Patients Here Should Be in Convalescent Homes
description: A spot survey of 50 repre sentative hospitals here showed that 8.3 per cent of their beds were occupied by holdover patients who no longer needed hospital care but who had no place to go for the convales ent care they required.

title: World Protector
description: In time of war, civil Strife or internal disturbances, the International Committee of the Red Cross acts as a neu tral intermedi ary to amelior ate the suffer ing of the vic tims. In today's troubled, world the committee has permanent staff all over the world ready to act when there is trouble. Thus, when three commercial airliners were hijacked to Jordan last surnmer, Red Cross delegates on the spot were able, with material assistance from the Jordanian Red Crescent So ciety, to bring Immediate aid to the passengers.

title: Bostonians Play a Fine Swan Lake
description: Michael Tilson Thomas's program with the Boston Symphony, in Philharmonic Hall on Wednesday evening, was 80 example of unusual and even defiant juxtaposi tions. Bach and Schoenberg; intermission; Stravinsky and Tchaikovsky. But the Tchai kovsky was the ACt III Di vertissement from Swan Lake.

title: HOUSE VOTES TO END FUND FOR DEVELOPMENT OF SST; BACKERS SEEK SENATE AID
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The House voted today to halt further development of the supersonic transport airliner by cutting off Federal funds March 30. The rollcall vote was 215 to 204.

title: Last Mile on City Pay?
description: The tortuous negotiations for new contracts covering the city's police, fire and sanitation forces enter what should be their last lap with appointment of a threeman impasse panel to make joint recommendations for resolv ing all three disputes.

title: Heckscher Calls Vandalism a Mirror of Times
description: A spreading form of urban guerrilla warfare  deliber ate destruction of comfort stationshas struck 80 of the 600 stations in the city's parks, according to August Heckscher, the Parks Recre ational and Cultural Affairs Administrator.

title: House RollCall Vote Denying SST Funds
War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)The Defense Department today identified 13 United States servicemen killed in ac tion in the war in Southeast Asia. They included:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Protests to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)  The Soviet Union has again protested harassment by the Jewish Defense League and requested that the Administra tion assure normal working conditions for the Soviet Em bassy and its personnel here.

title: MRS. T. DEL VECCHIO
description: Mrs. Doris Lambton Del Vecchio, wife of Thomas Del Vecchio, Associated Press re porter assigned to Kennedy Airport and a playwright, died Wednesday of cancer in Doc tor's Hospital. She was 64 years old and lived at 232 Fair Oaks Place, Cedarhurst, L. I.

title: Churches May Alter Process For the Family of Man Award
description: The Council of Churches of the City of New York will prob ably make a major change in the way it selects winners of its principal Family of Man award as a result of a controversy this week when it canceled plans to honor Bob Hope.

title: Pincay Rides 5 Victors In Row at Santa Anita
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 18 (UPI)Laffit Pincay Jr. rode five straight winners today, his third fivevictory per formance of the Santa Anita meeting, and Johnny Sellers piloted the 181 long shot Long Position to a head tri umph in the feature race, the $27,650 San Simeon Handicap.

title: M'DANIEL'S PITCH: KEEPING IN SHAPE
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 18Although there are more gray hairs on Lindy McDaniel's head now than when he started pitching in the majors 16 years ago, there's no more fat on his body and no less enthusiasm in his mind.

title: Catholic Church Urged to Heed Priest Group's Plea for Reform
description: BALTIMORE, March 18  If the Roman Catholic hierarchy fails to heed the latest call for reform in the life of the church, the exodus of priests from the ministry may increase, the Rev. William F. Graney, executive director of the National Federa tion of Priests Councils, said to day in an interview.

title: A Mother's Personal Protest Against War
description: Thirtyone days ago in Newton, Mass., Louise Bruyn, 40, left a hus band, two teenage daughters, a com fortable old nineroom house, a half breed collie, a cat, her job as a modern dance teacher, her household chores, community activities and friends, and began to walk to Washington, alone. She is still walking.

title: NEW YORK
description: Very little reliable information trick les out of China, these days, but two recent morsels are interesting. First, Chinese officials in Peking have been talking more freely and ominously to Western diplomats about the dangers of the Indochina war; and second, they have been emphasizing that, while they intervened in the Korean war, they withdrew all their troops from that country once the danger was over.

title: Taxpayer Finds the Tax Experts Taxing
description: Clutching W2 forms and other documents showing $8,600 in employe salary, $3,400 in selfemployed in come, certain deductions and two dependents, Brian Shar off has, visited eight income tax practitioners.

title: Governor Praises Israeli Spirit At Start of U.J.A.'s Drive Here
description: The United Jewish Appeal of Greater New York opened its 1971 drive for $150million last night with pledges and cash gifts of $35million to carry out programs to assist men, women and children in Israel and else where.

title: PENTAGON BELITTLES REPORT ON PULLOUT
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Defense Department officials today described as unimportant and not relevant to highlevel policy the reported complaint of some military leaders in Saigon about the pace and mo tivation of the rate of troop withdrawals.

title: Canadiens Down Leafs, 41
description: MONTREAL, March 18 (UPI) Two goals by Frank Mahov lich paced the Montreal Cana diens to a 41 victory tonight over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: ALBERT W. ORSINO
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 18 Albert W. Orsino, a ticket agent for the New Haven Rail road, died yesterday at St. Agnes Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived at 16 Up land Terrace.

title: Agnew Criticizes C.B.S. Over a TV Documentary
description: BOSTON, March 18 Vice President Agnew ques tioned the credibility of the Columbia Broadcasting System tonight and accused the na tional news media of indif ference to earlier criticism of the network by a Government agency and a Congressional subcommittee.

title: DATA PROCESSING RULED ON BY F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The Federal Communications Commission ruled today that all large communications com panies must set up totally sep arate affiliates if they want to sell dataprocessing services.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: After the Brawl Is Over
description: On St. Patrick's Day some 120,000 paraders marched proudly and many more watched and enjoyed the high stepping display, the bands and the admirable spirit of identification with past traditions.

title: BOSTON U. SEXTET SINKS DENVER, 42
description: SYRACUSE, March 18Bos ton. University upheld its posi tion as the nation's No. 1 college hockey team tonight by storming to a 42 semifinal decision over burly Denver in Onondaga War Memorial Audi torium.

title: F.P.C. Sets Change In GasRate Rules
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 (AP)The Federal Power Com mission announced today that the prices allowed to small producers of natural gas would no longer be determined under general areawide rate sched ules.

title: Scofflaws' Auto Is Seized; $3,210 Owed on 74 Tickets
description: The city seized a shabby red andwhite Volkswagen bus yes terday as its first hostage in a new crackdown on trafficticket scofflaws.

title: Confession of Mrs. Crimmins In 1965 Is Cited by Prosecutor
description: The chief prosecutor in the murder and manslaughter trial of Mrs. Alice Crimmins declared yesterday that the 32yearold woman had confessed to the July, 1965, killing of her two small children.

title: U.C.L.A. TROUNCES BRIGHAM YOUNG
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 18 (AP)University of California, Los Angeles, snuffed out Brig ham Young University's upset hopes with a 9173 victory to night in the Western Regional semifinals of the National Col legiate Athletic Association bas ketball tournament.

title: Merger News
description: An agreement in principle has been reached by G. D. Searle & Co., Chicago, and Howmedica, Inc., New York City, for the merger of How medica into Searle. Under the agreement, shareholders of the New York company would re ceive 0.44 share of Searle corn nion for each Howmedica share.

title: Norway's New Premier Says Ties With Hanoi Will Be Sought
description: OSLO, Norway, March 18 Premier Trygve Bratteli said today that his new Cabinet, which assumed office yester day, would move to establish diplomatic links between Nor way and North Vietnam.

title: RESERVE SUPPORT FOR YIELDS SEEN
description: The Federal Reserve System appears to have embarked on A deliberate effort to prevent shortterm interest rates from falling further, while at the same time continuing to push the cost of longterm borrowing downward.

title: Emigration Policy Of Soviet on Jews Is Reported Easing
description: MOSCOW, March 18Uncon firmed reports circulated in Moscow tonight that Soviet au thorities had decided on a fur ther and more extensive liber alization in their policy toward Jews seeking to emigrate to Israel.

title: Liquor Warning Backed
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 18 (AP)The Maine Senate has approved a bill to require health warnings on all bottles of liquor sold in the state.

title: MILLION BRITONS OUT IN 2D PROTEST STRIKE
description: LONDON, March 18More than a million British workers stayed home today in their sec ond political strike this month against the Conservative Gov ernment's industrial relations bill. The bill would bring labor management relations into legal framework for the first time.

title: B.P. Profit Drops 6%;
description: Earnings of the British Pe troleum Company declined 6 per cent last year from 1969 although the fourth quarter showed a gain of 54 per cent in profits, according to the com pany's annual report issued yes terday.

title: Professional Group's Attack on Master Plan Arouses Dispute
description: A hostile appraisal of the city's master plan by the metropolitan chapter of the American Institute of Planning has enmeshed that organization in an internal dispute amid charges that the chairman of the City Planning. Commission is trying to block the adverse report, or at least have it watered down.

title: Appeal of Phone Union Fine To Be Heard Here April 2
description: A hearing is scheduled on April 2 here before the United states Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit on the appeal of Local 1101, Communications Workers of America, of fines totaling $1.7million against the local and its president.

title: Tombs to Expand Addicts' Detoxification Monday
description: In an expansion of a program begun last July, all newly ad mitted prisoners to the Manhat tan House of Detention who are drug addicts will be detoxified with the aid of methadone if they so request, starting next Monday.

title: Leader in Dacca Rejects A Concession by Yahya
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 18 The leader of East Pakistan, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, today rejected as meaningless a West Pakistani concession, as West Pakistan increased its military buildup in the East and the crisis between Pakistan's two sections hardened.

title: Clark Assails Education Board On an Outside Testing Contract
description: Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, the psychologist and educator, called upon the Board of Edu cation yesterday to rescind its approval of a contract with ?? Educational Testing Service ?? devise a way of measuring the effectiveness of the city school system.

title: MILLS UNIT ACTS ON WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The House Ways and Means Committee is moving toward a new approach to welfare that would transfer all employable poor people into a separate program that emphasized work rather than relief.

title: Missing Link in Evolution of Book Is Found
description: A tattered scrap of ancient parchment containing several lines of a dialogue of Plato has been found by a Duke Univer sity professor who believes it is a missing link in the evo lution of the book in Western literature.

title: Recorded Teller Vote Credited With Defeat for SST Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Many opponents of the super sonic transport plane were as jubilant today over why they had won as over the fact that they had finally succeeded in striking out funds for the con troversial aircraft program.

title: U.S. COURT POSTS TO BE FILLED HERE
description: WASHINGTON, March 18  The impasse that has delayed the filling of 10 Federal judge ship vacancies in the New York City area was broken today with an aparent agreement on the nomination of at least three District Court judges.

title: Frazier to Undergo More Hospital Tests
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 18 The illness of Joe Frazier was minimized today as ten sion and pressure by his physician, Dr. James Giuffre, but the world heavyweight champion is scheduled to re main hospitalized until Tues day or Wednesday.

title: Witness Puts Seale's CoDefendant in Murder Victim's Room
description: NEW HAVEN, March 18 Subpoenaed just 40 minutes before the court session began, the first witness in the murder kidnapping trial of Bobby G. Seale and Ericka Huggins testi fied today that Mrs. Huggins was in the room at Black Pan ther headquarters here while Alex Rackley was being beaten with a stick.

title: 2 STUDENTS ARRESTED WITH BOMBS IN CAR
description: Two young men said to be college students were arrested last evening when they were allegedly driving through the Lower East Side with three homemade bombs and ele ments for making more.

title: France Urges Talks on Role of Sterling in the Market
description: BRUSSELS, March 18 France called on her five Com mon Market partners today to make the future role of sterling one of the issues in Britain's bid for market membership.

title: Full DDT Ban Is Refused Pending Review of Safety
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environ mental Protection Agency, said today he had decided that the pesticide DDT and the herbicide 2, 4, 5T were not im minent hazards to humans.

title: Britain to Reinforce Troops in Ulster; Avoids Crackdown
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 18 (Reuters)Britain to day assigned 1,300 more troops to keep the peace in Northern Ireland but refrained from the kind of crackdown demanded by restive Protestants.

title: HARPER'S TO SELECT A NEW EDITOR SOON
description: A new editor in chief for Harper's Magazine to succeed Willie Morris will be chosen in six to eight weeks, William S. Blair, the periodical's publisher, said yesterday.

title: 3 S.I. COUPLES SHARE $100,000 IN LOTTERY
description: Three Staten Island families who shared a $1 ticket won a top prize of $100,000 in the state lottery drawing yesterday at the Port of New York Au thority bus terminal, Eighth Avenue and 40th Street.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE OFF FROM '70 WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week, ended March 13 were both below the volume in the corresponding 1970 week.

title: Black Power Challenge Hurts Caribbean Growth
description: TORTOLA, British Virgin Is lands, March 18 (AP)TORTOLA, British Virgin Is lands, March 18 (AP) For many British and French is lands in the Caribbean this is election year, and tourism, which is suffering, may never be the same again.

title: FREDERICK B. PHILIPP
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., March 18Frederick B. Philipp, a retired New York insurance broker, died yesterday in Bataan Memorial Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: Indictment Charges Dentist With False Medicaid Claims
description: A 241count indictment was returned by a Manhattan grand jury yesterday against Dr. Frederick Fisher, a dentist, for allegedly falsifying Medi caid claims against the city.

title: House Unit Likely to Vote Big Military Pay Increase
description: WASHINGTON, March 18 The House Armed Services Committee appears certain to approve tomorrow increases in military pay and allowances that far exceed President Nix on's budget.

title: McGeorge Bundy for Delay By Senate on GasWar Put
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (AP)McGeorge Bundy, ad viser on national security af fairs to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, proposed today that Senate approval on a 46year old protocol outlawing gas and germ warfare be delayed. He also suggested additional ef forts to clarify whether it cov ered herbicides and such riot control agents as tear gas.

title: MGM TO WITHDRAW FROM A FILM GROUP
description: MetroGoldwynMayer has served notice on the Motion Picture Association of America that it plans to resign from the organization within a year.

title: DIVINITY STUDENTS MAY BE DRAFTED
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 The, Howe. Armed Services Committee voted today to eliminate draft deferments for divinity students and to extend the required civilian service for conscientious objectors to three years from two.

title: Design in California Manner: Pasadena Shows the Trends
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 19The varrous creative un dercurrents in this loosely knit but prolific artistic re gion are very much in the spotlight these days, with the output filling the galleries of the Pasadena Art Museum.

title: Razing of British Office Brings a Chou Apology
description: LONDON, March 19 Premier Chou Enlai has apol ogized to the British charg d'affaires in Peking for the 1967 sacking of the British mission, the Foreign Office announced here today.

title: Briton to Spend Million On America's Cup Bid
description: LONDON, March 19 (AP)  Anthony Boyden, British printing industrialist and yachting enthusiast, said to day he was prepared to spend close to $1million to chal lenge the United States for the America's Cup. Boyden bore most of the cost of Britain's last unsuccessful bid, in 1964.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: MADISON, Wisc.Harold Rohr, known to everybody as Babe, has been a local symbol of hardhat support for the Vietnam war. He is president of the Madison Building Trades Council. As an alderman a few years ago he fought the peace groups and opposed a referendum on the war.

title: Gierek's Thriving Home Town Is the Model for the Rest of Poland
description: KATOWICE, Poland, March 13At the Jan Mine outside this thriving industrial city in southern Poland, a visitor stepped from the main shaft into a clean reception hall. The guide pointed to two taps above a large sink. The miners can get water in one and hot tea in the other, he said.

title: Nixon at Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (AP)President Nixon flew to Camp David, Md., tonight for the weekend. Earlier he had returned from Mr. Dewey's fu I neral in New York.

title: LONDON STOCKS UP IN LOW TURNOVER
description: British Government bonds gained and Australian yester issues were in demand yester day on the London Stock Ex change, but trading was at a low level. American stocks were firm.

title: MRS. JANE K. ROULSTON
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., March 19Mrs. Jane Kemp Roulston, a former voice teacher in New York City and Boston, died yes terday at Pitt Memorial Hos pital here after a long illness. She was 85 years old and had lived here for the last four years.

title: Rolls and Lockheed Hold Talks
description: BURBANK, Calif., March 19Officials of the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation, the British Government and bankrupt RollsRoyce, Ltd., completed a full day of talks here today without reaching agreement to save the L1011 Tristar jetliner program.

title: James S. Milloy is Dead at 75; Retired Cowles Vice President
description: James S. Milloy, a former vice president of Cowles Com munications, died Thursday at a nursing home in Washington. He was 75 years old and lived for a number of years at the Sheraton Carlton Hotel there.

title: Hospital Says Armstrong Responds to Treatment
description: Louis (Satchmo) Armstrong has responded to treatment and made further improvement in the intensive care unit of Beth Israel Hospital, a hospital spokesman said yesterday.

title: Executive Changes
description: The East River Savings Bank announced yester day the appointment of Walter Oberstebrink to the new post of senior vice president and executive as sistant to the president. Mr. Oberstebrink, who will join the bank April 5, has been vice president and assistant to the chairman and president of the Se curity National Bank, based in Huntington, L. I. His new duties will include the areas of bank operations, marketing and personnel administration. He will act ac liaison between the president and the department heads in those areas. From 1939 until 1967 he was associated with Rheingold Breweries.

title: Industry Insisting Insurance Is Accessible
description: Insurance industry spokes men tried to reassure the State Assembly Committee on Insur ance at a hearing yesterday that any automobile owner or tenant or homeowner who was not an impossible risk and who wanted insurance could get it.

title: 70 Amex Net Plunges; Result Worst Since 62
description: The American Stock Ex change reported yesterday that it earned $20,000 in 1970, down sharply from $1.3million the year before, due mainly to a sharp drop in trading volume because of the stockmarket decline.

title: Agnew Says U.S. Would Acknowledge a Laos Defeat
description: NEWTON, Mass., March 19  The Nixon Administration would admit it publicly if South Vietnamese combat forces were mauled by the enemy in Laos, Vice President Agnew said to day.

title: PIANO DEBUT HERE FOR MISS VERBIT
description: Martha Anne, Verbit, herself a Scriabinesque vision in a ro mantically gauzy gown of pea cocktail colors, made her New York debut at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night in an all Scriabin piano recital. Miss Verbit is tall, blond and extrav agantly goodlooking, and her playing proved handsome, too, on the whole, though occasion ally labored and lacking in articulation.

title: Industry Panel Expects a SteelPrice Rise
description: George A. Stinson, president and chief executive officer of the National Steel Corporation, served notice here yesterday that the steel industry expects more than one round of price increases on most of its major products this year.

title: Heroin Smuggler Is Given A 40Year Sentence Here
description: Eduardo Poeta, a cocon spirator in one of the largest heroinsmuggling rings ever un covered here, was sentenced to 40 years in prison and fined $300,000 yesterday by Judge Jacob Mishler in Brooklyn Federal Court.

title: Pharmacist Robbed As Police Test Gun He Used on Others
description: A 38yearold Brooklyn phar macist who killed a holdup man Thursday the second time in a month that he had foiled a holdup with his 38 caliber revolverwas robbed yesterday. His gun was at a police ballistics laboratory.

title: GEORGE H. PRIDE, 84; LED TRUCKING FIRM
description: George Huddlestone Pride, who retired as president of the Pride Transportation Company, Brooklyn, a trucking concern, in 1962, died Thursday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: JANUARY, MEEK LEAD BY 2 SHOTS
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., March 19 (UPI)  Don January, the 1970 winner, carded a five underpar 67 today and tied for the secondround lead in the $125,000 Greater Jacksonville open with Steve Melnyk, a hometown amateur. The co leader has totals of 137 for the 36 holes.

title: Welk Show Among 11 Programs Dropped From A.B.C. Fall Slate
description: The American Broadcasting Company announced its fall television schedule last night, killing 11 of this year's shows, including Lawrence Welk, and adding seven new programs.

title: State Sues Penn Central Over Safety Equipment
description: ALBANY, March 19Attor ney General Louis J. Lefkowitz filed suit in State Supreme Court here today to require the Penn Central T ransportation Company to install firstaid equipment in its locomotives operating in the state and elec tric signal lights on rear cars.

title: EFFORT TO REPEAL RENT RISE SCORED
