title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: An idea for a new greeting card was working its way through the Kansas City headquarters of Hall mark Cards, Inc., recently when it came to an official who pointed out that it might be offensive to the women's liberation movement. The pro ject was scrapped.

title: Did They Give Sporting Club a Sporting Chance?
description: A MOVIE that appears sud denly, without much advance publicity, surrounded by rumors of disastrous, outraged pre view reactions, usually has something going for it. There may be exceptions to this perverse rule, but inter esting, important films like Performance, Burn! Pretty Poison, and Billy Wilder's Kiss Me, Stupid had all been written off be fore they opened, and never had a chance to find their audience. The most recent case in point, The Sporting Club, written by Lorenzo Semple Jr. and directed by Larry Peerce, sneaked into town two weeks ago, about as welcome as a tarantula in bed, and has already been withdrawn for reediting.

title: Harold and Joan and Dan and Nora
description: NORA: One morning The Times Book Review called and asked us if we'd review The Couple, the story of a married couple who went to the Masters and Johnson clinic in St. Louis to solve their sex problems. The book already had 60,000 copies in print before publication and was scheduled for major promotion and advertising. I told them to send it over.

title: Triumphs and Tribulations
description: DIARIES are oldfash ioned. A silly waste of time. Unless, of course, you're a gardener. Then you have good reason to record the successes and failures, the triumphs and tribulations that shape the year, day by day.

title: Priscilla W. Smith Prospective Bride
description: DARIEN, Conn., March 20 Mr. and Mrs. Miles An thony Smith have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Priscilla Ward Smith, to Anthony Richard Sapienza, son of Mr. and Mrs. Angelo A. Sapienza of Andover, Mass.

title: Orioles Bout Braves
description: MIAMI, March 20 (AP)The Baltimore Orioles rocked At lanta's George Stone For 10 hits in the first three innings, in cluding a threerun homer by Frank Robinson, and walloped the Braves, 112, today.

title: YEMEN IS HOLDING FIRST ELECTIONS
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, March 20The neighboring Re public of Yemen, a country emerging from the Middle Ages, hat just elected the first mem bers of her new Consultative Assembly, or parliament. The election of representatives for the twin capitals of Sena and Taiz and the port of Hodeida on the Red Sea marks a huge change in a country that for centuries had been under the absolute theocratic rule of imams.

title: Headliners
description: Hope Deferred

title: Addict Agencies Planning a Self  Study
description: The major, private voluntary agencies treating heroin ad dictsoften criticized for not producing clear, scientifically acceptable data on their re sultsare planning an impar tial study of their programs.

title: No Arrests in Five Months From F.B.I.'s Wanted List
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)Although the F.B.I.'s Most Wanted List of fugitives was increased last year from 10 to 16 names in an attempt to speed the capture of several radical terrorists, no arrests have been recorded in the last five months.

title: College Rush Stirs Scandal in Japan
description: TOKYO, March 20  The annual frenzy of examination time in Japancram schools, angling for introductions to college officials, contributions to schools to assure students' admissionshas been accom panies this year by a scan dal, a murder and widespread questioning of the nation's values.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 20 (UPI)Ray Culp, a righthander with a total of just five exhibi tion innings under his belt, hurled six standout innings to day, allowing just one hit as the Boston Red Sox beat the Detroit Tigers, 73.

title: CLUBBING OF SEALS IS PROTESTED BY 50
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)About 50 persons, in cluding actors from the mu sical show Hair, demonstra ted today against the Canadian government for allowing the slaughter of baby seals.

title: Artie Shaw Hurt in Accident
description: PAWLING, N. Y., March 20 (AP)Artie Shaw, the former bandleader, received minor in juries this morning when his foreignmade sports car slammed into a guard rail on Route 22 in a snowstorm, the police said. The car was demol ished, but the 60yearold Mr. Shaw, who is now a, theatrical producer, escaped with minor cuts and bruises on the hands and face.

title: Architecture
description: I SUPPOSE you could call the pictures on this page a sight gag. See the 116  year  old historic house. See it being knocked down. See the hamburger stand in its place. Pow. Amer ica, of thee I sing; sweet land of the Burger King.

title: Hotel Rooms Stand Empty
description: Business has been terrible for the last year and is get ting worse. Unless there is a big improvement in the economy soon we could be in trouble.

title: CAIRO AND MOSCOW SIGN NEW AID PACT
description: CAIRO, March 20The So viet Union has signed an econ omic agreement with the Egyp tian Government involving more than $400million, the Cairo press has reported.

title: ARLECCHINO SUNG IN A DOUBLE BILL
description: Busoni's Arlecchino is far from being a conventional opera. But it is a fascinating work that, as the Theater of Ideas showed a season or two ago in a Chelsea loft production, can seem particularly pertinent today in its cynical approach to so many aspects of life we have taken for granted for so long.

title: The Nation.
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.There were the cries of independencia. There was the largest campus on the island in revolt. There were the Molotov cocktails and the mobili zation of the Government, with its helmeted riot police, to quell the rebellious students.

title: RANGERS LOSE TO LEAFS, MISS CHANCE TO CLINCH 2D
description: TORONTO, March 20More concerned with fighting than skating the New York Rangers wasted an opportunity to clinch second place in th East Divi sion of the National Hockey League tonight by losing to the Toronto Maple Leafs, 31.

title: 3,000 at Rally in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)About 3,000 youths dem onstrated on the grassy ex panse south of the White House today in the first big gathering of the spring demonstration season. A series of speakers de manded an end to United States involvement in Southeast Asia, destruction of the capitalist sys tem and guaranteed jobs and wages for all citizens.

title: Pollution in Botany Bay
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 20 (Reuters)Botany Bay, where Captain James Cook landed two centuries ago, is being seriously polluted by mer cury, affecting fish and oysters, it was disclosed this week.

title: BIG CZECH LIBRARY A VICTIM OF PURGE
description: PRAGUE, March 20 (Reuters)  Czechoslovak Communist party officials have dismantled one of Europe's best Socialist libraries and are rapidly trans forming the building that housed it into a Soviet cultural center.

title: Coast Guard Ready for Summer Wave of L. I. Pleasure Boats
description: EATONS NECK, L. I., March 20The ice Is melt ing and that's bad news, a Coast Guardsman said. It means we'll have to get to work.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 20 (AP)Bill Sorrell's pop fly fell between Luis Alvarado and Mike Andrews near second base today for a single that scored Carl Taylor in the eighth in ning and gave the Kansas City Royals a 32 exhibition victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: Nuclear Plant Hearings Near an Exhausting End
description: PORT JEFFERSON STATION, L. I., March 20The Atomic Energy Commission's hearing on the proposal to build Long Island's first nuclear power plant is a few million words old and, as it draws to a close next month, has exhausted and exasperated many of the par ties.

title: Television
description: MEDIA RASH. Sensory bottle necks. Brain surgery without anesthetics. Karma congestion. In other words, the Teevee Heebie Jeebies.

title: In place of tables, sofas and chairs
description: Is furniture a thing of the past? If today's architects have their way it may be. Spaces have a style of their own, says architect James Rossant of the firm Conklin and Rossant, and conventional furniture intrudes on it and imposes a decora tive idiom. He believes that furniture should be as anonymous as possi ble. To that end, he has designed a system of movable upholstered plat forms to replace tables, sofas and chairs in his renovated Manhattan brownstone. (Rossant believes that the day of the chair is over because people like to slouch, not sit up straight.) His platforms have a flex ibility that conventional furniture can never attainand more than that, they are not expensive to build.

title: Earth Day Observance To Hail Start of Spring
description: When clocks in New York touched 1:38 A.M. today, the sun was directly over the equator at a point about 500 miles north of the Solomon Islands in the Pacific. Around the world at that moment in the northern hemisphere, spring began again.

title: Grand Old Party
description: A study of the Republican party in the late 19th century. The author theorizes that the party might have been ex pected to show increasing cen tralization and bureaucratiza tion, paralleling centralization in our national life. Instead party structure remained weak and at the disposal of Presi dential nonentities even though voter participation was high. By 1896, due to lack of effec tive leftist parties, alienation from political activity became endemic, particularly among the working classes. In his last chapter the author some what confusedly projects these trends into the 20th century.

title: Two Economists Urge a New Method of Financing American Medical Education
description: A plan to restructure the financing of American medical education, now largely depend ent on declining Federal re search funds, has been recom mended by two medical econ omists.

title: Printer Dies in Gun Accident
description: A 39yearold printer died of a bullet Wound of the head when a gun he was examining in his Bronx apartment went off accidentally yesterday, the police said. The victim, David Light, was sitting in his base ment apartment at 2155 Pauld ing Avenue when the accident occurred, the police said. Friends who were visiting Mr. Light notified the police im mediately after the gun, de scribed as a .25caliber auto matic, went off.

title: MOBILITY STUDIED IN WESTCHESTER
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 20 Two housing studies released this week by the County De partment of Planning show Westchester to be a highly mo bile society, in which 38 per cent of lowincome families and 28 per cent of middleincome families have moved within the last three years.

title: Dr. Saul Halprin, Dentist And Head of Dairy Concern
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., March 20Dr. Saul Halprin, a retired dentist, died today in St. Bar nabas Hospital, Livingston. He was 62 years old and lived at 15. Spring Hill Road.

title: CALIFORNIA SPAN DELAYED BY VOTE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 20  After a quartercentury of discussion and debate, the Cali fornia Toll Bridge Authority last month ordered construction to begin on a new $381million span across San Francisco Bay.

title: Cooking and carpentry and sewing and astrology
description: Living on the earth is fun, much more fun than reviewing books about it; but Alicia Bay Laurel (is it a girl? is it a tree?) has made such a beautiful, such a divine and prac tical book, it's a pleasure to tell you about it.

title: The World
description: ANKARA The Turkish brand of parliamentary democracy, a young and delicate plant, was saved from being uprooted last Week. A political crisis that had culminated in the forced resigna tion of Premier Suleyman Demirel appeared to have abated with the naming of a successor. The new Premier, Nihat Erim, a re spected law professor and former Cabinet minister, promised a re formist government, but basic reforms will be difficult to bring about.

title: 2 Duos Share Golf Lead
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 20 (AP)Two University of Florida golfers, Andy North and Gary Koch, combined for a 68 today to retain a share of the thirdround lead of the 15th annual men's amateur interna tional fourball golf tournament. They were under pressure from Downing Gray and Allen Miller, who equaled their 68 to tie for the lead at 200.

title: The Good Book
description: To the Editor:

title: Art
description: OF the various and distinguished clan of original Pop artists including Claes Olden burg, James Rosenquist and (until his recent apparent re tirement) Andy WarholRoy Lichtenstein in his work has always been the most elegant In terms both of form and content, the one possessed of the most fastidious touch and of the nimblest wit. He In effect, the premier Stylist of a very stylecon scious movement, the artist for whom style is all and compared to whom the others might seem a little crude or bumptious.

title: WEST GERMAN SOCCER FIRST DIVISION
description: Eintracht Frankfurt 1. Cologne 1.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The stock exchange, as the institution is now constituted, is an anachronism. The pub.. lic will best be served not by a monopolistic central market but by an openly competitive market where transactions are negotiated.

title: Et Al.
description: The story of the illfated im position of Maximilian, a mem ber of the Austrian royal fam ily, on the throne of Mexico. O'Connor is particularly good on the cynical, behind the scenes machinations. Not ele gant history nor notable schol arship, but readable.

title: Pirates Score All Their Runs Off Gibson in Sending Cardinals to 43 Defeat
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 20 (AP)Jim Grant struck out Leron Lee with two runners aboard to preserve a 43 exhi bition baseball victory today for the Pittsburgh Pirates over the St. Louis Cards.

title: Colombia Is Primed For Tourist Influx At Summer Games
description: CALI, Colombia, March 20  The biggest tourist event of 1971 in this third most populous of South American republics will be the sixth PanAmerican, Games. These hemisphere Olympics are to be held in Cali July 30Aug. 13. Tourist bookings are com ing in from all around the two sportsminded American continents.

title: Miss Slichter Wed in Jersey
description: SUMMIT, N. J., March 20 Miss Nancy Deborah Slich ter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Pence Slichter of Chatham, and George Dennis Wrangham, son of Mrs. Teresa Jane Wrangham of Clanfield, England, were mar ried here this afternoon by the Rev. Deane Starr at the Unitarian Church.

title: Suzanne Carolyn Wooster Wed To Henry Wilsey Jr., Teacher
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., March 20  Miss Suzanne Carolyn Wooster and Henry Richard Wilsey Jr., whose ancestors were part of the 17thcentury history of Amer ica, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Edwin Bockstiegel performed the ceremony in the Presbyterian Church.

title: Soccer Coach Switches
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., (UPI) Thomas Griffin, soccer coach at the university of the South in Sewanee, Tenn., has been named coach at the University of WisconsinGreen.Bay.

title: Clare Herrmann to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gustave D. Herrmann of Hollis, Queens, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Clare Herrmann, to John Pacetta, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert S. Pacetta of Hollis wood, Queens. A July wed ding is planned. Mr. Pacetta's father, a lawyer, is a mem ber of the State Human Rights Appeal Board.

title: New of the Rialto
description: JOAN MOLINSKYyou may have been one of the few who caught her in the Off Broadway revivals of Juno and the Paycock and See the Jaguar has written a comedy with her husband, Edgar Rosenberg, and Lester Kolodny. It's called My Sonin Law Knows Zubin Mehta and, understandably enough, Joan's written a juicy role for herself. In fact, she'll be the star.

title: Books: The Private Foundation
description: The private philanthropic foundation is a ubiquitous ad junct to the American busi ness establishment. There are thousands of them across the country created by entrepre neurs sufficiently skillful, ra pacious, or perhaps just lucky enough to have amassed substantial fortunes.

title: Deborah. B. Farber Is Married In Baltimore to William Kallop
description: BALTIMORE, March 20  Miss Deborah Brooks Farber and William Moore Kallop of New York were married here this afternoon in the Episcopal Ohurch of the Redeemer.

title: Christian Brothers Triumph
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., March 20 (AP)  Christian Brothers Academy of Lincroft won the state Parochial A basketball championship today, beating Essex Catholic High School of Newark, 7068.

title: Music
description: PETER MENNIN leaned back in his chair and said: I could never by nature be a successful pessi mist. The statement sounded both true and char acteristic of the composer who is also president of the Juilliard School. It was made during a conversa tion in his office recently, when he was discussing his Sinfonia, which will he given its New York premiere by the New York Philharmonic this week under the direction of Stanislaw Skrowaczewski. The new work, in fact, re flects his attitude, since he described it as moving from elements of pure anguish to very positive lifeaffirm ing musical ideas.

title: MYSTERY IS RAISED OVER JACK LONDON
description: PLEASANT HILL, Calif., March 20Something of a mys tery surrounds the eventual fate of a trove of books and papersher father's as well as her ownleft by Jack Lon don's daughter, Mrs. Joan Lon don Miller, when she died at the age of 70.

title: A Small Band of Aficionados Plays Sweet Tunes in Zihuatanejo
description: ZIHUATANEJO, Mexico  The man from Toronto leaned across the aisle of the little sevenpassenger Piper Navajo and above the engine noise confided in a shout, This is our second trip to Zihuatanejo. It's our per sonal Shangrilaa place to get away from this crazy world. We were flying from Mexico City across the crumpled range of the Sierra Madre del Sur. Now we dropped down, headed out to the Pa cific and circled back to a rocky shore broken by slices of beach. There it is, said the Canadian, pointing to a cluster of houses at the head of a blue bay and a few small hotels scattered around its perimeter. It's pretty primitive, he said. I hope nothing happens to spoil it.

title: Music: Guarneri Trio
description: The Guarneri Trio is, as they say in the movie ads, the Guarneri Quartet minus one player. It was the Trio and not the Quartet that played Friday evening in the Grace Rainey Rogers Audi torium.

title: The Nation.
description: SAIGON  Until the spring of 1970, the peasants of Cam bodia's sleepy villages could lis ten with little concern to the daily air strikes across the Viet namese border. Today the bor der is no more.

title: U.S. Vehicle Costs Cited
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)The General Services Administration said yesterday that it cost more than $368 million during the fiscal year 1970 to operate the Federal Government's domestic and foreign fleet of motor vehicles. In a published report, the agency said this averaged out to 12.774 cents a mile.

title: Ellen Breen Engaged To David F. Lomasney
description: OLD SAYBROOX, Conn., March 20Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Francis Breen have announced the engagement of Mr. Breen's daughter, Miss Ellen Sinnott Breen to David. Fales Lomasney, son of Mrs. Anderson Fowler Hewitt of Oyster Bay, L. I., and New York and the late David A. Lomasney of Locust Valley, L. I. Miss Breen is the daugh ter also of the late Mrs. Eleanor Sinnott Breen. A spring wedding is planned.

title: N.B.C. Seeks News Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)The National Broadcast ing Company has asked the Supreme Court to review a Massachusetts ruling that a newsman does not have the privilege of protecting confi dential sources. The television network asked to be allowed to intervene as a friend of the court in a case involving Paul Pappas, 46 years old, of Prov idence, R. I., a newsman cameraman for WTEVTV in New Bedford, Mass.

title: Brazil's Neighbors Watching Warily as the Sleeping Giant Stirs
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, March. 17 With a booming economy en hancing the dream of the build ing of a great industrial nation, Brazil has begun in the last two years to grow visibly into her vast territory, which is some 47 per cent of South America.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: BRADENTON, Fla., March 20 Since it was reasonably close to St. Patrick's Day, an emerald green euphoria still seemed to surround Danny Murtaugh the oversized leprechaun who manages the Pittsburgh Pirateg. That mapofIreland face is even more oversized on a billboard on the edge of town as Danny welcomes the tourists to Bradenton the winter home of the Pirates.

title: To Heloise With Love, But No Passion
description: I KNOW you've seen, or been sent, those threedimen sional Christmas cards that can be pulled forward with the finger, or that pop toward you simply upon being opened, to display separate levels of cutout paper by way of suggesting depth. The odd thing about them is, that they are always less dimensional than the same figures left flat. The moment the card is fully open, two things happen: the foremost cutouts seem un bearably thin, and the spaces behind them become enor mously vacant. Ronald Millar's Abelard and Heloise is a play like that.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Hofstra Names Simmons As Head Track Coach
description: Cart Simmons has been named head track coach at Hofstra University, effective immediately.

title: Bitter Enemies to Be Rivals In Oklahoma Mayor's Race
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, March 20 (AP)  Two bitter enemies on the Oklahoma City council  one of them a womanwill be the candidates in an April 6 runoff in the Mayor's race.

title: The 60's: A Sense Of Doom, Anger
description: I Can Hear It Now: The Sixties. Walter Cronkite and Fred W. Friendly Columbia M3X 30353

title: Mary Bradley, Student, Wed
description: BALTIMORE, March 20 Miss Mary Margaret Bradley, who is studying for a bachel or'h degree at the University of Maryland, was married here this afternoon to Peter Ross Corbino, a special agent for the Prudential Insurance Company of America in Washington.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: A little fertilizer in the right places did wonders
description: If the topic Marxism and Science is raised among a group of educated people outside the Soviet Union, the most frequent assumption made by the members of the group is that the issue at hand concerns Trofim D. Lysenko's brand of biology, now thoroughly discredited even in its homeland. The connection between Lysenkoism and Marxism is usually seen in terms of the environment heredity debate; Soviet ideologists allegedly maintained that the radi cally changed environment of Soviet society would lead to the develop ment of a New Soviet Man, an individual who would be superior both in his moral outlook and his genetic constitution.

title: How Does a Man Tell a Liberated Woman That She's Too Fat?
description: Seven men sat in a circle in a high rise apartment in Greenwich Village the other evening, sipping coffee out of blue mugs and trying to deal with their male chauvinism.

title: A Threat to Mount Vernon
description: George Washington's home at Mount Vernon has a beautiful and undisturbed physical setting. The view across the Potomac to the Maryland shore is almost the same as it was in Washington's time. Under laws passed by Congress in 1961 and 1966, this Maryland shore is being assembled through Federal acquisition, through donations and by scenic easements under which owners promise not alter the appearance of their land.

title: Bob Hope to Get Award
description: CHICAGO, March 20 (AP)  Bob Hope, the comedian, will get the 1971 humanitarian award of Lions International. The organization's president, Robert D. McCullough, said the comedian was being honored for his work with the blind and efforts toward conservation of sight. The award is to be pre sented at Las Vegas, Nev., dur ing the Lions' 45th annual con vention June 2225.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: In 1970 a bomb landed in the middle of Madison Ave nue and when the dust had cleared, media services, in dependent creative teams and new forms of the in house agency had secured a small but threatening posi tion in the business.

title: Caroline Jacobs Wed to T. W. Johnson
description: DARIEN, Conn., March 20 Miss Caroline Brown Ja cobs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Jacobs 3d of Dar ien and Nantucket, Mass., was married here this after noon to Timothy Ward John son, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ward L. Johnson Jr. of Pot tersville, N.J. The Rev. Ed ward Howley, a Roman Catholic priest, and the Rev. H. Arthur Lane Jr. performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church, of which Mr. Lane is rector.

title: GUATEMALA TO SEEK SOVIET BLOC TRADE
description: MEXICO CITY, March 20 (Reuters)Guatemala, one of the stanchest antiCommunist countries in Latin America, plans to send a trade mission to Eastern Europe.

title: Youth Poll
description: To the Editor: Peter Marin reports in your pages that the favorite authors of the young include Kurt Vonnegut, Jerry Rubin, Abbie Hoff man, Eldridge Cleaver and Mao Tsetung. Mr. Marin's appraisal is contradicted by a Gallup sur vey of college students made last November . . .

title: N.Y.U., COLUMBIA IN TIE FOR TITLE
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, March 20New York University and Columbia tied for first place today in the National Collegiate threeweapon fencing cham pionships at the Air Force Academy.

title: Romano Retains Title
description: NORTH ADAMS, Mass., March 20 (AP)  Al Romano, 147 pounds of North Adams re tained his New England welter weight boxing crown tonight by knocking out Irish Danny Heath, 144, of Lowell at 1:58 of the ninth round at North Adams Armory.

title: Newman, Queens College Distance Man, Gives the Planes a Run at Kennedy
description: On an isolated runway at one end of John F. Kennedy Airport, the tranquility is rudely disturbed by a lone figure jogging during the twilight of the early evenings.

title: Bullets, Minus Unseld and Johnson, Beat 76 ers, 12 4 112, as Loughery Scores 32
description: BALTIMORE, March 20, (AP) Kevin Loughery scored 32 points20 in the first halfto lead the Baltimore Bullets to a 124112 victory over the Phila delphia 76ers tonight in a Na tional Basketball Association game.

title: BIAS END SOUGHT IN LAW AGENCIES
description: WASHINGTON, March 20  Three Democratic Senators are pressing the Nixon Administra tion to eliminate racial discrim ination in state and local law enforcement agencies that re ceive Federal grants.

title: Auxiliary Policemen Stage Demonstration at City Hall
description: About 150 auxiliary police men, and policewomen demon strated outside City Hall yester day morning in support of their demands for a uniform, allow ance and free city transporta tion.

title: The difficult baby is born that way
description: ONE out of 10 babies is born difficult. The difficult babies are the redfaced infants whose howling wakes the other newborns in the hospital nursery. They're the babies who twist and scream when their faces are washed. Who spit out new foods. Who'd rather cry than sleepor so it seems to their harassed parents, who are often not only be wildered by these cantankerous infants but deeply anxious, even guilty. What are they doing wrong? Could there be something wrong with the child?

title: Coins
description: WITH the arrival of spring, many coin clubs throughout the nation make flowers the theme for an ex hibit at their monthly meet ings. A great variety of floral items has appeared in the de signs for the monies of many nations down through the years, so club displays in this field can be attractive.

title: Suffolk Symphony Is Growing; Noted Soloists Attest Its Quality
description: The world at large is cutting budgets, retrenching on com mitments and talking poor, But not the Suffolk Symphony Society.

title: WORLD FISHING YIELD SHOWS 2% DECLINE
description: ROME, March 20 (Reuters) The world fishing catch in 1969 showed its first decrease in 25 years when it dropped 2 per cent from the previous year, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization reports.

title: The World
description: DACCA, PakistanIf you are united, there is no power on earth which can prevent you from getting Pakistan.

title: Calley to Lecture Against All Wars If He Is Acquitted
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 20 (AP)First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. said today that if he is acquitted he will go on a worldwide tour delivering anti war lectures.

title: MRS. FRANK MARSHALL
description: Mrs. Caroline D. Krauss Mar shall, widow of Frank J. Mar shall, former American chess champion, died yesterday at the Sanger Nursing Home, 500 West 57th Street. She was 85 years old and lived in an apartment at the Marshall Chess Club, of which she was secretary for 55 years.

title: Bronx Show's 2,121 Dogs Sets a Record
description: The Bronx County Kennel Club fixture, one of the pio neers on the dog show circuit, will be held next Saturday in the Kingslatidge Armory, Jerome Avenue and Kings bridge Road, the Bronx. It has drawn a record, 2,121 dogs.

title: Ondine Ahead in Race to Montego Bay
description: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, March 20  Ondine surged ahead of Windward Passage to day as the 33boat fleet sailed southward at a fast pace in the 811Mile MiamiMontego Bay yacht race.

title: THOSE RADICAL PROFESSORS (CONT.)
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Chess
description: FOR the fifth consecutive year the Chess Club of Orlot, Spain, town of 20,000 nestling among the first peaks of the Pyrenees, was the scene of an international tour nament.

title: Miss Chi to Get Award Here Tuesday
description: Chi Cheng, the Taiwan sprinter who broke or equaled world records nine times in 1970, has been chosen to re ceive the annual Tanqueray Sports Achievement Award. She will receive the award, a silver plaque, at a luncheon Tuesday at Gallagher's Res taurant on West 52d Street.

title: Avalanche in Italy Kills 2
description: IMPERIA, Italy, March 20 (Reuters)An avalanche swept across a mountain road about 35 miles north of here today, burying several cars and kill ing at least two children, the police said. The disaster oc curred between the villages of Monesi and Nava.

title: The Nympho And Other Maniacs
description: In any other year, Irving Wallace's latest potboiler would have come forward unaffected ly as just what it is: popular history of The Loose Woman. Ah yes, God bless her, without whom history would have been so horny and drear; who refreshes all those guns and musty Parliaments with perfumes, silks, ribbons and glimpse of thigh; chucks great statesmen under the chin and so bequeaths a slightly softened expression to posterity; who fires 'em up before the battle and tucks 'em in at the end of a long hard day. Who, in short, has always wielded great and secret power over the powerful. And we all know what the name of that power is, don't we? That's right  thirty centuries of it, making the old world round.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTONPart of the trouble in the U.S.Israel dispute over a Mid dle East peace settlement is that Washington has come forward with only half a policy.

title: Judge Scores Nevada Welfare Purge
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., March 20 A Federal judge ruled here yesterday that Nevada must re store to its welfare rolls more than 1,000 families whose bene fits have been cut in recent months.

title: Reed Holds Key to Knicks' Title Hopes
description: What some basketball people call the Second Seasonand others designate as the Real Onefinally starts for the New York Knicks this week, 10 months after the climax of their exciting ascent to their first National Basketball Association championship.

title: Reader's Report
description: Before the oldfashioned nuclear family bows out, as some swinging savants tell us it will, I hope that Rosalind Brackenbury will get in a few more licks. (I can't believe that daycare centers will be as rich a source of literature as the incubators that gave birth to Oedipus and Lear, but I don't want to be a sore loser.)

title: Petraglia Defeats Anthony,204197, In Bowling Final
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)  Johnny Petraglia of Brooklyn defeated Earl Anthony of Tacoma, Wash., today to gain the $7,000 firstplace prize in the $60,000 Fair Lanes open bowling tournament.

title: COLUMBIA NINE GOES SOUTH FOR 7 GAMES
description: Columbia's baseball team travels to Virginia this week for the first of seven exhibition contests before the 19game regularseason schedule.

title: Airport Funds Allocated
description: BOSTON, March 20 (AP)The Massachusetts Aeronautics Commission yesterday allo cated $81,000 to the Weymouth Airport Commission for a new taxiway, apron and access road for a civilian terminal at the South Weymouth Naval Air Station and $31,000 for the Hyannis Airport Commission for constructing, marking and lighting a taxiway.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Junior Ski Jumping Taken By Washington State Youth
description: BOREAL RIDGE, Calif., March 20 (UPI)Ron Steele of Leavenworth, Wash., captured the national junior special ski jumping championship today from 56 competitors.

title: Carmichael, Back in U.S., Bids Blacks Build Mother Africa
description: HOUSTON, March 20  At Grenada, Miss., in the summer of 1966, Stokely Carmichael, the bushyhaired, overallsclad, 25yearold head of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Com mittee, gave a new direction to the Negro civil rights movement in the United States with his black power speech.

title: Bacallao Gains Semifinals In U.S. Squash Tennis
description: Pedro Bacallao, seeking his third straight United States open squash tennis title, moved to the semifinals of the tour nament yesterday at the Lone Star Boat.Club.,He won his sec ondround match from Aaron Daniels and defeated Charles LaRoche in quarterfinal play.

title: Dance Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The TestingTree
description: Most of Stanley Kunitz's poetry is intwo concentrated books, The TestingTree, just out and green, and his familiar Selected Poems, pub lished in 1959. There is a difference, not just in lapse of time; the books ara landmarks of the old and the new style. The smoke has blown off. The old Delphic voice has learned to speak words that cats and dogs can clear, it is the drift of the age, but the powerful manner in which it is done here goes beyond my shrewd ness.

title: Oil Executives More Hopeful of Settlement of Libyan Dispute
description: LONDON, March 20Oil ex ecutives in London are growing more optimistic that the pro tracted dispute over Libyan oil prices can be resolved soon and a threatened oil shutdown averted.

title: 200 AT RALLY HERE FOR HARRISBURG 6
description: Urging their supporters at rally here yesterday not to be distracted by their indictment in a kidnappingbombing plot, two members of the Harris burg Six and two of their al leged coconspirators pleaded for emphasis on what they re garded as the main issuesend ing the war in Indochina and what they call repression in the United States.

title: Chancellor Harvey Scribner
description: HARVEY BERTRAM SCRIBNER, the first Chancellor of the city school system that was sup posedly reborn last fall under a pro gram of decentralization, left a Board of Education meeting on the 11th floor of the headquarters building one recent evening and hurried down a flight of stairs to his office. Wait ing for him there was an elementary school teacher on whom he wanted to try out some ideas for reforms in classrooms, a middleaged woman wearing a homey blue sweater over a workaday print dress. Her name was Gloria Channon and what had brought her to the Chancellor's atten tion was a slender book titled Home work she had written out of the pain, doubts and discoveries that ac companied her efforts to reform the ideas of just one of the city's 63,000 teachers: herself.

title: PARTY SHIFTS STIR CRITICISM IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, March 20  China is almost at the halfway point in the establishment of new party committees in the provinces, but broadcasts have disclosed the existence of ele ments that do not share the au thorities' satisfaction with the reconstruction.

title: Ford Co. Held Liable In CarHouse Burning
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., March 20 (AP)The Arkansas Su preme Court has affirmed a Circuit Court ruling that held Ford Motor Company liable for the destruction of a house. The house burned in a fire that apparently began in an automobile parked in a garage attached to the house.

title: College of Podiatry Gets Continuing Education Dean
description: Dr. Horace C. DeCotiis of Brooklyn has been named to the newly created post of dean of continuing education at the M. J. Lewi College of Podiatry in Manhattan.

title: WICHITA STATE FIVE NAMES MILLER PILOT
description: WICHITA, Kan., March 20 (UPI)Harry Miller, who came to North Texas State Universi ty a year ago as head basket ball coach, signed a fouryear contract today to lift the sag ging basketball fortunes of Wichita State University.

title: Alaska Permits Hunting
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 Alaska permits the hunting of polar bears by guides licensed by the state Fish and Game Commission. These guides con duct biggame hunters to the habitat of the polar bear, mainly on the ice off the coasts, Eskimos also hunt the polar bear for food and skin.

title: Santo Clouts Pair
description: TEMPE, Ariz., March 20 (UPI)Ron Santo blasted two home runs, his first homers of the spring, to lift the Chicago Cubs to a 74 victory today over the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: L.A.'s Food Values
description: LOS ANGELES  If she were willing to put up with a little inconvenience, a housewife could have bought a smoked ham here recently for 39 cents a pound, or choice hamburger meat for 55 cents. Fresh asparagus was going for 39 cents a pound and grapefruit were eight for $1.

title: End of House Consumer Panel Called Catastrophic by Nader
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 Abolition of a Congressional unit that has been actively pro moting consumer causes since 1966 was disclosed today when Ralph Nader sent a sharp let ter of protest to the Capitol.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONIn this town where, sooner or later, the quality of men counts for more than measures, William D. Ruckelshaus has been watched with a critical eye since he took command of the new Environmental Protec tion Agency nearly four months ago. There Were three reasons for this special interest.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 6Member Juries to Try U.S. Civil Cases in Kansas
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan., March 20 (AP)Civil cases in Federal district courts in Kansas will be tried before six instead of 12 jurors beginning in June under an order issued yesterday by the four judges.

title: LongAwaited Subway Line on Utica Ave. in Brooklyn Is Still an Idea That Keeps Getting Untracked
description: Will there ever be a new sub way down Utica Avenue in Brooklyn? A lot of people in the area are beginning to wonder.

title: Bank Aide to Wed Judith Williams
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 20Mr. and Mrs. Burch Wil liams of Greenwich and Sachem's Head have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Holmes Williams, to James Curtis Gibbons of New York, where he is with the First National City Bank's control ler division.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM  Some say it's bad for our image if we stand firm. What did Czecho slovakia lack in the way of a good image? Yet Soviet tanks rolled into Prague.

title: Stamps
description: ANPHILEX '71 is the title of an international stamp exhibition to be staged at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel here from Nov. 26 to Dec. 1. It will com memorate the 75th anniver sary of the Collectors Club, New York.

title: Is Vienna Europe's Premier Pension City? One Yes Vote
description: VIENNA When my family and first came to settle in this city, we took temporary refuge in the Pension Elite, a firstclass pen sion we were familiar with from pre vious visits. During the day, when we left our transient residence in search of a permanent home, we hung our room key on a hook in the doorway so the help knew we were not inside. Nobody talked about thieves, and attempts to conjure the specter were parried with such thrusts as: This is Vienna, not New York.

title: Travel Tips for Lensmen
description: THERE'S a story going the rounds about the weary tourists who sit down at a sidewalk cafe somewhere in Europe, Asia or Africa and are ap proached by a smiling stran ger who greets them with, Hello, Americans, yes? You want I take picture of you together in our beautiful city, yes? He picks up the trav eler's camera from the table, begins to focus it, then moves back for a better angleand back and back and back and suddenly he's off at a run, taking the camera with him.

title: Nindl Triumphs Over Sabich In Pro Giant Slalom Final
description: VAIL, Colo., March 20 (AP) Hugo Nindl defeated Spider Sa bich today in the headtohead final of the world Professional giant slalom championship. Nindl won $2,500.

title: Hospital's Program Is Geared to Slums
description: She wore the badge of an administrative assistant. He wore the uniform of an at tending physician. Their discus sion took place in the tiled halls of a special clinic in a new wing of the Jewish Hos pital and Medical Center of Brooklyn.

title: County Chiefs Differ On Island's Growth
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., March 20  The Comprehensive Development Plan for Long Island for 1985 has brought into sharp focus several dif ferences of approach between the Nassau and Suffolk County Executives.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: ENGLISH OARSMEN TO ROW AT MIAMI
description: Oxford and Cambridge will be rowing for more than glory next Saturday when they meet in their celebrated boat race on the Thames in England.

title: Jamaica Found Making Strides as a Business Center
description: Queens, The revival of Jamaica, Queens, one of the city's most Important satellite business districts, finally appears to be getting under er way.

title: Vernal Equinox
description: The vernal equinox occurred early this morning and the almanac's arbitrary spring has now arrived. It is good to know that the posture and position of the earth are properly in order, but beyond that there isn't much vernal accomplishment in the equinox. Spring, as usual, is rooted here on earth, not off there in the empyrean, and a good deal more warmth and sunlight will be needed before we achieve that green and flowery season.

title: Clothier and Foulke Take Court Tennis Doubles Title
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 20 William J. Clothier 2d and Wil liam G. Foulke won the United States senior amateur court doubles championship by de feating Dick Boenning and Dr. Carl Fischer, 6.5, 62, today in a onehour final at the Racquet Club.

title: 2 Views on Indian Award Are Heard by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)The Interior Department has recommended to a House Panel that a $932,620 award by the Indian Claims Commis sion be distributed per capita to all descendants of the Grand River Band of Ottawa Indians in Michigan.

title: Letters:
description: To The Editor:

title: Nader's Raiders is their name, and whistleblowing is their game . . .
description: WASHINGTON.

title: SOVIET IS TERMED POLAR BEAR'S MB
description: MOSCOW, March 20  Two Russian conservationists have portrayed the Soviet Union as the sole defender of the polar bear.

title: Western Kentucky Downs Ohio State in Overtime, 8178, in Mideast Final
description: ATHENS, Ga., March 20 (UPI)  Western Kentucky, trailing by 14 points late in the first half, beat Ohio State, 81 78, in overtime today to win the Mideast regional basketball final and a berth in the National Collegiate semifinals against Villanova at Houston next Thursday.

title: Nassau Officials Are Cautious On Offtrack Betting Proposal
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 20 A proposal to submit an off track betting system in Nassau County to the voters in a ref erendum is being viewed with caution here.

title: GALLUP FINDS 12% WANT TO QUIT U.S.
description: A growing number of Ameri cans say they would like to emigrate to some other country if given the chance, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: Miss Madeleine S. Dickerson Is Engaged to Simon Watson
description: Miss Madeleine Stiles Dickerson, an editorial re searcher at the Reader's Di gest, and Simon Conran Ham ilton Watson, who is with the New York office of the Bank of London & South America, Ltd., plan to be married here May 13.

title: L. I. Guitar School Strums Knowledge Into Novices
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. I., March 20  Every Tuesday night the largest of the seven studios that have been squeezed into the small, tree shaded cottage at 200 Forest Street, which houses the Guitar Workshop, is filled with the sounds of rounds, blues, old folk songs, material drawn from the repertory of the Clancy Brothers and songs by such contempo rary composersperformers as Tom Paxton, the Beatles and James Taylor.

title: Two Kentucky State Stars Head N.A.I.A. APIStar Team
description: Elmore Smith and Travis Grant, who paced Kentucky State to the National Associa tion of Intercollegiate Athletics small college basketball chain pionship for two straight seasons, headed a 10  player NA.I.A. all  star team an nounced yesterday.

title: ST. JOHN'S BOWS;
description: In two close, hardfought, fu riousfinish games replete with missed opportunities and nar row escapes, Tennessee elimi nated St. John's and Georgia Tech knocked out La Salle last night in the fourth and fifth firstround National Invitation Tournament games at Madison Square Garden.

title: There's a New Goal in Lacrosse: Playoffs
description: Lacrosse sticks will swing in earnest this week as col lege teams across the country begin a campaign that will end with one alone at the top.

title: Linda Janien To Be a Bride
description: Miss Linda Louise Janien and Anthony Kennedy Moul ton will be married June 5.

title: John Jay's Pistol Team Seeks Justice
description: Should a college student be deprived of a possible nation al collegiate pistolshooting championship because he happens to be a policeman?

title: SQUIRES CONQUER NETS, 135 TO 125
description: NORFOLK, Va., March 20 (AP)Oharlie Scott and Ray Scott scored 28 points eadh to night as the Virginia Squires led virtually all the way in a 135.125 victory over the New York Nets in an American Bas ketball Association game.

title: Student Fiance Of Cathie Bush
description: OYSTER BAY, L,I. March 20The engagement of Miss Cathie Glendinning Bush to Charles Willard Bennett War dell 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wardell Jr. of. Cold Spring Harbor, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Clinton G. Bush Jr. of Centre Island.

title: CHILD AGENCIES ACCUSED IN ITALY
description: ROME, March 20A grow ing scandal that has bared the neglect and exploitation of des titute children is embarrassing the Roman Catholic Church, the Christian Democratic party and the publicwelfare bureaucracy.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONSenator Abe Ribi coff of Connecticut, boldly following the logic of the position he took last year in, support of the socalled Sten nis Amendment, has introduced two bills that would produce the first seri ions attack on racial division in Amer ica. It remains to be seen how many other Senators, Northern and South ern, who supported the Stennis Amend ment will be willing to go along with that attack.

title: Strategic Air Command Is Facing an Uncertain Future
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 The Strategic Air Command, for a quarter of a century the symbol of America's ability to deter nuclear war, faces vast uncertainties.

title: Gardens
description: WHAT will the gypsy moth caterpillars be up to this year? Memories are sharp of the tree defoliation and general nuisance these vora cious insects caused in the last few summers.

title: Rueful Birdnapper Doesn't Give Hoot For Ferocious Owl
description: WESTPORT, Conn., March 20 Lord Nelson, a great horned owl stolen last Sunday night from his cage at the Mid Fairfield County Youth Museum here, was found unharmed last night in a big cardboard box at the nearby Compo Shopping Center.

title: Christine R. Whittaker Is Married
description: NEW HAVEN, March 20  Miss Christine Ruth Whitta ker, who is studying for a Ph.D. degree in the history of science at Yale Univer sity, and Stephen Austin Mer rill, also a doctoral candidate and acting instructor in po litical science at Saybrook College at Yale, were mar ried here this afternoon in the Marquand Chapel at Yale's Divinity School.

title: Smith of N. Carolina Named Conference Coach of Year
description: RALEIGH, N. C. (UPI)Dean Smith of North Carolina has been named basketball coach of the year by the Atlantic Coast Conference Sports Writ ers Association.

title: VILLANOVA ROUTS PENN IN N.C.A A.;
description: RALEIGH, N. C., March 20 Villanova played a nearperfect basketball game today that shocked previously unbeaten Pennsylvania and carried the Wildcats to a 9047 victory over the Quakers in the quar terfinal round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association championship.

title: Father and 2 TeenAge Girls Are Killed in Smithtown Fire
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., March 20  A father and two of his five children died here early today when fire, apparently caused by faulty electric wir ing, damaged the first floor of a twostory home.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: The rebuff dealt chairman Wilbur Mills of the House Ways and Means Committee by President Nixon over the issue of Japanese textile quotas has left the industry confused and disenchanted.

title: POLICE MICROPHONE REMOVED FROM PARK
description: WILMINGTON, Del., March 20 (AP)  City engineers re moved a police microphone from a tree in Rodney Square today, several hours before demonstration protesting the war in Indochina.

title: Lady Macbeth Into Lady X
description: Macbeth, the film version of the Shakespearean play being made by Roman Polanski and Kenneth Tynan, is Playboy's first motion picture financing venture.The New York Times, February 28.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: When Johnny comes Marching to Hawaii on R. & R.
description: HONOLULUSome squeal with de light. Some break down and sob. And some of the performers rush into silent and long drawn out clinches at a rambling, open air Army installation here just a few steps off bustling Kalakaua. Avenue, the main artery to Honolulu's Waikiki Beach. For this is the stage where the wives, sweethearts and occasionally mothers and fathers of American serv icemen in Southeast Asia first meet their husbands, lovers and sons, men on six day R. & R. leave from Southeast Asia The scene is the Fort DeRussy Rest and Recuperation Center.

title: School Officials Seek Safeguards After Attacks on 2 Teachers
description: Top school officials have de cided to meet this week with representatives of parent and teacher groups to seek added safeguards in schools as the police yesterday sought sus pects in sexual assaults on two teachers.

title: Reader's Report
description: Anyone who believes hyper bolic claims that America is number one in the area of violence hasn't paid attention to the modern history of Asia Minor. Richard Reinhardt has, and his bloody chronicle of ir redentism and atrocity is the cautionary result. The period covered is from 1919 to 1922, when Smyrna was occupied first by Greek armies and then retaken by the Turks. Caught between the intransigent na tionalism of Venizelos and Kemal are the civilian popula tions (who take turns at mas sacring one another) and the city itself, which goes up in flames.

title: CONCERT PRESENTED BY GEORGIA SINGERS
description: The Georgia Singers, a pleas ant little choir of about two dozen voices from the Univer sity of Georgia, appeared in Carnegie Recital Hall Friday night. They have obviously been carefully trained by their con ductor, Thomas Weaver, and the performances were generally precise, enthusiastic and tonally attractive.

title: Pennsylvania Man Gets Death Penalty in Murder
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 20 (AP)Alan D. Pierce, 22 years old, of Chester, Pa., has been sentenced to the electric chair for the murder of a Roman Catholic seminarian on April 7, 1969.

title: Kathleen Huth Is Wed
description: In the Lady Chapel at St. Patrick's Cathedral here yes terday afternoon, Miss Kath leen Marie Huth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Don E. Huth of New York, was married to John. J. K. Rae Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Rae of Weym outh, Mass. The Rev. Vin cent J. P. Fox performed the ceremony. The bride's father, who spent many years in Asia as chief of The Associ ated Press Southeast Asian Services, is an executive as sistant in World Service, The Associated Press. The senior Mr. Rae is with the New Eng land Telephone Company.

title: WRITERS AGAIN PICK CARR, ROCHE, WICKS
description: RADNOR, Pa., March 20 (UPI)Three repeaters and one sophomore are among the 10 players selected on the 197071 TV Guide, ellAmerica basketball team.

title: A Sports Book With Offbeat Answers
description: A high school football player who par ticipates in a full season of practice and games has a 20 per cent chance of being injured sometime during the season, and an 8 per cent chance of sustaining serious injury.

title: Harms Way a Boon towed Hook Bay's Fishing
description: RED HOOK, St. Thomas, Virgin IslandsCapt Johnny Harms is a charter boat skip per who found the fish but lost his boat. Harms, who has worked for Laurance S. Rockefeller for the last six years to develop the Virgin Islands as a major fishing center; saw the Rockefeller 47footcustombuilt power cruiser burn to the water line at his Lagoon Marina here in January.

title: The Golden Evenings Of Summer
description: There is no accounting for humorists. Will Stanton en dured a Depression childhood and spent World War II as glider pilot, surely the least habitforming of military oc cupations. (Glider pilots had oneway tickets into combat.) Instead of being a Catch23 or a reprise of blasted hopes, his novel mythologizes his Mid western boyhood into a garden of delights.

title: A Part of Myself
description: To the Editor:

title: New de Gaulle Memoirs Judge Pompidou as a Prudent Leader
description: PARIS, March 20  Charles de Gaulle saw his successor as President, Georges Pompidou, as a man with a practical, pru dent and reserved turn of mind.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Many College Point Residents Want a Park on Site Selected for a Queens High School
description: A perambulating park in the College Point section of Queens may solve the problems of a determined community looking for an alternative site for the city's future midQueens high school.

title: Miss Nichols Becomes Bride
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 20Miss Priscilla Barton Nichols, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bruce Duncan Nichols of Fairfield, Conn., and Delray Beach, was married here this afternoon to James Gordon Pyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Tolman Pyle of Oyster Bay, L. I. The, Rev. Hundson Cary Jr. performed the cere mony at the Bethesdabythe Sea Episcopal Church.

title: Faith Rollins LeSauvage Is Affianced
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., March 20  Mr. and Mrs. George Ross LeSauvage, Jr. have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Faith Rollins Le Sauvage, to Frederick W. Goedde Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Goedde of Houston.

title: Elizabeth May Reinstate Hirohito to Order of Garter
description: LONDON, March 20 (AP) According to diplomat sources, Queen Elizabeth II will rein state Emperor Hirohito of Japan to the oldest and most exclu sive order of knighthood in the worldthe Order of the Garter when the Emperor visits Brit ain next October.

title: TIGHT RULE ASKED FOR SCHOOL BUSES
description: ALBANY, March 20  Four Long Island members of the Legislature have asked it to im pose stricter supervision of school buses and other buses carrying children, to avoid repetition of the kind of acci dent that killed seven Long Is land children last summer.

title: Alcindor of Bucks Is Named N.B. A.'s Most Valuable Player
description: Lew Alcindor, the 7foot2 inch superstar who turned Milwaukee's expansion team from a lastplace club into a division winner in two sea sons, was named yesterday the most valuable player in the National Basketball Asso ciation for this season.

title: Community Involved in Choosing Principal for Brooklyn School
description: Efforts to increase commu nity involvement in choosing high school principals are going through a test case in the one present vacancy in the school system.

title: Ballplayers Shop for Wares on the Job
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., March 20 Imagine Gristede's, Saks and Sloane's plat,. ing their wares in mobile trailers and transporting them door to door along Park Avene in Manhattan. There, the woman.. of the house would select her groeeries, her clothes and her furniture without leav ing her doorstep.

title: Coast Guard Alleges Negligence By Skippers in Tanker Collision
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 20 (AP) The Coast Guard has filed negligence charges against the skippers of two tanker ships that collided beside the Golden Gate Bridge. Jan. 18 and spilled 840,000 gallons of oil into San Francisco Bay and along 60 miles of Pacific Coast.

title: Auto Racers to Mix Formulas Sunday in California
description: About Motor Sports

title: More Hope Seen in Karachi
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 20Possibilities for a settle ment of Pakistan's constitu tional crisis were believed im proved here today with the announcement that Mr. Bhutto would fly tomorrow to join the talks President Yahya is having with political leaders of East and West Pakistan in Dacca.

title: PANEL URGES RULES ON NOISE POLLUTION
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)  A Governmentspon sored panel said today that noise pollution in the United States was on the verge of reaching a serious level and called for new Federal and state standards to protect Americans against hearing damage and annoyance.

title: D. A. Restlers Have a Son
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., March 20A son was born on March 3 to Mr. and Mrs. Donald A. Restler at the LyingIn Hospital in New York. Mrs. Restler is the former Miss June F. Hiner feld, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip B. Hinerfeld of Rockville Centre, L. I. The child has been named John Kenin. Mr. Restler is an account executive with CBWL Hayden, Stone Inc., New York investment bankers.

title: 29 Senators Request Uncut Transit Subsidy
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)A bipartisan group of 29 Senators urged the Nixon Administration today to re store a cut of $200million in mass transit subsidy funds for the current year.

title: Nicklaus Reported Backing Tampa Bid for N.F.L. Club
description: SEBRING, Fla., March 20 (AP)Bill Marcum, secretary of the Suncoast Pro Football Com mittee, said today that Jack Nicklaus, the pro golfer, was part of a group that would seek a franchise for Tampa, Fla., at next week's National Football League meetings in Palm Beach.

title: From Trust To Terror
description: To the Editor:

title: No hostility intended or accomplished
description: The Military Establishment is to sociomilitary studies what Naked Came the Stran ger is to pornoliterature: manifestly uneven product re sulting from, as its ostensible author candidly acknowl edges, the work of many hands. On the ideological meter, it registers as a liberal establishment effort to reform the Pentagon without applying radical correctives, for, as the book contends, there is much to admire in the Defense De partment, and besides, states an upbeat conclusion, By and large, the American people get the kind of military Establishment they deserve.

title: Davis CoDefendant Takes Spotlight
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 20  Until last week Ruchell Magee was seldom looked on as a real codefendant in the pre trial proceedings involving the black activist Angela Davis.

title: Leontyne Price Excels With Minnesota Orchestra
description: With due respect to the Min nesota Orchestra, which played in Carnegie Hall on Friday night, the auditorium was packed, probably because the soloist was Leontyne Price, and it was the soprano's only ap pearance here this season.

title: Mass. U. Signs Two Aides
description: The University of Massachu setts has named two coaches to the Redmen's football staff. Robert Harris, the head coach at Northampton High School for the east two years will serve as defensive line coach on Dick McPherson's staff while Larry Pasquale, an assis tant coach at Navy the last two years will be the defensive backfield side.

title: Yanks Drop 12th in Row, 132, to Expos
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 20  William S. Paley, the chairman of the board of the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem, watched the Yankees play the Montreal Expos today.

title: Elford's Porsche First in Sebring Race
description: SEBRING, Fla., March 20 Porsche, defending the world manufacturers championship, won tonight its third consecu tive race of the season, the Twelve Hours of Sebring.

title: Soil Recipes for Potting
description: TWO new artificial soil recipes for growing tropical foliage plants have been developed at the N.Y. State College of Ag riculture at Cornell Univer sity. Though developed for commercial plant growers, the mixes can be adapted for homeowner use.

title: Research Into Human Soul Due for Judicial GoAhead
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 16 Four: parties framed, by the Arizona Supreme Court will begin oral arguments next week to determine which of them will receive almost $300, 000 for research into the ex istence of a human soul.

title: Top Post at L. I. U., Vacant 9 Months, Expected to Be Filled by June
description: A new chancellor for Long Island University will be ap pointed before the end of the current semester in June, ac cording to John P. McGrath, chairman of board of trustees.

title: The Prisoner And the Bomb
description: In this highly personal memoir of captivity in Java towards the end of World War II, Col. Laurens van der Post argues that the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, horrible though it was, at least saved the lives of several hun dredthousand prisoners of the Japanese in Southeast Asia, who would otherwise have been executed by Japanese Field Marshal Terauchi during the planned Allied landings.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Bloomfield Takes Crown
description: PRINCETON, N. J.,, March 20 (AP)Bloomfield High School, led by Pat Sibilia's 20 points, took the New Jersey Group 4 basketball title today with a 7566 victory over Ewing at Princeton's Jadwin Gymna sium.

title: The Containment Of Latin America
description: A full and solid study of FD.R.'s Good Neighbor Policy and how it served to reinforce. United States domination of Latin America. The style is academic and denseone can hear the flip of the index cards but also confident and de cisive.

title: Most Ignored False Alert
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)The Federal Communi cations Commission says a sur vey indicates 92 per cent of the nation's radio and television stations remained on the air when an emergency civil de fense warning alert was sent by mistake Feb. 20.

title: OILSPILL STUDY IS PLANNED HERE
description: Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery announced a $340,000 Federal grant to the Fire De partment yesterday for develop ing and testing ways to control on spills in the watets sur rounding the city.

title: Ch. Chinoe's Adamant James, English Springer Spaniel, Is Harrisburg Best
description: HARRISBURG, March 20A flashy liver and white English springer spaniel, Ch. Chinoe's Adamant James, who was best in show at Westminster last month, took another giant stride today toward winning the dogoftheyear honors. He was named best among a field of 3,028 dogs at the Harrisburg Kennel Club fixture in the Pennsylvania state farm build ing.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Recordings
description: THE genuine magic in Mozart's Die Zauber flote is the music. The flute that protects Tamino from bodily harm could be a symbol of the composer's genius, which saves him from a libretto that combines a birdcatcher whose lips are padlocked, serious hymns about brother ly love, three ladies squab bling over a man, and what have you.

title: Our Bo Barbra
description: IF YOU thought Barbra Streisand was the great est star by far in Funny Girl, wait till you see her as funny boy. Miss Streisand is set to star in the title role of Yentle the Ye shiva Boy, the movie version of Isaac Bashevis Singer's short story that was original ly published in the 1964 col lection called Short Friday. The film will go out under the banner of First Artists Productions Company, in which Miss Streisand is a partner with Paul Newman, Sidney Poitier and Steve McQueen. The producer is Valentine Sherry, the director Ivan Passer. Singer  in his first movie stintwill col laborate with Passer on the script.

title: RANGERS TO FACE CANADIENS HERE
description: The New York Rangers head into the homestretch of their National Hockey League sched ule tonight, when they take on the Montreal Canadiens at 5:35 at Madison Square Garden. It will be the final regularseason visit of the Candiens.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: It was just a year after World War II and a couple of unknowns named Henry and Richard Bloch, searching for a good business to get into, decided to open a book keeping service.

title: Harbour Village Housing Project Is Due for Vote by Board of Estimate Thursday
description: The fate of the controversial Harbour Village housing project in the Paerdegat Basin section of Brooklyn moves closer to resolution this week when the Board of Estimate is expected to vote on the 904unit, $32 million plan et its meeting Thursday.

title: Michael Trees Have Son
description: A son was born March 8 to Mr. and Mrs. Michael Tree of New York at the Harkness Pavilion. Mrs. Tree is the former Miss Johanna Kreck of Rumburg, Czechoslovakia. Her husband is violist of the Guarneri String Quartet. The child has been named Conrad Efrem.

title: Stewart's 113 M.P.H. Gains Pole in Brands Hatch Race
description: BRANDS HATCH England, March 20 (AP)Jackie Stewart of Scotland, with a final prac tice lap of 113 miles an hour, in a Tyrell Ford won the pole position today for tomorrow's 132mile Race of Champions.

title: 2 Rival Groups Vying for Role In Governing South Brooklyn
description: Two rival groups are com peting for recognition from slity Hall as the neighborhood government of South Brooklyn. Both local Community Plan ning Board No. 6 and the South Brooklyn Development Council claim to represent the opinions of the quarter of a million residents of the area whose homes range from ele gant brownstones in Brooklyn Heights to decaying tenements in Red Hook.

title: BruinsClinch East Division Championship With 53 Victory Over Flyers
description: BOSTON, March 20 (AP) The Boston Bruins clinched the National Hockey League's East Division championship and their first Prince of Wales Trophy in 30 years tonight by defeating the Philadelphia Fly ers, 53 Bobby Orr led the way with a goal and two assists.

title: RUMANIANS DENY POLICY IS SHIFTING
description: BUCHAREST, March 14  When Rumania agreed to join the Comecon Investment Bank, in January, and sent her De fense Minister to a meeting of his Warsaw Pact colleagues in Budapest and received the Czechoslovak leader Gustav Husak here earlier this month, analysts of Eastern European affairs voiced alarm.

title: Hot Pursuit
description: Hot Pursuit is an ingenious chase through the torturous alignments of the Greek civil war that followed World War II. It involves expartisan fac tions now perpetrating atroci ties on one another, and an American, O.S.S.type captain assigned to the Greek Govern ment. Mr. Katcher attributes to Robert Braden anachronistic doubts about violence. (We'd give the enemy a name  Nazism, Fascism. But was it the hooked cross and the bundled twigs that we wanted to obliterate? Or had we con cocted these symbols as our excuse for killing other men?) His philosophizing does not pre vent the captain from leading a detail in hot pursuit of Communist band that has kid napped a village of children and exchanging an eye for an eye. The suspense is sharpened to a razor's edge by the vola tile political composition of Braden's little group. Who is loyal to whom is divulged only after a literal cliffhanger.

title: Priscilla S. Farr, J. W. Thompson Is a Bride Here
description: Miss Priscilla Shelton Farr was married here yesterday afternoon to James Wilson Thompson in the Holy Trinity Episcopal Church. The Rev. Charles Supin, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church, Far Rockaway, Queens, per formed the ceremony, as sisted by the Rev. Charles Colwell, assistant rector of Holy Trinity Church. A recep tion was held at the Colony Club.

title: LATE SCORE WINS FOR LEEDS UNITED
description: LONDON, March 20, Reuters Leeds United maintained a 6point lead at the top of the English Football League First Division today by rallying to defeat Crystal Palace, 21.

title: Contractors Vie for Space Shuttle Funds
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 20 The biggest new space program since Apollothe space shuttle is about to spring to life, and it has the nation's major aero space contractors locked in a fierce and financially crucial struggle for a piece of the action.

title: Pacific Tuna Fleet Reports 1971 Catch Is Large
description: SAN DIEGO, March 20 The United Stattes tuna fleet is making its richest haul in years along the South Ameri can coasts despite Ecuador's seizure of 24 of the fleet's fishing boats.

title: Officer to Marry Lucinda E. Train
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 Mr. and Mrs. Cuthbert R. Train of Washington and Keene Valley, N. Y., have announced the engagement of Mr. Train's daughter, Miss Lucinda Edwards Train, to Lieut. (lg.) Richard Washing ton Longstreth, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Thaddeus Longstreth of Princeton, N. J.

title: Barrett Chase, Rosemary Lyons Marry
description: PINE PLAINS, N. Y., March 20Miss Rosemary Wetter: son Lyons and K. Barrett Chase were married hero this noon in St. Anthony's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Nicholas Fabijanic, who also celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: TaxExempt Funds
description: The smaller investor is get ting an easier shot at tax exempt bonds.

title: Bridge You're a pro if you can take losses in stride
description: THE tiny minority of rubber bridge players who compete regularly for substantial stakes need the cour age of Kipling's hypothetical gambler.

title: WOLFE DUBERSTEIN
description: Wolfe Duberstein, a realtor, died yesterday in his winter home in Miami Beach after long illness, his family here dis closed. He lived at 310 Oxford Road, New Rochelle, and was 62 years old.

title: U.C.L.A. DEFEATS LONG BEAR 5755
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 20 The University of California, Los Angeles, overcame an 11 point deficit in the second half behind the shooting of Henry Bibby and Steve Patterson to eke out a 5755 victory over valiant Long Beach State in the final of the National Collegiate Far West regional basketball tournament today.

title: Abortion Loan Fund Persists at Maine U.
description: ORONO, Me, March 20 (AP)Despite a barrage of hate mail and an investigation by a county prosecutor, a stu dentsponsored abortion loan fund is continuing its finan cial assistance to pregnant coeds.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONOne does not often think of Richard Nixon as a family man. Mr. Nixon has pursued his star with such single minded dedication that, in the public eye, his wife and daugh ters have seemed little more than appendages to his career, unknown figures listening with blank dedication to an endless succession of speeches.

title: Robyn A. MacTavish, Student, Wed to Theodore Stedman 3d
description: SAN MARINO, Calif., March 20In the San Marino Com munity Church this after noon Miss Robyn Adair Mac Tavish and Theodore Win throp Stedman 3d, seniors at the University of Denver, were married by the Rev. Robert W. McClellan.

title: Four City Golf Courses Will Close for Repairs
description: The City's four yearround golf courses will be closed tomorrow through Friday to be restored for the, spring and summer seasons.

title: C. B. S. Is Challenged by Agnew To AdmitErrors in 3 TV Films
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew challenged the Columbia Broad casting System tonight to ad mit or deny his charges of error and propagandistic ma nipulation in three C.B.S. tele vision documentaries.

title: Tito Will Visit Italy
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 20 (Reuters)  President Tito of Yugoslavia will begin an official visit to Italy Thursday, it was'announced here today.

title: DALLAS ACES LEAD IN TOURNEY FINAL
description: ATLANTA, March 20  The world champion Dallas Aces overwhelmed their opponents at the start of the Vanderbilt Cup knockout team champion ship final here today.

title: NEW GROUP PLANS ISSUES ANALYSIS
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 26 private council to per form nonpartisan analysis of major national issues is being formed by a group of leaders in academics, law, labor and industry.

title: Items in Transportation Plan
description: ALBANY, March 20The proposed $2.5billion trans portation bond issue provides the following for New York City and the New York metropolitan area:

title: HayPrice Battle Pits Neighbor Against Neighbor in the Northwest Farm Country
description: EPHRATA,. Wash., March 20 A strong feeling of suspicion and distrust of neighbor against neighbor, like the after math of an Old West range war pervades this community and others here in the farm coun try of the Northwest.

title: SHORTER,MISS BROWN VOTED BEST IN MEET
description: In the opinion of spectators at the national indoor track and field championships at Madison Square Garden recently, Frank Shorter of the Florida track club, victor in the 3mile, and Doris Brown of the Seattle Fal cons, winner of the mile, were the outstanding man and wom an in the meet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Moon Vehicle Stops
description: MOSCOW, March 20 (UPI) The Soviet Union's moon ve hicle stopped today for its fifth lunar night since it began its remotecontrol travels Nov. 17, Tass the official press agency, said. Tess said the eight wheeled machine covered about 1.2 miles during the two weeks of the lunar day, photographing a wide crater and analyzing soil samples Inside it.

title: Blues Down Wings, 21
description: ST. LOUIS, Mo., March 20 (UPI)  Jim Lorentz and Bill Sutherland scored on St. Louis power plays to ..give the Blues a 21 victory over the Detroit Red Wings tonight.

title: Lumber Prices Stir Concern
description: The sharp rise in lumber and plywood prices that has been under way since early this year: is causing deep concern in the Nixon Admin istration.

title: In Florida, They Bet Not Only on the Horses and the Jaialai Players, but Also on the Greyhounds
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 20 (UPI)Unconscious emerged as the top Kentucky Derby candi date in the West today when he captured the 34th running of the $58,650 San Felipe Handi cap for 3yearolds by a half length at Santa. Anita.

title: Britons to Report On New Proposals In Lockheed Talks
description: BURBANK, Calif., March 20 Two members of the British delegation renegotiating the RollsRoyce engine contract with the Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration returned to London to night to report to their Govern ment.

title: GREEK AIDE ASSAILS ROLE OF EXLEFTISTS
description: ATHENS, March 20A key member of the army junta that seized power in Greece in 1967 publicly accused the Govern ment today of having failed to cleanse public life and to re cruit able and worthy per sonnel.

title: FOR THE RECORD
description: In a recent article about pornography in San Francisco, the magazine Psychic was er roneously included in a list of pornographic publications. Psychic is not a pornographic magazine, and is not connect ed with the pornographic pub lication movement in any way.

title: Florida Officials Told to Destroy Tapes on Attack
description: MIAMI, March 20 (AP)Civil Defense officials of Dade Coun ty have been ordered to destroy prepared radio broadcasts that assure the public that an enemy who attacked the United States has been hit by strong Ameri can retaliation, officials in Washington said yesterday.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The econ omy is emerging from the re cession of 1970 much more slowly than the Administration, and most private forecasters, had hoped or expected. And with each passing day the Adminis tration's target of a Gross Na tional Product of $1,065billion this year seems less likely to be attained.

title: MRS. CAP. LETON BUNCE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., March 20Mrs. Emily Tosbell Bunce, widow of Carleton B. Bunce, vice president of the Chase National Bank, died yesterday in Greenwich Hospital. She lived at 35 Shady Glen Court, New Rochelle, N. Y.

title: Thousands Here Deliver 105 Tons of Bottles and Cans for Recycling
description: Despite stayatborne weath er, thousands of people in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut earned 30 cents to $105.98 apiece yesterday for taking discarded bottles and aluminums cans to collection centers.

title: Too French? Perhaps, But You'll Eat Well And Get a $4 Check
description: EATING in Paris, as described by some gourmets, seems to be the most expensive dining in the world. Many an American, con templating a trip to Paris, will say, How can the Parisians afford to eat In a restaurant? The answer is that American travelers, even learned and sophisticated ones, rarely if ever find the eating places that average French citizens cherish for themselves. In fact, Parisians feel secure in the knowledge that tourists won't find the pet French restaurants, and if they do, will be afraid to enter them. They look too French.

title: Feasting with feta
description: One of the staples of the Greek table is feta, cheese that is becoming increasingly popular America. It is a chalkwhite product, somewhat salty because it is preserved in brine. It can be mild, medium or sharp. In Greek kitchens feta used in cooking, as in the recipe here for shrimp, or as a table cheese to eat with fruit or in salads such as the colorful one described below.

title: HALLETI TAKES TWO SNOWMOBILE RACES
description: BOONVILLE, N. Y., March 20 (AP)Larry Halleti Jr. of Co lumbia, N. J., took two of three junior classes in the world series of snowmobiling here to day while other members of the United States Snowmobile Association's Eastern Division cleaned up in the women's events.

title: ALFRED J. GROSSO
description: ORANGE, N. J., March 20 Alfred J. Grosso, senior partner in the law firm of Grosso, Beck & Mangino, here, died today in Orange Memorial Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 15 Cedar Drive, Loveladies.

title: Harold Lloyd 1893 4971
description: EVEN at his peak, Harold Lloyd had neither Keaton's sublime serenity nor Chaplin's passionate poetry, but he was often funnier than either just the same. Lloyd was the man in the crowd, on the subway, in the elevator, at the office.
