title: Octagon Is Given a Virtuoso Reading
description: William Mayer, in his Octa gon for Piano and Orchestra, was obviously thinking large scale. The work lasts just under a halfhour and calls for super virtuosity from orchestra, so loist and conductor, too.

title: Nixon Flexibility Impresses Russians
description: MOSCOW, March 21  Al though Soviet officials have made no secret of their disap pointment with the Nixon Ad ministration, they seem to dis play a grudging respect for what they describe as an in creased flexibility in American foreign policy since Mr. Nixon took office.

title: HARRY LERNER
description: Harry Lerner of Glastonbury, Conn., formerly a traffic man ager of 20th CenturyFox Film Corporation and sales manager of Greyhound Van Lines, Inc. died Thursday in St. Francis Hospital, Hartford. His age was 67.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS TO LICENSE MEDICS
description: Governor Rockefeller intends to seek state licensing and reg ulatory authority enabling med ical paraprofessionals to assist physicians in their duties.

title: Con Ed to Seek Rate Rise To Cover Increased Costs
description: The Consolidated Edison Com pany's chairman yesterday cit ed more than $100million in added costs this year in three fields alone as a compelling reason for anew application to increase electric rates shortly.

title: St. Bonaventure Downs Purdue, 9479, And Michigan Defeats Syracuse in N.I.T.
description: Big 10 schools, making their first appearance in the Na tional Invitation Tournament, broke even yesterday at Madi son Square Garden.

title: Von Ruden Wins 1,000 Run
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, March 21 (AP)  Torn Von Ruden of the United States defeated Chris Fisher of Australia in the 1,000 meter invitation run today at the Olympic sport field. Each runner was clocked in 2 minutes 21.3 seconds, with Von Ruden finishing inches ahead of his rival.

title: U.S. Families Fly Out After Laos Airport Raid
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 21 (AP)  American depend ents streamed into Vientiane today as the United States Embassy ordered nonessential personnel flown out of Luang Prabang, the royal capital, after a morning rocket at tack on its airport.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Following are the votes of dele gations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress dur ing the week ended yesterday:

title: BLAZE DESTROYS OFFICES AT TUFTS
description: MEDFORD, Mass., March 21 A threealarm blaze destroyed offices at Tufts University's Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy early this morning.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Turkish PremierDesignate Says Reforms Are Planned
description: ANKARA, March 21 (AP) Turkey's new Premierdesignate said today that he planned a reform program that, if ac cepted by Parliament, would make it unnecessary for the armed forces to take over the Government.

title: Report Says Farm Child Labor Recalls Sweatshops of 1930's
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21 Except that the work is out doors, child labor abuse on farms in the nineteenseventies is reminiscent of sweatshop conditions of the thirties, the American Friends Service Com mittee reported in a study to day.

title: GOVERNOR SEEKS FOURTH JETPORT NEAR NEWBURGH
description: Governor Rockefeller will put forward soon a plan for devel opment of the former Stewart Air Force Base into the fourth jetport long sought for the metropolitan area, according to state government sources here.

title: Ulster Gets Hint of Direct London Rule
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 21The Northern Ire land Government, torn by strife between moderate and rightist Protestants, faced a political crisis today in the aftermath of the resignation last night of the Prime Minister, Maj. James D. ChichesterClark.

title: Spring Is Welcomed On a Wintry Day In Central Park Rite
description: The astronomers said that spring arrived yesterday, but several thousand young people who crowded the Mall in Cen tral Park to celebrate the earth's renewal found a chilly welcome from the season.

title: Villanova Is Top Surprise in N.C.A.A.
description: The Villanova Wildcats es tablished themselves as formid able giant killers on Saturday and will be out for bigger game this week.

title: Young Lords Take Part In March in Puerto Rico
description: PONCE, P. R., March 21 (UPI) Twenty members of the Young Lords, a militant group of New Yorkers of Puerto Rican descent, joined Puerto Rican nationalists today in a march commemorating the 1937 Ponce massacre.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: To the Editor: In their worthy efforts to get people off relief and into jobs, are Governors Reagan and Rockefeller going to fail by starting out as defeatists?

title: Dean Rusk: On the War
description: At this particular time I would men tion two situations that are highly dangerous. The first is the Middle East. There, the two sides that live in the areaIsrael and its Arab neighbors show very little indication of being willing to make the concessions that are necessary to establish peace.

title: Met Presents Don Giovanni With Cast of Quality
description: Don Giovanni made a welcome return to the Metro politan Opera Saturday after noon in a performance fa vored by a cast of quality and a conductor who is com fortable with the music of Mozart.

title: Muskie Has Edge
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)Senator Muskie holds a visible read for the Presidential nomination among Democratic Governors and state chairmen willing to name their personal choices or to assess the current mood of Democratic voters in their states.

title: Nixon Aides Use Agnew Phrase of Orderly Retreat
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Administration officials con tinued to maintain today that the quickening South Viet namese withdrawals from Laos represented an orderly re treat, not a rout, and that the gains in the operation still out weighed the losses.

title: New Look on Telegraph Avenue
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 21  Like Bleecker Street in New York's Greenwich Vil lage, like North Beach and, later, Haight Street in San Francisco, Berkeley's Tele graph Avenue has for years evoked a special mystery and magic in the minds of the young and proved an irre sistible attraction for count less hundreds of them.

title: Boy, 10, Missing in Bay
description: LINDENHURST, L. I.. March 21 (UPI)Suffolk County po lice boats searched Great South Bay off here tonight for a 10 yearold boy missing and feared drowned. The boy, whose name was not immediately released, had floated with a companion on a 55gallon drum about 50 feet into the bay off the Baby lon town beach this afternoon, the police said. The boys fell from the drum, but one, 12 yearold Steven Brelfsford of Lindenhurst, swam back to shore.

title: Ellen Lieberfarb Wed
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., March 21Miss Ellen Carol Lieberfarb was married this afternoon to Joseph Mark Silverman by Rabbi Charles Annen in the Manor. The bride is the daughtei of Mr. and Mrs, Charles Liebeffarb of Maplewood. Mr. Silverma is the son of Mrs. David Silverman of Fort Lee and the late Mr: Silverman.

title: Greer Sparks 76ers
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21 (UPI)Hal Greer paced a bal anced Philadelphia attack with 23 points today as the 76ers defeated the Baltimore Bullets, 120108.

title: Wisconsin Democrats Would Like to See Lindsay in 1972 Primary
description: MILWAUKEE, March 19 Mayor John V. Lindsay may not know whether he will be come a Democrat, but even in his present inbetween status he was creating discernible in terest today among Wisconsin Democrats, who are already looking a year ahead to this state's Presidential primary.

title: B.O.A.C. Is Unsubsidized
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 25 editorial (White Ele phant With Wings) contains a com ment that is misleading.

title: Lois Guterman Bride Of Mark J. Rosenthal
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., March 21Miss Lois R. Guterman and Mark J. Rosenthal were married this evening in the Huntington Town House by Rabbi Joseph Grossman.

title: Trade Delegates of O.A.S. Mix Dissension and Togetherness
description: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 20One week ago, on the 10th anniversary of the founding of the now moribund Alliance for Progress, delegates from the United States and 22 other Western Hemisphere countries gathered here to search for another avenue to ward regional cooperation.

title: Groups of Trustees Agree On Merger at Notre Dame
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., March 21 (UPI)A merger of the Uni versity of Notre Dame and St. Mary's College has been recom mended by executive commit tees of the boards of trustees of the two Roman Catholic schools, it was announced to day.

title: New York A.G. Five Gains
description: HILLSIDE, N. J., March 21 The New York Athletic Club won the eastern regional cham pionships of the American Ath letic Union basketball tourna ment today by beating the Jersey City AllStars, 11974.

title: Top West Pakistan Leader Talks With Yahya in Dacca
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 21 West Pakistan's dominant po litical leader, Zulfikar All Bhu tto, the last awaited participant in the talks here over East Pakistan's demands for self rule, arrived in Dacca today under heavy military guard. Hostile crowds of East Paid; stanis waved fists and shouted, Murderer Bhutto, go home!

title: HISAYA FUKADA
description: KOFU, Japan. March 21 (AP); Hisaya Fukada, a novelist, and vice president of the Japan Alpine Club, died today of a heart attack while climbing a mountain, the police reported. He was 68 years old.

title: Delancey St. Awakens to Bustle of Spring
description: Coaxed out by subtle in timations of spring, thousands of people thronged a sixblock stretch of Delancey Street yesterday to buy, to hawk, to bargain and to kibbitz.

title: PUERTO RICAN AID FOUND RISING HERE
description: More than 100,000 Puerto Ricans in New York City were directly served by antipoverty organizations in 1970 at a cost of $37.9million, Jule M. Sugarman, the city's Human Resources Administrator, an nounced yesterday.

title: Mondale Says Migrant Labor Gained Little Through Congress
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)For two years, Senator Walter F. Mondale lent much of his legislative effort to a group he considers the most powerless in America today the migrant farmworkers.

title: Nader Opposes Tax Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)Ralph Nader, the con sumer advocate, asked Congress today to block President Nix on's speedup of tax deductions for depreciation, calling it an unlawful $3billion subsidy to favored businesses.

title: Knicks Lose Final, 10198
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., March 21It was a year ago that the Knicks lost their final game of the season before going on to beat the Los Angeles Lakers for the National Basketball As sociation championship. Tonight they closed out the regular sea son on the short end of a 101 98 score against Los Angeles in the Forum.

title: To Penalize Polluters
description: To the Editor: Most conservationists have recog nized the existence of an environ mental conflict that pits the need for a vigorous legislative and enforce ment program to restore a semblance of ecological balance against the economic perils of passing on the cost of pollution control measures or of instituting manufacturing methods that do not degrade the environment.

title: Germaine Greer Opinions That May Shock the Faithful
description: LONDON, March 21After Prime Minister Edward Heath and pictures of the embat 9tled British troops in North ern Ireland, the person most likely to be seen on television screens here these days is Germaine Greer.

title: Polish Economist Views Eastern Europe
description: VIENNAAdam Zwass point ed with some pride to the study he had just published in German on East Bloc monetary mechanisms and said he was now well adjusted to his new life in Vienna on the staff of the Austrian Economics In stitute.

title: M'MAHON SHUFFLES AUSTRALIA CABINET
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 21Prime Minister William McMahon shuffled the Austral ian Cabinet tonight and left his predecespor, John G. Gorton, in the senior post of Defense Minister.

title: Susan Rebecca Brown Married To Robert Elias Agus, Lawyer
description: BALTIMORE, March 21 Miss Susan Rebecca Brown, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Nathan Brown of New York and Herzliya, Israel was mar ried here this afternoon to Robert Elias Agus of more and Washington in the chapel of the BethEl Syna gogue.

title: 2 Britons Return Home
description: LONDON, March 22 (UPI) Two members of the Rolls Royce and Government team that flew to California last week for talks with the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation (about saving the RB211 jet engine project returned today. James Hamilton, of the Ministry of Aviation Supply, told reporters that the talks are still going on.

title: CANADA WEIGHING A URANIUM PLAN
description: TORONTO, March 21  The Canadian Government has re acted cautiously to an in dustrialist's suggestion that uraniumenrichment facility be built in Canada, a country with large uranium reserves.

title: ROUGH SEAS TAKE TOLL IN LONG RACE
description: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, March 21Strong winds and rough seas today began to take their toll on smaller boats in the sixth biennial MiamiMon tego Bay yacht race.

title: Saigon Troops, in Desperation, Scramble for U.S. Helicopters
description: HAMNGHI COMMAND POST, South Vietnam, March 21The men who are considered South Vietnam's best soldiers are coming out of Laos, sonic in orderly fashion, others in panic. The North Vietnamese are right behind them.

title: Marijuana Terms Range From Seven Days to Life
description: Despite a general trend toward relaxation of state penalties for possession of marijuana, the nationwide pattern remains a crazy quilt, with maximum sen tences ranging from seven days in jail in Nebraska to life imprisonment in Texas.

title: 100,000 March In Bologna
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, March 21 (Reuters)About 100,000 peo ple marched through the streets of this city today to protest the reported resurgence of Fascism in Italy.

title: A Doctor Cries Fix On AliFrazier Fight
description: LONDON, March 21 (Reu ters)A British doctor, high ly respected in international boxing circles, contended in an article published here that the world heavyweight fight between Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier was fixed.

title: Slump in Manufacturing Jobs Here Surpasses National Average
description: A survey identifying manu facturing job openings in the New York metropolitan area was made public yesterday by the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics here.

title: 2,000 RETREAT FROM LAOS, PURSUED BY HANOI UNITS; U.S. PLANES BOMB IN NORTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, March 22More than 2,000 South Vietnames troops retreated hastily from Laos yesterday and today while North Vietnamese forces pur sued them, posing a possible threat to American installations supporting the sixweekold campaign.

title: 27,000 See an Execution
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, March 21 (Agence FrancePresse)  A ca pacity of 27,000 people watched a firing squad execute four armed robbers yesterday in the sports stadium of Warri, in Ni geria's Midwestern State.

title: Slide Hits NewGuinea Villagel
description: PORT MORESBY, New Guinea, March 21 (Reuters)A land Side buried a village in New Guinea today and all 100 resi dents are feared killed, civil defense and emergency services reported. The village is high in the Star Mountains in the West Sepik district.

title: Miss Davis's Counsel Says Marcuse Offers to Hire Her
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 21 UPI)Howard Moore, chief counsel for Angela Davis, co defendant in the Marin County kidnapping and murder plot, said today that her former philosophy teacher had offered to hire her if she was released under bail.

title: Avalanches Kill 4 in Italy
description: ROME, March 21 (AP) Avalanches set off by heavy snow blocked mountain high ways from the Alps to the Ligurian Coast today and killed at least four persons.

title: McGovern to Offer Msure Asking Recognition of Peking
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)  Senator George S. Mc Govern of South Dakota said today that he would introduce a resolution in the Senate on Tuesday calling for United States recognition of Commu nist China as the only Chinese Government.

title: Shack Scores 3 Goals as Sabres Beat Bruins 75
description: BOSTON, March 21 (UPI)  Eddie Shack pumped in three goals to lead the Buffalo Sabres to a 75 victory over the Boston Bruins tonight.

title: ARTHUR C. SPURR
description: WHEELING, W. Va., March 21Arthur C. Spurr, president of the Monongehela Power Company from 1935 until his retirement in 1955, died yester day in Reynolds Memorial Hos pital in nearby Glendale. He was 81 years old.

title: Sebring Victory Gives Porsche a Sweep
description: SEBRING, Fla., March 21 Porsche, the current holder of the world manufacturers cham pionship, strengthened its grip on the 1971 title yesterday by winning the Twelve Hours of Sebring. It was the German marque's third victory in this season's three endurance races.

title: JERSEY ENSEMBLES OFFER ROREM WORKS
description: The New Jersey Schola Can torum and Fairleigh Dickinson University Chamber Orchestra presented an interesting cross section of Ned's Rorem's choral music yesterday afternoon at Tully Hall: Three Incantations From a Mariontte Tale (1948) for children's chorus, From an Unknown Past (1951) and Letters From Paris (1966) for chorus and orchestra.

title: Theater: Chas. Abbott & Son Opens
description: The Roundabout Theater interrupted its classic reper tory last night to present a new work, Lewis S. Sals burg's Chas, Abbott & Son. The play begins with the an nouncement, Lily Langtry is dead, presumably to set the time as the late 1920's. All mournful thoughts about Miss Langtry are soon replaced by condolences for the play.

title: BANKAIDED RACES IN TEXAS ALLEGED
description: AUSTIN, Tex., March 21 The staff of Gov. Preston Smith, who has accused the Nixon Ad ministration of trying to des troy him for political reasons, has collected the names of more than 100 Texas politicians he says have borrowed money from banks for political campaigns.

title: Driver Is Killed as Car Explodes After Chase
description: A car traveling east aat a speed estimated by the po lice at between 80 and 100 miles an hour careened across Fifth Avenue at 24th Street in Manhattan last night, flipped end over end eight times, landed upside down in the fountain at Madison Square Park and exploded into flames.

title: TESTIMONY RERUN FOR CALLEY JURY
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 21The jury in the war crimes murder trial of First Lieut. Wil liam L. Calley Jr. returned to court today to hear a twohour rerun of Government testimony.

title: OUTLOOK IS BLEAK Al MILL FACTORS
description: Two years, two months and 24 days ago, the stockholdersi of the Mill Factors Corporation were first told that their com pany was in trouble. Last week end they were told officially for the first time the details of just how badthe problems are.

title: RiversOr Open Sewers?
description: A strange gambling game is now going on in Washing ton that may prejudice the health of America's streams and rivers. It is a game in which the Administration invites Congress to pass a strong measure to curb the polluting of the country's waters while concerned Con gressmen insist that the Administration can act effec tively to that end right now, whether it gets new legis lation or not.

title: 3M Develops Slow Tape
description: The Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Company has developed a new magnetic tape that it said would permit video and audio records to operate at slow speeds without any loss in quality. Designated highenergy tape, it is aimed at consumer markets through the use of cassettes, where cut ting the tape speed could re duce costs by using less tape.

title: Moscow Is Split On Nursery Issue
description: MOSCOWIt is often said that the grandmother is the most important institution in the Soviet Union. For if babushka is available and willing to babysit during the day, a mother does, not have to face the increasingly diffi cult problem or what to do with her child while she is at work.

title: REGAZZONI TAKES 132MILE CAR RACE
description: BRANDS HATCH, England, March 21 (AP)Clay Regazzoni of Switzerland, driving a rebuilt Ferrari Grand Pix, scored an impressive victory today in the Formula One Race of Champ ions.

title: Soviet Public Learns of Oil Pollution Problem in Disclosure of a Spill Threatening Caspian
description: MOSCOW, March 21spill age from one of the Soviet Union's biggest pipelines has brought the problem of pollu tion by oil to pubic atten tion after a long silence in the controlled press.

title: SST FOES WOULD AID ANY WHO LOST JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)  Three Democratic Senators opposed to Govern ment financing of the super sonic transport airliner said to day that they planned to intro duce a resolution in Congress to help workers who might lose jobs from the cancellation of the program.

title: Tanker Sinks at the Canal
description: BALBOA, Panama Canal Zone, March 21 (AP)The Panaman ianregistered tanker Esso Hon duras rammed a bank in the Panama Canal early today and sank in Gatun Lake. The 21, 627ton vessel, carrying a cargo of crude oil, was refloated hours later and towed to an chorage at Cristobal. No oil spillage was reported.

title: Indian Head Reweaves Acquisition Policy
description: Indian Head, Inc., a highly diversified company that be gan in textiles 18 years ago and then broadened out from there, recently reversed its practice at least temporarily and acquired a 142yearold textiles maker.

title: Mills Face Shipping Test
description: PITTSBURGH, March 21 Steel producers were bracing for a test of shipping capacity last week.

title: Lag in Housing Spurs A Drive to Alter Law
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 Despite the enactment of broad new housing laws in recent years and strenuous efforts by the Federal Government to spur production, there is wide spread and growing dissatisfac tion with the national housing effort.

title: Piston Surge Tops Bulls
description: DETRIT, March 21 (UPI)  The Detroit Pistons scored three straight baskets in the final 80 seconds today to overcome a 1 point Chicago lead and post a 116111 victory over the Bulls.

title: Theater: Snow White in New Guise
description: Al Carmines is the kind of artist who joins rather than merges. Let me explain. First we had better note that Mr. Carmines's new show (he calls it with more pride than hope an opera) is The Journey of Snow White, and it has been given at the Judson Memorial Church by the Judson Poets' Theater. It is delightful, like eating pistachio ice cream to the sound of cornets.

title: Cut in State Relief Unit's Power Opposed
description: The chairman of the State Board of Social Welfare yester day opposed a legislative pro posal that would strip the board of its authority to name the Commissioner of Social Serv ices.

title: We Must Build SST
description: To the Editor: On March 15 Anthony Lewis, in a column in the form of an open letter to Scoop Jackson, was critical of the SST. He pointed out, quite rightly, that technology should be applied to meet important human needs  in housing, in transportation, in urban development. There is only one thing wrong with his statement: he did not take account of a source for funding these needs.

title: Ceylon Orders Death Penalty
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, March 21 (AP)The Prime Minister, Mrs. Sirimavo Bandaranaika, acting under emergency laws, ordered the death penalty today for arson, looting, trespass and damage by explosives. The order came 12 hours after policemen and soldiers found a huge ammunition and explo sives cache on the University of Ceylon campus.

title: Counteroffer Is Reported
description: LONDON, March 22One member from each of the two British teams that have been negotiating for the rescue of the Lockheed Tristar aircraft and its RollsRoyce engine re ported to the British Govern ment today on Lockheed's counteroffer.

title: The SchoolinaCart for G.I.'s
description: HONOLULU, March 22 (UPI) The students Judith Par rish teaches from her one wagon schoolhouse have a lot to remember.

title: Letter From the Greek Underground
description: ATHENSI spent this New Year's Eve planting bombs at three American targets in Athens.

title: College Raises Tuition
description: WINOOSKI, Vt., March 22 (AP)  St. Michael's College will raise its tuition $75 a semester, effective July 1. Tuition for incoming students next September will go from $1,850 to $2,000.

title: TV Impact on Views About Environment Studied
description: The Ford Foundation is spend ing nearly a quarter of a million dollars to find out how televi sion is affecting the environ ment.

title: Widows Get $1Million Here In Car Deaths Settlement
description: A $2.5million auto crash award was cut to $1million in Federal Court yesterday.

title: Executive Changes
description: Burton Sapiro and John Bagatta have been appointed senior vice presidents of the Macy's New York division of R. H. Macy, & Co., Inc., effective May 1. Mr. Sa piro, merchandise vice president for Junior wear, misses' and women's dresses, will be senior vice president in charge of merchandising worn en's, misses' and Junior better and budget ready to wear apparel, intimate apparel, accessories, foot wear, millinery and fash ion fabrics. Mr. Bagatta, merchandise vice presi dent for misses' and women's sportswear and coats and fashion fabrics, will be senior vice presi dent tied regional director of stores. He will be re sponsible for the Roosevelt Field, Huntington, Bay Shore and Smith Haven stores on Long Island.

title: NEW NAME FOR I.O.S. PLANNED IN 60 DAYS
description: Investors Overseas Services, the giant mutual fund complex, will change its name within the next 60 days, after it has sold off its assets and formed a new company, sources close to the situation said yesterday.

title: ROCKEFELLER ASKS DETERGENT CURBS
description: ALBANY, March 22Gover nor Rockefeller sent to the Legislature today a bill that would ban by June 1, 1973, the sale of detergents containing phosphates.

title: FOX FILM FILES SUIT AGAINST DISSIDENTS
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation filed suit yes terday against kgroup of dissi dent stockholders who launched a proxy fight for control two weeks ago, charging them with making false, misleading, in complete and inaccurate state ments to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Pimlico Names Publicist
description: BALTIMORE, March 22 (AP) Sam P. Siciliano of Shrews bury, N. J., was named today public relations and publicity director of Pimlico Race Course. Siciliano, a newsman for more than 25 years, re places Kelso Sturgeon, who resigned to join Turf and Sport magazine.

title: Compromise Is Reported
description: GAUHATI, India, March 22 (Reuters)Dacca radio, moni tored in this city north of Dacca tonight, said a com promise formula has been readied between President Yay ha and Sheik Mujib to end the country's political crisis.

title: Desegregation for Real
description: The General Accounting Office's allegations of serious abuses in allocating the Administration's special school desegregation funds emphasize the need for effective guidelines for these vital appropriations.

title: Sportswear Buyers' Funds Are Low, Hopes Are High
description: Thousands of retail buyers of men's sportswear are in New York this week with less opentobuy funds avail able but high hopes for busi ness in 19/1.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: March 22, 1971 THE PRESIDENT

title: Mr Force Band Cutback
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)The Air Force said today that it would inactivate six bands by June 30, leaving only 25. A spokesman said the de activation was part of an econ omy drive and affecting 230 musicians.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 22, 1971

title: RANGERS. TO DUEL SABRES TONIGHT
description: Gil Perreault, the Young cen ter who has created more ex citement than any rookie for ward since Jean Beliveau joined the National Hockey League in 1953, leads, the streaking Ruf falo Sabres Into Madison Square Garden tonight to face the suddenly weary Rangers.

title: Profit Taking Cuts Amex Prices As Volume Falls to 4.77 Million
description: The American Stock Ex change turned in its second consecutive loss yesterday as the list declined in slower trading.

title: Crimmins Case Jury. Examines Pictures Of Slain Children
description: The 12 male Jurors in the murder and manslaughter trial of Mrs: Alice Crimmins ex examined exhibits yesterday that included maps, drawings and 17 photographs of the bodies, of her two children, whom she is alleged to, have killed.

title: Appeal on Mutual Funds
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)The Supreme Court de clined today to consider wheth er mutualfund investors have a right to bring personal law suits against funds and their management.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Some South Vietnamese soldiers, in the re treat from Laos, have been Clinging to the landing skids of American heli copters. Some have been falling to their deaths from these precarious perches, and in addition, we just have to kick some of them off, an Ameri can pilot has reported. We have to think about ourselves, too. You just cannot lift this bird with fifteen guys clinging to it.

title: Soviet Leaders'Policy Reports Get Party's Formal Approval
description: MOSCOW, March 22The Soviet Communist party Central Committee gave formal ap proval today to the main re ports that the party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, and Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin will deliver to the 24th., party congress, which begins a week from to morrow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Italian Rights Group Honors Colombo
description: HUNTINGTON TOWNSHIP, L. I., March 22More than 1,000 persons paid $125 a plate tonight to attend a testimonial dinner for Joseph A. Colombo Sr., who has been called a Mafia leader by both a Senate investigating committee and the Justice Department.

title: THREE RACES WON BY RON MOUE
description: With Ron Turcotte riding to his third triumph on the pro gram, Here Comes Trouble car ried the colors of Anne Ran dazzo to a convincing success in the feature seventh event at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: PORTABLE BAR UNITS GET TRIAL ON L.I.R.
description: The railroad, long plagued by general confusion in its bar cars on the evening runs when conductors have difficulty in collecting tickets, said it hoped to develop some order. The portable units are small tables that can serve the riders in sev eral cars.

title: Heath Sees Guerrilla Threat
description: LONDON, March 22Prime Minister Heath said today that urban guerrilla warfare was threatening Northern Ireland and stressed that Britain had the ultimate authority to deal with terrorists.

title: Chi eng Is Hailed as Top Athlete
description: Mrs. Vince Reel says she is more Introverted than Odra Verted prefers quiet occasions to parties, picks no fights with her husband and, is teased about her new naive by fellow college students at California Poly, Pomona.

title: Du Pont Schedules Antipollution Fight Costing 300Million
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. Inc., announced yester day that it planned to spend more than $300million over the next three years on air and waterpollution control in the United States.

title: LAWYER IS SEIZED IN BRIBERY CASE
description: A lawyer who acted as a judge at city, parking violation hearings was arrested yester day on charges of attempting to, fix a speeding case for client by offering $750 to third parties.

title: House Committee Seeking a More Active Foreign Policy Role
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The longdormant House For eign Affairs Committee, which has tended to be an acquies cent partner to the executive branch, is staking out a more active, independent role in the formulation of foreign policy.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES SERVICE PAY RISE
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The House Armed Services Committee gave its final ap proval today to a two  year continuation of the draft, but voted an increase in military pay and allowances that many Congressmen believe would permit the draft to be ended well before the two years are up.

title: U.S. BEGINS RECALL OF INFECTED FLUID
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)The Food and Drug Ad ministration ordered today phased recall of contaminated intravenous fluids that have been linked to 350 cases of hos pital blood Infection.

title: Screen: 'Transient Life':Incestuous Love Theme of Japanese Import
description: Akio Jissoji's "This Transient Life," which opened on a double bill with Kihachi Okamoto's samurai drama "Kill!" at the Bijou yesterday, is an on-going story of incestuous love that runs for rather more than two hours. It is, all at once, a good deal to take. But I think it is worth taking, for reasons that include both its extraordinary theme and its ambitious, proficient and sometimes impossibly fancy-narrative technique.Set in a modern Japan that preserves its ancient artifacts and fragments of some of its ancient beliefs in a physical environment of gorgeous dense lushness, "This Transient Life" concerns a middle class college-age brother and sister who on a rainy afternoon discover one another's bodies and begin an affair that neither intends to end.The girl becomes pregnant. The brother arranges for her to marry a family servantan upright but sexually tormented young man who nevertheless makes an excellent husband and father until, discovering his wife and her brother making passionate love, he kills himself.Two more men the brother has contact with die: a carver of images of the Buddha to whom he apprentices and whose renewed sex life in middle age (the brother's influence) leads to a heart attack, and the carver's son, who in seeking revenge, fatally stabs himself with one of his father's tools.If the action sounds extreme, I had better indicate at once that it is, and that I have described only part of it, and that it is all immensely complicated by a visual style that means to employ every rhetorical device of which the camera seems capable, and by an intellectual program that in mediating between time and eternity really does try to deal with every potential of the film's title."This Transient Life" is therefore evocative, ironic, lyrical, bitter, grotesque, sensuously beautiful, contemplative, active, philosophicaland  quite elaborately, lustful.In combining these impulses, the film succeeds perhaps a third of the time, which isn't a bad average, and which makes for interesting watching if only in the exuberance of the effort. Apparently, not a man to flinch at the obvious, when Jissoji wants to tell us that his hero, in the midst of love-making, considers the bone beneath the flesh, he rings a bell and in a series of flash cuts shows us literally some bones beneath the flesh.At his most intense, for example, when he is simultaneously presenting four strands of action on the screen plus an unaccompanied cello suite on the sound track, Jissoji overfills the cup of artistic expectation by a considerable margin. But he never underfills it, and in the movies as in all things, more is more.Jissoji's approach to filming, cutting things up, continually discovering by means of the camera pan and track, has a way or making performances seem more resonant than perhaps they really are. I liked everybody, especially Ryo Tamura, who plays the brother with a kind of sullen intelligence, and the girl (I do not know her name) who plays the image carver's slatternly and appealing young wife."This Transient Life" is the kind of imperfect, enormously ambitious movie that again and again, and at the most unlikely moments, breaks through its pretensions to a genuine complexity of vision.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's TV Interview
description: Following lire excerpts from an interview with President. Nixon last night by Howard K. Smith of the American Broadcasting Company, as recorded by The New. York Times.

title: 133 LEADING GREEKS ASSAIL GOVERNMENT
description: ATHENS, March 22  A group of 133 prominent Greeks declared today that the sus pension of political liberty and democracy In Greece, under military rule since the coup d'etat of April 21, 1967, had led to the spiritual and poli tical withering of the country.

title: Suit Against Banks to Be Heard
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)  The Supreme Court today granted a hearing to the New York State Superintendent of Insurance, who has been trying to sue five banks over stock transaction of the Man hattan Casualty Company, now in liquidation., The court will hear the case next fall or win ter and decide it by written opinion.

title: Connecticut Officials Pleased
description: NEW HAVEN, March 22 Officials of the financially troubled Roman Catholic schools in Connecticut said they were pleased and encouraged by today's Supreme Court ruling.

title: Jersey Central Is Assured Of Funds
description: The Federal Government yesterday agreed to guarantee up to $6million of trustee certificates for the bankrupt Cen tral Railroad of New Jersey. With this assurance of working funds, the trustee, R, D. Tim pany, filed with the Federal District Court in Newark a plan showing how he believes the road must be restructured to make it a viable operation.

title: UNWED PARENTS WIN LEGAL POINT
description: TRENTON, March 22  The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that the state's rarely used criminal law against fornication could mot be used to prosecute unwed parents seeking welfare assistance for their illegitimate children.

title: MARKET PAUSES IN UPWARD TREK
description: Wall Street analysts have been saying for some time now that the stock market needs to pause and digest its spectacular gains of recent months.

title: Administration Concedes City Payroll Rise of 10,000
description: The Lindsay administration acknowledged yesterday that the city's payroll had increased by 10,000 in 1970, while the administration was building up a $300million operating deficit.

title: Appalachian Bill Approved
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  A House public works subcommittee approved today bill to extend for four years the Appalachian Regional Develop ment program.

title: Goldwator to Have Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)Senator Banry Gokwater, Republican of Ariona, has a bone spur in his shoulder and win have it surgically removed next Monday.

title: Premier Arrives for Talks
description: VIENTIANE, March 22 (UPI) Premier Souvanna Phouma flew to Luang Prabang during the day to discuss the military situation with Sisouk na Cham passak, Deputy Minister for Defense.

title: Al McGuire Is Named Coach of Year in Poll
description: Al McGuire, a tough minded disciplinarian who guided Marquette to its first undefeated, regular season in history, was voted col lege basketball's coach of the year in the United Press In ternational poll yesterday.

title: Daryl's Joy and Cougar II To Miss Santa Anita Race
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 22 (UPI)Daryl's Joy and Cougar II, the top turfcourse horses campaigning at Santa Anita, were withdrawn today from the $75,000 San Luis Rey Handi cap on Saturday because of ill ness.

title: THE TIMES TO ISSUE EDUCATIONAL TAPES
description: The New York Times has entered the educational audio tape cassette field, it was an nounced by Karl Horwitz, man ager of the Library Services Division.

title: State Job T raining Called Ineffective By Watchdog Group
description: ALBANY, March 22A legis lative commission found grave problems in the state's man power programs today, describ ing the welfare work incentive program as almost totally in effective.

title: School Accounting Gets F After New Audit by Beame
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame reported yesterday that the final audit by his office found that the Board of Education's current budget deficit was S29.2million, or $7million un der the board's previous revised estimate.

title: Plywood Futures Rise in Price in Active Trading
description: In active trading, plywood futures prices bounced back on the Chicago Board of Trade after dropping on Friday.

title: Students Learn to Save by Using Coops
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 Faced with rising prices, dwin dling support from home and merchants who are sometimes not above taking advantage of them, college students across the country are turning increas ingly to independent buying co operatives in an effort to stretch each dollar as far as possible.

title: Navy Adds R.O.T:C. Plans
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (XP)The Navy announced to day the establishment of two new Reserve Officer Training Corps units at predominantly Negro colleges. The programs will start next fall at Savannah State College, Savannah, Ga., and at Southern University in Baton Rouge, La.

title: ELECTION OUTCOME ASSESSED BY PARIS
description: PARIS, March. 22The Min istry of the Interior reported today that the great losers of the municipal elections com pleted yesterday were those groups in the middle that tried to maintain their independence of both the Gaullists and the Communists.

title: Clearing the Ulster Air,
description: Prime Minister Heath has reaffirmed British policy and responsibility for Northern Ireland in a clear manner that may yet bring the warring factions into contact with reality. The statement was overdue but Stormont politicians and Belfast terrorists can have no doubt about its meaning.

title: Windward Passage Crosses Line First In Race to Jamaica
description: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, March 22Achieving an in credible 20knot speed on the final Caribbean leg, Windward Passage sailed across the finish line first in the 811mile Miami to Montego Bay Yacht Race. Her elapsed time clipped more than 30 hours off her own rec ord for the event.

description: To the Editor:

title: NIXON SAYS DRIVE BY SAIGON HELPS REACH KEY GOALS
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 President Nixon said tonight that the South Vietnamese drive in Laos has made considerable progress thus far toward the goals of insuring United States withdrawals from Vietnam, re ducing the threat to the Ameri can forces still there and de veloping the ability of Saigon's army to defend itself.

title: Protestant Rightists Bid for Ulster Post
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 22The Protestant right wing made an unforeseen bid to take over the leadership of Northern Ireland's ruling party today but an Ulster moderate, Brian Faulkner, was favored to win the. Unionist party leader ship tomorrow and thus become the next Prime Minister.

title: Pravda Reports Pullback
description: MOSCOW, March 22The Soviet press prominently dis played news of the South Viet namese pullback from Laos to day.

title: Bill Rates Register an Increase At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, March 22  Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Pope Exhorts Chile on Ties
description: ROME, March 22Pope Paul VI told Chile's new Ambassa dor to the Holy See today that Chile should always respect her Roman Catholic tradition and maintain good relations with the church. The Pope's formal remarks were in response to an address by the new Ambas sador, Rene Rojas Galdamas stressing that the Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens attached great impor tance to good relations with the Church and the Vatican.

description: Pants. Pants. Pants.

title: HIGH COURT TAKES DOW PROXY CASE
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  The Supreme Court agreed today to review a lower court decision that the Gov ernment asserts drastically up sets procedures for handling business proxy cases.

title: $25,000 Holdup in Queens
description: Three bandits one armed with a shotgun and two with revolversescaped with about $25,000 from a bank in Jackson Heights, Queens, yesterday after forcing 32 persons to lie on the floor of the bank, the police re ported. According to the police, a customer followed the holdup men as they were driven from the Bankers Trust Company branch at 7701 31st Avenue, but gave up the pursuit when two shots were fired.

title: Sports of The Times
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22Baseball has seen steady increase in the number of switchhitting batsmen recent years. Almost without exception they have been natural righthanded hitters with a distaste for curved balls. So they crossed to the other side of the plate and swung lefty whenever the situation suggested the wisdom of such action.

title: Dominican Leader Accuses U.S. Press en Latin News
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domini can Republic, March 22 (AP) President Joaquin Balaguer ac cused the press of North Amer ica today of emphasizing ter rorism and violence in coverage of Latin America.

title: NEW COLLEGE SITE ENDORSED BY BOARD
description: The Board of Higher Educa tion last night approved a re quest for $2.7million for the purchase of the site and build ing of the newly formed Med gar Evers College.

description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Nuclear Blast Is Reported by A.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)  The Atomic Energy Commission said today that it recorded last night what presumably was a Soviet underground nuclear ex plosion.

title: Soviet Expert Opposes Abortion Ban
description: MOSCOW, March 22  A prominent Soviet population specialist is. Arguing against proposals to abolish legal abor tions as a way of raising the falling Soviet birth rate.

title: ACCORDS DRAFTED BY IMPASSE PANEL
description: The special impasse panel in the police, fire and sanita tion cases worked late yester day preparing recommendations for settling the longdrawnout disputes.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 1.2% LAST WEEK
description: Steel production rose last week by 1,2 per cent compared with output the week before, according to the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: Muskie, in a Shift, Urges Mayors to Oppose Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, March 22  President Nixon's revenueshar ing proposal received, another blow today when Senator Ed mund S, Muskie told about 800 mayors that as a practical political matter they should support instead a Federal take over of welfare costs.

title: Vatican Paper Assails Israel For Policies on Jerusalem
description: ROME, March 22 (Reuters) The Vatican newspaper L'Os servatore Romano sharply crit icized Israel today for policies that it said were aimed at achieving virtual sovereignty over the entire city of Jeru salem

title: New L.I. Coliseum Seeks Only BigLeague Tenants
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., March 22  Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso announced to day that the county's $27 million Coliseum at Mitchel Field would open April 1, 1972 for major sports events.

title: Filipino Boxer Earns Draw
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, March 22 (AP)Willie Cordo va, a Filipino bantamweight, held the unbeaten Australian champion, Paul Ferreri, to a draw over 10 rounds tonight. Cordova weighed 115 and Ferreri 118.

title: Market Place: The Gray Sheet And Computers
description: The Gray Sheet is out with its annual review and fore cast for the computer Indus try.

title: JOBLESSNESS RATE HITS 5.8% IN STATE
description: ALBANY, March 22Unem ployment throughout the state rose to 5.8 per cent last month, up twotenths of a percentage point above the January figure.

title: ROZELLE PONDERS HAYWOOD RULING
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 22 While girls in the briefest of bikinis sunned themeelves on the beach outside, Pete Rozelle sat dresded In a business suit in a room at the expensive Breakers Hotel today and dls cussed the adverse effect the Spencer Haywood case could have on pro football.

title: Executive House Asks Aid
description: CHICAGO, March 22 (AP) Executive House, Inc., asked the Federal District Court here to day for an arrangement with creditors, under Chapter XI of the Bankruptcy Act, in connec tion with its longterm lease of the Condado Beach Hotel at San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: Harness Drivers Aiming at World Title
description: WESTBURY, L.I., March 22 Competition to determine, the world champion harness racing driver, which was introduced last year, will begin at Roose velt Raceway the night of May 3 and wind up at Philadelphia's Liberty Bell Park on May, 15.

title: GLUT OF DOLLARS IS BURDEN ABROAD
description: PARIS, March 22As West ern Europe and Japan struggle under a load of surplus dollars, specialists of a Western eco nomiccooperation agency are circulating forecasts showing that the load will remain unusually heavy through the course of this year.

title: Laver, Injured, Withdraws; Lutz Eliminated by Ruffels
description: WHEATON, Ill., March 22 (UPI)Rod Laver withdrew to day from the $50,000 Sportface international tennis champion ship because of a back injury.

title: EDWIN TREAKLE, 93, EXSEAFOOD DEALER
description: GLOUCESTER, Va., March 22J. Edwin Treakle, a retired seafood dealer of the old Ful ton Fish Market in New York, died yesterday at his home in Mathews County. His age was 93.

title: MRS. DWIGHT M. MILLS
description: Mrs. Katharine Pyle Cole Mills, widow of Dwight M. Mills, former chairman of Ken yon & Eckhardt, Inc., advertis ing agency, died Saturday on visit to Los Angeles, She lived at Lake Placid.

title: First Boston Tops List Of Syndicate Managers
description: The First Boston Corpora tion in 1970 headed the list of leading investmentbanking syndicate managers for the eighth year in a row, data published by the Investment Dealers' Digest showed yes terday.

title: U.S., WARNS STATES ON BUILDING WAGE
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The Federal Government has informed all 50 states that it regards their laws governing construction wages on Govern merit projects as no longer in effect.

title: Winthrop Paul Rockefeller Weds Miss Deborah C. Sage
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va March 22 The jet set lost a premising yoting cpouple to a hill farm in Arkahsas to day.

title: BRITISH MAKE BID TO U.S. ON ROLLS
description: Two British officials asked Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally Jr. yesterday for guarantee to repay British out Jays for a RollsRoyce jet en gine if the Lockheed L101 air bus eventually fell by the way side, according to reliable in dustry sources. They were said to have been turned down.

title: F. W, PHILLIPS JR.
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., March 22 Francis W. Phillips Jr., devel opment manager of the Bartlett Tree Expert Company of High land Park, Ill., died last night at the Highland Park Hospital after a brief illness. He was 54 years old, and lived in Fort Lau derdale, Fla. He had lived here.

title: A WEEK OF CONCERN FOR P.O.W.'S OPENS
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 A national week of concern for the American prisoners of war and servicemen missing in action in Indochina opened here today amid growing Con gressional feeling that an alter native to President Nixon's policy on the prisoners must be found.

title: EDMOND E. FRISCH
description: NAPLES, Fla., March 22 Edmond E. Frisch, a retired New York jeweler, died today.

title: Spaghetti Eaters, RelaxHelp Is on the Way
description: What the wheel did for transportation, 48yearold Israel Robert Smuts hopes his latest invention will do for spaghetti.

title: U.S SEXTET BOWS TO SOVIET BY 102
description: BERN, Switzerland, March 22 (UPI)  The Soviet Union's defending world champions taught the United States how to play hockey tonight, trounc ing the Americans, 102, in the 1971 world ice /hockey cham pionships.

title: Environment Defense Group Gets $285,000 Ford Grant
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced yesterday a $285,000 grant to the Environmental De fense Fund, public interest law group that was founded by law yers and biologists.

title: Brooklyn Infant Is Kidnapped; Woman, 51, Seized Within Hour
description: A 2monthold Brooklyn baby, kidnapped from in front of Bay Ridge drug stare yester day afternoon, was returned to his mother unharmed within 45 minutes.

title: Confiscated Marijuana To Aid Cancer Study
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)  Using confiscated marijuana, the Government began making two million cigarettes today for use in laboratory experiments to see if smoking large amounts of pot can lead to cancer.

title: Black Caucus of House To See Nixon Thursday
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)The White House said today that President Nixon would meet Thursday with 12 Negro members of the House  a meeting the socalled black caucus has been seeking for nearly a year.

title: ICBM Cone Is Intercepted By Two Sprint Missiles
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (Reuters)  Two Sprint missiles sucessfully intercepted the nose cone of an intercontinental bal listic missile over the Pacific today in the latest test of the Safeguard defense system, the Pentagon announced.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Diary of a spring (excerpted):

title: Sir Hughe KnatchbullHugessen, Cicero Spy Case Victim, Dead
description: BARHAM, England, March 22, (AP)Sir Hughe Knatchbull Hugessen, the diplomat whose secrets were stolen in the World War II Cicero spy case, died here today. He was 84 years old.

title: Dance: Facade Returns
description: Art may be long, but ballet history Is surprisingly short. Over the past weekendI saw it on Friday nightthe City Center Joffrey Ballet re vived Frederick Ashton's Fa cade at the New York City Center. Although Facade is regarded as a modern ballet, it is, going to be 40 years old at the end of this week.

title: General Won't Punish G.I.'s for Refusing Orders
description: KHESANH, South Vietnam, March, 22  A command ing general said today, he did, not plan to take disciplinary action against 53 of his men who refused an order to move forward to secure a damaged helicopter and their command ing officer's armored vehicle.

title: 2 Girls Arrested as Heroin Suppliers
description: Two Washington Irving High School girls described by the police as major suppliers of heroin were arrested in a pizza shop across from the school yesterday morning.

title: Protester Seized in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (Reuters)  Josef Schneider, a 24yearold Soviet emigrant to Israel, was arrested tonight when he handcuffed himself in side a wooden cage in front of the White House in protest against Soviet treatment of ,Jews. He had been fasting since last Monday in a park facing the White House to dramatize the plight of Soviet Jews.

title: Vornado Sales Increase
description: Vornado, Inc., reported yes terday that sales in the five weeks ended March 7 totaled $68,598,000, including leased department sales, up from the yearearlier $59,527,000.

title: Film: The Conformist
description: The following review origi nally appeared on Sept. 19, 1970, when the film was shown at the New York Film Festival. The movie is being exhibited here commercially.Bernardo Bertolucci, who is associated with Italy's avant  garde because of such films as Before the Revolution, Partner and The Spider's Stratagem, has at last made a very middleclass, almost conven tional (in the context of his other work) movie that turns out to be one of the elegant surprises of the current New York Film Festival.

title: Blind Man, a Fire Near, Is Aided by Mrs. Hicks
description: BOSTON, March 22 (UPI) Representative Louise Day Hicks, Democrat of Massa chusetts, ran to a house next to a burning building and led an elderly olind man and his wife to safety.

title: LINDBERGH NAVIES 2 KEY SST DEFECTS
description: ST. PAUL, March 22 Charles A. Lindbergh, the avia tor and conservationist, told conservation group here to night that the speed of prop osed supersonic planes did not justify the perils of upper at mospheric pollution. and the disturbance caused by the sonic boom.

title: A Requiem Reappears
description: When Frederic Waldman and his Musica Aeterna Or chestra and Chorus revived the Dvorak Requiem at Car negie Hall in 1964, the per formance was its first ap pearance in New York in more than 60 years. Hear ing the 1890 score at that time, a great, many people wondered where it had been keeping itself, and why. Whilenot on the exalted level of the Requiems of Mozart, Verdi, Faure or, Berlioz, this is certainly one of Dvorak's most complex and persuasive works, and Should be heard than it is.

title: Bridge: Open Pair Championship Ends In Tie at the Spring Nationals
description: ATLANTA, March 22The Open Pair Championship that ended the American Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals here last night resulted in a tie, a rare event. Sharing the title with a store of 854 match points were Barry Crane of Los An geles, the world's leading masterpoint holder, and Dr. John Fisher of Dallas, and a Midwest couple, Vince and Joan Remey of Southfield, Mich.

title: U.C.L.A. Coach Cites Need For a Total Team Effort
description: LOS ANGELES, March 22 This team has impressed me all season long with its poise, patience and intelligence. That was Coach John Wooden's trib ute to his stillalive University of California, Los Angeles Bru ins on the eve of their bid for a fifth straight National Col legiate basketball title.

title: Tablet Hints at Early Maya Link
description: A professor at the Univer sity of the Americas in Mex ico City believes designs on a stone recently placed on display at the National Mu seum of Mexico indicate con tact between Mediterranean people and the Maya, of Mex ico as early as 700 AD.

title: 2 AT WHARTON SEE G.N.P. DOUBLE BY '80
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 23 (UPI)Economists at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania's Whar ton School of Finance and Commerce predicted today that the United States economy would approach the twotril lion  dollar level by 1980, almost double the onetrillion mark it passed this year.

title: Wellesley Panel Asks Limited Admission of Men
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., March 22 A special commission at Wellesley College has urged that the 96yearold women's college accept a limited number of male students on an experi mental basis.

title: SEIZED CUBAN FACING LISBON ARMY TRIAL
description: LISBON, March 22A Cuban Army officer captured with na tionalist guerrillas in Portuguese Guinea will be tried by Lisbon's Second Military Court although the court's judges have declared that the tribunal lacks jurisdic tion in the case.

title: CENSUS CONFIRMS SUBURBS' GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 Final Census Bureau figures for metropolitan areas con firmed today the preliminary finding that metropolitan areas grew far faster than central cities during the sixties.

title: Aurelio Tears Into Critics Of Lindsay and Is Rebuked
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio last night assailed Con troller Abraham D. Beame, clubhouse politicians, The Daily News and other critics of Mayor Lindsay who enjoy dumping on the city.

title: CHURCH SCHOOLS ARE ALLOWED AID
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP) The Supreme Court to day allowed Connecticut to ex tend aid to parochial schools in the stale.

title: Lab Tests Hint at Life on Mars
description: The existence of at prrimitive form of life on Mars leas been shown in laboratory experi ments to be possible through a Chemical process stimulated by the sun's ultraviolet radia tion.

title: Two Executives of Tabloid Guilty in Obscenity Case
description: The editor and the publisher of Screw, a weekly tabloid, were convicted in Criminal Court in Manhattan yesterday of publishing and disseminating obscene material.

title: Enemy Troops Repulsed After Assault on Khesanh
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, March 23  North Vietnamese soldiers carrying satchel charges broke into Khe sanh today behind a heavy ar tillery barrage, but were driven out with heavy losses, the United States command said.

title: E.E.C.Opens FarmPrice Talks;
description: BRUSSELS, March 22With angry farmers demonstrating all over Europe and preparing a protest march on Brussels for tomorrow, the six European Economic Community Agricul ture Ministers; met here today to set new prices for a range of products guaranteed under the European farm policy.

title: Expressway Repairs Planned!
description: One northbound lane of the Brooklyn  Queens Expressway from Atlantic Avenue to the Brooklyn Bridge will be blocked tto repair work today from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M., according to the Traffic Department. The department also said that cleaning work on the express way would block off one north bound lane in the Hamilton Avenue overpass area from 11:30 A.M. to 2 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Hearing Set for Captain
description: FORT McPHERSON, March 22 (UPI)The Army an nounced today that the initial pretrial hearing in the court martial of Capt. Eugene M. Kotouc for the alleged maiming of a Vietnamese near Mylai would, be held here April 13.

title: Black Minister Favored to Win Congress Race in Capital Today
description: WASHINGTON, March 22  The District of Columbia will vote tomorrow for a delegate to Congress whose main task will be to work for legislation that will at last make possible some form of selfgovernment. More than half of the 260,000 voters are expected to turn out.

title: Hayward Memorial April 2
description: A memorial service for Le land Hayward, long a leading theatrical producer here, will be held Friday, April 2, at noon in St. James' Episcopal Church, Madison Avenue at 71st Street. The Rev. Dr. John B. Coburn will conduct the service. Mr Hayward died Thursday at his home in Yorktown Heights, N.Y., after a long illness at the age of 68.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, March 22 President Kenneth D. Kaunda charged today that Portugal was preventing food from enter ing Zambia from Angola and Mozambique and was threaten ing invasion.

title: Pentagon Defends Use of Tear Gases.
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The Defense Department argued today that tear gases and plant killers were legitimate, humane weapons of war that should not be abandoned by the United States.

title: Women Net Stars Seek Jackpot Here
description: On the eve of the richest tournament in their new pro fessional tour, leading women tennis players will meet tonight to discuss plans, progress and problems.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON STEADY AT CLOSE
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were steady yester day in sluggish trading. Issues closing higher were led by Leo pold Minerals following its over night performance in Sydney. The Leopold shares rose to about $10.40 from $4.80 before reacting to profit taking.

title: Credit Group Withdraws Chrysler's Prime Rating
description: The National Credit Office, a Dun & Bradstreet division that evaluates issuers of corn. mercial paper, withdrew yes terday its prime rating from such unsecured corporate notes sold by the Chrysler Corpora tion and two of its subsidiaries the Chrysler Financial Cor poration and Chrysler Credit Canada, Ltd. No new rating was substituted.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL TO INCREASE PRICES
description: The Bethlehem Steel Cor poration said yesterday that it would follow other producers in raising prices of carbon and alloy hotrolled bars and semi finished steel products, effec tive April 15.

title: MRS. GEORGE MALONE, WIDOW OF SENATOR
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)Mrs. Ruth von Moslander Malone, widow of Senator George W. Malone, Republican of Nevada, died yesterday after a brief illness, She was 65 years old.

title: Italy to Press Charges Over a Raphael
description: ROME, March 22Italian authorities said today they were pressing criminal charges against two officials of the Boston Museum of Fine Arts in an effort to re trieve a painting attributed to Raphael that they alleged was smuggled out of this country in 1969.

title: Mayor of Montgomery, Ala., Loses Democratic Primary
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., March 22Mayor Earl D. James was defeated in the Democratic primary today by a political newcomer, Lamar Wagner, by 700 votes. There are no Republi can candidates.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Breaking longstanding tra dition, the International Game Fish Association last month moved to drop its regulation prohibiting the use of gang (double or treble) hooks on plugs.

title: N.Y.U. Official to Be President of Reed, College
description: Paul E. Bragdon, a vice presi dent of New York University, accepted yesterday an invita tion to become the 11th presi dent of Reed College in Portland, Ore., long rated one of the top, colleges in the coun try.

title: Test Expert Calls I.Q. and Grade Equivalency Scores Monstrosities
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The I.Q. and grade equiva lency scores by which most public schools attempt to meas ure student potential and per formance were attacked as psychological and statistical monstrosities here today by one of the country's foremost authorities on testing.

title: Gannett Fills Florida Post
description: COCOA Fl., March 22, (UPI) James H Jesse, was named, today president and general manager of Gannett Florida, publishers of three daily news papers in this Cape Kennedy area The appointment was an nounced by Raul Miller chair man and chief executive offi cer, and Allen. H. Neuharth, president of the parent Gannett Co Inc., a national communi cations company with head,. quarters in Rochester, N.Y. Mr. Miller and Mr. Neuharth an nounced that they had stepped down as chairman and presi .dent respectively.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cubs Replace Pitching Coach
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., March 22 (AP)The Chicago Cubs have appointed Mel Wright pitching coach, replacing the ailing Verlon Walker.

title: Egg Roll Set at White Houses
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)  The White House said today that its annual Easter Egg Roll for children 8 years old and tinder would be held on the south lawn of the mansion April 12. President Nixon and his family customarily spend the Easter holidays at Key Bis cayne, Fla., and may not be back on Monday, the 12th.

title: Corporate Rift in Godfather Filming
description: Negotiations designed to facilitate the New York film ing of Mario Puzo's The Godfather have caused Something of a corporate rift between Paramount Pictures and its parent company, Gulf & Western Industries.

title: Calley jurors Hear Reading of Testimony by 3 Witnesses Telling of Officer's Part in Deaths at Mylai
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 22The story of the alleged massacre of South Vietnamese women and children in an ir rigation ditch outside the ham let of Mylai three years ago was told again today to the military jury weighing the fate of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: Idioms Fly at Met? School for Latins
description: ST. PETERSBURG,. Fla., March 22  The New York Mets crossed a linguistic fron tier today when they searted 25day crash program in English for 15 Spanishspeak ing minor leaguers in their training camp.

title: ARGENTINE JUNTA OUTS PRESIDENT IN POST 9 MONTHS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Tuesday, March 23The commanders of Argentina's three armed serv ices early today announced the dismissal of Roberto Marcelo Levingston from the presi dency.

title: Katy Industries Set To Acquire Cenac In a Deal for Stock
description: Merger News

title: DR. ANNA Q. CHURCHILL
description: WESTFORD, Mass., March 22 (AP)Dr. Anna Quincy Church ill, who served on the faculties of the Tufts University School of Medicine and Dental Medi cine from 1923 until her re tirement in 1954, died yesterday at Massachusetts General Hos pital in Boston. She was 87 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Haywood Case Recessed
description: LOS ANGELES, March 22 (AP) Judge Wairen J. Ferguson of the United States District Court called a threeday recess today in the contractdispute between Spencer Haywood and the Den ver Rockets.

title: HEYNS SAYS CUTS SPOIL BERKELEY
description: BERKELEY, Calif., March 22 Dr. Roger W. Heyns said today that budget cuts were spolling the edubational oppor tunities for students at the Berkeley campus of the Univer sity of California.

title: PRESSURE IS CITED IN COOP CHANGES
description: Reports of attempted bribes, evictions and other means of pressure to force tenants to yield apartments were related to the City Council Housing Committee yesterday by speak ers discussing the conversion of rental apartment houses to co operatives or condominiums.

title: Consultants Helped Draft City Tax Plan For a $160,000 Fee
description: I Mayor Lindsay's $880.7mil lion tax program was formu lated in large measure by management consulting compa ny to which $160,000 in two contracts were let without com petitive bidding or public hear ing.

title: Bronx School Area Chosen to Redesign Education Program
description: ALBANY, March 22Com munity School District 7, com posed of 23 schools with 30,000 pupils in the South Bronx, has been selected by the State Edu cation Department for partici pation in a pilot program in the redesign of education.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Appeal For HartkeRoudebush Recount
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 The Supreme Court agreed to day to consider If the Consti tution bars Indiana officials from recounting the votes in the disputed election of Sena tor Vance }lattice over former Representative Richard L. Rou debush.

title: 2D MISTRIAL RULED IN EXTORTION CASE
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn declared a second mistrial yes terday in an extortion and con spiracy case involving two former Federal narcotics agents pending a ruling on whether to admit the results of liedetec tor tests as evidence.

title: PETERSON EXCELS, BUT YANKS LOSE
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 22 An 11thinning home run to right field by the eighth Detroit pinchhitter of the game, Kevin Collins, gave the Tigers a 54 victory over the Yankees to day, It was the former Met's first hit in 17 trips to the plate.

title: Panther Who Jumped Bail in' 69 Returns Voluntarily for Trial
description: A Black Panther who jumped $25,000 bail after his indict, ment with 13 others currently on trial, retutred here volun tarily and was held without bail yesterday by Suprelne Court Justice John M. Mur tagh.

title: Division and Unrest on Rise In Harlem School Complex
description: Harlem's Intermediate School 201 ??plexthe pioneer experim?? in com munity control ?? school is beset with ??wing divi sion and unrest ??ong some of those who ??anded its creation five years ago.

title: Democrats Charge Nixon Tries To Dismantle Poverty Agency
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 House Democrats accused the Nixon Administration today of trying to dismantle the Office of Economic Opportunity under the guise of Government re form.

title: NASA to Seek $100Million For STOL Research Plane
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)The space agency plans to ask Congress for $100mil lion over the next four years to develop an exprimental jet shorttakeoffandlanding re search plane.

title: Yahya Delays Assembly Again as Talks Progress
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 22 President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan of Pakistan today postponed the National Assem bly for a second time, saying that more delay is needed to resolve the crisis over East Pakistan's demands for self rule.

title: Seoul Sets Vote for April 27
description: SEOUL, South Korea, March 22The South Korean Gov ernment formally decided to day to hold elections on April 27 to choose the nation's new president for the next four years. A Cabinet spokesman said that President Chung Hee Park was scheduled to pro claim the election date tomor row.

title: Princeton Plans Abandoned
description: PRINCETON, N.J., March 22  A $34million development plan for the southeast corner of the Princeton University cam pus, drawn up by I. M. Pei and artners, has been abandoned for the present as too ambitious, according to Ricardo A. Mes tres, financial vice president and treasurer of the university.

title: West Pakistan Industry, Hurt by Rift, Presses Regime for Accord With East
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 22Urgent pressure for a set tlement of differences between East and West Pakistaneven if broad autonomy must be granted to the Eastis com ing from industrialists in Ka rachi and Lahore, the two big manufacturing centers of Paki stan.

title: Bettor in Marseilles Collects $200,000 on Triplet, But Police Investigate Performance of Trotting Race
description: PARIS, March 22  New York bettors trying to beat the new triple at Roosevelt Race way will be Interested to know that a lone plunger in Mar seilles won the equivalent of $200,000 on a French triplet recently at a harness track.

title: Nixon Suggests Press Distorts Policy
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 Although his language was tol erant and his mood almost: de liberately polite, President Nixon suggested tonight that his Indo china policy has been distorted by incomplete and at times un fair coverage by the nation's news media.

title: Particularly Lively Style Played by OldTimers
description: Two styles'of good old moun tain music came together Sun day evening at the McBurney Branch of the Young Men's Christian Association, 215 West 23d Street.

title: Nixon Offers a Plan To Prevent Crime By Nation's Youths
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP) President Nixon sent Con gress today a juvenile delin quency report urging a new national program strategy to deal with a rise in crime among the nation's young people.

title: METS BEAT CARDS FOR CITY CROWN
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 22  The New York Mets won their third straight game today and the St. Louis Cardinals lost their fifth straight when the Mets scratched out 21 decision in 10 innings.

title: Soviet Aid Said to Run $2Billion Yearly
description: Soviet military aid to Com munist and underdeveloped. countries amounted to more than $19billion in the years from 1955 to 1970, according to authoritative sources in the United States and Allied gov ernments.

title: HISTORIC SILVER STOLEN IN MIAMI
description: MIAMI, March 22  Three thieves invaded the Vizcaya Museum early today and made off with a valuable collection of historic silver.

title: Nixon Asks Disaster Fund
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (AP)President Nixon asked Congress today for $290mil lion in supplemental funds to cover the cost of relief to parts of the nation recently hit by major disasters, including the earthquake in Southern Cali fornia and storms in the Mid dle West and Gulf states.

title: Agnew Challenges C.B.S. To Let Him Edit Remarks
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew challenged the Columbia Broad casting System television net work today to allow him to edit personally his own critical remarks that will appear to morrow night following the re peat showing of the documen tary The Selling of the Pen tagon.

title: Dean Rusk: On the Presidency
description: These remarks by former Secretary of State Dean Rusk are excerpted from a conversation he held last month with Georgia broadcasters at the University of Georgia's School of Journalism. The conversations were broadcast by WSB in Atlanta; this is the second of two articles derived from the broadcast. Mr. Rush is now Professor of Interna tional Law at the University of Georgia.

title: VANDALISM DROPS IN CITY'S SCHOOLS
description: Vandalism in the city's schools, decreased by 10 per cent last year, reversing the upsurge of recent years, according to a report released yesterday by the Chancellor of Schools Har vey B. Scribner.

description: FREE PRESS/FREE PEOPLE. The beat Cause. By John Hohenberg 514 pages. Columbia University Press. $9.95.

title: TRIP TO THE MIDEAST BY ROGERS POSSIBLE
description: WASHINGTON, MARCH 22 (Reuters)  The State Depart ment today declined to rule out the possibility that Secretary of State William P. Rogers might visit Israel and Arab capitals next month.

title: RAILPAX SELECTS 21 TRAIN ROUTES, LINKING 114 CITIES
SUBURB INTEGRATION IS OPPOSED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 President Nixon said tonight that segregation in the nation's suburb was cauted by economic problems rather than racial problems and that, as long as this was true, the Government would not take steps to alter the situation.

description: WASHINGTQN, March 22 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Skidmore to Admit Men
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., March 22 (AP)Skidmore Col lege, with an exclusively fe male enrollment since its inception 60 years ago, will ad mitt male students beginning with the fall term.

title: U.S. Strikes Missile Bases
description: SAIGON, March 23  United States fighters and bombers struck at missile sites inside North Vietnam yesterday for the second consecutive day as South Vietnamese troops re treating from Laos continued to encounter heavy enemy as saults.

description: News Analysis

title: A WELFARE FAMILY GETS CITY HOUSING
description: Mr. and Mrs. Anibal Martinez and their six small children va cated three seedy rooms at the Kimberly Hotel yesterday and set up house in a freshly painted fiveroom apartment in the South Bronx.

title: Austria Negotiates Tariff Cuts
description: VIENNA, March 22Common Market negotiators have agreed to Austria's request for an acrosstheboard reciprocal tariff cut during the period be fore Vienqna's proposed per manent association with the European Economic Commu nity.

title: Advertising:
description: Ira Nerken is proving again that one lone person with the proper spark and, drive can get the ball rolling in this country.

title: Advertising:
description: Sears, Roebuck has guts. It will be bringing back that almostforgotten art forth, the live television commer cial, to give added believ ability to the claim that its Eager I lawnmower engine starts the first time almost every time.

title: Patriots Switch Again, Adding Regional Flavor
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 22The Bay State Patriots, who until five weeks ago were the Boston Patriots, be came the New England Pat riots today.

title: The Coast of Maine
description: The region around Maine's Penobscot Bay, one of the last strongholds of the independent Yankee farmer fisherman, is largely unspoiled land where wooded hills plunge to the rugged, granite shores of an islandstudded sea. The bay, Robert P. T. Coffin once wrote, has a loveliness as fresh as the morning of Creation.

title: Welfare Ruling Is Accepted
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., March 22 (AP)Gov. D. N. (Mike) O'Callaghan said today that the state would comply scrupu lously with a Federal court order to return 3,000 women and children to the welfare rolls, but would attempt to cut them off the rolls again after hearings. Nevada dropped the recipients in January, contend ing that an investigation showed widespread cheating. A Federal District Court or dered the state last Friday to reinstate all 3,000 with back payments.

title: Texas Cuts Welfare Grant
description: AUSTIN, Tex., March 22 (AP)  The Texas Public Welfare Board ordered today a one third reduction in aid to fami lies with dependent children, effective, May 1. The cut will drop the average family grant from $118 to $80 a month for more than 351,425 Texans.

title: WIMBLEDON RAISES EXPENSE PAYMENTS
description: WIMBLEDON, England, March 22(AP)The AllEngland Ten nis Club reduced prize money for the Wimbledon tournament today, but said it would pay large travel expenses to the stars competing.

title: GAF Suit Against Milsteins Is Dismissed by U.S. Judge
