description: GAF Suit Against Milsteins Is Dismissed by U.S. JudgeA Federal judge dismissed yesterday a complaint by the GAF Corporation seeking to en join members of the. Milstein family from acquiring stock or proxies in a struggle to control the company.

title: Diplomat in Fatigues George McMurtrie Godley
description: Man in the New

title: SST: The Prototype Fallacy
description: Under pressure of repeated defeats in the Senate last December and in the House last week, the Nixon Admin istration and other advocates of the supersonic transport have retreated to what they hope is a defensible position. As the Senate prepares to cast what could be the final vote on this question tomorrow, SST advocates are con tending that nothing more is at stake than the building of two SST prototypes. Surely, they argue, there cannot be any harm in going ahead with a couple of test models to obtain research data on disputed issues.

title: HANOI AIDE TERMS RETREAT BLOCKED
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, March 22 (Agence France Presse)A highranking North Vietnamese officer wrote today that the South Vietnamese forces were in the midst of a bloody retreat, but that it was too late for the bulk of their troops to escape from southern Laos.

title: U.S. Forces Reduced To 312,900 in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 22 (AP)The United States Command said today that American troop strength in South Vietnam had dropped to 312,900 men by last Thursday, a decrease of 4,400 from the previous week.

title: More Can Afford Domestic Help . . . Fewer Can Afford to Do It
description: WASHINGTONYou just can't get good help like you used to, a Louisville matron complained. You have to stand over them all the time. And they won't do any hard work like scrubbing floors with a rag and soap.

title: Yes, Mr. Ruddy, There Is a...
description: To imply that any ethnic, national or racial group is particularly prone to criminal or antisocial deeds despicable. It is alsoas the melting pot of crime America showssimply not supportable by facts.

title: Planners Approve City Trailer Parks For the Homeless
description: The use of trailers as tem porary relocation homes was approved yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: Western Union Sells Stock To Help Buy TWX Service
description: The Western Union Corpora tion raised an indicated $48.5 million yesterday through the sale of 1 million shares of com mon stock priced by a Kuhn, Loeb & Co. underwriting group at $48.50.

title: PAUL B. OWEN, 79, A FORMER BANKER
description: Paul Barry Owen, a retired banking and real estate execu tive, died Sunday after a sud den illness at his home, 123 East 37th Street. He was 79 years old.

title: Duke, N. Carolina Gain in N.I.T.
description: Duke and North Carolina, members of the Atlantic Coast Conference, advanced last night to the semifinal round of the National Invitation Tournament tduring a basketball triplehead er at Madison Square Garden watched by 12,347 fans.

title: SEASON'S SPECIALS ARE LISTED BY C.B.S.
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System continued yesterday to announce program plans for next fall. The latest announce ment covered special shows.

title: Truck Hijacked in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, March 22  A tractor trailer traveling from New York City to Baltimore with 37,604 pounds of beef val ued at $45,000 was hijacked early today in Baltimore County by five men who held the driver and his wife captive for three hours. Frank Runions, 30 years old, and his wife, Rita, 25, of Kansas City, Kans., owners of the rig, were released unharmed about 6:30 A.M. in East Balti more. The cabs of the trac?? trailer was recovered on the same street where the couple was released, The police are searching for the trailer.

title: RATES GO LOWER IN BOND MARKETS
description: The credit markets moved confidently toward still lower interest rates yesterday as in vestment bankers set the terms on more than $1.1billion of bonds scheduled for sale today.

title: Upstate G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, March 22 (UPI)The Defense Department said today that Pfc. James L. Randall of Addison, N. V., of the Army, had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: 10 Students Seized at Rally
description: DEKALB, Ill., March 22 (AP) The security police at North ern Illinois University arrested 10 students on trespassing charges today after they had taken part in a rally to protest against the destruction of a threeacre arboretum to make way for a new psychology building. The demonstrators had asked that the new build ing be constructed on a park ing lot.

title: A. HUGH FORSTER
description: LANCASTER, Pa., March 22 A. Hugh Forster, assistant vice president for public rela tions of Armstrong Cork Com pany and a vice president of the United States Chamber of Commerce, died yesterday after a brief illness. He was 54 years old.

title: DEBT EASING SOUGHT BY LEVINTOWNSEND
description: The financially troubled Levin Townsend Computer Corpora tion said yesterday it is seek ing the approval of some len?? ers to ease debenture restrie tions so that the company can be more flexible in reducing its heavy debt load.

title: Alioto Assails Indictment
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 23 (AP)Mr. Alioto called the in dictment contrived and a 14 karat fake upon his arrival here tonight from Washington, where he testified before Sen ate committees on Federal rev enue sharing.

title: PUSH CUT SHORT, PENTAGON ADMITS
description: WASHINGTON, March 23  The Defense Department ac knowledged today that South Vietnamese troops might have stayed longer in Laos if the Communists had not reacted as strongly as they did to the attacks on their vital supply line.

title: Theater: Cuckoo's Nest 63 Play About Insanity Revived Downtown
description: Dale Wasserman's play, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, was first given in 1963 on Broadway, where as a flier it, proved a lame duck. It has now been revived, and I understand in part rewrit ten. Last night it opened at the MercerHansberry Theater.

title: Choice Welcomed in Dublin
description: DUBLIN, March 23Brian Faulkner's election as Prime Minister of Northern Ireland was well received here today.

title: Hoffa Files a New Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)James R. Hoffa, the im prisoned president of the Inter national Brotherhood of Team sters, has filed a new appeal with the Supreme Court in an effort to upset his jurytamper ing conviction, for which he is serving an eightyear sentence. The central allegation in the appeal is that Ewing King, a codefendant, was the subject of illegal electronic eavesdrop ping.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaWhen the in domitable Bolivar first freed this great country from Spain it included, in ad dition to Colombia, Venezuela, Ecuador and Panama. The famous Liberator settled into what is still the presiden tial palace, a jewel of eighteenthcen tury Spanish architecture that even now delightedly maintains the bedroom from which Bolivar escaped wouldbe assassins while his mistress held them at bay.

title: Hawks Match Up Well With Knicks in Playoffs
description: The Atlanta Hawks are the first obstacle on the path the New York Knickerbockers must traverse to win a sec ond straight National Basket ball Association title. And it could be a big obstacle.

title: Arabs Plan to Widen Petroleum Role
description: The Arab nations intend to move from being just producers of oil to participation in the entire spectrum of the world petroleum industry, A. M. Su hail Sadawi, Secretary General of the Organization of Arab Petroleum Exporting Countries, said yesterday.

title: PERMIT GRANTED FOR PARK SUBWAY
description: A permit requiring exten sive protections and valuable compensations for Central Park was granted yesterday to the Transit Authority for the construction of new Queens Manhattan subway lines in the southern end of Central Park.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gambucci Scores. 2 Goals, but U.S. Loses to Finn Six
description: BERNE, March 23 (AP)  Finland scored the first four goals and downed the United States, 74, today in the world ice hockey championship. Gary Gambucci scored two goals for the Americans.

title: Commercial Wins Award
description: LOS ANGELES, March 23 (UPI)The Alka Seltzer commercial featuring the phrase Mama Mia, datsa somma spicy meatball took top honors to night at the 11th annual Inter national Broadcasting Award ceremonies.

title: JEWS IN MOSCOW DENOUNCE ISRAEL
description: MOSCOW, March 23The heads of some 60 Jewish con gregations from all over the Soviet Union met in the Mos cow Synagogue today to de nounce the Israeli Government and Zionism.

title: The Alaskan Pipeline Is Essential
description: ANCHORAGEI cherish Alaska's beauty. I call it Alaska's resource of the heart and soul, I would not give the pipeline project my support if I were not convincedby facts rather than emotionthat it can be built without harming this beauty. The key lies with the Government, and its de termination to meet its responsibilities to John Q. Citizen.

title: Justice Dept. Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (UPI)  Powell A. Moore, for mer press secretary for the late Senator Richard B. Russell, Democrat of Georgia, was named today as a deputy direc tor of public information for the Justice Department.

title: Gains for Laotians Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 23 (UPI)Laotian troops supported by artillery and air strikes went on the offensive today and recaptured a position held by North Vietnamese forces five miles northeast of the royal capital of Luang Prabang, mili tary sources reported.

title: EAST PAKISTANIS UNVEIL NEW RAG
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 23 The President of Pakistan, who has spent eight days in the eastern wing of his country under heavy protection, came out of his walled compound for the first time today for heavily protected drive to the military cantonment on the edge of the city.

title: Yanks Bow to White Sox, 43;
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 23 Tom Egan, a thirdstring catcher with a career major league batting average of .194, accumulated four extrabase hits today to lead the Chicago White Sox to a 43 victory over the New York Yankees. Eagan's fourth hit, a double to rightcenter field in the eighth inning, was converted into the winning run when, with two out, Tom McCraw, a pinchhitter, singled him across.

title: senate Votes Today on SST
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 senate opponents of the super sonic transport airliner ap peared today to hold a narrow advantage. A vote will be held tomorrow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Opera: Belfagor Makes a U. S. Debut
description: What is good and bad in Respighi's music is good and bad in his opera Belfagor, which was given its American premiere, in concert form, by the Opera Orchestra of New York in Tully Hall on Monday night. The composer's gift for highly colored, sensual or chestral effects and his abil ity to write equally sensual vocal lines make this work luscious to hear. The ear is never assaulted; it is con stantly caressed by blandish ing sounds.

title: NEUMANN SIGNED BY MEMPHIS PROS
description: Johnny Neumann of the Uni versity of Mississippi, a sopho more who was the leading scor er in college basketball this sea son, signed yesterday with the Memphis Pros of the American Basketball Association. Neu mann, a 6foot6inch guard, averaged 40 points a game.

title: WILLIAM AISENBERG OF STORE CHAIN, 67
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., March 23  William D. Aisenberg, who had lived here since his retirement in 1969 as vice presi dent of the apparel divisions of Allied Stores Marketing Cor poration, died yesterday in Lawrence and Memorial Hos pitals after a short illness. He was 67 years old.

title: Campus Disorders Assailed in Report
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (UPI)The Senate Government Operations Committee said to day that if disorder, riotous conduct and violence by students were carried repeatedly to the extremes which the na tion has seen during the past several years, they will eventu ally destroy many of our major educational institutions.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, March 23Scene The library of the White House. The President and Howard K. Smith of A.B.C. talking before the TV cameras sitting under a portrait of General Washington.

title: Perot Again Helps Bolster duPont Brokerage Firm
description: F. I. duPont, Glore Forgan & Co., one of the nation's largest brokerage firms, has been rescued from the brink of collapse once again through another refinancing involving H. Ross Perot, the Texas com puter millionaire.

title: Mayors, Angry at Democrats, Amicable With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The nation's mayors ended a threeday conference on the urban fiscal crisis today, angry at their old friends, the Demo crats in Congress, and on sur prisingly friendly terms with the man they had most severely criticized, President Nixon.

title: RAILROADS GIVEN FREIGHTRATERISE
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Eastern and Western railroads were told today by the Inter state Commerce Commission twit they could raise their freight rates by another 3.8 per cent on 15 days' notice. The new tariffs, with certain re strictions placed by the I.C.C. on selected commodities, would gross the roads about another $300million annually.

title: Scribner Promises Action To Curb School Violence
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner yesterday promised a tightening up of school securi ty in an effort to curb violence by intruders and disruptive stu dents.

title: Advertising:
description: In a half a dozen cities around the country yester day American Airlines people attended pep rallies to intro duce them to a new look and the new advertising promot ing it.

title: Japan Puts Three Followers of Mishima on Trial for Murder by Request
description: TOKYO, March 23  Three youthful followers of the novel ist Yukio Mishima went on trial here today on five charges including the unusual one of murder by requestin con nection with his ritual suicide last November.

title: White House. Bomb Threat
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (UPI)  Secret Service agents searched the White House to day after a man teephoned a bomb threat to its main switch board. No bomb was found.

title: Aurelio's Anger Pleasing to Lindsay
description: I'd like to see you when you really get angry, Mayor Lindsay said appreciatively over the telephone yesterday to his No. 1 deputy, Richard R. Aurelio.

title: Labor Aides Begin Course
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)  The first class of 28 compliance officers under the new Federal job, health and safety law entered training school today, the Labor De partment said.

title: Books of The Times
description: ANGLE OF REPOSE. By Wallace Stegner. 569 pages. Doubleday. $7.95.

title: Bridge:
description: The American Contract Bridge League's spring na tionals in Atlanta last week were the second biggest such championships ever held. Dur the 10 days, 9,706 tables were in play, a figure topped only by the spring event in New York in 1968, when there were 13,538 tables.

title: Textile Exhibit Is Not OneMan Show
description: His name may not be known to the man on the street, but in the furnishings world, Jack Lenor Larsen is an undisputed leader, possi bly the most copied textile de signer and weaver at work today.

title: Herbert Schutz Weds Mrs. Black
description: WILTON, Conn., March 23  Mrs. Suzanne Cameron Black, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Allen Cameron of Green wich, was married hero yes terday to Herbert Dietrich Schutz, a vice president of Time Inc., and president of its subsidiary, the New York Graphic Society, Ltd. Justice of the Peace Robert J. Mills performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's home.

title: ARMOR QUITS LAOS WITH HEAVY LOSS; 5,000 STILL THERE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, March 24  A South Vietnamese armored force of 100 tanks and heavy tracked vehicles fought its way out of Laos yesterday.

title: North Vietnam Disputes Nixon
description: PARIS, March 23 (AP)  North Vietnam, contesting Presi dent Nixon's assessment of the Laos incursion, said today that it had completely failed.

title: Market Place: What Portends Troubled Cities?
description: Think about it. The na tion's major cities are in deep trouble. Their plight arises out of soaring costs partly due to the unusual degree of inflation in recent years.

title: OFFICERS REALIGNED BY. BURLINGTON LINE
description: A realignment of the top management of Burlington Northern, Inc., a rumor for several months, was implement ed yesterday.

title: MISSISSIPPI BLACKS TO TEST VOTE RULE
description: JACKSON, Miss., March 23 Negro leaders, contending that white officials are once again trying to disfranchise Negroes in Mississippi, are pteparing to go into Federal court to chal lenge voter reregistration plans in 24 Misaissippi counties as be ing a ruse to reduce the num ber of Negro voters this year.

title: Too Few lien, Soviet Town Laments
description: MOSCOW, March 23Tchai kovsky is a new Soviet indus trial town dominated by women, and seven of the heavily out numbered men have addressed a Plea to Soviet planners to right the imbalance.

title: A People Mover Being Considered To Link Subways
description: Private and Government agencies are looking into the possibility of building a people mover around the periphery of lower Manhattan to improve transportation in the area, city planning official said yesterday.

title: Rise in Imports by Japan Is Seen by Envoy to U.S.
description: Japan will offer more of an import market and less of an export threat for other nations in coming years, according to Nobuhiko Ushiba, the Japanese Ambassador to the United States.

title: Appeals Court Dismisses Medina Suit Against Time
description: BOSTON, March 23 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit affirmed today a lower court ruling dismissing a $2million libel suit filed by Capt. Ernest L. Medina against the publish ers of Time magazine.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Every President's economic policy has five major goals: full employment, price stability, higher living standards, pre venting trouble for the United States dollar internationally and winning elections, Because the fifth goal is the wild card in the deck, Presidents tend to be more flexible than econo, mists about both the ends and the means of econom ic policy. It was the late Prof. Jo seph A. Schum peter of Harvard, writing of the scholastics of the 13th cen tury, who said, Professors are men who are constitutionally unable to conceive that the other fellow might be right, and then added, This holds for all times and places. But service within or close to the White House tends to make even professors of economics more flexible.

title: Seattle Paper Raises Price
description: SEATTLE, March 23 (AP) The Seattle Times announced today that the cost of its Sun day issue would go up to 35 cents a copy on April 1 from 25 cents. The price of the daily Times will remain at 10 cents.

title: GREEK PARTY CHIEFS ASSAIL GOVERNMENT
description: ATHENS, March 23Leaders of Greece's two largest banned political parties joined for the first time today in a statement denouncing the military regime, which seized power here April 21, 1967.

title: Immunization is Reported In Serum Hepatitis Tests
description: Researchers at New York University Medical Center re ported yesterday that they had apparently succeeded in immu nizing a small group of chil dren against serum hepatitis in a series of continuing ex periments.

title: PROS BEAT NETS, END LOSS STREAK
description: MEMPHIS, March 23 (AP) The Memphis Pros, with six players in double figures, snapped a threegame losing streak with a 117110 American Basketball Association victory over the New York Nets tonight.

title: Shift in Court Control Asked in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 23  The Joint Legislative Committee on Crime introduced bills today to create a Department of Judi cial administration to manage the state's criminal and civil Courts.

title: MONETARY RESERVES SLIPPED LAST MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 United States international monetary reserves declined by $165million in February, almost entirely in the component of foreign currencies, the Treas ury Department reported to day.

title: URUGUAY AN OFFICIAL IS FREED BY REBELS
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 23 (Reuters)  Urban guerrillas freed the Uruguayan Attorney General, Guido Berro Oribe, tonight, two weeks after kidnapping him for a short chat.

title: Progress Against Hepatitis
description: The rising incidence of illness and death from serum hepatitis in recent years has been a cause of growing concern, especially as the disease is usually transmitted through blood transfusions or infected needles. The re port yesterday by Dr. Saul Krugman of New York Uni versity that he and his colleagues have apparently demonstrated two means of immunizing patients against the disease, is highly encouraging. Dr. Krugman was properly cautious in his announcement, but the pos sibility of an effective vaccine against serum hepatitis now appears brighter than ever before.

title: Ending Eximbank Curbs Backed by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, March 23The Senate Banking Com mittee voted today to remove the lending operations of the ExportImport Bank from all budgetary ceilings and also approved repeal of the pres ent limitation of the bank's lending in Eastern European countries.

title: MRS. RALPH S. BUTLER
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., March 23  Mrs. Eleanor Danaher Butler, the widow of Ralph Starr Butler, a former vice president of General Foods Cor poration, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital. She was 84 years old and lived at 52 Mid land Avenue. Her husband died on Saturday at the age of 88.

title: It Wouldn't Be Sebring Without the Confusion
description: About Motor Sports

title: Kinney Services And Starrett
description: Kinney Services, Inc., said it has completed its investment in Starrett Brothers & Eken, Inc., and in a wholly owned sub sidiary of Starrett engaged in the modular housing construc tion field.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 23, 1971

title: New Argentine Junta Hints at Elections
description: BUENOS AIRES March 23 The three commanders of the Argentine armed forces as sumed control of the Govern ment as a junta today after deposing Gen. Roberto Marcelo Levingston as President.

title: Canucks Beat Blues, 41
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, March 23 (UPI)  Strong goaltending by George Gardener and two powerplay goals by Andre Bourias paced the Van couver Canucks to a 41 victory over the St. Louis Blues to night.

title: 2,000 Protest MitchellLama Rents
description: ALBANY, March 23More than 2,000 residents of mod erateincome housing in New York City called upon legisla tors here today to enact legis lation that would keep rents and housing costs within limits they could afford.

title: MANTA CAPTURES SANTA ANITA RACE
description: ARCADIA, Calif. March 23 (UPI)Elmendorf Farm's Man ta strengthened her bid for na tional honors today. The 5 yearold mare carried 128 pounds to a threelength vic tory in the $65,700 Santa Bar bara Handicap at Santa Anita.

title: Legislature. Approves Silent School Prayers
description: A bill to permit a brief pe riod of silent prayer or re flection in public schools at the beginning of each school day was passed by the State Senate, 39 to 14, and sent to the Governor.

title: Metropolitan to Show Soviet Children's Art
description: Fifty paintings by Soviet children from 5 to 14 years old, will be exhibited in the Junior Museum Studio of the Metropolitan Museum of Art from April 1 through May 9.

title: TV: Dropout and His Family In Search of Ameika
description: Some may tall it the drop out culture. Some may call it the new consciousness: Whatever the label, if it's salable it will make it to the mass Media.

title: G.O.P. BLOCKS BILL ON CAMPAIGN COST
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Republicans moved on several fronts today to counter Demo cratic pressure for speedy ap proval of legislation to limiting spending in political campaigns.

title: Saul Says the Amex Plans No Merger
description: Ralph S. Saul, outgoing presi dent of the American Stock Ex change, told the exchange's members at its annual meeting yesterday that in response to questions, he again wanted to make it clear that the Amex and the New York Stock Ex change are definitely not con sidering merging, but only con solidating certain facilities to better serve the public and their memberships.

title: NORTH STARS GAIN WEST PLAYOFFS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., March 23 (AP)The Minnesota North Stars clinched a West Division playoff berth in the National Hockey League tonight with a 31 victory over the Los Ange les Kings.

title: Rockefeller, and Leaders Meet on Budget Impasse
description: ALBANY, March 23  Gov ernor Rockefeller and Republi can legislative leaders net four hours today in an attempt to resolve an impasse over Governor's $8.45billion budget.

title: JANET WOOD CARSE, FILM STORY EDITOR
description: Mrs. Janet. Wood Carse, the widow of Robert Carse, a mer chant mariner who was also a writer, died of cancer Mon day in the DeWitt Nursing Home, 211 East 79th Street. She was 66 years old, Her hus band died on Jan. 14 of a heart attack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gardner Dropped By Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 23 (AP)  Jack Gardner, head basketball coach at the Univer sity of Utah for the past 18 years, was dismissed today by Ithe school's athletic board. His wonlost record at Utah was 339154, but he failed to win the Western Athletic Confer ence title in the last five years.

title: Faulkner Easily Defeats Protestant Rightist and Wins Prime Ministry in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, March 23  Brian Faulkner, Protestant moderate, easily de feated a militant rival today to become the sixth Prime Minister of Northern Ireland.

title: Ballot Proposal to Aid Blacks Loses in Carolina Referendum
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., March 23 The business community that has dominated Charlotte with out serious challenge for decades has suffered a serious setback because it offered to open the local political system to greater participation by blacks.

title: Wilds of Alaska Home for a Few '59ers
description: CACHE CREEK, Alaska,  During the first winter Carol Sik had to melt snow to wash diapers. That might have been the low point But almost 12 years later, the Siks are still here They have survived.

title: Prices on Amex Decline Slightly As Trading Activity Rises a Bit
description: Most issues finished lower on the American Stock Exchange yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Downtown Scene: Wilmarth's Glass
description: The work of Chris. Wil marth at the Paula Cooper Gallery, 96 Prince Street, is defined as glass sculpture. Although the definition may be applicable for practical and categorical purposes, the sculpture is still closer in feeling and conception to spatial drawing in glass. Its manipulation of space as a sculptural object is more suggestive than factual. But what Mr. Wilmarth does with his drawing in glass re sults in configurations that are elegant and graceful.

title: Restaurants in Italy to Shut Today in Tax Protest
description: ROME, March 23The new travel season's first tourists, already numerous, were warned today that they would have a hard time getting a cup of cof fee or a meal tomorrow.

title: Guns Kill
description: A policeman is seriously injured in a gunfight that apparently started as part of a family argument. A deranged sniper fires at passing traffic. A 16yearold boy attempts to hijack an airliner at gun point.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE DOWNWARD DRIFT
description: Stock prices slipped a bit further yesterday as the second trading day of spring continued Monday's lackadaisical move ment.

title: Mellon Fund Aids 16 Colleges
description: Charles S. Hamilton Jr., pres ident of the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, yesterday an nounced the award of $200,000 in faculty support grants to each of 16 private, independent liberal arts colleges. The awards may he used for salary in creases, additions to faculties and paid release time as de termined by the colleges, but may not be used for endow ment.

title: 146 CALLED SO FAR BY KNAPP PANEL
description: The Knapp Commission, which is investigating allega tions of corruption in the Police Department, reported yesterday that it had subpoenaed 146 per sons so far to testify in closed door sessions.

title: New Orleans Selected As 72 Super Bowl Site
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., March 23With an assist from the Society of AirConditioning and Refrigeration Engineers, New Orleans was selected today as the site for next season's Super Bowl game.

title: Title Bout Is Postponed
description: TURIN, Italy, March 23 (AP) The middleweight title bout between the champion, Carlos Monzon of Argentina, and Nino Benvenuti of Italy was post poned to May 8, today by the promoter, Rodolfo Sabbatini. It had been scheduled for April 17. It was reported that Sab batini made the postponement to give Benvenuti more time to train following his defeat last week by Roberto Chirino.

title: Retreat From Laos ...
description: The precipitate withdrawal of South Vietnamese troops from Laos well before the anticipated arrival of the mon soon may not represent the humiliating rout that is sug gested by fragmentary reports from the combat zone. But it is painfully clear, despite persisting efforts Washington and Saigon to put the best possible face on a bad situation, that the Laotian operation has fallen far short of the expectations of American and South Viet namese military planners.

title: Steve Hamilton to Giants
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., March 23 (AP)The San Francisco Giants acquired Steve Hamil ton, former New York Yankee lefthanded relief pitcher in a trade that sent an infielder, Steve Huntz, to the Chicago White Sox today.

title: Sinatra Bows Out Of Show Business After 3 Decades
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., March 23 (UPI)Frank Sinatra an nounced today that he was re tiring from show business.

title: RareStamp Auction Nets $700,690 Here
description: A letter carried by Pony Express in 1860, its envelope bearing the Wells Fargo adhesive stamp and a 1918 airmail stamp on which the airplane was printed flying upside down were among 261 lots of rare stamps that brought a total of $700,690 at auction here last night.

title: Allott Doubts That Budget Aide Will Be Named to Interior Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 A key Republican Senator said today that he did not believe President Nixon's chosen candi date would be nominated to the important post of Under Secretary of the Interior.

title: Michael Field,Food Writer,Dies;Once Duo Pianist
description: Michael Field, the prolific food writer and critic and for mer member of the duopiano team of Appleton and Field, died Monday night of mas sive heart attack, Mr. Field, who was 56 years old, was stricken at his home, 17 East 96th Street.

title: Army Engineers Would Be Shifted Under Nixon Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Army Corps of Engineers would be transferred to the pro posed Department of Natural, Resources under an executive reorganization bill that will be released by the White House on Thursday, Nixon Administration sources said today.

title: Easter Seals Bring Hope
description: It had been a long hard Struggle, but Betsy, 7 years old, was finally ready for braces. She had to learn what to do with them. Every week the Easter Seal therapist arrived to show her mother how to put the braces on and how to help Betsy learn to stand. It took time and patience, but Betsy was and to learn. By Christmas, she was able to stand alone for several hours. By next Christmas, it is hoped that Betsy will be  walking with the help of crutches. It takes courage, ;but it, also takes the skilled, knowhow that Easter Seals provide. Contributions may be sent in care of your postmaster.

title: Justice Official Outlines Rights Compliance Policy
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)Assistant Attorney Gen eral Jerris Leonard said today that he regarded as a last al ternative a cutoff of Federal grants to state and local law enforcement agencies because of discriminatory employment practices.

title: Moscow and Peking Plan to Triple Trade After New Low in 1970
description: MOSCOW, March 23  The Soviet Union announced today, that its foreign trade with Com munist China fell to a new low last year but that the two countries had agreed to triple their trade this year, appar ently as part of an effort to have more normal governmen tal relations.

title: Rites for Malcom on Friday.
description: A funeral service for Donald C. Malcom, a retired interna tional merchant banker, will be held on Friday at Trinity Church, Newport, R. I. An item in The New York Times on March 20 referred to him as retired manufacturer. Mr. Mal com, who was 78 years old, died at the American Hospital in Neuilly, Frante, on March 5.

title: Hunt Show Has 50 Sculptures, Drawings and Prints
description: At the age of 35, Richard Hunt can look back on an astonishingly productive and successful career as both a sculptor and graphic artist. The retrospective exhibition of his work opening tomor row at the Museum of Mod ern Art contains about 50 sculptures and a selection of drawings and prints dating from 1956.

title: Stars Tie for First
description: SALT LAKE CITY, March 23 (AP)Wi11ie Wise scored 28 points in leading the Utah Stars to a 124117 victory over the Denver Rockets tonight, en abling the stars to gain a firstplace tie with the Indiana Pacers in the Western Division.

title: Admiral Ends Color Tubes
description: The Admiral Corporation said yesterday that it planned to halt production of color tele vision picture tubes effective Friday. Last month the com pany said it was holding dis cussions with the RCA Corpo ration over the possible sale of its color tube production equipment to RCA. It said yes terday that these discussions are continuing.

title: Judge Lets Penn Central Lease 1,000 New Boxcars
description: Federal Judge John P. Fullam yesterday granted approval to the Penn Central Transporta tion Company to lease 1,000 new boxcars from a subsidiary of ACF Industries, Inc. The cost of the 20year lease is estimated at $32million.

title: Coast College to Be Coed
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., March 23 (UPI)Dominican College of San Rafael, a fouryear liberal arts school for women for 80 years, will become coeduca tional this fall, Sister Samuel Conlan, president of the college, announced today.

title: Pillsbury Recalls Cereal; Boxes May Contain Glass
description: GREENFIELD, Mass., March 23 (AP)The Pillsbury Com pany has ordered the recall of packages of, farina cereal be cause they may contain par ticles of glass.

title: I.O.S. PLANS A SHIFT IN MANAGING FUNDS
description: GENEVA, March 23  In vestors Overseas Services an nounced today that it planned to shift its mutual fund manage ment from the parent company, I.O.S., Ltd., to a subsidiary, 10.S. Management, Ltd.

title: Executive Changes
description: Stanley Kohlenberg has been appointed president of Coty U.S., reporting to Thomas M. Cooney, vice president of consumer products operations for Pfizer, Inc.

title: HIGH COURT CURBS POLLUTION CASES
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Supreme Court declared to day that it lacked the time and the expertise to play a ma jor role in antinollution litiga tion.The 8to1 ruling served notice that the Court would not exercise the original juris diction conferred upon it by the Constitution to give states a forum to attack water and air pollution that crosses state and national boundaries. Article III gives the high court juris diction over controversies be tween states and citizens of other states and countries.The Court suggested that Ohio file the suit in its own state courts. Later in the day, William J. Brown, Attorney General of Ohio, said that he would do so. The defendants are the Dow Chemical Com pany and its Canadian subsidi ary, plus the Wyandotte Chem icals Corporation.

title: Technicon Names President
description: William J. Smythe, has been named president of the Techni eon Corporation.

title: Ban on SealKilling Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)  Legislation to prohibit the killing of seals and other ocean mammals and ban the import of their skins into the United States was introduced in Congress today by Senator Fred R. Harris, Democrat of Oklahoma and Representative David H. Pryor, Democrat of Arkansas.

title: New Look for Interior
description: Rogers C. B. Morton, the new Secretary of the Interior, has set out to get a firmer administrative grip on his huge department. The planned appointment as Under Secretary of Dr. James R. Schlesinger, an expert on systems analysis, and of two new Assistant Secretaries with broad administrative, responsibilities should strengthen Mr. Morton's control. The choice of an Under Secretary is particularly significant in the light of the Nixon Administration's peculiar treatment of this office.

title: ParochialSchool Plan Gets Laconic Support
description: ALBANY, March 23The daily opening prayer in the State Assembly was offered today by a Roman Catholic priest who wore a large cir cular tag indicating his sup port for tuition aid to parents of parochialschool students.

title: Orthodox Jews' Center Grows in North England
description: GATESHEAD, England, March 4  The Hebrew chants begin shortly after dawn on Bewick Road, a meandering lane of old red brick houses in this northern industrial community.

title: ROCKRELLER URGES GREATERLENIENCY IN MARIJUANA LAW
description: ALBANY, March 23Gover nor Rockefeller proposed sub stantial reductions in state penalties for marijuana of fenses today, including drop ping the criminal stigma for minor first offenses.

title: EXTENSION IS BACKED ON EQUALIZATION TAX
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)  The Senate Finance Committee approved today a twoyear extension of the in terestequalization tax sought by the Administration to help hold down the United States in ternational balance  of  pay ments deficit.

title: GALLEY ATTORNEY CRITICIZES JURORS
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 23The chief defense lawyer for First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. complained at a hear ing today that the jury of six officers seemed more interested in wining and dining than in reaching a verdict.

title: MITCHELL ISSUES PLEA ON F.B.I. FILES
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Attorney General John N. Mitchell issued an urgent plea to the press today not to pub lish information from files stolen earlier this month from the Federal Bureau of Investi gation's office in Media, Pa.

title: TV's to Drop Mafia and Cosa Nostra From Its Scripts
description: The words Mafia and Cosa Nostra will not be heard on the American Broadcasting Company's television series The F.B.I. when that pro gram begins its new season in September, the ItalianAmer ican Civil Rights League said yesterday.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SHOW INCREASE
description: Soybean and wheat futures prices advanced rather sharply shortly after the opening of trading on the Chicago Board of Wade yesterday but profit taking trimmed the gains be fore the session ended.

title: Amendment Is Expected to Clear Legislatures Before'72 Election
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The constitutional amendment to give 18yearolds the right to vote in all elections appears likely to win approval in enough state legislatures to take effect by, the 1972 elec tions.

title: Adoption Law: When Should a Mother Lose Rights to Her Child?
description: The magic number is 4225B. There are Other numbers being played, too: 6053, 6476 and 4452, but 4225B is given, the best odds for coming up in the legislative'roulette.

title: CON ED WORKERS ACCEPT CONTRACT
description: Consolidated Edison workers have voted overwhelmingly to accept a new contract provid ing for a 10 per cent general pay increase the first year and an additional 8 per cent the seoond year.

title: Sierra Leone Army Puts Down a Coup
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone March 23 (AP)  Senior army officers arrested their com mander in this West African nation tonight, hours after he announced the seizure of power from the Prime Minister, Siaka P. Stevens. They told the na tion that they intended to keep Mr. Stevens in office.

title: ALIOTO INDICTED OVER SHARED FEE
description: SEATTLE, March 23Joseph L. Alioto, the Mayor of San Francisco, was indicted today under a Federal statute against interstate racketeering.

title: Georgia Tech Keying on Michigan Ace
description: John (Whack) Hyder, the Georgia Tech basketball coach, was not happy with the way his Engineers played in the first round of the National Invitation Tournament here Saturday night against La Salle, even though they won.

title: Rearing Set for Medina
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (Reuters)Pretria hearings in the courtmartial of Capt. Ern est Medina, charged with the premeditated murder of more than 100 South Vietnamese ci vilians at Mylai; will begin at Fort McPherson, Ga., on May 24, the Army announced today. Captain Medina was Lieutenant Galley's officer at the time of the alleged massacre.

title: Frazier to Stay in Hospital For Remainder of the Week
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 23 (AP)Joe Frazier will remain at St. Luke's Hospital for the rest of the week, according to Dr. James C. Giuffre, the hos pital's medical director.

title: News Analysis
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 23The allied thrust against Communist supply lines, now drawing to a close, may have achieved some limited military success and killed thousands of the enemy, but in political propaganda terms Hanoi seems to have won the day. In this situation, unlike the aftermath of last spring's joint American and South Vietnamese offensive against the Cambodian sanctuaries, the allies are com ing out looking like losers, whether they are or not.

title: Bill Would Exempt Newsmen
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (UPI)Senator James B. Pear son, Republican of Kansas, in treduced a bill today providing that newsmen not be required to disclose any confidential in formation to any court, grand jury, government agency or Congress.

title: 400to1 9 Vote Finishes Action in congress on Lowering of Age
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 A proposed constitutional amendment to lower the voting age to 18 in all elections cleared Congress today after little more than token oppo sition.

title: Lois Holland Callaway Picks Up Headache Pill
description: Glenbrook Laboratories has asked Lois Holland Cal laway to handle Vanquish, an analgesic that was backed last year by $4million in television advertising. The agency said O.K.

title: ...Increases the Credibility Gap
description: President Nixon's illdisguised criticism of press and television for their reporting of the Laotian campaign likely to benefit him as much as ancient Persian gen erals were benefitted by killing messengers who brought bad news.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 80,000PROTESTERS MARCH IN BELGIUM
description: BRUSSELS, March 23  Eighty thousand Western Euro pean farmers swarmed into Brussels today in a violent pro test demanding increased prices for their produce. Automobiles were burned, street signs torn up and windows broken.

title: Democrats Name Publisher
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (AP)John S. Dyson, publisher and defeated Congressional can didate from Millbrook, N. Y., was named today to a post on the policy council of the Na tional Democratic Committee.

title: J. M. DRYFOOS JOINS ABACUS FUND FIGHT
description: J. M. Dryfoos & Co., a mem ber of the New York Stock Ex change, jumped into the battle for control of the Abacus Fund, Inc., yesterday with the filing of a formal declaration with the Securities and Exchange Com mission that the firm supported Peter Sharp, a New York real estate man who wants to take the fund.

title: Theater: Ordeal of Pueblo's Captain
description: WASHINGTON  Stanley R. Greenbetg's new play, Pueblo, which is having its world premiere at the Arena Stage, has all the ingredients, necessary for exciting and provocative theater: A spy ship captured at sea, im prisonment, torture, confes sions, repudiations, Navy and Congressional hearings, con flicts between duty and morality, patriotism and sur vival.

title: Man in the News Ulster's Moderate Chief Arthur Brian Deane Faulkner
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, March 23As the sun streamed through the win dows of the Martyrs Memor ial Free Presbyterian Church Sunday, the Rev. Ian Paisley, the Protestant extremist, told his congregation that a vic tory for Brian Faulkner would be the worst thing that has ever happened to Ulster. In the Roman Catholic ghettos of Bel fast, dominated by the terrorists of the Irish Republican Army, memories stretch back a decade when Mr. Faulkner was calling the antiCatholic Orange Order the backbone of Ulster and declaring that the really divisive force in Ulster life was the Catholic church.

title: LONDON TO ADMIT FOREIGN BROKERS
description: LONDON, March 23 Bro kers from the United States and other countries are to be admitted as members of the London Stock Exchange for the first time.

title: The New Urban Witchcraft
description: Today the problems of urban so ciety must be reckoned with against a backdrop of a rapidly shifting, sur realistic urbanscape. We are forced to decide and to act in a bizarre arena a kind of theater of the unreal.

title: L. I. Man Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 (UPI)The Defense Department said today that Pfc. Francis M. Curry of Yaphank, LI, of the Army, was killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Works of Bearden and Hunt Are Displayed
description: This is the year of the black art show and, with a number of Institutions around the country already having recognized that fact, could the Museum of Modern Art be far behind? Certainly not. By way of proof, it currently doublebills the outhes of two wellknown AfroAmeri cans, the New York painter collagist Romero Bearden and the Chicago sculptor Richard Hunt. Both shows open tomorrow.

title: Blazers Win Finale,114112; Petrie Passes 2,000 Mark
description: CLEVELAND, March 23 (UPI) Geoff Petrie's 37 points led the Portland Trail Blazers to a 114112 victory over the Cleve land Cavaliers tonight in the final National Basketball Asso ciation game of the season.

title: Szymanski Quitting Drexel
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 23 (AP)Frank Szymanski will leave his position as head bas ketball coach at Drexel Uni versity to become head basket ball coach and athletic director at the University of Baltimore. The appointment becomes effec tive Aug. 10.

title: Hazeltine Unit Asks Court To Rehear Zenith Case
description: The Hazeltine Corporation has advised its stockholders in a letter that its subsidiary, Hazeltine Research, Inc., filed on March 19 a petition for a rehearing in the United States Supreme Court of a Feb. 24 decision handed down by that court.

title: On Route 9, an Ambush Every Day
description: LANGVEI, South Vietnam, March 23The last four miles of Route 9, down which exultant South Viet namese troops moved unop posed to the Laotian border six weeks ago, have become a daily ordeal for the Amer ican tank crews that are covering, their retreat under heavy fire.

title: News Analysis
description: A disappointing showing by President Nixon in the New York audience popular ity ratings and a flap over granting equal time to Wil liam Magruder. Director of Supersonic Transport Devel opment for the Department of Defense, enlivened yester day's business hours for theEqual Time DemandedLawyers Find Merit American Broad casting Company. The President, in an exclusive in terview Monday night with How ard K. Smith, attracted only an 11 per tent share of the available audience in the metropolitan area. The Chief Executive was statistically swamped by the National Broadcasting Company's new movie, Triple Play, which won a whopping 42 per cent share., The Columbia Broad casting System's comktitive attractions were Doris Day, who had a 25 per cent share, and Carol Burnett, who got 32 per cent.

title: MRS. DARLEY RANDALL
description: SYOSSET, L. I., March 23 Mrs. Grace Helen Talbot Ran dall, of Woodbury Road, wife of Parley Randall, a retired banker, died yesterday in Hunt ington Hospital after a brief ill ness, She was 69 years old, and with her husband lived also in St. Jeande Luz France, before and after World War II.

title: Beauty Of Upsate County Hides Poverty of Its Residents
description: KEENE, N. Y.  Roland Smith, who lives in an area beautiful enough to attract visitors from around the world, exists in the kind of poverty that most people as sociate with city slums.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rangers Win, Clinch Second
description: The remembrance of night mares, in which their team would nosedive just when it was ready to grab the brass ring, turned into beautiful thoughts for Ranger fans last, night at Madison Square, Garden.

title: N.F.L. Inquiry to Resume
description: CLEVELAND, March 23 (UPI) A Federal grand jury investi gation of the National Football League will resume here April 5.

title: Newsweek Picks EditorinChief For Company's President, Too
description: Osborn Elliott, the 46year old editorinchief of Newsweek magazine, was named yester day to the additional post of president and chief executive officer of Newsweek, Inc.

title: Text of the Proposal For 18YearOld Vote
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 Following is the text of the proposed 26th constitu tional amendment, sent by Congress to the state legis latures today, that would permit 18yearolds to. Vote in all elections:

title: SAMUEL GREENBERG
description: Samuel Greenberg, who headed the real estate invest ment and management com pany of that name, died Mon day at his home, 1035 Fifth Avenue, after a long illness. He was 74 years old.

title: Prague Prosecutor Seeks Stiffer Terms for Radicals
description: PRAGUE, March 23 (Reuters) The Prague district prosecu tor has appealed for stiffer jail terms for at least 13 of 16 young leftist radicals who were convicted of subversion Friday, informed sources said today.

title: INSKO GETS PICK IN PACING FINAL
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 23 Del Insko, having driven Red mond Lane and Tired to victory three times each in the local preliminaries of the Yonkers Roosevelt Hopeful Pacing Series elected to handle Redmond Lane in tomorrow night's $17,500 final of the competition for 3 yearolds. The race will be the fourth on the card at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: School Deadline Extended
description: BOSTON, March 23 (AP) The Massachusetts Board of Education today extended Springfield's deadline for sub mitting a shortrange plan to ease racial imbalance in its pub lic schools. Springfield, which originally was to submit a plan by April 1 or lose $5.4million in state school aid, now has un til May 18 to file a plan.

title: Third U.S.Soviet Session On Arms Is Held in Vienna
description: VIENNA, March 23United States and Soviet negotiators met, here today for the third time since they resumed their talks on the limitation of strategic nuclear arms last week, and again the session was devoted to a review of their positions.

title: 3 Narcotics Suspects Held; Tied to Big Ring in Bronx
description: Three men who the police said were members of a ring that supply almost all the heroin sold in the Bronx were arrested yesterday. The police said they seized four and a half pounds of pure heroin with street value of $1.5million.

title: Sports of The Times
description: BRADENTON, Fla., March 23All baseball managers have problems. They are as much a part of the job as is the parlor in their hotel suites or the front seat in the player bus or a private office in the clubhouse. Yet there are 23 somewhat envious bigleague managers who are absolutely convinced that Earl. Weaver, the manager of the world champion Baltimore Orioles, has no problems at all. That's manifestly ridiculous. Weaver is cursed by many problems. He admits as much with almost a straight face, manfully fighting back the merriment that bubbles within him. He has four regular outfielders. Having a fourth may be ac ceptable for bridge, but it becomes awkward in a game that normally calls for three outfielders at a time. How does he shoehorn them all in? It's a pitiful situation. A midwinter trade with San Diego brought Pat Dobson Baltimore and the big righthanded pitcher has the poten tial to become a 20game winner. Since the Orioles already have three 20garners in Dave McNally, Mike Cuellar and Jim Palmer, an instant difficulty becomes apparent. How does a manager manipulate four 20garners into a rota tion? The poor man! All his troubles seem geared along the same general lines, but Earl is bearing up nobly under so crushing a burden.

title: Laguna to Face Buchanan In Title Bout Here June 9
description: In the first world lightweight championship bout in New York in nearly four years, Ken Bu chanan of Scotland will defend his title against Ismael Laguna of Panama, a twotime cham pion, at Madison Square Gar den on Wednesday, June 9.

title: Canada Drops Plan To Buy Home Oil
description: OTTAWA, March 23The Government of Canada has sus pended, at least for the time being, its negotiations to buy the Home Oil Company, Ltd., of Calgary, Alberta, to keep it from falling into American con trol.

title: ARTHUR C. MOORE,
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J., March 23Arthur C. Moore, former president of the Keystone Sav ings and Loan Association and a member of the board of directors of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York, died yesterday at the Jersey Shore Medical Center in Neptune. His age was 68.

title: Farmers Feel Frustrated
description: PARIS, March 23The farm ers of Western: Europe have become angry and frustrated as they confront the problems of survival in an advanced in dustrial society.

title: Seale Witness Denies Hearing Talk of Plot Against Rackley
description: NEW HAVEN, March 23  Mrs. Margaret Hudgins, the pro secution's unwilling witness against Bobby G. Seale and Ericka Huggins, testified today that she never heard anyone agree to do anything to Alex Rackley  even though, as she testified earlier, she was at Black Panther headquarters here through most of the four day period preceding Rackley's death.

title: Brooklyn Boy Found Dead
description: A 15yearold Erasmus High School student was found dead behind the garage of his home yesterday. The boy, Charles Warton of 352 East 17th Street, Brooklyn, had been reported missing by his father, Louis, to the police on Sunday. The police believe that the youth may have fallen from the roof of the garage and have listed his death as accidental.

title: A King Helps a Mayor Capture Post Upstate
description: BOLIVAR, N. Y., March 23 (UPI)  James E. Dunn, a Democrat, won election as mayor of this Allegany Coun ty village last night by a king of spades.

title: OfficeBuilding Owners Open Private Drive to Clean Midtown Streets
description: Sidewalks (many have dis charged that responsibility by simply sweeping litter into gut ters), but the gutters them selves are the responsibility of the Sanitation Department.

title: DAVID STERN, HEAD OF CARLYLE. HOUSE
description: David I. Stern, president of the Carlyle House Corporation, died Monday at his home after a short illness. He was 79 years old and lived at 50. East 77th Street.

title: Brydges Calls for a study of Pensions
description: ALBANY, March 23Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges today order a spe cial legislative committee to de termine whether what he termed skyrocketing public employe retirement benefits should be regulated by a bipar tisan pension commission.

title: Ocean Hill Schools: Conflict Goes On
description: The sehools of Ocean Hill Brownsville, which sparked the citywide teachers' strike of 1968, are once again the scene of turmoil, violence and political struggle.

title: RATES ON BONDS CONTINUE TO FALL
The Last of the Red Hot Principals
description: Abraham H. Lass has re cently retired as the city's only ragtime movie pianist high school principal.

title: For Fall, Some Fashion Classics Are Revived
description: Remember the twin sweat er set? That old classic, the delight of suburbanites and college girls a: generation ago, is back in fashion. Halston has resurrected it.

title: Black Minister Wins Election As House Delegate for Capital
description: WASHINGTON, March 23 The Rev. Walter E. Fauntroy, a 37yearold Baptist clergy man who entered politics as an aide to the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., was elected today as the District of Colum bia's first nonvoting Congres sional delegate in a century.

title: State Senate Votes Silent Prayer Period in Schools
description: ALBANY, March 23  The State Senate gave final approv al today to a bill that permits a brief period of silent prayer or reflection in public schools at the beginning of each school day. The vote was 39 to 14.

title: Project on Hepatitis Research Is Now Praised by State Critic
description: A state Senator who has been one of the most outspok en critics of using retarded children in hepatitis research said yesterday he was now per suaded that the work was being properly conducted.

title: ItalianChinese Trade Parley
description: MILAN, Italy, March 23  The Italian Foreign Trade Min ister, Mario Zagari, said in the presence of Chinese Communist officials here today that Peking was considering switching from exchanges with individual Eu ropean countries to trading with the European Common Market as a bloc.

title: Thermal Pollution Ban Sought For Lake Michigan by Agency
description: CHICAGO, March 23  The Nixon Administration's new En vironmental Protection Agency called today for a new thermal pollution policy that would for bid nuclear power plants to dump heated water into Lake Michigan.

title: A.C.B.S. Rerun Adds AgnewLaird View
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System, caught in a contro versy over its documentary; The Selling of the Pentagon, showed the film again last night, adding the criticism or three Nixon Administration of heads and a defense of the film by the president of C.B.S. News.

title: NEW JUDGE NAMED FORDAVIS HEARING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 23 A 54yearold judge who was appointed to the bench by Gov. Ronald, Reagan in 1967 was selected today to hear pretrial proceedings, involving Angela Davis.

title: J. & L. Stockholder Sues Over TakeOver by LTV
description: Howard H. Perelman, a law yer who is a shareholder of the Jones & Laughlin Steel Corpo ration and has long been op posed to its takeover by Ling TemcoVought, Inc., filed a suit in the Federal District Court of Pittsburgh yesterday charging the steelmaker with violations of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

title: IMPROBABLE LEADS ON CORRECTED TIME
description: MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica, B. W.I., March 23  Fourteen boats had completed the 811 mile course in the Miami Montego Bay yacht race at nightfall today. Seventeen were still at sea in diminishing winds.

title: Merger News
description: The Equity Funding Corpora tion of America yesterday sub mitted a formal proposal to acquire the Bankers National Life Insurance Company, a 44 year old life insurance and health insurance company.

title: Fulbright, in Senate, Defends Rogers Position on Middle East
description: WASHINGTON, March 23  Senator J. W. Fulbright came to the defense of Secretary of State William P. Rogers today against Senate critics who charged that the Secretary was undermining Israeli interests in a Middle East settlement.

title: Dr: Charles Steinman Dies; WAS a Surgeon in Yonkers
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., March 23  Dr. Charles Stein man of 161 Lawrence Avenue, died today in Cross County Hospital, Yonkers, where he was chief of surgery, after a short's He was 48 years old.

title: PrimeRate Cut in Canada
description: MONTREAL, March 23 (Reu ters )The Mercantile Bank of Canada said today it would re duce its prime rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent, effec tive April 1. Mercantile which is wholly owned by the First National City Bank of New York and is one of Canada's smaller hanks, is the first com mercial hank in the country to cut the prime rate to 6 per cent.

title: CRIMMINS TRIAL HEARS DETECTIVE
description: A police detective who is one of the key prosecution wit nesses in the murder and man slaughter trial of Mrs. Alice Crimmins conceded under crossexamination yesterday that he never included in his official reports any reference to several pieces of evidence he al legedly saw in the two dead children's bedroom.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Details Program to Reform The Indian Economy
description: NEW DELHI, March 23 (Reu ters) Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today followed up her sweeping election victory with a broad statement of policies and programs designed to bring about social and economic change.

title: XRays From Space Fascinate Scientists
description: American astronomers have discovered in a distant constel lation a rapidly flaring source of Xrays that is strangely un like any other known Xray source in the heavens.

title: Rating on Chrysler By N.C.O. Ignored By Paper Market
description: The commercial paper mar ket shrugged off yesterday the downgrading of the Chrysler Corporation by Dun & Bradstreet.

title: 4 Indicted in Picket Clash at S.I. Paper
description: Natale Marcone, president of the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League, was among four persons indicted yester day on charges stemming from a fracas with the police when the league picketed the offices of The Staten Island Advance last month.

title: Hudson and Essex Losing Seats in Jersey's Senate
description: TRENTON, March 23  A redistricting of New Jersey for this year's State Senate and Assembly elections was an nounced early this morning by the bipartisan Legislative Re apportionment Commission.

title: Serious Approach To Music Is Shown By Purvin, Pianist
description: Jonathan Purvin, a young pianist with strong, facile fin gers and a deadserious al); proach to music, played what amounted to two recitals at the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Grace Rainey Rogers Auditori um on Monday night.

title: Military Training Becoming Optional For Xavier Students
description: Xavier High School, where the Army Reserve Officer Train ing Corps program has been a mandatory part of the curri culum for 35 years, is making military training optional be ginning in September.

title: Track Fast Horses Slow
description: Anything can win this one, the trainer of Lord Pine said hopefully in the paddock before yesterday's second race at Aqueduct.

title: 2 British Ministers Fly to Washington For Talks on Rolls
description: WASHINGTON, March 24Two British ministers arrived here today for meetings tomorrow with executives of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation and Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally that could lead to a showdown on the highstakes transAtlantic dispute over the RollsRoyce RB211 jet engine.

title: News Dogs
description: For the first time since 1894, a change has been made. in the date for obtaining dog licenses. The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals now is issuing licenses here for one, year from the date of sale. This follows the practice of the State Motor Vehicle Bureau and other government agencies. For 77 years all dog licenses had ex pired on April 30, regardless of the date of purchase.

title: 17 Antimugging Teams Formed by City Police
description: Responding to a soaring rate in reported robberiesand study showing that less than 6 per Cent of the robberies assigned to detectives result in an arrestthe Police Department formed special robbery squads yesterday in each of the city's 17 detective districts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A minor miracle has happened in our polluted, strikethreatened city and it should not go unnoticed or unappreciated. In the oourse of fifteen cab rides since the fares were increased, I have not met one driver who was not friendly, courteous and attentive. I wish the cabbies and their industry a prosperous future, and hope they will retain this friendly, cooperative spirit.

title: 2 Major Banks See Gains for Quarter
description: Two giant bank holding companies  the Chemical New York Corporation and the Charter New York Corporation told stockholders yesterday they expected sharply higher net income after securities transactions for the first quarter, ending next week.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., March 24 (UPI)A Republic Aviation official said today that the concern would lay off 500 ployes here within a few weeks.

title: 'King Heroin' Patrons Can Take a Bus There
description: A free Safari to Harlem bus ride to and from performances of the Al Fann Theatrical Ensemble's production of King Heroin will get under way, tonight.

title: The Return to Prosperity
description: The nation is weary of chronic inflation, economic sluggishness and unemployment. President Nixon has m?? clear bia deter??nation to get the economy back to full employmentor as close to it as possiblebefore the 1972 election. Obviously this is a desirable objective, although it deepens public cynicism to have such vital matters as policies to end unemployment closely geared to the election timetable.

title: Sioux Tribes Planning To Run Travel Agency
description: WASHINGTON, March 24  Leaders of the United Sioux Tribes of South Dakota disclosed today plans for a multimilliondollar international travel agency designed to lure Europeans to the American West.

title: Cahill Says the Giants May Move to Jersey
description: TRENTON, March 24  Gov. William T. Cahill announced today that he had a verbal commitment from the New York Giants football club to leave Yankee Stadium and play in a new sports complex in the Hackensack River meadowlands.

title: Dole Doubts Fairness
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 24 (AP) Senator Robert Dole, Republican of Kansas, said today that he felt the Administration definitely has a hard time getting its views across in the nation's televised medium.

title: EDWARD W. BATES, NEWSMAN, 88, DIES Headed the Albany Bureau of The Herald Tribune
description: ALBANY, March 24Edward W. Bates, a veteran legislative correspondent, died today in the Albany Medical Center at the age of 88.

title: Hanoi and Vietcong, in Protest, Cancel Session at Paris Talks
description: PARIS, March 24Hanoi and the Vietcong, protesting against the latest American bombing of North Vietnam, today called off tomorrow's session of the Paris negotiations.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, March 24If you are the parent of a 13yearold Child or even an 18yearold brute with biceps like Max Baer, you have doubtless wondered why your telephone keeps ringing. That is the 200th tree it has rung today, you have cried aloud to an indifferent heaven. What can they possibly have to talk about?

title: LAKERS OVERHAUL BULLS, 100 TO 99 Erase Deficit of 17 Points in Playoff Opener
description: LOS ANGELES, March 24 (AP) Battling back from a 17point deficit, the Los Angeles Lakers topped the Chicago Bulls, 10099; tonight in the opening game of their National Basketball Association playoffs.

title: Handsome Ballo in Maschera Keeps Period Flavor
description: Of all the Verdi operas, Un Ballo in Maschera of 1859 occupies a special niche. In many respects it is the most songful of any. Melody follows melody in an unforced mannerlyric, spontaneous, gorgeous melody. No Verdi opera is more singable. And the libretto, as Verdi operas go, is well constructed. It has its share of melodrama, without which Verdi would not be Verdi, but it also has characters with whom one can identify. Un Ballo in Maschera is a unique work of genius.

title: CARLUCCI CONFIRMED IN ANTIPOVERTY POST
description: WASHINGTON, March 24 (AP)The Senate approved today the nomination of Frank C. Carlucci 3d to be director of the Office of Economic Opportunity, ending a threemoth delay that stemmed from a dispute over a California Poverty program.

title: ALIOTO DENOUNCES INDICTMENT AS FAKE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 24, (AP)Mayor Joseph L. Alioto asserted today that Federal indictments against him in Seattle were a shoddy fake concocted by highranking Republicans. He pushed for a speedy trial as political and business associates rallied to his support.

title: 4 Indicted in Trenton Cable TV Award
description: TRENTON, March 24Four present and former Trenton city, officials were indicted here this afternoon by a. Mercer County grand jury on charges of extorting approximately $50,000 from the Teleprompter Corporation in return for awarding the company an exclusive cable television franchise here in 1968.

title: STATE COURTS GET BEHAVIOR RULES
description: New York yesterday became the first state to have a special set of rules governing courtroom behavior.

title: Cleveland Awaits the End of the Line
description: CLEVELAND, March 24In 1942, '43, '44 this concourse was full of people. The trains were in and out of here every five minutes, said Ray Kinsinger, a maintenance man at the massive Cleveland Union Railroad Terminal. I never thought it would happen. I never really did.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK BULLETS, 126112
description: BALTIMORE, March 24Led by Hal Greer, their 34yearold backcourt marvel, the Philadelphia 76ers opened the National Basketball Association playoffs handsomely tonight, drubbing the Baltimore Bullets, 126112, before a crowd of 6,707 at Civic Center.

title: Governor. Warns Cabinet To Reef Sails on Budget
description: ALBANY, March 24  In the midst of negotiating massive cuts in his proposed $8.45billion budget, Governor Rockefeller warned his cabinet today to reef the sails and batten down the hatches.

title: Hawks Win Bruin Series
description: CHICAGO, March 24 (UPI)Bobby Hull powered his own rebound into the Boston Bruin's net with less than 12 minutes to play tonight to give the Chicago Black Hawks a 21 victory, It was his 44th goal of the season. The Hawks won the season series between the division champions with three victories, two losses and one tie.

title: New Course for Argentina?
description: There is one hopeful aspect in Argentina's second military coup in nine months: a major factor in the decision of the leaders of the armed forces to throw out General Levingston as President was his announced intention of continuing dictatorial military rule for another four or five years.

title: Commons Approves Tories' Bill On Reform of Labor Relations
description: LONDON, March 24The Government's controversial bill to reform labormanagement relations passed its last major Parliamentary hurdle today after lengthy debate in the House of Commons.

title: Books of The Times
description: Oh, yes. The American Indian. Ho hum. Our guilt boxes are so full these days that there is hardly room for the biggest load in our national hertigate. Besides, Arthur Kopit piled it too high and deep in his theatrical extravaganza; Indians; Vine Deloria has already proved that Indians can talk for themselves (if someone will listen); and Dee Brown's history, Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee, is climbing the bestseller list. So why read The Memoirs of Chief Red Fox?

title: Bridge: B.ecker Book Covers Game Prom Primitive to Modern
description: One of the very few people who can be considered in world class both as player and writer is B. Jay Becker of New York. In almost four decades at the top of ;the tournament tree, he has won two world titles and a host of national ones.

title: BrokerFee Competition Surfaces on Wall Street
description: Commissionrate competition, traditionally forbidden the New York Stock Exchange, has begun to materialize on Wall Street in anticipation of an April 5 deadline set bythe Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: School Aide Wins Backing in Dispute In Ocean Hill Area
description: The Association of Assistant Superintendents of Schools threw its support yesterday to Mrs. Nellie R. Duncan, who has been suspended as superintendent by Local School Board 23 in Brooklyn in a controversy over the alleged misuse of Federal education funds.

title: TV: Not Welles's Jane Byre, but One That Works
description: Jane Eyre is a nonconformist, a rebel who comes up against the Establishment and wins out over it.

title: FUND IMPOUNDING BY NIXON BASKED
description: WASHINGTON, March 24One of President Nixon's key budget advisers said today that the President had the right to impound money that Congress had ordered spent, but he declared that Mr. Nixon would never do it to thwart the lawmakers.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: March 24, 1971

title: ARGENTINA LIFTS CEILING ON WAGES
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 24 Lieut Gen. Alejandro A. Lanusse, who dismissed Brig. Gen. Roberto M. Levingston as president of Argentina early yesterday has moved quickly to attract the support of labor and business.

title: Wood, Field and Stream;Here's a Crash Program to Get Ready for the Opening of the Trout Season
description: If you have put off until now the task of assembling your trout fishing gear for the coming season, which opens April 1 in New York State, it is really too late to do anything but attend to the essentials. The refinements will have to come after the sport is under way.

title: 3 Seized With $250,000 In Allegedly Stolen Items
description: The police seized more than $250,000 in allegedly stolen antique silver, Jewelry, paintings and other Items last night at a cooperative apartment house at 27 West 55th Street.

title: No Title
description: CAIRO, March 24  The United Arab Republic, Libya and Syria are rumored to be planning an early announcement of a form of confederation. The three countries and the Sudan are linked in a loose alliance known as the Tripoli Charter and have proclaimed intentions of achieving an ultimate federation.

title: PAKISTAN'S LEADERS REPORTED IN ACCORD
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, March 24 (AP)Leaders of five minor groups in Pakistan's National Assembly said today that President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan and. Sheik Mujibur Rahman had reached complete agreement on constitutional questions that threatened a political split between East and West Pakistan.

title: Hickel Agrees on SST Vote
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 24 (AP)Walter J. Hickel, former Secretary of the Interior, said tonight that he agreed with the Senate vote cutting off funds for the supersonic transport plane. He spoke before the Harvard Law School Forum.

title: CANADIENS DOWN FLYERS, CLINCH 3D
description: MONTREAL, March 24 (UPI) Yvan Cournoyer scored his 33d and 34th goals of the season tonight as the Montreal Canadiens celebrated Jean Beliveau night with a 53 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: News Analysis
description: We must have more help from Washington, may be the sentence that John V. Lindsay has uttered most often in his five years as Mayor.

title: State Help Sought.
description: The city has told state that it cannot keep helping 22 voluntaryprivate, nonprofithospitals to melt their deficits for the next three months, and has asked $4million in interim state emergency aid. But legislators are talking about slashing such state did.

title: Times and Cowles Shareholders Support Agreement on Acquisitions
description: Shareholders of The New York Times yesterday approved by a margin of more than 40 to 1 the acquisition of a number of properties from Cowles Communications, Inc.

title: Dr. Arnold Horowitz, 46, Hofstra Faculty Member
description: Dr. Arnold Horowitz, an associate professor at Hofstra University, Hempstead, L.I., died yesterday in Ceylon of heart attack, the university announced. Dr. Horowitz was 46 years old and lived at 90 70th Avenue, Sea Cliff, L.I.

title: POLK AWARDS GIVEN AT LUNCHEON HERE
description: The 23d annual George Polk Memorial Awards for outstanding achievement in journalism during 1970 were presented yesterday to the winners in 12 categories at an awards luncheon.

title: Strike at Dow Averted
description: MIDLAND, Mich., March 24 (AP)Employes at the Dow Chemical Company plant in Midland voted yesterday to accept a new threeyear contract, thus averting a strike set for today by 5,600 hourly rated workers. The new contract provides an increase of $1.13 an hour in wages and fringe benefits over the next three years. Current wages average $182.40 a week.

title: Textile Men Score Japan's Move
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., March 24 The American Textile Manufacturers Institute, pointing to a 100,000job loss last year and declining industry earnings, sales and Capital investment, today sharply criticized a recent Japanese industry move to voluntarily limit its exports to the United States. The, textile group's board labeled the Japanese Move an arrogant and deliberate ploy to block a fair and, reasonable solution to this increasingly serious, national problem

title: Armstrong Has Setback
description: Louis Armstrong who has been in Beth Israel Hospital since March 15 for treatment of a heart ailment, developed a pulmonary infection yesterday and had difficulty expectorating mucus from the bronchi, or lung tubes, a hospital spokesman said. A tracheotomy was performed on the 70yearold jazz trumpeter. The spokesman said that Mr. Armstrong's cardiac condition remained stable.

title: After the SST
description: In endorsing the House of Representatives' refusal to grant additional funds for the supersonic transport plane, the Senate has brought to an end a long story of error and of stubborn refusal to admit error. Yesterday's vote is a welcome break with the obsessions the last decade and marks a move toward a saner, more balanced understanding of the national interest.

title: G.E. ENDS 1,500 Jon ON ENGINE PROJECT
description: The General Electric Company will have to terminate about 1,500 jobs connected with the GE4 engine, which was scheduled for the Boeing supersonic transport plane, E. E. Hood, vice president and general manager of the commercial engine division, said yesterday.

title: CONVERSION EASED BY ISRAELI RABBIS
description: TEL AVIV, March 24  The Supreme Rabbinical Council in Jerusalem decided today to ease conversion procedures for nonJewish spouses and children accompanying Jewish immigrants from the Soviet Union and other Sovietbloc countries.

title: MRS. WILMERDING
description: Mrs. Helen Suydam Wilmerding, widow of Lucius Wilmerding, a stockbroker, died yesterday after a short illness at her home, 115 East 67th Street. She was 87 years old.

title: Saigon Cowboys Race the Draft
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 24Four cowboys sitting in a cafe spoke of their restlessness, their contempt for the attitudes of their parents, their anger at having to go into the army and their need to be entertained while there is still time.

title: State Senator Charges Fraud In Disbursing of Lottery Funds
description: ALBANY, March 24Senator Donald M. Halperin charged today that the state had been defrauding the public by label. Ing lottery proceeds as a dolar for education because the money had not been segregated specifically for education.

title: News Analysis
