description: Like bizarre names? Names like Mickey de Voisins, Paulo Hayakawa, Coco Latour, Ma ciasReoyo, the Chapochnikoff brothers, Odiharvi, Costachesco, Magda D'Andurian, Lionel de Zieff, JeanFarouk de Mdthode? You'll find them aplenty in this frappe of cinema clichs.

title: Remodeled Queens Library Due to Reopen Tomorrow
description: The Woodhaven branch of the Queens Borough Public Li brary will reopen for service tomorrow following extensive rehabilitation by the Depart ment of Public Works.

title: Recordings
description: THE WINTER CONSORT: ROAD (A & M, 4279). While jazz, rock, folk and country musicians have been busily trying to produce amalgams of their own music with one or more of the others, Paul Win ter, a quondam jazz saxo phonist, has been working the college circuit relatively un ostentatiously with a six piece group called The Win ter Consort that brings it all together so successfully that he has, in effect, created an idiom of his own.

title: Technology for What?
description: The Congressional decision to scrap the SST program marks a milestone in modern American history. This highly technologically oriented nation, whose past ex ploits range from building the first atomic bomb and the first electronic computer to landing the first men on the moon, hasafter long argument and careful consideration decided to bow out of the competition to make the fastest passenger plane in the world.

title: Ancient Sailor's Hobby Is Enjoying a Revival
description: There has never been so little indecision as to what to wear when a female heads for the docks. Since almost everyone seems to be heading for the docks late ly, it would not be wrong to label the boating set as avant garde.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: ECOLOGICAL THREAT TO HAWAII CHARGED
description: WASHINGTON, March 27A nationwide mailing campaign to alert thousands of airline offi cials, travel agents and tourist industry executives to the al leged threat of an environ. mental disaster in the Hawai ian islands was announced here today by the office of Ralph Nader.

title: Collins Coach of Year
description: John (Jack) Collins, who took his Glassboro State Col lege Profs from last place to a tie for first place in one New Jersey State College Athletic Conference basketball season, has been named conference coach of the year. Glassboro won 21 games and lost 6.

title: Miss Casals Defeats Mrs. King, in Final of $15,000 Tennis Tourney
description: Fun City became another nightmare for Mrs. Billie Jean King, the queen of women's tennis, last night.

title: 2 Public Courses Set in Seamanship
description: Coast Guard Auxiliary, Flo tilla 137 of Baldwin, L. I., has scheduled two public in struction courses in basic seamanship and safe boating, at Gimbels, Green Acres Shopping Center, Valley Stream, L. I.

title: ARTILLERY USED
description: DACCA, Pakistan, March 27 The Pakistani Army is using artillery and heavy machine guns against unarmed East Pakistani civilians to crush the movement for autonomy in this province of 75 million people.

title: Senators Throw Out 2 at Plate In 13th Inning to Top Yanks, 21
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 27Curt Flood, still finding difficulty in regaining his preexile baseball ability, played center field with his son's glove today, but it was two other Washington outfield ers using their own gloves who made it impossible for the Yankees to win the game.

title: Agonizing Trail to Airports
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 27  When a family from Westchester County decides to take an airliner, getting to and from the airport is definitely not half the fun. More often, it is half the headache and may even ap proach half the expense of the trip.

title: ROBERT HARTLEY, A BROOKINGS AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Robert W. Hartley, vice presi dent for administration of the Brookings Institution since 1957, died today in Georgetown Hospital. He was 60 years old.

title: Women Seeking New Life on L.I.
description: ROSLYN, L. I., March 27  In the Roslyn Country Club Community, the street names are displayed on clean white signposts. They follow a rustic theme: Farm, Shep herd, Saddle, Hayloft.

title: Eastern Fleet. Scores in Florida;
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 27Calumet Farm's Eastern Fleet took a few strides toward his old Kentucky home today by winning the $137,800 Florida Derby at Gulstream Park by threequarters of a length over the favored Executioner.

title: Sod Farming Gaining in Importance in Long Island Agriculture
description: MELVILLE, LI., March 27 To most residents, Long Is land agriculture means pota toes and vegetables. Nearly everyone is familiar with the neat rows of soil where these crops are grown. But there is another agricultural product of the Island that does not grow in rows and that goes largely unnoticed.

title: Remember When We Had a Doorman?
description: Miss Lawrence's Greenwich Village apartment house may not have a doorman, but it has two manned elevators and no homicides. Clearly an untypical multiple dwelling. It also har bors some dog walkers, gos sips, at least one heavy drinker, a bride or two, a kindly curmudgeon, and a houseful of Just Folks  all of whom are appraised by a spry widow named Holly Berry. If New York were like this, who would ever move to Darien?

title: A School's Responsibility for Results: Debate Grows
description: The concept of educational accountabilitythat is, how to hold the schools more directly responsible for the re sults they produce, in precise wayshas become one of the more widely debated issues among American educators in recent months.

title: The Nation
description: It may be true that being Mayor of New York is the sec ond toughest job in America, but it would be even tougher if the Mayor had to face summer reruns on television like Lucille Ball. Instead of a 15yearold I Love Lucy this July, New York ers might see a fiveyearold John Lindsay show.

title: Garden and Horne
description: THERE ere many different gar dens in the midst of the city: vestpocket parks, terraces brownstone yards and flower pots on a windowsill. Each is an oasis with its own moaning.

title: War Protest Upstate
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., March 27A group of 150 students, teachers and mothers with their children gathered in front of the Dutchess County Court house today to protest the war in Indochina.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe public fi nally caught up with the super sonic transport last week. But after the Senate voted 5146 to cancel Government support of the SSTconfirming the House ver dict of a week before and prompt ing the Boeing Company to an nounce that it would terminate the project immediatelythere were some bitter recriminations. The public had been misin formed, the plane's supporters chargedand in any event, what business did the public have making such an important tech nological judgment?

title: Kathleen King Fiancee Of Arthur Caughlin 3d
description: NEW MILFORD, N. J., March 27William P. King, president of the Boiling Springs Savings and Loan As sociation of Rutherford, and Mrs. King have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen Anne King, to Arthur B. Caughlin 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Caughlan Jr. A December wedding is planned.

title: CHARGES DROPPED IN NEW BEDFORD
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., March 27In a surprise development today, the Bristol County Dis trict Attorney dropped most of the charges againts 10 persons scheduled to go on trial Mon day in connection with racial disorders here last summer.

title: Miss Donna Christine Hembling Betrothed to Clifford Hemphill
description: RUMSON, N.J., March 27 The engagement of Miss Donna Christine Hembling to Clifford Joseph Hemphill, a grandson of the late Clifford Hemphill, a founding partner of Hemphill, Noyes & Co., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Donald C. Hembling of Rumson. A wedding in the summer is planned.

title: Oakley Leads Thailand Golf
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 27 (AP)  David Oakley of Vienna, Va., carded a one underpar 71 today, for a 205 total and retained his four stroke lead after three rounds in the Thailand open golf cham pionship. Greg Powers, a club pro in Greenwich, Conn., had a 69 for the day's, best score and stood at 219.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve Board, Con gress and in a sense all the rest of us soon will have to make a decision on a ques tion of great importance for the future: Whether the cen tral bank should be involved, at least partially, in the set ting of national priorities.

title: Peter Herrick, a Lawyer Here, Fiance of Norma K. Meyetson
description: Miss Norma Karen Meyer son, an honor student at Bos ton University, and Peter Herrick, a 1970 graduate of the Boston Law School, will be married June 27.

title: Light Whisky More Than a Year Off, but the industry Is Already in Turmoil
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The prospective introduction of light whisky has produced controversy in the liquor indus try and confusion among con sumers.

title: CITY AIDE OPPOSES ADDICTCARE BILL
description: The head of the city's Addic tion Services Agency charged last week that the State Legis lature wanted to cripple certain antinarcotis programs begun by Governor Rockefeller last year with high hopes and much fanfare.

title: Synagogue to Honor Rabbi
description: Rabbi Israel Levinthal, the spiritual leader of the Brook lyn Jewish Center for the last 52 years, will be honored by his synagogue and the Jewish Theological Seminary of Amer ica at a luncheon on Sunday, April 4, in the center, at 667 Eastern Parkway.

title: Rev. Dr. Luther W. Smith Dies; Education Official for Baptists
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 27The Rev. Dr. Luther Wes ley Smith, former executive secretary of the American Bap tist Board of Education and Publications, who was the mov ing spirit in founding the American Baptist Assembly at Green Lake, Wis., died today at the age of 73.

title: Doubling of Office Space in Nassau Seen
description: MINEOLA, L. I. March 27  The amount of office space in Nassau County at the end of the year will be nearly double what it was two years ago, the County Planning Cornission has reported.

title: Don't Delay Hunt For Space at Docks
description: For people now in search of the boat they hope to launch this spring: Make use of good weekend days to hunt for dock or mooring space for the hopedfor boat.

title: N. CAROLINA WINS N. I. T.;
description: North Carolina, a basket ball team with quickness, aggressiveness and bench strength, won the 34th an nual National Invitation Tour nament yesterday by over whelming Georgia Tech, 8466, at Madison Square Garden.

title: Et Al.
description: The first of a projected defin itive sixtoeightvolume edition of the letters of the abolitionist William Lloyd Garrison. This volume covers the years 1822 35 and contains mainly public letters to newspapers and per sonal correspondence in flowery 19thcentury epistolary style to fiancee, friends, mother. (Adieu! dear mother, and O may heaven grant that I shall clasp you again to my throb bing breast, followed by the signature, W. L. Garrison.) For scholars only.

title: Sailing Capital of South Proud of It
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., This waterfront city has a hardtoshake image as a ha ven for shuffleboard players, 60yearold softball stars and countless aged people in the rockingchair fleet. But it has a different reputation for oth ers who agree that the city's claim as The Sailing Capi tal of the South has a good deal of validity.

title: TOIL GALLED HIGH
description: NEW DELHI, March 27 Pakistani Government troops supported by artillery and air force jets were reported battling on many fronts today with the forces of Sheik Mujibur Rah man, the nationalist leader of East Pakistan.

title: BUCKLEY DEFENDS HIS VOTE FOR SST
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Before the Senete voted last Wednesday to end further spending for the supersonic transport, Senator James L. Buckley's office was getting a heavy flow of mail with senti ment running about 5to1 against the SST.

title: National Notes
description: They may work 10 hours a day in 100degree heat, stooping and crawling through fields sprayed with DDT, returning at day's end to shacks without plumbing or running water. They are among the tens of thousands of children, some as young as 6 years of age, who harvest America's agricultural bounty.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONIt was galling enough for Secretary of State William P. Rogers to have Sena tors suggest he had become laughing stock on the Washing ton cocktail circuit because Henry Kissinger had displaced him as the President's chief for eign affairs adviser. But it be came almost intolerable when the Senate turned to Abba Eban, Eoreign Minister of Israel, for an explanation of his policy in the Middle East.

title: Instrument Concern to Quit Queens and Go to Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, March 27 (AP) American Precision Industries has announced that it is mov ing most of the operations of Its subsidiary, Moeller Instru ment Company, from Queens to the Buffalo area.

title: Wheelchair Basketball Title Is Taken by Detroit, 4845
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., March 27 (UPI)Bud Rumple scored 16 points, Gary Odorowski 15 and Denver Branum 13 today to lead the Detroit Sparks to al 4845 victory over Champaign1 Urbana in the championship

title: TITO AND EGYPTIAN HAVE TALKS IN ITALY
description: ROME, March 27President Tito of Yugoslavia today ended a twoday state visit in Rome and conferred with the Foreign, Minister of the United Arab Republic near Pisa amid reports of policy shifts regarding the Middle East.

title: Bridge
description: COMMON sense suggests that great wealth is better than moderate wealth. And in bridge it is true that wealth in trumps is desir able. A player with a good trump fit in the combined hands can expect to make at least as many tricks as he would if he had chosen a trump suit with a lesser total of cards. But there can be interesting paradoxical ex ceptions, as on the diagramed deal.

title: Love and Will and Rollo May
description: BEFORE the advent of the touch system of psychotherapy, peo ple in trouble unburdened themselves in private. These 50 minute hours were sealed from the outside world by two thick doors and a wondrously esoteric vocabulary which dealt with the patient's child hood memories, his libidinal instincts, Oedipus complex, anal obsession, dream life, death wish, father hatred and similar hidden forces that mani fested themselves in forms of neuro sis. The treatment for the sickness was simply talk, and the cure might take years, although this depended somewhat on the patient's finances. One of the oldest jokes in analytic humor concerns this touchy matter of cost:

title: Morgan Yachts Shift To 4Day Work Week
description: The Morgan Yacht Corpo ration has shifted to a four day, 10  hour  a  day work week. Charles Morgan, presi dent of the St. Petersburg based yacht manufacturing company, said that the move was designed to improve conditions for personnel and the company.

title: Announcements
description: Anniversaries

title: Article 3  No Title
description: AMMAN, Jordan, March 27 (AP)The Government report ed that Palestinian guerrillas ambushed and killed two of ficers and three soldiers today in new fighting with the army in Irbid.

title: New Commanders Elected By Area Power Squadrons
description: Recently installed as com mander of District 3, United States Power Squadrons, was Walter Raskin of Brook lyn. Supporting him are Don ald R. Pierce of Roslyn, L. I., executive officer; Wallace P. Gould of Bayside, Queens, administrative officer; Robert J. Burgio Sr. of Garden City, L. I., secretary, and William Nassoysky of Babylon, L. I.

title: Kyrie
description: Letters from a prepschool senior to his advisorteacher friend. The generation gap, the decline of traditional religion, the fickleness of some females, the dependability of other friends, the problems of grow:. ing up in a hypocritical world. There are inescapable holier thanthou implications in these observations by a 17yearold, as well as the expected over tones of profundity. Charles Trueheart (sounds like a put on but isn't: he's the son of Foreign Service officer) is in telligent; this book may elimi nate the need for him to write first novel.

title: The Chairman as a dupe and a fool when not a cynical tyrant
description: Five years after the onset of the Cultural Revolution in China, there is still, no adequate study of what is perhaps the greatest, and surely the most unprecedented, social upheaval of modern times. It would be agree able to report that this gap has now been filled by Robert S. Elegant, for eign affairs columnist of The Los Angeles Times, but unfortunately such is not the case.

title: Chess
description: MORE than a century ago, in 1851 and 1853 to be exact, the Im mortal and Evergreen gamesso titled in various anthologies to preserve their beauty in perpetuity were created by Adolf Anderssen of Breslau, Germany, universally regarded as the strongest player in the world between 1859 and 1866.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: WAGE INFLATION BESETS RHODESIA
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, March 27 (UPI)  Like many other countries Rhodesia is suffering from wage inflation, but since her situation is unusual, she is experiencing a special form of the disease.

title: East Pakistani Group in U.S. Urges Nixon to Intervene
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 27 (AP)The Bangla Desh As sociation, a newly formed group here that says it represents the Bengali people of East Pakistan, said today it had sent tele grams to President Nixon and to U Thant, the United Na tions Secretary General, urging worldwide recognition of the new Republic of Bangla Desh.

title: Queens Village Planning Festive Summer to Mark Centennial
description: A town crier will call the residents of Queens Village to a reenactment of a town meeting today to diicuss plans for a summerlong contennial observance of the community's establishment 100 years ago.

title: Hodgson Expects His Proposal To Stabilize Building Industry
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said today that the draft of an executive order he submitted to President Nixon yesterday should bring sub stantial stability to the infla tionridden construction indus try.

title: David Burns 190271
description: WHEN our beloved David Burns died, he was performing in the tryout of 70, Girls, 70 in Philadelphia. He had just done his big song, and dance number to enormous applause, and had gone into the next scene. When he keeled over on the stage, after delivering big laugh line, the audience thought he was kid ding and there was an added wave of laughter and warmth. I cannot think of any way that Davey would rather go. Knowing him as I did, I felt strangely soulsatisfied in the midst of my grief when I heard the story.

title: The Hail Mary! Airlines
description: DESPITE what the major airlines might want us to believe, the price of a ticket to fly from one destination to another is not al ways the same. There is still some old fashioned price competition in the skies at least in certain parts of the sky, such as between the United States and Latin America and across the Atlantic, too. On some runs, the competition in fares can amount to a considerable saving for the passenger, an economy that might influence his choice of an airline more than the width of the seat the sauce on a steak.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: State's Plan for Aerial Spraying of Gypsy Moths on L. I. Opposed
description: Even conservation groups be lieve the gypsy moth should be controlled, but a new state plan to spray from the air 21,000 acres of Long Island woodland affected by the voracious pest has come under strong criticism from some ecology organiza tions.

title: Photography
description: ONE of the most inter esting recent publica tions from George Eastman House is an untitled portfolio containing 12 unbound reproductions of pictures by Lewis W. Hine, along with an appreciation of Hine's work by Thomas F. Barrow.

title: MillsforPresident Campaign Is On, With His Support
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., March 26Close friends and support ers of Representative Wilbur D. Mills are quietly and seriously promoting him as a possible compromise candidate for President on the Democratic ticket next year.

title: James Davis to Wed Cynthia M. Swain
description: PEORIA, III., March, 27 Miss Cynthia M. Swain and James R. Davis plan to be married here on June 12. There engagement has been announced by Miss Swain's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Timo thy W. Swain of Peoria.

title: POLITICAL POLICE STRONG IN LISBON
description: LISBON, March 27Although one of Premier Marcelo Caetano's early acts was to re organize the nation's political police, it remains a powerful and often arbitrary force.

title: Vatican Names Hanoi Bishop
description: ROME, March 27 (UPI)The Vatican has announced the ap pointment of the Msgr. Pierre Marie Nguyen Nang as Bishop of Vinh, North Vietnam. He was consecrated about two weeks ago in Hanoi Cathedral.

title: Miss Engle Bride of Lieut. David Jacot
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., March 27  Miss Kristine Elaine Engle and Lieut. David Mur ray Jacot, U.S.A.F., were mar ried here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. Marshall Rice.

title: Yacht in Sarasota Is Old Landlubber
description: SARASOTA, Fla  Arthur Rowe's yacht is anchored to a corner lot at 425 North Osprey Avenue, more than a mile from Sarasota Bay. She's never been to sea, she has no keel, and the only light house she's ever seen is right off her port bow and has no beacon.

title: Europeans Flock to U.S., Lured by Low Air Fares
description: A new wave of European tourists is coming to America milkmen, mechanics, bak ers, factory workers, bus drivers and middle  class housewives.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: William J. Fitzgerald, Brooklyn  born consulting economist, is getting ready for a business boom that could very well make Presi dent Nixon's forecast of gross national product of $1,065billion come true this year. He's counting on that untrustworthy group over age 35.

title: This place
description: THADDEUS L. HALL JR. and Arthur Molinelli don't pretend to be sociologists, architects or realtors, and they aren't exactly in the line of conducting house tours. In fact, Hall and Molinelli are patrol men who work a unique plainclothes assignment out of the 75th Precinct, a small redbrick castle at Liberty and Miller Avenues in the East New York section of Brooklyn. They are known as the vacanthouse team. And if you are looking for one of the best (and certainly the safest) field studies of the desolate ghetto heart of East New York, especially its sad inventory of perhaps 1,000 empty, derelict buildings, most aban doned by their owners, not to mention sidelights on other local crises such as the very high incidence of crime and fire, they are guides.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: A Floating High School Clears Troubled Seas
description: Given time, the sea seems able to cure almost anything. The simple but unpatented formula of salt water, clean air and sunshine, mixed with selfdiscipline and forthright ness, offers a universal medi cament that can heal both small wounds and large prob lems.

title: Reform Democrats Threaten Walkout to Halt State Budget Vote
description: Reform Democrats proposed yesterday to stage a state leg islative walkout to try to block a needed quorum unless they received a reasonable period, preferably three days, to study the new budget agreed on by Governor Rockefeller and Re publican leaders.

title: SEX AS JOB BASIS IS BARRED IN ADS
description: PITTSBURGH, March 27 Pittsburgh's two daily newspa pers will be required to run help wanted ads under a single classification rather than in separate categories for male help wanted and female help wanted, according to a ruling handed down in Allegheny County Common Pleas Court this week.

title: LIR. Commuters Opposing Plan for New Tickets
description: Opposition is stirring against the Long Island Railroad's plan to experiment with a new weekly ticket next month in an attempt to reduce cheating on the fare.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE windows in a mod ern house should per form a number of im portant functionsin addition to contributing to its overall attractiveness. They should let in adequate amounts of light during the daytime; they should permit occupants to see out easily and enjoy the view (if any), thus Plimineting a cooped up or shut in feeling; they bould keep out wind, rain and cold urafts; they should open easily to permit fresh air to enter, and they should keep Heat inside during the winter by preventing cold drafts and minimizing heat losses.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: U. C. L. A. GAINS N.C. A. A. TITLE;
description: HOUSTON, March 27Villa nova came closer to beating the University of California, Los Angeles in the final of the Na tional Collegiate basketball tournament today than any of the Bruins' six previous oppo nents in N.C.A.A. title games.

title: Benvenuti Says He'll Quit If Monzon Wins Rematch
description: TRIESTE, Italy, March 27 (UPI) Nino Benvenuti said today his May 8 return match with Carlos Monzon of Argentina for the world middleweight title would determine whether he quits boxing.

title: CENTURYOLD PACT ON CARE IS ENDED
description: A 100yearold agreement be tween Mount Sinai Hospital and the Jewish Child Care Associa tion of New York has ended by mutual agreement because of major advances in public fi nancing and medical care for dependent children.

title: Lodge Confers With Pope
description: ROME, March 27President Nixon's spceial envoy to Pope Paul VI, Henry Cabot Lodge had gin audience with the Pon tiff today. Vatican sources said that a wide range of subjects was believed to have been dis cussed, including the sitaeua tion in Vietnam and the. Mid dle Eats, and EastWest pro blems.

title: Success Story Began at Sea
description: Plumley, a name that New Englanders have been seeing for years, has gradually been making an impact on the country as a whole. Because he began his career as an $8aweek runner for an in surance company, it is a suc cess story Americans never tire of hearing.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: My objections to the wide ly publicized decision of the Episcopal Church to put pressure on General Motors to pull out of South Africa should be read in context: am a black, cardcarrying Episcopalian who has visit ed the Republic of South Af rica.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ready for April
description: Dawn comes threequarters of an hour earlier now than it did when March began, but it is still frosty around the edges, like the puddles in the pasture. There is a thin scum of ice on those puddles, and the brook that chat tered so loudly all yesterday afternoon is now reduced to a burble that will slowly increase again as the aun resumes the melting of ice and sheltered snowbanks among the hemlocks on the hill. And the dooryard lawn has a frosty crispness underfoot where yesterday after noon it was damp and spongy.

title: Pakistani Protest Reported
description: NEW DELHI, March 27 (AP) Radio Pakistan said today that the Pakistani Foreign Min istry had complained to the United States Ambassador and the British High Commissioner about news coverage of events in East Pakistan by the Voice of America and the British Broadcasting Corporation...

title: Suit Seeks Curb on Brooklyn Renewal
description: A suit bas been filed in Fed eral Court to block the fi nancing of a major urbanre newal program In Brooklyn unless the city carries out im provements for relocating displaced tenants, rehabilitating occupied housing and replacing demolished buildings.

title: Judge Stricken in Court; Life Saved by Lawyer
description: TEHACHAPI, Calif., March 27 (UPI)A quickthinking lawyer saved a judge's life this week and won his case when the jury returned.

title: SOUTH AFRICANS EASE NURSES' RACIAL BAR
description: CAPETOWN, March 27Hos pitals in the Transvaal, South Africa's most heavily populated province, have been told that they may employ nonwhite nurses in white hospital wards.

title: Pornography, Obscenity and The Case For Censorship
description: BEING frustrated is disagreeable, but the real disasters in life begin when you get what you want. For almost a century now, great many intelligent, wellmeaning and articulate peopleof a kind gen erally called liberal or intellectual, or bothhave argued eloquently against any kind of censorship of art and/or entertainment. And within the past 10 years, the courts and the legisla tures of most Western nations have found these arguments persuasive so persuasive that hardly a man is now alive who clearly remembers what the answers to these arguments were. Today, in the United States and other democracies, censorship has to all intents and purposes ceased to exist.

title: Sea Cooks Can Learn From Book
description: America has become a nation of people on the go. During the next few months, millions of Americans will spend most of their leisure Mime living and traveling in everything from canoes to luxurious twin diesel yachts.

title: Reader's Report
description: Allan Prior evidently knows quite a bit about television, but he wears his expertise easily, using the specifics of electronic show biz as back ground for more transcendent matters, like love, ambition, success and compromise. The result of this amalgam is an entertainment that rolls with swift authority toward a des tination determined by charac ter as well as circumstance.

title: Quake on Coast Called Costliest U.S. Disaster
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)In terms of money spent for restoration and cleaning up the earthquake that struck Los Angeles Feb, 9 is proving to be the na tion's greatest natural disas ter.

title: For Young Readers
description: When I was a teenager, the most important event in my life was a Wednesday evening telephone call from a boy asking me for a weekend date. If the call came on Thursday or Friday of the week, I knew I was a second choice. If no call came, I was rejected. Taking the initiative and calling a boy was out of the ques tion. Good grades, girl friends, adult approvalnothing mattered as much as the weekly agony of waiting for that callthe approval of a boy.

title: For Young Readers
description: Out of an impassioned childhood desire to share life visually with her blind sister Mary, Laura Ingalls Wilder took her first steps toward the writing of the Little House books, which have become for chil dren what Conrad Richter's The Trees, The Fields and The Town have for adults: a classic saga of the opening up of the frontier. And long before Laura reached her 60th year, when she began writing, she had re marked of the James River in her diary On the Way Home, that she wished for an artist's hand or a poet's brain or even to be able to tell in good plain prose how beautiful it was.

title: West German Prohibition On Male Midwives Upheld
description: KASSEL, West Germany, March 27 (AP) West Ger man court has upheld a prohibi tion against male midwives, ruling that the restriction does mot violate constitutional guarantees of equal rights and opportunities for the sexes.

title: Kidnapping and Threats Linked to a Man Opposed to Nude Models
description: MEMPHIS, March 27  A mentally deranged person with a phobia about nude females as artistic models is being sought here for a bizarre series of inci dents including the kidnapping of a 14yearold boy.

title: HAWKS BEAT KNICKS, 113104;
description: Overcoming a 15point defi cit they acquired by scoring only 7 points in the first nine minutes, the Atlanta Hawks fought back for a 113.104 vic tory over the New York Knicks last night and evened their four  of  seven  game National Basketball Associations playoff series at one victory apiece.

title: ANTIWAR RALLIES SET FOR CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, March 27  A coalition of antiwar and civil rights organizations is planning a monthlong series of demon strations this spring, including a mass rally April 24 on the steps of the Capitol and an at tempt to stop the Govern ment.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: It was a long but impor tant day with the talk all hav ing to do with changes in the advertising business. The 11th and last speaker was William P. MacFarland, vice presi ident for marketing services for Campbell Soup. He is a huge, cheerful man.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: TokyoKoichi Wajima, 155 pounds, Japan, knocked out At Fuentes, 155, the Philippines, 1 round.

title: ROCKEFELLER URGES YEAR'S RESIDENCY IN WELFARE CASES
description: ALBANY, March 27Gover nor Rockefeller proposed sweeping changes in the state's welfare system today, includ ing establishment of a oneyear residency requirement, to re duce soaring costs.

title: What's The Bore? A Man? No. A Thing? Yes.
description: MONCTON, N. B.  Something about the way the Canadian customs official said it, the deceptively casual note in his voice, caught my attention: When you go through Moncton, don't miss seeing The Bore. Then he waved us on into Canadamy wife and I and baby son traveling in our camper.

title: JURY WEIGHS FATE OF TATE SLAYERS
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 The jury that found Charles M. Manson and the three young women who were his codefend ants guilty of the seven Tate LaBianca murders two months ago deliberated today but reached no agreement on their punishment. The jury will re sume its deliberations at 9 A.M., Monday.

title: Ohio Five Beats N.Y.A.C. In A.A.U. Tourney, 9987
description: LONDON, Ky., March 27 (UPI)Sanders Stone Insurance of Dayton, Ohio, led by Roy Hinton's 22 points, beat the New York Athletic Club, 9987, in the first round of the nation al Amateur Athletic Union bas ketball tournament today.

title: Vehicular Traffic Is Down by 30% On the S.I. Ferry
description: The number of cars, trucks and buses on the Staten Island ferry has dropped by about 30 per cent since the increase in vehicular rates went into ef fect last March 14, according to a spokesman for the De partment of Marine and Avia tion.

title: 'Great Progress' by Red China Reported in Fight Against Snail Fever, a Common Disease of Man
description: Communist China has made great progress since 1949 in controlling snail fever, one of man's most common diseases, a biologist at Pennsylvania State University has reported.

title: HOSPITAL IN QUEENS INCREASES SERVICES
description: Outpatient visits to various medical services operated by Mary Immaculate Hospital in Jamaica, Queens, have almost doubled since 1967. A total of 35,555 visits were recorded in 1970, as opposed to 18,168 three years ago.

title: Penn Central Is Delayed By Fire on Bronx Tracks
description: Service on the Penn Central's Harlem and New Haven Divi sions in and out of Grand Cen tral Terminal was suspended for 90 minutes yesterday after noon after debris from a burn ing pedestrian overpass fell onto the tracks at the Melrose station, at 162d Strest and Mel rose Avenue in the Bronx.

title: 2d Quarter: Up, Not Away
description: Imagine, if you will, driving down a crowded, twisting highway at 60 miles an hour in an automobile that is normal in all respects but onethe steering, the brakes and the accelerator respond only after a lag of two minutes. Turn the wheel or step on the gas, and you're two miles down the road before the change starts to take effect.

title: RAILPAX A FRAUD, MANSFIELD SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield of Mon tana, said today that the Governmentbacked corporation that will begin May 1 to take over the nation's railroad pas senger service was a fraud and an outrage, an outrage.

title: WOMEN'S JOB LAW IS VOIDED IN OHIO
description: DAYTON, Ohio, March 27A Federal District Court judge this week voided several sections of an Ohio law that requires pref erential working conditions for female employes. The same law was ruled basically valid by a state appeals court two weeks ago.

title: Camp to Be Child Clinic
description: BOSTON, March 27 (AP)  The Nauset Regional School District on Cape Cod will oper ate Camp Wellfleet, a former Job Corps center, as a clinical center to aid children with severe learning disabilities and emotional handicaps, Federal officials said Tuesday.

title: Packers Want Goat Meat Labeled Chevon or Mutton
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)Goat meat, f the Agri culture Department approves recent proposal may wind up being called chevon or mut ton.

title: EASTERN SKI TITLE GOES TO KENNISON
description: LINCOLN, N. H., March 27 Brad Kennison, the solidly bullt sophomore skier from Johnson; (Vt.) State College, won the eastern slalom championship today on snow  choked Len Mountain,

title: Dallas: 2 Super Bowls Lost in 2 Months
description: About Pro Football

title: Basic Policy Shift Emerging on RevenueSharing Plan
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 As the Administration has been slowly working out the details of President Nixon's special revenuesharing plan, a basic, policy shift has been emerging in the distribution of funds.

title: Kieran, 78, to Be Cited By U.S. Sportswriters
description: SALISBURY, N. C., March 27John Kieran, 78year old former sports columnist for The New York Times, will be inducted here Tues day night into the National Sportscasters and Sports writers Hall of Fame.

title: TWO RUNS IN 9TH WIN FOR METS 54
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., March 27The New York lets equaled their entire 1970 spring training victory total tonight when they rallied for two runs in the ninth inning to overcome the Atlanta Braves 54.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Every year, as certain as everreturning spring, Hal Lyman, publisher of the au thoritative Salt Water Sports man magazine, predicts what he thinks the fishing will be for certain game fish in the coming season along the Atlantic seaboard.

title: SAMUEL L. HIRSCHBERG
description: WEST NEW YORK, N. J., March 27Samuel L. Hirsch berg, town attorney here for 50 years, died today in North Hud son Hospital, Weehawken, of a heart attack. He was 78 years old and lived at 6600 Boulevard East.

title: Look dry, stay dry
description: Far left

title: Reed Terms Play, Not Knee, Subpar
description: In the quiet of the Knicker bockers' locker room, Willis Reed glanced at his left knee.

description: Residents of the Williams burgGreenpoint section Brooklyn vented their anger a crowded meeting the other night at the proposed closing of police stations in their neighbanhood.

title: White Sox Beat AllStars
description: SARASOTA, Fla., March 27 (AP) Home runs by Pat Kelly and Lee Maye paced the Chi cago White Sox to a 43 victory over a team comprised of play ers from Boston, Pittsburgh and Cincinnati today.

title: Line Drive Hits Coleman
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 27 (UPI)  Joe Coleman, a De troit Tiger pitcher, suffered a fractured skull when he was struck by a line drive in the fourth inning today in a game won by the Tigers from the St. Louis Cardinals, 117.

title: Eleanore D. Schweppe Is Bride Of Capt. John Baxendale, Lawyer
description: The Episcopal Church of the Heavenly. Rest was the setting here yesterday af noon for the marriage of Miss Eleanore Darst Schweppe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Denison W. Schweppe of New York and Old Lyme, Conn., formerly of Locust Valley, L.I., to Capt. John. Richard Day Bax endale, who is serving with the Army Judge Advocate General Corps at Fort Monmouth, N.J. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Stan ley Baxendale of Somerset, N.J.

title: Miss Forsyth Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. William H. Forsyth of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marion Mitchell Forsyth, to Gordon David Weekly, son of Mr. and Mrs. George E. Weekly of Fort Walton Beach, Fla.

title: Another Cosmos in Orbit
description: MOSCOW, March 27 (UPI) The Soviet Union launched to day the 401st in its Cosmos series of artificial earth satel lites, the official press agency Tass said.

title: National Notes
description: Datsa nice! So says the television spokes man for Ragu Spaghetti Sauce, but there are indications that he Is about to lose his accent. The ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League is on the march, 40,000 strong; as they see it, That is nice!

description: To the Editor:

title: Lecture Series to Deal With the Puerto Rican
description: An eightweek lecture series entitled A New Look at the Puerto Rican and His So ciety will begin April 12 under the sponsorship of the Institute of Puerto Rican Studies at Brooklyn College.

title: Northfields Captures Louisiana Derby by HalfLength and Returns $26.40
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 27 (AP)Northfields, a long shot owned by the chemical mag nate, J. M. Olin, rushed to the front today and withstood pair of stretch charges to post a halflength victory in the $61,000 Louisiana Derby at the Fair Grounds race track.

title: Priests in Double Wedding
description: REGGIO EM ILIA, Italy, March 27 (AP)Paolo and Ro berto Camellini, two brothers who gave up the priesthood in January, took wives in a dou blewedding ceremony in the cathedral here this week. Paolo, 41 years old, married Carla Masini, a 36yearold widow. Roberto, 44, married 21year old Franca Rizzi.

title: Foreign Notes
description: For Siaka Stevens, the Ox fordeducated political leader of diamondrich Sierra Leone, the problem has been to work out a stable relationship with his country's 1,500man Army. Sworn in as the first elected Prime Minister of the former British West African colony in 1967, he was promptly, jailed by the Army commander, who quarreled with the election re sults (and jailed Dr. Stevens's principal opponent too, for good measure.) Fleeing to Guinea, Dr. Stevens returned in triumph to resume the Premiership when the Army commander was over thrown by a mutiny in 1968.

title: Homicide Rate Rises 30% In First Part of 1971 Here
description: The rate of homicides in New York  which set records in 1969 and 1970  is now run ning at least 30 per cent over the same period last year.

title: Art In London
description: LONDON.

title: UNSER VICTOR IN 150MILE RACE
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 27 (UPI)  Al Unser of Albu querque, N. M., took the lead from his brother, Bobby, on the 140th lap and went on to take the 150mile Jimmy Bryan United States Auto Club Race today for the second year in a row.

title: Roller Derby: Three Cheers for the Good Skates
description: It is fast and furious and bruising and battering. The men, playing against men, play hard and some times dirty. The women, playing against women, play hard and sometimes dirty, and sometimes they pull the hair of the other women.

title: Manhasset Antidrug Unit Set Up in Parish House
description: MANFIASSET, L. I., March 27 A day center operated in a parish house here is the new est attempt by Long Island Jew ish Medical Center to treat drug abuse in this area.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: About a year and a half ago, faced with the prospect of a declining economy in 1970, William J. Weisz, the young, singleminded presi dent of Motorola, Inc., told each of his six division man agers to prepare three addi tional financial projections as alternates to one they had already submitted.

title: DRIVE TO OPEN HERE TO RECRUIT FIREMEN
description: The Fire Department will be gin an intensive sixmonth drive tomorrow to encourage city residents, and especially members of minority groups, to apply and prepare for its en trance examination, the first such test to be offered since 1968.

title: The life and wild times of Toby Malothioon
description: Here is a fiction (is it a novel?) in which the title is either mean ingless or means everything. The whole frantic, crazy book is like that. Obscure, frownmaking, fantastic, allegorical, Eisenhower, My Eisen hower can make you feel you've gone mad reading it, or that the author himself has flipped, gone novelfreaked, lost control of an ex perimental technique and made too many demands on the reader's patience. Or, on the other hand, that you've just read a fiction so de fiantly original and zany that you don't know what to do with your mindmuch less what to say about the bewildering book.

title: RANGERS TOP BRUINS, 63
description: BOSTON, March 27While the Bruins were otherwise oc cupiedperhaps thinking of how they'll spend their first place moneythe Rangers sneaked in for five firstperiod goals tonight and skated away with a 63 victory.

title: Barrier Reef a Skindivers' Delight
description: Imagine 80,000 square miles of underwater coral gardens, stretching 1,250 miles along the Queensland, Australia, coastline. This is the Great Barrier Reef, a liv ing eighth wonder, and un doubtedly the best skindiv ing area in the world.

title: Last Dance is Victor
description: LINCOLN, R.I., March 27 (AP) Last Dance, breaking from the outside post in a field of nine, went on to a convincing 3length victory in the $7,500 Yankee Bredrs Handicap at Lincoln Downs today.

title: Et Al.
description: An American Jew goes to Germany in 1964 on a Fulbright to teach. At first he is suspicious, sees antiSemites and war criminals behind every beer stein; but he is haunted by a desire to come to terms with the GermanJewish past. As he meets more of the enemy especially the younghe rec ognizes the need for a dialogue, if not reconciliation between these two peoples so tragically linked by history. This is not the first such report, but Hal perin has compassion and fresh insights.

title: $1Million Is Awaiting Horseplayers Here
description: Many skeptics don't be lieve the legend that ele phants never forget. On the contrary, most persons go along with the truism that horse players have forgotten more than elephants ever have known. What's more, there are statistics to prove it.

title: U.N. Unit Acts to Safeguard Newsmen in Danger Zones
description: GENEVA, March 27 (UPI) The United Nations Committee on Human Rights adopted a resolution and draft convention this week that would give to journalists on dangerous assignments.

title: Pakistan Divided
description: The resort to force by both sides in Pakistan's consti tutional crisis is a tragic mistake that can only inflict horrible new suffering on the Bengalis, recent victims one of history's worst natural disasters, and cannot hope to achieve President Yahya's goal of preserving a strong and united Moslem state.

title: News of the Bialto
description: SEEING is believing but, as of the moment, we are told that Anthony Quinn has signed his contract and Anthony Franciosa's signature is virtually cer tain and, come next season, they will be together as father and son in a new play called Come Dressed in Red by Melba Redman Thomas.

title: Mayor Daley Heads for His Fourth Reelection
description: CHICAGO, March 27This election, said Mayor Richard J. Daley, won't be won by speeches. It will have to be won by hard, hard work.

title: The Opera: Fellowship of the Road in The Losers
description: It's relevant, The Losers is, if motorcycle gangs, vio lence, a gang rape and other assorted gore can be con sidered relevant. Harold Far berman has put all this into his new opera, which had its premiere Friday evening at the Juilliard Theater. Yes, it's relevant, but it's also an opera, and there is a motor cyclists ballet, just like the Bacchanale in Faust. Or maybe West Side Story.

title: Buyers of Used Boats
description: Yachtsmen looking at used boats should imitate their tirekicking counterparts on usedcar lots. They can avoid bitter disappointment, shock ing repair bills and possible mishaps if they do.

title: Rio Bravo Oaklawn Victor
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., March 27 (AP)  Rio Bravo, owned by T.A. and J.E. Grissom, over took Sado in the final furlong to win today's $50,000 added Oaklawn Hhandicap.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Education
description: The City University of New York has given the ac ademic boat an awful rock ing, Dr. Timothy S. Healy, CUNY's vice chancellor, said last week.

title: U.S. Consulate Reports AM Quiet in Dacca
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 The State Department said today its reports from Dacca indicated that all is quiet in the city.

title: Sore Toe Failed to Keep Wicks From Role in U.C.L.A. Victory
description: HOUSTON, March 27 (UPI) Coach John Wooden savoring his fifth consecutive National Collegiate basketball champion ship, disclosed today after his team's victory over Villanova that Sidney Wicks was playing with an injured toe that badly hampered his performance.

title: Fullerton Wins Gym Title
description: CHICAGO, March 27 (AP) California State at Fullerton captured the National Collegi ate Athletic Association Col lege Division gymnastics cham pionship today with 158.15 points. Springfield was second with 156.99. and Northwestern Louisiana took third place with 149.08 points.

title: The Truth About Dragons
description: The truth about dragons is that they have a mission to guard a very special hoard. What does the hoard contain? Well, not what you might ex pect, and I'm not going to be the one to tell you. But the dragon's natural enemies are land developers and sociolo gists and technocrats and brainless hedonists and all hu mans who cannot see beyond their noses. The scaly narrator of Mr. Adams's enchanting fable is a 606yearold 39footer named Firedrake, who is trying to make the world safe for dragonism somewhere around Santa Barbara. Through a tape recorded journal unearthed in the year 2001, Firedrake de bunks St. George and Beowulf, and makes some draconic reve lations concerning the shape of things to come. Mr. Adams mingles myth and reality with a playfulness that disguises the of his humor.

title: Residents of Exclusive Forest Hills Gardens Employ Towaway System to Discourage Outside Parkers
description: Forest Hills Gardens, an en clave of expensive homes, mani cured lawns and curving, tree shaped lanes in Central Queens, has recently instituted a tow ing system to overcome one of its most persistent problems parking by outsiders on its private streets.

title: Visiting the Blue Grass Where the Blue Bloods Are Bred
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.  When Man O' War, the greatest thoroughbred that ever raced, returned here for stud service in 1921 after breaking all records in his 20 victories out of 21 races entered, he was this town's greatest celebrity. During the next 26 years more than a million peo ple came here just to see the famous chestnut stallion.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Boy, 7, Dies in L.I. Fire
description: ROOSEVELT, L. I., March 27 A 7yearold boy died in a fire in his home here last night. The body of Charles Butler Jr., the only child of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Butler, was found in a secondfloor bedroom of the family's home at 72 Allers Boulevard.

title: Searching for Clams in Moriches Bay on Long Island's South Shore
description: Until last year, the Ameri ca's Cup matches were rath er dull displays of American yachting superiority. But be hind that superiority was one of another sort  technolog ical. Last year's close match indicated that the gap is nar rowing,

title: Foreign Notes
description: In the summer of 1944, as World War II entered its climac tic phase, the legendary Yugo slav partisan leader, Josip Tito, resplendent in a new, specially tailored, goldbraided uniform, flew to Italy to meet with British generals and Sir Winston Church ill: The camaraderie of the visit gave way within a year to bitter ness in a dispute over the Adri atic port of Trieste. Marshal Tito claimed it as part of Yugoslavia. Italy, backed by the Western al lies, claimed it as hers.

title: A cheerleader's report
description: Books like Richard Gott's Guer rilla Movements in Latin America seem part of a widening conspiracy to make gypsies like me feel a deeper respect for the sanity and coherence of bourgeois values.

title: Carnegie in Full Bloom.
description: CARNEGIE HALL has be come the place where New Yorkers can sam ple the qualities of or chestras from around the world. Most of thent appear on the series called Inter national Festival of Visiting Orchestras, which was in stituted by Julius Bloom, the hall's executive director, in 1963. Next season, for ex ample, the list of ensembles and conductors scheduled for presentation in the series or otherwise includes the fol lowing:

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla.  The announcement late last week of the merger of two lead ing centuryold textile trade associations would seem at first blush to indicate a con tinuing market decline and a girding of forces to meet such common problems as the tide of imports.

title: Spirit of Saigon's Army Shaken in Laos
description: KHESANH, South Vietnam, March 27The morale of many soldiers in South Vietnam's fi nest military units, who fought the North Vietnamese in Laos, is shattered.

title: Foreign Notes
description: In the ancient Japan of the samurai and worship of the Emperor, a kaishahu was some one whoto spare prolonged agonybeheaded a friend who committed harakiri. In the mod ern Japan of the transistor and the pursuit of the yen, harakiri is virtually forgotten and the kaishahu even more so.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: SANTIAGO, ChileSalvador Allende Gossens' Chilean experiment has been tried before by various means in various countries and never yet came off. If he succeeds it will be a notable new departure in government.

title: Craft Comeback
description: By a combination of de pressing factors such as re cession, inflation, the aliena tion of youth and consumer resistance to fashion, the urge to be creative has caused a boomlet in such re cently gloomy industries as retailing, textiles and pub lishing.

title: After Polio, She Became a Crusader for the Handicapped
description: WHITE PLAINS, N.Y., March 26 (AP)Nancy Kreisler has huge brown eyes, a friendly smile and an irrepressible en thusiasm. She is a former Powers model, likes short shorts and boots, has three chil dren ranging in age from 10 to 21 and looks younger than the age she is reticent about.

title: PLAN ON STADIUM HELD STILL ALIVE
description: The city's plan to buy Yankee Stadium  set back when the Football Giants re fused to promise to stay there will be moved forward in the City Council this week, accord ing to a private vote count by Council leaders.

title: 2 GOLFERS SHARE LEAD WITH 206'S
description: MIAMI, March 27Gary Player of South Africa and Bruce Crampton of Australia shared the lead after 54 holes in the $200,000 National Air lines open at 206 as the foreign golfers dominated the third round today.

title: Miss Kraemer Sets Wedding
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., March 27Miss Pamela Track Krae mer and James Cameron Col thup plan to be married here on Aug. 28 at the First Pres byterian Church.

title: Town Aide Urges Recycling of Papers In North Hempstead
description: MANHASSET, L. I., March 27Michael J. Tully Jr., Su pervisor of North Hempstead, has called for enactment of a town ordinance requiring the recycling of newspapers in an effort to cut down on the grow ing volume of solidwaste ma terial handled by town inciner ators.

title: The Disciples Of Sappho, Updated
description: AS recently as a year ago, most members of the New York chapter of the Daughters of Bilitis, the country's oldest and largest lesbian organization, knew each other only by first names, which were usually false. Meetings, in a small, stuffy, sublet room on West 38th Street, were uninspiring and poorly attended. Younger, more radical lesbians referred to D.O.B., as it is called, as the N.A.A.C.P. of lesbian groups, and to its members as Aunt Tabbies.

title: Reservist's CourtMartial Over Hair Cut Is Reversed
description: SAN DIEGO, March 27 (AP) The courtmartial conviction of a Marine reservist for refus ing to cut his hir has been reversed by a United States dis trict court.

description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (UPI)  Senator Charles McC. Mathias, Republican of Mary land, said today he would intro duce legislation to preserve the confidentiality of information that taxpapers give persons for preparation of their income tax returns.

title: Hall Takes 3d Title in Record Time as Indiana Keeps N.C.A.A. Swim Crown
description: AMES, Iowa, March 27 (AP) Gary Hall posted his third American record of the meet tonight as he helped lead Indiana to its fourth straight National Collegiate Athletic Association swimming and div ing championship.

title: Ulster Trade Group in Japan
description: TOKYO, March 27 (Reuters) A Northern Ireland trade mis sion arrived in Japan this week for a 12day visit aimed at promoting exports and imports between the two countries.

title: DETROIT FUND CUT HITS ART MUSEUM
description: DETROIT, March 27 De troit's Institute of Art will close a third of its exhibits daily be cause the city held back money needed to hire guards.

title: The heroine is not queer for herself
description: Rapture unwrapped has been ripped off so thoroughly that it's astonishing to find a novel told by a virgin (at least, a virgin until the last few chapters). But Hortense Calisher has always specialized in astonishment. In her collections of splendid short stories and novellas such as Tale for the Mirror, Ex treme Magic and The Railway Po liceshe excels at jamming shocks into her deceptively cool narratives.

title: Alec McCowen Brings Back Farce, and Be Glad of It
description: ACOMMITTEE should be formed to thank Alec McCowen, and his new author Christopher Hampton, for restoring digni ty to farce. The Philanthro pist, which David Merrick has just brought us from Lon don, may not at first sight look like a farce and Mr. McCowen's performance is so subtle, so crotchety, so devil ishly detailed, that you may not want to pin that looked downupon label upon it, but farce the whole thing is, and there's still some glory to it.

title: Marine Ecology, Rather Than Summer Camp, Is What's Turning Youth On
description: ROWAYTON, Conn. Somewhat to the surprise of parents, many youngsters here aren't thinking about camp or the usual recre ational hijinks when summer comes. For instance, one 10 yearold set off vibrations at home when he announced:

title: Steve's Phil, $14.80, Captures Feature at Westbury by Head
description: WESTBURY, L. I., March 27 The No. 8 post proved to be no disadvantage to Lucien Fon taine's Steve's Phil in the $10, 000 feature pace at Roosevelt Raceway tonight.

title: L.I. Conference Told Alcohol Is Greater Problem Than Drugs
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., March 27Alcoholism Is a greater problem to our society tOday than narcotics because drinking is part of our culture, a psychi atrist and specialist on alcohol ism said at a threeday confer ence on Alcoholismthe For gotten Addiction, here.

title: SovietPress Provides Forum For Its Readers' Pet Projects
description: MOSCOW, March 27  In the nationwide discussion of the new draft fiveyear plan, the controlled Soviet press has been thrown open to virtually everyone's pet proj ectfrom an academician's lofty espousal of sociological surveys to a supermarket manager's plea for more readywrapped belogna.

title: Dr. Fly Leaves Uruguay
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 27 (AP)Dr. Claude L. Fly, the United States agrono mist kidnapped by the Tupa maro guerrillas and held for 208 days, until March 2, left by plane today for his home in Fort Collins, Colo.

title: A Separate L. I. Judicial District Is sought by Nassau Bar Group
description: MINEOLA, L. I., March 27 Declaring that the establish ment of a judicial department encompassing Nassau and Suf folk Counties is a present nec essity, the Nassau County Bar Association has called an the Legislature to approve for a second time a constitutional proposition so that it can be on the November ballot.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: How to Be Prim and Strip, Too
description: WE'RE sitting in the kitchen of Maralin Niska's tiny three  room apartment (rentcontrolled, $115 a month) way uptown in unfashionable Washington Heights, talking about Benjamin Britten's The Turn of the Screw. Next Sunday after noon Niska returns to her role as The Gov erness, which she first sang to considerable critical acclaim in the New York City Opera's revival a year ago.

title: Nassau Will Try Rehabilitation To Aid Single People on Relief
description: MINEOLA, L.I., March 27 In an attempt to reduce the number of single welfare recip ients now housed in motels, Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso has authorized the county's Social Services Com missioner to negotiate agree ments with private agencies to provide rehabilitation for them.

title: Dearer Oil
description: While the classic confronta tion between the international oil companies and the pro ducing nations in the Middle East has held center stage, events have quietly taken place in nearby Venezuela that will likely have far greater immediate effect on American oil users.

title: WOLFF MAKES USE OF VIDEO TALENTS
description: Ten years ago Lester Lionel Wolff was a showbusinessori ented promoter of prepared and packaged foodstuffs as well as a television producer.

title: Results Termed Mixed for Study Panels
description: BOSTON, March 27In 25 crisisladen years since World War TI, American Presidents have created about 50 commis sions of distinguished citizens to obtain advice  or to post pone decisions, according tol cynicson almost every na tional issue from veterans pen sions to campus unrest.

title: Charting Aided by Power Squadrons
description: These days, government usually helps people. A wel come switch of citizens aid ing government is found in the cooperative charting pro gram of the United States Power Squadrons.

title: IN DEPTH
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: How the President Would Reorganize the Cabinet
description: WASHINGTONOne of the ofttold John F. Kennedy stories is about the gentleman who pro posed to him a splendid new method for operating a Federal program. That's a good idea, said President Kennedy. Now let's see if we can get the Gov ernment to accept it.

title: FOREIGN WORKERS ON RISE IN BERLIN
description: BERLIN, March 27 The Germanborn population of West Berlin has dropped below two million, officials disclosed this week.

title: The World
description: From the start, there were those who considered Pakistan an impossible dream. Only two months after its birth in 1947, Pakistan was described by India's second  ranking leader, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, as a tempo rary phenomenon. East Pakistan, he predicted, would collapse of its own weight within two or three years.

title: At Thoiry: Windows Down for Elephants, Up for Lions
description: PARTSAn hour from the boule vards of Paris, we were skirting antelopes and elephants, rhinos and camels on the grounds of the 16thcentury Chateau de Thoiry at Yvelines. We were encaged in our car, but all around us animals came and went, freely roaming the reserve. Ze bras nuzzled sugar from our out stretched palms. A lion paused, flank to fender with our car. In the distance, giraffes reached for leaves on 200year old trees.

title: G.O.P. in St. Paul Hears Reagan And Goodell Divide Over Nixon
description: ST. PAUL, March 27 Gov. Ronald Reagan of Cali fornia and former Senator Charles E. Goodell of New York clashed here yesterday over the policies and prospects of the Nixon Administration. But Minnesota Republicans have taken precautions to avoid an early fight between their rival followings within the party.

title: Recycling Drive Gains Impetus on 2d Saturday
description: On the second Saturday of a massive campaign to get peo ple to take discarded aluminum cans and glass bottles to collec tion centers for recycling, many thousands more turned out yes terday than had participated last week.

title: TRY SHEEP PAYS $110.40 ON COAST
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 27 (AP)  Try Sheep, the second longest shot in the field, scored an upset today by winning the $82,000 San Luis Rey Handicap at Santa Anita as the favorite, Drumtop, the only mare in the race, finished fourth.

title: CALLEY JURY ASKS TO REHEAR 8 MORE
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., March 27After deliberating nearly 70 hours, the military jury weighing the fate of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. indicated today that it was still far from a verdict by asking for a re reading of the testimony of eight more witnesses.

title: CONDORS HALT RALLY, SINK STARS 128120
description: PITTSBURGH, March 27 (AP) John Brisker scored 37 points today to lead the Pittsburgh Condors to a 128120 victory over the Utah Stars in an American Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Knight of Army Named To Coach Indiana Five
description: BLOMMINGTON Ind., March 27, (AP)  Boh Knight, head basketball coach for the last six seasons at the United States Military Academy, was named head coach at Indiana University today.

title: Miss Charlotte Jones Is Bride To Bob Moore, Radio Newsman
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 27 Miss Charlotte FitzHenry Jones, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul McClellan Zones, was married here this after noon to Bob Stahly Moore of Chicago, an anchorman and correspondent for WBBM, the Columbia Broadcasting System radio station there. The, key. Frank N. Watson performed the ceremony in the White Plains Presbyteri an Church.

title: SENSELESS KILLING
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: A VOICE PROM THE HINTERLAND
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: The Nation
description: The White House and Con gress are in a state of crucial and paradoxical confrontation with the medium of television. President Nixon uses TV to seek support for his policies and to humanize his public image; mean While his Administration and supporters in Congress are busy Ohallenging the home screen's catdibility and subjecting one or more of the networks to a drumbeat of criticism.

title: Many Happy Returns
description: When offtrack betting opens here, don't expect to walk up to a window and have the clerk punch out a ticket on the horse of your choice.

title: Mrs. Albano Has a Son
description: DALLAS, March 27A son was born on March 6, to Mr. and Mrs. Vincent F. Albano 3d in the Presbyterian Hospi tal here. Mrs. Albano is the former Miss Daphne Hayes. The child has been named for his father, who is with the Dunhill Record Company. His grandfather, Vincent F. Albano Jr. of New York, is chairman of the New York Republican County Commit tee and chairman of the Century National Bank and Trust Company.

title: $100Million in City Aid Cut by Leaders in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 27Repub lican legislative leaders today proposed cuts of $141million in welfare spending, of nearly $100million in aid for New York City and of 8,400 state jobs as part of a $703million reduction in the $8.45billion budget proposed by Governor Rockefeller.

title: NUCLEAR AGFNCY SEEKS INSPECTORS
description: VIENNA, March 24  The International Atomic Energy Agency has started recruiting the 55 inspectors who are to take over next March the task of verifying compliance with the treaty prohibiting the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: STUTTGART BALLET PLANS 6WEEK SERIES
description: The Stuttgart Ballet will open a sixweek season at the Metro politan Opera on April 19 with Eugene Onegin. The company is being presented here by S. Hurok, who sponsored its visit here in 1969.

title: Garden Tours
description: THE period rooms in the Henry Francis du Pont Museum near Wilming ton, Del. will be open this year on Sundays for the first time. Opening date is April 13 through Saturday, May 22.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Tabletop art
description: In less than four years, Warner and Kay LeRoy (left) have amassed a staggering and welledited collection of English and French Art Nouveau and Art Deco objects. They have used them to decorate his restaurant Maxwell's Plum, and their apartment at the Dakota. Part of the explana tion for how they acquired so much so fast may stem from his Hollywood background, where movie sets are assembled with stunning speed. His grandfather was Harry Warner, one of the three Warner Brothers, and his father is the noted directorproducer Mervyn LeRoy. The collection is far from static; it changes whenever the maid dusts, guests examine a piece or the LeBoys trade one object for another they like better. The gilded bear (left, center foreground), for instance, designed to serve as a radiator cap in the nineteentwenties, is going to decorate the hood of the couples Lin coln one of these days. They insist that the collection is not an addiction. If it should become one, LeRoy says, the tables will be swept clean.

title: Bouillabaisse Recipe For the Galley Stove
description: For those of you who might like to try making bouillabaisse, here's a recipe: BOUILLABAISSE

title: Liquor License Requested By Hospital for Children
description: BOSTON, March 27 (AP) Children's Hospital Medical Center has applied for a license to sell liquor at its Children's Inn.

title: BRAINERD R. TAYLOR OF AMERICAN MAIZE
description: Brainerd R. Taylor, a director and a retired senior vice pres ident of the American Maize Products Company of this city, died on Thursday. He was stricken, apparently by a heart attack, in Grand Central Ter minal.

title: POLITICIANS LEAD ANTIWAR RALLIES
description: Four members of the House of Representatives and a num ber of state and local officials staged a series of antiwar ral lies in the Bronx, Queens and Westchester County yesterday to raise support for a new move in Congress to cut off funds for the war in Indochina by the end of 1971.

title: Yonkers Resident Heads Power Unit
description: William L. Smith of Yon kers has been elected com mander of United States Power Squadron, District 2. Others named were Robert W. Rolands of Westport, Conn., executive officer; Rob ert W. Krummenacher of New City, N. Y., administra tive officer; Raymond C. Sar faty of Darien, Conn., secre tary, and E. Dean Wilcox of Poughkeepsie, N. Y., treas surer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. and South Vietnamese Negotiators Move for a One Week Delay in Paris Peace Talks
description: PARIS, March 27The Unit ed States and South Vietnam rejected today a Communist proposal to hold the next ses sion of the Vietnam peace talks April 1 and proposed April 8 instead.

title: Miss Mary Lucinda Donohue Is Fiancee of Richard A. Allen
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., March 27  Miss Mary Lucinda Donohue, a student at the Fordham Law School, plans to be married here in early summer to Richard Allison Allen a graduate of the Co lumbia Law School.

title: Lollipops
description: LOLLIPOPS, that's what they look like! Standards of roses, herbs and shrubs are becoming popular these days to add extra dimension to borders and terraces. You can buy them already trained, or train your own.

title: EUGENE M'GUCKIN JR., PUBLISHER IN DULUTH
description: DULUTH, Minn., March 27 (AP)Eugene McGuckin Jr., publisher of the Duluth Herald and NewsTribune, died in a Duluth hospital today. He was 59 years old.

title: Et Al.
description: A scholarly assessment of the social philosophy of the ec centric Jansenist rou and nov elist. A disciple of Rousseau but closer to Sade in his advocacy of the morality of pleasure, he was an early convert to the ideals of free love, shortterm marriage and other socializa Lions of the passions. While lucidly enough preiented by Mark Poster, Restif's utopian schemes will remain elusive for readers not directly ac quainted with his work.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Civil Service Director Retires After 30 Years
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)Nicholas J. Oganovic is retiring as executive direc tor of the Civil Service Com mission after 30 years in government service.

title: DAYCARE CENTER WINS IN BROOKLYN
description: The Board of Estimate has approved a muchdiscussed pro posal for a daycare center in South Brooklyn after Commu nity Planning Board 6 had cautiously examined the spon sor, an ItalianAmerican group, in what appeared to some com munity residents as a stalling tactic.

title: CHILDREN'S CLINIC OPENED IN HARLEM
description: When seven children in a family who ranged in age from 4 to 11 years were brought to see a Harlem pediatrician re cently, only one of the young sters could talk. The others, the doctor said, communicated with one another mostly with grunts and cries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Ethics Debate Set Off By Life Science Gains
description: This article was prepared by Jane E. Brody, a science writer, and Edward B. Fiske, religion editor.

title: Miss Holden Bride Of Oliver Loring Jr.
description: LYNDONVILLE, Vt., March 27 Miss Martha Jane Hold en, who expects to be gradu ated in June front the Uni versity of Maine School of Law in Portland, was married here this afternoon to Oliver Leland Loring Jr., bureau manager for United Press In ternational in Augusta, Me. The Rev. Ronald Prinn per formed the ceremony in St. Peter's Episcopal Church.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Brooklyn Area Loses Power
description: About 500 Consolidated Edi son customers in Brooklyn were without power for more than an hour yesterday when a 4,000volt feeder line was knocked out of service, the utility reported. Power went out at 10:28 A.M. and was restored at 11:33 A.M., a Con Edison spokesmen said. The customers affected lived in an area bounded by King, Coffee, Ferris and Richards Streets, he said.

title: Warriors Get Jim Barnett
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 27 (UPI)The San Francisco War riors today acquired Jim Bar net of the Portland Trail Blazers In exchange for three draft selections. The Warriors gave Portland their second and third picks in this year's N.B.A. draft and an undisclosed selection in next year's draft.

title: Pirates Win on an Error
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 27 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates scored an unearned run in the sixth inning and defeated the Kansas City Royals, 10, in an exhibition game today.

title: Drug Arrests at Border Grow As U.S. and Mexico Cooperate
description: MEXICO CITY, March 27 Early problems in the cam paign of the United States and Mexico to control drug traffic across their border appear to have been solved, and the oper ation is claiming increasing success.

title: Connecticut Woman Dies in Fall From Bunk in a Coast Jail Cell
description: TULARE, Calif., March 27 (UPI) Marina J. Maguire, a member of a prominent Con necticut family, died here yes terday after falling from an upper bunk in a jail cell, it was learned today.

title: MENTAL PATIENTS HELD VULNERABLE
description: Echoing this theme, a civil rights lawyer called for total abolition of involuntary hospitalization of mentally disturbed persons.

title: Fitting Out: For Women, Too
description: Men, as long as you're fitting out your boat, start thinking about fitting us girls into your project. It's about time, too, because you're going to be seeing more of us these liberated days.

title: Foreign Notes
description: The gentleman, said Confucius 2,500 years ago, is content with the plainest clothes for common wear, while capable of stand ing unabashed with those who wear fox and badger.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: How Nature Does It
description: INSECTS were present and established long before the advent of man. Since man began raising crops the problem of protecting them from insects and other pests has occupied a great deal of his time.

title: Man Held in Death of Wife
description: BALDWIN, L.I., March 27 An unemployed bookbinder al legedly stabbed his wife to death in the bedroom of their home last night, then stabbed himself in the abdomen. The police today charged Victor Soto, 41 years old, of 52 Pacific Street, Baldwin Harbor, with murdering his wife, Lillian, 36, with a kitchen knife. The couple's six children, ranging in age from 3 to 18 years, were home at the time. Mr. Soto was reported to be in poor condition today in the Nassau County Medical Center in East Meadow.

title: Mrs. Yoo Has Daughter
description: A daugnter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Ronald J. Yoo of New York on March 4 at Lenox Hill Hospital. The child has been named Christine. Mrs. Yoo, the former Miss Leslie J. Weiss, is the daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. L. Weiss of New York. Mr. Yoo is a management consultant with McKinsey & Co.

title: Democrats in a Survey Prefer Kennedy
description: Registered Democrats, by a slight margin, prefer Senator Edward M. Kennedy to be the party's presidential candidate in 1972 over Senator Edmund S. Muskie or former Vice Pres ident Hubert H. Humphrey, ac cording to a new Gallup poll.

title: EACH TAX RETURN TESTED 200 TIMES
description: MARTINSBURG, W. VA., March 27 (AP)Arrned with a complex of computers and a system of crosschecking that explores angles by the thou sands, the Government keeps close watch here over 95 mil lion taxpayers.

title: Jersey Club Is Back in Show Business
description: News or Dogs

title: Payson to Be Honored At Boxing Benefit Here
description: Charles Shipman Payson, industrialist and husband of the owner of the New York. Mets, will be honored May 5 at the second annual box ing benefit for Governor Rockefeller's committee on scholastic achievement at the state armory, Park Avenue at 63d Street.
